original: khyad par 'gro dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khyad par 'gro dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: In particular, it is said, ‚Äúit is the basis for the special progress. ‚Äù

original: sa bcu gong nas gong du bzod pa spangs shing shas je che je cher gyur pa ni khyad par 'gro ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa bcu gong nas gong du bzod pa spangs shing shas je che je cher gyur pa ni khyad par 'gro ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The special progress is the increase of the acceptance of the stage above the stage of patience.

original: 'di bzod pa'i las rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'di bzod pa'i las rnam pa gcig go //
translated: This is one kind of activity of patience.

original: de la dge ba la mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la dge ba la mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: In regard to the statement, ‚Äúit is the basis for the delight in virtue,‚Äù

original: bzod pa dang ldan pa rnams ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa la dga' ste /
analyzed: bzod pa dang ldan pa rnams ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa la dga' ste /
translated: those who have patience delight in the practice of the six perfections.

original: 'di ni bzod pa'i las rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di ni bzod pa'i las rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: This is the second kind of activity of patience.

original: bzod pa yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid 'dod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: bzod pa yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid 'dod ces bya ba la /
translated: In regard to the statement, ‚Äúit is the basis for the desire for the characteristics of patience, ‚Äù

original: gong du bshad pa lta bur bzod pa'i rgyu dang / rang bzhin dang / las gsum dang ldan na bzod pa yongs su smin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa lta bur bzod pa'i rgyu dang / rang bzhin dang / las gsum dang ldan na bzod pa yongs su smin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that one who has the three‚Äîthe cause of patience, the nature of patience, and the activity of patience‚Äîas explained above, has patience that is fully developed.

original: yid rno ba yongs su smin pa las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid rno ba yongs su smin pa las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse on the maturity of sharpness of mind.

original: dran pa dang shes rab gnyis po yid rno ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes rab gnyis po yid rno ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The sharpness of mind is the pair, mindfulness and wisdom.

original: yang na yid rno ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi rnam grangs kyi ming ste /
analyzed: yang na yid rno ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi rnam grangs kyi ming ste /
translated: Or else, ‚Äúsharp mind‚Äù is a synonym for wisdom.

original: yid rno ba zhes kyang bya ;
analyzed: yid rno ba zhes kyang bya ;
translated: It is called ‚Äúsharp mind‚Äù

original: shes rab ces kyang bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab ces kyang bya ste /
translated: and also ‚Äúwisdom.‚Äù

original: de bas na mdo sde de dag las /
analyzed: de bas na mdo sde de dag las /
translated: Therefore, in those s≈´tras,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi dbang du byas nas shes rab can yid rno ba mkhas pa'o zhes gsungs so //üîΩdon du na de kho na khong du ma chud pa bskal pa grangs med pa gcig gi @94a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi dbang du byas nas shes rab can yid rno ba mkhas pa'o zhes gsungs so // don du na de kho na khong du ma chud pa bskal pa grangs med pa gcig gi @94a * //
translated: the BhagavƒÅn, in terms of wisdom, said, ‚ÄúThe wise have sharp minds and are skilled.‚Äù

original: bar du nyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa'i dge ba la zhugs pa'i gang zag mos pas spyod pa rnams kyi shes rab la yid rno ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bar du nyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa'i dge ba la zhugs pa'i gang zag mos pas spyod pa rnams kyi shes rab la yid rno ba zhes bya ste /
translated: In fact, for those individuals who have not yet realized reality and are engaged in the virtues of listening, reflection, etc., for one incalculable eon, the wisdom of those engaged in the practice of resolute intention is called ‚Äúsharp mind.‚Äù

original: de yang yid rno ba zhes bya ba'i rgyu dang / rang bzhin dang / las gsum dang ldan na yid rno ba yongs su smin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang yid rno ba zhes bya ba'i rgyu dang / rang bzhin dang / las gsum dang ldan na yid rno ba yongs su smin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And that is taught to be the full ripening of a sharp mind if it has three qualities: cause, nature, and function. The verse is composed for that purpose.

original: rnam smin dag cing zhes bya ba la tshe rabs snga ma la dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i dge ba byas pas gar skyes kyang mig la sogs pa'i dbang po thams cad tshang ba dang rang bzhin gyis shes rab rno ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phung po lnga thob pa ni rnam par smin pa dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam smin dag cing zhes bya ba la tshe rabs snga ma la dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i dge ba byas pas gar skyes kyang mig la sogs pa'i dbang po thams cad tshang ba dang rang bzhin gyis shes rab rno ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phung po lnga thob pa ni rnam par smin pa dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Pure karmic maturation refers to obtaining the five aggregates that have the characteristics of being complete in all faculties such as eyes and having sharp wisdom by nature, wherever one is born, through virtuous actions such as listening to and contemplating the excellent Dharma in previous lives.

original: 'dis ni yid rno ba rnam par smin pa'i rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni yid rno ba rnam par smin pa'i rgyu bstan to //
translated: This indicates that sharp mental faculty is a cause of karmic maturation.

original: thos pa la sogs mi brjed ces bya ba la /
analyzed: thos pa la sogs mi brjed ces bya ba la /
translated: Not forgetting what one has heard and so on refers to

original: gong du dran pa dang shes rab gnyis la yid rno ba zhes bya'o zhes bstan te /
analyzed: gong du dran pa dang shes rab gnyis la yid rno ba zhes bya'o zhes bstan te /
translated: the above explanation that both mindfulness and wisdom are called sharp mental faculty.

original: dran pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dam pa'i chos thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa dang / sngon lus kyi sgo nas las ci byas pa dang ngag gi sgo nas tshig ci smras pa rnams dran zhing mi brjed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dam pa'i chos thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa dang / sngon lus kyi sgo nas las ci byas pa dang ngag gi sgo nas tshig ci smras pa rnams dran zhing mi brjed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because he is mindful, he hears the holy Dharma, reflects on it, meditates on it, etc. He remembers and does not forget what he has done by way of body and what he has said by way of speech.

original: de bzhin legs smras nyes smras rab tu chud //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin legs smras nyes smras rab tu chud // ces bya ba la /
translated: He understands well what is said well and what is said badly.

original: shes rab dang ldan pas na bdag dang gzhan gyis legs par smras pa dang / nyes par smras pa ngos zin cing rtogs te /
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pas na bdag dang gzhan gyis legs par smras pa dang / nyes par smras pa ngos zin cing rtogs te /
translated: Because he is wise, he recognizes and understands what is said well by himself and others and what is said badly by himself and others.

original: 'dis tshig 'di smras pa ni ma nor te legs par smras pa yin no zhes rtogs /
analyzed: 'dis tshig 'di smras pa ni ma nor te legs par smras pa yin no zhes rtogs /
translated: He understands that what this person says is not mistaken, that it is said well.

original: 'dis ni tshig 'di smras pa ni nor te nyes par smras pa yin no zhes rtogs te /
analyzed: 'dis ni tshig 'di smras pa ni nor te nyes par smras pa yin no zhes rtogs te /
translated: He understands that what this person says is mistaken, that it is said badly.

original: mnyan pa la sogs mi brjed pa dang / legs par smras pa dang / nyes par smras pa khong du chud pa ni yid rno ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mnyan pa la sogs mi brjed pa dang / legs par smras pa dang / nyes par smras pa khong du chud pa ni yid rno ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Not forgetting what he has heard, etc., and understanding what is said well and what is said badly, is the nature of sharp intellect.

original: dran pa yin te zhes bya ba ni mnyan pa la sogs pa mi brjed par ni dran par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dran pa yin te zhes bya ba ni mnyan pa la sogs pa mi brjed par ni dran par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Recollection means that one is mindful of what one has heard, etc., so as not to forget it.

original: blo chen skye ba rung zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: blo chen skye ba rung zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase the arising of great intelligence is fitting means that.

original: ji ltar byas pa mi brjed pa dang / legs nyes kyang ngos zin te bye brag byed pa'i shes rab des 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes bskyed pa bas blo chen skye ba rung zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pa mi brjed pa dang / legs nyes kyang ngos zin te bye brag byed pa'i shes rab des 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes bskyed pa bas blo chen skye ba rung zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The arising of supramundane knowledge is fitting because of the wisdom that distinguishes what is well done from what is badly done, and that does not forget what has been done.

original: 'di ni las so //
analyzed: 'di ni las so //
translated: This is its activity.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes ni sa dang por chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i @94b mtshan nyid du rtogs pa'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes ni sa dang por chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i @94b mtshan nyid du rtogs pa'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la bya'o //
translated: Supramundane knowledge is the nondualistic knowledge of the reality realm that occurs on the first spiritual level.

original: stobs dang ldan pa bskyed pa yongs su smin pa las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la stobs zhes bya ba dang / mthu zhes bya ba don gcig ste /
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa bskyed pa yongs su smin pa las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la stobs zhes bya ba dang / mthu zhes bya ba don gcig ste /
translated: A verse on the topic of the evolution of the powerful

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags nas sgrib pa gnyis spangs te /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags nas sgrib pa gnyis spangs te /
translated: Having accumulated the collections of merit and knowledge, having abandoned the two obstructions,

original: chos kyi dbyings rtogs par nus pa ni stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rtogs par nus pa ni stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: one is able to realize the Reality limit. This is called ‚Äúpower.‚Äù

original: de'i stobs kyi rgyu dang / rang bzhin dang / las gsum dang ldan na stobs yongs su smin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyi rgyu dang / rang bzhin dang / las gsum dang ldan na stobs yongs su smin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When it is endowed with the three‚Äîcause, nature, and function‚Äîof that power, it is the full ripening of power.

original: dge ba gnyis kyis khams gnyis rgyas pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba gnyis kyis khams gnyis rgyas pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The two virtues increase the two seed natures,

original: dge ba gnyis ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi dge ba dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyi dge ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba gnyis ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi dge ba dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyi dge ba'o //
translated: The two virtues are the virtue of the collection of merit and the virtue of the collection of knowledge.

original: khams kyi sgras ni tshogs de gnyis kyi sa bon la bya ste /
analyzed: khams kyi sgras ni tshogs de gnyis kyi sa bon la bya ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúseed nature‚Äù refers to the seeds of those two collections.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis bsod nams kyi sa bon rtas par byed /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis bsod nams kyi sa bon rtas par byed /
translated: The collection of merit increases the seed of merit.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs kyis kyang ye shes kyi sa bon rtas par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs kyis kyang ye shes kyi sa bon rtas par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The collection of knowledge increases the seed of knowledge. This is the meaning.

original: 'dis ni stobs yongs su smin pa'i rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni stobs yongs su smin pa'i rgyu bstan to //
translated: This shows the cause of the full ripening of power.

original: 'bras bu skye ba'i rten du rung ba'i mchog //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba'i rten du rung ba'i mchog //
translated: It is the supreme basis for the arising of the result.

original: ces bya ba'i rten zhes bya ba ni lus la bya ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i rten zhes bya ba ni lus la bya ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúbasis‚Äù in the verse refers to the body.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pas gzung 'dzin spangs nas stong pa nyid khong du chud de /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pas gzung 'dzin spangs nas stong pa nyid khong du chud de /
translated: By accumulating the collections of merit and knowledge, one abandons the subject-object dichotomy and comprehends emptiness.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa thob pa ni 'bras bu skye ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa thob pa ni 'bras bu skye ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The attainment of the buddha stage is called ‚Äúthe arising of the result.‚Äù

original: de lta bu nus pa'i lus thob par gyur na /
analyzed: de lta bu nus pa'i lus thob par gyur na /
translated: When one has attained a body that is capable of such,

original: 'bras bu skye ba'i rten du rung ba'i mchog //üîΩces bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba'i rten du rung ba'i mchog // ces bya ste /
translated: it is the supreme basis for the arising of the result.

original: 'dis ni stobs kyi rang bzhin bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni stobs kyi rang bzhin bstan to //
translated: This verse shows the nature of the power of the body.

original: mchog gi sgras ni lus de nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa las 'phags par bstan to //
analyzed: mchog gi sgras ni lus de nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa las 'phags par bstan to //
translated: The word ‚Äúsupreme‚Äù indicates that this body is superior to those of the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on.

original: bsam pa grub cing zhes bya ba la bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa de dag nyid ci bsams pa rnams kyang de bzhin du 'grub la /
analyzed: bsam pa grub cing zhes bya ba la bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa de dag nyid ci bsams pa rnams kyang de bzhin du 'grub la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe accomplishment of intentions‚Äù means that those who possess the collections of merit and knowledge accomplish whatever they intend.

original: sems can gyi bsam pa yang yongs su khengs par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can gyi bsam pa yang yongs su khengs par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It also means that they fulfill the intentions of sentient beings.

original: 'di ni stobs kyi las rnam pa gcig go //üîΩ'gro ba'i mchog tu gyur zhes bya ba la bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa de ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa ni sems can kun las shes pas 'phags bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan pa ni sems @95a * //
analyzed: 'di ni stobs kyi las rnam pa gcig go // 'gro ba'i mchog tu gyur zhes bya ba la bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa de ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa ni sems can kun las shes pas 'phags bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan pa ni sems @95a * //
translated: This is one kind of action of power.

original: can kun las lus mdzes pa dang longs spyod kyis 'phags zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: can kun las lus mdzes pa dang longs spyod kyis 'phags zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having become the best in the world means that, endowed with the stores of merit and of knowledge, he is exalted above all beings by his knowledge, because of his store of knowledge; and he is exalted above all beings by his body and his wealth, because of his store of merit.

original: 'di ni stobs yongs su smin pa'i las gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni stobs yongs su smin pa'i las gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second action of the power of maturity.

original: stobs rnyed pa yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni stobs kyi rgyu dang / rang bzhin dang / las gsum dang ldan na stobs yongs su smin pa rnyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: stobs rnyed pa yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni stobs kyi rgyu dang / rang bzhin dang / las gsum dang ldan na stobs yongs su smin pa rnyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The characteristic of the attainment of the power of maturity is that he attains the power of maturity when he is endowed with the three, cause, nature, and action of power.

original: mi 'phrogs pa yongs su smin pa las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa yongs su smin pa las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse on the topic of the maturity of invincibility.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsod nams kyi mthu dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mthu dang ldan pas bdud la sogs pas ni spyod pa bsgyur bar mi nus pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsod nams kyi mthu dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mthu dang ldan pas bdud la sogs pas ni spyod pa bsgyur bar mi nus pa la /
translated: The bodhisattva is endowed with the power of merit and the power of the collection of intuition; therefore, he cannot be turned away from his practice by demons, etc.

original: mu stegs pa la sogs pas kyang lta ba bsgyur bar mi nus pa bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mu stegs pa la sogs pas kyang lta ba bsgyur bar mi nus pa bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In order to demonstrate that he cannot be turned away from his view by heterodox groups, etc., the verse is begun.

original: de yang mi 'phrogs pa'i rgyu dang / rang bzhin dang / las gsum dang ldan na mi 'phrogs pa yongs su smin pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de yang mi 'phrogs pa'i rgyu dang / rang bzhin dang / las gsum dang ldan na mi 'phrogs pa yongs su smin pa yin par bstan to //
translated: Moreover, it is taught that the full perfection of the unperturbed is endowed with three causes, natures, and activities.

original: chos bzang rigs pa rnam par dpyod pa'i sems //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos bzang rigs pa rnam par dpyod pa'i sems // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind that analyzes the good doctrine.

original: chos bzang po ni theg pa chen po'i chos te /
analyzed: chos bzang po ni theg pa chen po'i chos te /
translated: The good doctrine is the doctrine of the universal vehicle.

original: theg pa chen po'i chos la rigs pa rnam pa bzhis dpyad cing bsam pa las /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos la rigs pa rnam pa bzhis dpyad cing bsam pa las /
translated: From the analysis and reflection on the doctrine of the universal vehicle by means of four kinds of reasoning,

original: chos kyi don gtan la phab cing the tshom med pa'i sems rnyed pa ni rigs pas rnam par dpyod pa'i sems zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi don gtan la phab cing the tshom med pa'i sems rnyed pa ni rigs pas rnam par dpyod pa'i sems zhes bya ste /
translated: one finds the mind that is free from doubt, having ascertained the meaning of the doctrine. This is called the mind that analyzes with reasoning.

original: 'di ni mi 'phrogs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'phrogs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: This is the cause of the unassailable.

original: de la rigs pa bzhi ni ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / gtan tshigs bsgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa'o ;
analyzed: de la rigs pa bzhi ni ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / gtan tshigs bsgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa'o ;
translated: The four principles are the principle of dependence, the principle of efficacy, the principle of logical possibility, and the principle of reality.

original: / de la rgyu las brten nas 'bras bu skye ba'i rim pa la ltos pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ste /üîΩdper na gzugs dang mig gi dbang po la brten nas /
analyzed: / de la rgyu las brten nas 'bras bu skye ba'i rim pa la ltos pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ste / dper na gzugs dang mig gi dbang po la brten nas /
translated: The principle of dependence is the order of the arising of effects in dependence on causes.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba ni ltos pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba ni ltos pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: For example, the arising of visual consciousness in dependence on form and the eye faculty is called the principle of dependence.

original: rgyu rkyen gyi mthu las mig gi rnam par shes pa skyes nas gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa rang gi las byed pa ni bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen gyi mthu las mig gi rnam par shes pa skyes nas gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa rang gi las byed pa ni bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The principle of efficacy is the performance of its own function by visual consciousness, which has arisen from the power of causes and conditions, in seeing form, and so on.

original: gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni gsum ste /
translated: The principle of logical possibility is threefold:

original: 'bras bu'i rgyu dang / rang bzhin gyi rgyu dang / mi dmigs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyu dang / rang bzhin gyi rgyu dang / mi dmigs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: the cause of effect, the cause of nature, and the cause of non-apprehension.

original: de la 'bras bu'i rgyu ni gang na du ba yod pa de na me yod do zhes @95b bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu'i rgyu ni gang na du ba yod pa de na me yod do zhes @95b bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The causal relation is like the statement, ‚ÄúWhere there is smoke, there is fire.‚ÄùüîΩThe natural relation is like the statement, ‚ÄúThis is a tree, because it is an a≈õoka tree.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin gyi rgyu ni shing zhes bya bas shing sha pa dang thang shing la sogs pa kun la khyab pas na 'di ni shing yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi rgyu ni shing zhes bya bas shing sha pa dang thang shing la sogs pa kun la khyab pas na 'di ni shing yin te /
translated: The a≈õoka tree and the palm tree are both included in the category of trees.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: shing sha pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: shing sha pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Because it is an a≈õoka tree.

original: mi dmigs pa'i rgyu ni sa phyogs 'di na dmigs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bum pa mi snang ba ni bum pa med do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //üîΩchos nyid kyi rigs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /üîΩma byung yang rung /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rgyu ni sa phyogs 'di na dmigs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bum pa mi snang ba ni bum pa med do zhes bya ba lta bu'o // chos nyid kyi rigs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung / ma byung yang rung /
translated: The relation of nonobservation is like the statement, ‚ÄúSince the vase, which is perceptible in this place, is not seen, it does not exist.‚Äù

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed la sogs pa'i chos nyid 'di ni ye nas gnas pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //üîΩrtag tu bdud kyis bar chad byed pa med //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed la sogs pa'i chos nyid 'di ni ye nas gnas pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o // rtag tu bdud kyis bar chad byed pa med //
translated: The relation of reality is like the statement, ‚ÄúWhether the tathƒÅgatas appear or not, this reality of things, i.e., that volitions are conditioned by ignorance, and so on, has always been present.‚Äù

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: The relation of noninterruption is like the statement, ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva is always uninterrupted by the activities of mƒÅras.‚Äù

original: nam byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i tshe bdud la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su sprul te /
analyzed: nam byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i tshe bdud la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su sprul te /
translated: When a bodhisattva is practicing the bodhisattva practices, even if Mara and others, in the form of Buddhas, try to get him to give up the bodhisattva practices, he cannot be made to do so.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'dor du bcug kyang 'dor du mi btub pa dang / mu stegs pa la sogs pas gtan tshigs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis lta ba sun phyung nas lta ba gzhan sun phyung bar brtsams kyang lta ba 'dor du mi btub pa ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'dor du bcug kyang 'dor du mi btub pa dang / mu stegs pa la sogs pas gtan tshigs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis lta ba sun phyung nas lta ba gzhan sun phyung bar brtsams kyang lta ba 'dor du mi btub pa ni //
translated: And even if non-Buddhists and others try to refute his views with various arguments and get him to adopt other views, he cannot be made to do so.

original: rtag tu bdud kyis bar chad byed pa med //
analyzed: rtag tu bdud kyis bar chad byed pa med //
translated: He is never hindered by Mara.

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: 'di ni mi 'phrogs pa la yongs su smin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'phrogs pa la yongs su smin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: This is the nature of the maturity of immunity.

original: khyad par rnyed dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khyad par rnyed dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The verse says, ‚Äúgaining distinction, etc. ‚Äù

original: rigs pas rnam par dpyod pa'i sems des rim par gnas pa la yang zhing shas je che je cher gyur pa ni khyad par rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pas rnam par dpyod pa'i sems des rim par gnas pa la yang zhing shas je che je cher gyur pa ni khyad par rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind that analyzes with reasoning becomes more and more tranquil and still as it progresses, and this is called ‚Äúgaining distinction. ‚Äù

original: de yang dper na sa dang po'i rigs pas rnam par dpyod pa'i sems pas /
analyzed: de yang dper na sa dang po'i rigs pas rnam par dpyod pa'i sems pas /
translated: For example, on the first ground, the mind that analyzes with reasoning is not as tranquil and still as it is on the second ground.

original: sa gnyis pa'i rigs pas rnam par dpyod pa'i sems shas che bas na khyad zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: sa gnyis pa'i rigs pas rnam par dpyod pa'i sems shas che bas na khyad zhugs pa yin te /
translated: The second level is distinguished by the predominance of the mind that investigates with reasoning.

original: 'di ni mi 'phrogs pa rnam par smin pa'i las rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'phrogs pa rnam par smin pa'i las rnam pa gcig go //
translated: This is the first kind of activity of the fully ripened result that is not subject to loss.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin zhes bya ba la /
translated: Refuting the positions of others.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs ni mu stegs pa rnams kyi gtsug lag dang ldan pa la bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs ni mu stegs pa rnams kyi gtsug lag dang ldan pa la bya ste /
translated: The positions of others refers to those who possess the scriptures of the tƒ´rthikas.

original: rigs pas rnam par dpyod pa'i sems dang ldan pas mu stegs pa la sogs pa'i phyogs ni sun 'byin par nus /
analyzed: rigs pas rnam par dpyod pa'i sems dang ldan pas mu stegs pa la sogs pa'i phyogs ni sun 'byin par nus /
translated: Because they possess the mind that investigates with reasoning, they are able to refute the positions of the tƒ´rthikas and so forth.

original: bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi gzhung nyid ni gzugs par nus zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi gzhung nyid ni gzugs par nus zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚ÄúI am able to uphold the scriptures of the Buddha‚Äù is that they are able to uphold the scriptures of the Buddha.

original: 'di ni mi 'phrogs pa'i las yongs su smin pa'i las rnam pa gnyis pa'o //üîΩmi 'phrogs pa yongs su smin par byed @96a * //
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'phrogs pa'i las yongs su smin pa'i las rnam pa gnyis pa'o // mi 'phrogs pa yongs su smin par byed @96a * //
translated: This is the second kind of activity of the fully ripened result that is not subject to loss.

original: pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The characteristic of the fully ripened result that is not subject to loss.

original: mi 'phrogs pa'i rgyu dang / rang bzhin dang / las gsum dang ldan na mi 'phrogs pa yongs su smin par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa'i rgyu dang / rang bzhin dang / las gsum dang ldan na mi 'phrogs pa yongs su smin par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if one has the three: the cause of non-loss, the nature of non-loss, and the action of non-loss, one will have complete maturation of non-loss.

original: spong ba'i yan lag dang ldan pa yongs su smin pa las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: spong ba'i yan lag dang ldan pa yongs su smin pa las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse on the maturity of possessing the branches of abandonment.

original: spong ba ni sa dang po'i chos kyi dbyings rtogs nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis spangs pa las spong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: spong ba ni sa dang po'i chos kyi dbyings rtogs nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis spangs pa las spong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Abandonment is so called because, having realized the reality of the first stage, one abandons the duality of subject and object.

original: de'i grogs su gyur pa'i chos rnam pa lnga ni spong ba'i yan lag dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i grogs su gyur pa'i chos rnam pa lnga ni spong ba'i yan lag dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The five aspects of the teaching that are its auxiliaries are called the branches of abandonment.

original: lnga po yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga po yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: dad pa dang / g-yo med pa dang / sgyu med pa dang / lus la nad med pa dang / shes rab bo //
analyzed: dad pa dang / g-yo med pa dang / sgyu med pa dang / lus la nad med pa dang / shes rab bo //
translated: Faith, non-deceptiveness, non-fraudulence, physical health, and wisdom.

original: de yang spong ba'i yan lag gi rgyu dang / rang bzhin dang / las gsum dang ldan na spong ba'i yan lag yongs su smin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang spong ba'i yan lag gi rgyu dang / rang bzhin dang / las gsum dang ldan na spong ba'i yan lag yongs su smin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Moreover, the verse is composed in order to demonstrate that the limbs of abandonment are fully matured when they are endowed with three things: cause, nature, and function.

original: dge ba stsogs dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba stsogs dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of the verse is as follows: He has undertaken the accumulations of virtue and so on.

original: dge ba'i sgras ni bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs la bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i sgras ni bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs la bya ste /
translated: The term virtue refers to the accumulation of merit and the accumulation of wisdom.

original: de gnyis brtsams zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de gnyis brtsams zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he has undertaken those two.

original: de ni spong ba'i yan lag gi rgyu'o //
analyzed: de ni spong ba'i yan lag gi rgyu'o //
translated: That is the cause of the limbs of abandonment.

original: yan lag lnga las 'di ni dad pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yan lag lnga las 'di ni dad pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is connected with faith among the five limbs.

original: gnas kyang brtson par rung zhes bya ba dang / gnas kyi sgras ni lus la bya ste /
analyzed: gnas kyang brtson par rung zhes bya ba dang / gnas kyi sgras ni lus la bya ste /
translated: The term abode refers to the body.

original: nyan pa dang sems pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa dge ba byed pa na lus la gnod pa dang / mi bde ba med cing brtson 'grus rgyun du rtsom par gnas pa'i lus la ni gnas kyang brtson par rung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyan pa dang sems pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa dge ba byed pa na lus la gnod pa dang / mi bde ba med cing brtson 'grus rgyun du rtsom par gnas pa'i lus la ni gnas kyang brtson par rung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: When one is engaged in virtue such as listening, reflection, and meditation, one is not harmed by physical pain or mental unhappiness, and one is able to remain in the practice of effort.

original: 'di ni spang ba'i yan lag gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni spang ba'i yan lag gi rang bzhin no //
translated: This is the nature of the branch of elimination.

original: yan lag lnga las 'di ni lus la nad med par sbyar ro //
analyzed: yan lag lnga las 'di ni lus la nad med par sbyar ro //
translated: Among the five branches, this is applied to the absence of physical illness.

original: dben la dga' dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dben la dga' dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: One delights in solitude.

original: 'du 'dzi thams cad spangs nas shing drung brag phug la sogs pa'i gnas dben pa dag na gnas par dga' ba ni dben pa mchog la dga' ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'du 'dzi thams cad spangs nas shing drung brag phug la sogs pa'i gnas dben pa dag na gnas par dga' ba ni dben pa mchog la dga' ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Having abandoned all crowds, one delights in remaining in solitary places such as the foot of a tree, a cave, and so on. This is called delighting in supreme solitude.

original: 'di ni spong ba'i yan lag gi las rnam pa gcig ste /
analyzed: 'di ni spong ba'i yan lag gi las rnam pa gcig ste /
translated: This is one aspect of the function of the branch of elimination.

original: g-yo med pa dang sgyu med pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: g-yo med pa dang sgyu med pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is applied to the absence of deceit and the absence of pretense.

original: dge ba la mngon par dga'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba la mngon par dga'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One delights in virtue.

original: dge ba'i sgra theg pa chen po'i chos la bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i sgra theg pa chen po'i chos la bya ste /
translated: The word virtue refers to the MahƒÅyƒÅna Dharma.

original: chos de dag nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa la dga' ba ni dge ba la mngon par dga'o zhes @96b bya'o ;
analyzed: chos de dag nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa la dga' ba ni dge ba la mngon par dga'o zhes @96b bya'o ;
translated: One delights in listening to, reflecting on, and meditating on those teachings.

original: /'di ni spong ba'i yan lag gi las rnam pa gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: /'di ni spong ba'i yan lag gi las rnam pa gnyis pa ste /
translated: This is the second kind of activity of the branches of abandonment.

original: 'di ni shes rab dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni shes rab dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is the application to wisdom.

original: rgyal ba'i sras kyi yan lag ldan pa yis //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras kyi yan lag ldan pa yis //
translated: The sons of the Victorious Ones, who possess the branches,

original: yang dag yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid 'dod //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dag yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid 'dod // ces bya ba la /
translated: Desire the characteristics of perfect complete ripening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spong ba'i yan lag rnam pa lnga rnam pa rgyu dang / rang bzhin dang / las dang ldan na spong pa'i yan lag yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spong ba'i yan lag rnam pa lnga rnam pa rgyu dang / rang bzhin dang / las dang ldan na spong pa'i yan lag yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod do //
translated: Here, the five kinds of branches of abandonment of the bodhisattvas are considered to be the characteristics of the complete ripening of the branches of abandonment in terms of cause, essence, activity, and possession.

original: bdag yongs su smin pa'i rnam pa dgu'i che ba las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag yongs su smin pa'i rnam pa dgu'i che ba las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: One verse on the greatness of the bodhisattva‚Äôs nine aspects of complete ripening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dad pa nas spong ba'i yan lag gi bar du chos dgu dang ldan na bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dad pa nas spong ba'i yan lag gi bar du chos dgu dang ldan na bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas are said to be fully matured in the qualities of the Buddha when they possess nine qualities, from faith to the branches of elimination.

original: dgu pos bdag sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i chos dgu po de nyid yon tan dang / bdag nyid chen po bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dgu pos bdag sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i chos dgu po de nyid yon tan dang / bdag nyid chen po bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The nine qualities by which one is fully matured in the qualities of the Buddha are taught in order to demonstrate the qualities and greatness of the bodhisattvas.

original: che ba yang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: che ba yang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Greatness is twofold.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: gzhan yongs su smin pa'i bya ba'i rten du gyur pa dang / chos kyi lus 'phel bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yongs su smin pa'i bya ba'i rten du gyur pa dang / chos kyi lus 'phel bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The support for the activity of fully maturing others and the increase of the body of truth.

original: de ltar dngos po rnam pa dgu smin pa'i gzhi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po rnam pa dgu smin pa'i gzhi zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, the nine aspects of full maturation are the basis.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus means as previously explained.

original: dngos po rnam pa dgu ni dad pa nas spong ba'i yan lag gi bar du dgu ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnam pa dgu ni dad pa nas spong ba'i yan lag gi bar du dgu ste /
translated: The nine aspects are the nine from faith to the branches of elimination.

original: gang du bshad pa ltar na byang chub sems dpa' de chos rnam pa dgu'i gzhi'am rten tam gnas de lta bur gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang du bshad pa ltar na byang chub sems dpa' de chos rnam pa dgu'i gzhi'am rten tam gnas de lta bur gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the above passage is that the bodhisattva becomes the basis, the support, the foundation of nine kinds of attributes.

original: pha rol yongs su smin byed rung dang ldan //
analyzed: pha rol yongs su smin byed rung dang ldan //
translated: He is fit to bring others to full maturity.

original: zhes bya bas gzhan yongs su smin par bya ba'i rten du gyur par bstan te ;
analyzed: zhes bya bas gzhan yongs su smin par bya ba'i rten du gyur par bstan te ;
translated: This shows that he is the support for bringing others to full maturity.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de chos rnam pa dgu'i rten du gyur pas sems can yongs su smin par byed par nus shing sems can yongs su smin pa'i mthu yod la sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i gnas su yang gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de chos rnam pa dgu'i rten du gyur pas sems can yongs su smin par byed par nus shing sems can yongs su smin pa'i mthu yod la sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i gnas su yang gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that because the bodhisattva becomes the support for nine kinds of attributes, he is able to bring sentient beings to full maturity, he has the power to bring sentient beings to full maturity, and he is the foundation for bringing sentient beings to full maturity.

original: dge ba rtag tu rab tu 'phel ba'i dngos po zhes bya bas rtag tu chos kyi lus 'phel ba bstan te /
analyzed: dge ba rtag tu rab tu 'phel ba'i dngos po zhes bya bas rtag tu chos kyi lus 'phel ba bstan te /
translated: The phrase the constant increase of virtue shows the constant increase of the body of Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos dgu'i rten du gyur pas na sems can yongs su smin par byed par nus par yang ma zad kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos dgu'i rten du gyur pas na sems can yongs su smin par byed par nus par yang ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is the bodhisattva able to bring sentient beings to full maturity because he becomes the support for nine kinds of attributes,

original: dus thams cad du pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi chos rnams 'phel bar 'gyur te bdag gi rgyud la dge @97a * //
analyzed: dus thams cad du pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi chos rnams 'phel bar 'gyur te bdag gi rgyud la dge @97a * //
translated: At all times, the qualities of the six perfections will increase in your mindstream.

original: ba bskyed pa'i gzhi dang rten du yang gyur ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba bskyed pa'i gzhi dang rten du yang gyur ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: At all times, the qualities of the six perfections increase, and one becomes the basis and support for generating virtue in one's own mindstream.

original: rtag tu 'gro ba rnams kyi gnyen mchog 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩde ltar byang chub sems dpa' de chos rnam pa dgu dang yang ldan /üîΩsems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i mthu yang yod /
analyzed: rtag tu 'gro ba rnams kyi gnyen mchog 'gyur // zhes bya ba la / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de chos rnam pa dgu dang yang ldan / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i mthu yang yod /
translated: One always becomes the supreme friend of beings.

original: rtag tu dge ba'i chos kyang 'phel bas na /
analyzed: rtag tu dge ba'i chos kyang 'phel bas na /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who possesses these nine qualities and has the power to ripen sentient beings always increases in virtue.

original: sems can rnams tshe 'dir zang zing gis phan btags nas dge ba la bkod de phan par byed pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du bde 'gro dang mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod de bde bar byas pas na 'gro ba rnams kyi gnyen mchog gyur pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams tshe 'dir zang zing gis phan btags nas dge ba la bkod de phan par byed pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du bde 'gro dang mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod de bde bar byas pas na 'gro ba rnams kyi gnyen mchog gyur pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since he benefits sentient beings by helping them in this life through material gifts and by establishing them in virtue, and since he makes them happy in other lives by establishing them in the happy realms and in nirvana, he becomes the supreme friend of beings.

original: pha ma dang he du gnyen bshes pas sems can la phan pa lhag par mdzad pas na gnyen mchog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: pha ma dang he du gnyen bshes pas sems can la phan pa lhag par mdzad pas na gnyen mchog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: They are the best of relatives because they are especially helpful to sentient beings, as parents and friends are.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: pha mas ni 'dir zang zing gis phran tshegs tsam gyi phan 'dogs par nus kyi /
analyzed: pha mas ni 'dir zang zing gis phran tshegs tsam gyi phan 'dogs par nus kyi /
translated: Parents are able to help a little with material things in this life,

original: tshe rabs gzhan du mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das par 'jog par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsems can yongs su smin pa'i rnam par dbye ba las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig go zhes bya ba la gong du gang la bslab par bya ba la rnam pa bdun du gzhag pa las 'di yan chad bdag yongs su smin pas brtsams pa'i bar
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das par 'jog par mi nus pa'i phyir ro // sems can yongs su smin pa'i rnam par dbye ba las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig go zhes bya ba la gong du gang la bslab par bya ba la rnam pa bdun du gzhag pa las 'di yan chad bdag yongs su smin pas brtsams pa'i bar
translated: but they are not able to establish their children in the higher realms or in liberation in other lives.üîΩThe eleven verses beginning with the one that goes, ‚ÄúThe wise one should first of all bring to mind the benefits of minding the training,‚Äù are about the benefits of the training.

original: du rnam pa lnga bshad nas ;
analyzed: du rnam pa lnga bshad nas ;
translated: The eleven verses beginning with the one that goes, ‚ÄúThe wise one should first of all bring to mind the benefits of minding the training,‚Äù are about the benefits of the training.

original: da sems can yongs su smin par byed pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: da sems can yongs su smin par byed pa las brtsams te /
translated: The eleven verses beginning with the one that goes, ‚ÄúThe wise one should first of all bring to mind the benefits of minding the training,‚Äù are about the benefits of the training.

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su smin par byed pa tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig gis ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su smin par byed pa tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig gis ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How the bodhisattva ripens sentient beings is shown by eleven verses.

original: de la bdag yongs su smin par byed pa'i rjes la sems can yongs su smin par byed par bstan pa la 'brel bar lta ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de la bdag yongs su smin par byed pa'i rjes la sems can yongs su smin par byed par bstan pa la 'brel bar lta ba ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the teaching on the ripening of oneself and the ripening of sentient beings?

original: ji ltar bdag ma smin bdag ma grol bdag thar par ma gyur pa'i sems can grol ba dang thar par bya bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag ma smin bdag ma grol bdag thar par ma gyur pa'i sems can grol ba dang thar par bya bar mi rung ste /
translated: It is not possible for one who is not himself ripened, not liberated, not freed, to liberate and free others.

original: de bas na bdag yongs su smin par byed pa'i rjes la sems can yongs su smin par byed pa bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: de bas na bdag yongs su smin par byed pa'i rjes la sems can yongs su smin par byed pa bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, after the teaching on the ripening of oneself, the teaching on the ripening of sentient beings is connected.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig gis bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig gis bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The meaning of the eleven verses is summarized in four topics:

original: yongs su smin pa'i rang bzhin dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / bsam pa dang / sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i rang bzhin dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / bsam pa dang / sbyor ba'o //
translated: the nature of ripening, its divisions, its intention, and its application.

original: ji ltar rma rnams dang ni kha zas dag / gzag cing sbyang tu rung bar smin 'dod ltar //
analyzed: ji ltar rma rnams dang ni kha zas dag / gzag cing sbyang tu rung bar smin 'dod ltar //
translated: Just as a wound and food are considered ripe when they are ready to be drained and eaten.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su @97b bcad pa gcig gis ni yongs su smin pa'i rang bzhin ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su @97b bcad pa gcig gis ni yongs su smin pa'i rang bzhin ston te /
translated: One verse on the nature of full ripening:üîΩA wound is considered ripe when it is ready to be drained and when it is ready to be closed. Food is considered ripe when it is ready to be eaten.

original: 'di ni 'bras dang phol mig la sogs pa'i rma rnams nam dbug pa'i dus la bab cing rnag 'dzag pa de'i dus na yongs su smin pa yin pa dang / nam kha zas la sogs pa spyad du rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras dang phol mig la sogs pa'i rma rnams nam dbug pa'i dus la bab cing rnag 'dzag pa de'i dus na yongs su smin pa yin pa dang / nam kha zas la sogs pa spyad du rung ste /
translated: The wound is considered ripe when it is ready to be drained of pus and when it is ready to be closed.

original: bzar rung bar gyur pa na yongs su smin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bzar rung bar gyur pa na yongs su smin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Food is considered ripe when it is ready to be eaten.

original: 'di ni dpe'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dpe'o //
translated: This is the example.

original: don bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gnas la phyogs gnyis zhi ba dang / de bzhin spyad cing smin par brjod cing bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gnas la phyogs gnyis zhi ba dang / de bzhin spyad cing smin par brjod cing bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to show the meaning, he says, ‚ÄúLikewise, in the case of the bases, it is said that they are ripe when the two sides are pacified.‚Äù

original: gnas kyi sgra ni phung po lnga la bya'o //
analyzed: gnas kyi sgra ni phung po lnga la bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúbases‚Äù refers to the five aggregates.

original: phyogs gnyis ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang ; dad pa la sogs pa gnyen po'i phyogs so //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang ; dad pa la sogs pa gnyen po'i phyogs so //
translated: The two sides are the side of the afflictions, such as passion, and the side of the antidotes, such as faith.üîΩJust as a wound is said to be ripe when pus oozes out, so a person is said to be ripe when he obtains a body in which the afflictions such as passion for his aggregates can be pacified and eliminated.

original: dper na rma nang na rnag 'dzag pa'i dus na smin pa zhes bya ba bzhin du nam bdag gi phung po la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa yod pa zhi bar bya nus shing spong nus pa'i lus thob pa dang / dper na kha zas bzar rung bar gyur na smin pa zhes bya ba de bzhin du nam bdag gi lus la yod pa'i dge ba'i phyogs rnams rgyun du spyad cing sgom par nus pa'i lus thob na gang zag de yongs su smin par byas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dper na rma nang na rnag 'dzag pa'i dus na smin pa zhes bya ba bzhin du nam bdag gi phung po la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa yod pa zhi bar bya nus shing spong nus pa'i lus thob pa dang / dper na kha zas bzar rung bar gyur na smin pa zhes bya ba de bzhin du nam bdag gi lus la yod pa'i dge ba'i phyogs rnams rgyun du spyad cing sgom par nus pa'i lus thob na gang zag de yongs su smin par byas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as food is said to be ripe when it is ready to eat, so a person is said to be ripe when he obtains a body in which the factors of virtue that exist in his body can be continuously practiced and cultivated.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa zhes bya bas yongs su smin pa'i rab tu dbye ba ston te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa zhes bya bas yongs su smin pa'i rab tu dbye ba ston te /
translated: The second verse teaches the classification of maturity.

original: de rnam pa brgyad kyis ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rnam pa brgyad kyis ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that the bodhisattva brings beings to full maturity through these eight aspects.

original: bral bar smin byed ces bya ba la /
analyzed: bral bar smin byed ces bya ba la /
translated: The full ripening of separation.

original: sems can rnams 'dod chags dang bral bar byas zhe sdang dang bral bar byas nas nyon mongs pa kun dang bral bar byas pa ni bral bar smin byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams 'dod chags dang bral bar byas zhe sdang dang bral bar byas nas nyon mongs pa kun dang bral bar byas pa ni bral bar smin byed ces bya'o //
translated: The full ripening of separation is the full ripening of beings who are separated from attachment, separated from hatred, and separated from all the afflictions.

original: yongs su smin byed ces gsungs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yongs su smin byed ces gsungs zhes bya ba la /
translated: The full ripening of complete maturity.

original: theg pa gsum gyi thabs kyis theg pa gsum gyi rigs can gyi gang zag kun smin par byas pa ni yongs su smin byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi thabs kyis theg pa gsum gyi rigs can gyi gang zag kun smin par byas pa ni yongs su smin byed ces bya'o //
translated: The full ripening of complete maturity is the full ripening of all beings who are of the three spiritual lineages by means of the three vehicles.üîΩThe full ripening of excellence.

original: de bzhin rab tu smin byed ces bya bas mu stegs la sogs pa'i grogs dag gis kyang chos bstan pa'i sgo nas gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu smin par byed pa yod mod kyi slar ldog par 'gyur bas na rab tu smin par byed ces mi
analyzed: de bzhin rab tu smin byed ces bya bas mu stegs la sogs pa'i grogs dag gis kyang chos bstan pa'i sgo nas gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu smin par byed pa yod mod kyi slar ldog par 'gyur bas na rab tu smin par byed ces mi
translated: The full ripening of excellence is the full ripening of beings in the form and formless realms by means of the teaching of the Dharma by friends such as tirthikas.

original: bya'o // byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa gsum gyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu la bkod de smin par byas pa rnams la slar @98a * //
analyzed: bya'o // byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa gsum gyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu la bkod de smin par byas pa rnams la slar @98a * //
translated: The bodhisattvas bring beings to maturity by establishing them in the result of the three vehicles nirvana and they do not turn back from this.

original: ldog pa med pas na rab tu smin byed ces bya'o //üîΩrjes smin gzhan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ldog pa med pas na rab tu smin byed ces bya'o // rjes smin gzhan zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus it is called the fully ripened effect.üîΩThe other is the fully matured effect.

original: gdul ba dang mthun par chos bstan pa'i sgo nas smin par byas pa ni rjes smin zhes bya ste /üîΩ'dod chags can la mi gtsang ba bsgom pa 'chad pa dang / zhe sdang can la byams pa bsgom pa dang / gti mug can la rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: gdul ba dang mthun par chos bstan pa'i sgo nas smin par byas pa ni rjes smin zhes bya ste / 'dod chags can la mi gtsang ba bsgom pa 'chad pa dang / zhe sdang can la byams pa bsgom pa dang / gti mug can la rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba 'chad pa'o //
translated: The effect of fully maturing others is called the fully matured effect.üîΩThe effect of the fully matured is the cause of the fully matured.

original: legs par smin byed ces bya ba la /
analyzed: legs par smin byed ces bya ba la /
translated: The effect of the fully matured is the cause of the fully matured.

original: mtho dman dang byams sdang med par snyoms par sems can kun smin par byed cing sems can smin par byed pa'i dus na yang bsgrims te nan tan gyis bsti stang dang gus pa dang bcas par smin par byed pa ni legs par smin byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: mtho dman dang byams sdang med par snyoms par sems can kun smin par byed cing sems can smin par byed pa'i dus na yang bsgrims te nan tan gyis bsti stang dang gus pa dang bcas par smin par byed pa ni legs par smin byed ces bya'o //
translated: The good ripening is the ripening of all sentient beings without distinction of high or low, friend or enemy, and the ripening of sentient beings with effort, with intense effort, with respect and reverence.

original: lhag par smin byed ces bya ba la /üîΩbdag nyid kyis sa dang po thob nas chos kyi dbyings rtogs par byas te /
analyzed: lhag par smin byed ces bya ba la / bdag nyid kyis sa dang po thob nas chos kyi dbyings rtogs par byas te /
translated: The special ripening is as follows:üîΩHaving attained the first stage oneself, one causes others to attain the first stage and to realize the Dharma-element.

original: gzhan dag kyang sa dang po thob par byas nas chos kyi dbyings rtogs par byas pa ni lhag par smin byed ces bya'o ;
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang sa dang po thob par byas nas chos kyi dbyings rtogs par byas pa ni lhag par smin byed ces bya'o ;
translated: This is called special ripening.

original: / rtag smin byed dang ces bya ba la /
analyzed: / rtag smin byed dang ces bya ba la /
translated: The constant ripening is as follows:

original: gang 'das pa dang da ltar gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs kyi sgo nas chos phyin ci ma log par bshad pa la /
analyzed: gang 'das pa dang da ltar gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs kyi sgo nas chos phyin ci ma log par bshad pa la /
translated: The unerring explanation of the Dharma by the Buddhas of the past and present, by means of the collection of names, the collection of phrases, and the collection of letters,

original: sems can gyi don du ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams kyi sgo nas chos de dag gi don rtag tu phyin ci ma log par 'chad pa ni rtag tu smin byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams kyi sgo nas chos de dag gi don rtag tu phyin ci ma log par 'chad pa ni rtag tu smin byed ces bya'o //
translated: And for the sake of sentient beings, one always explains the meaning of those teachings without error by means of the collection of names, the collection of words, and the collection of letters. This is called always bringing to maturity.

original: yang na mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rang bzhin du rtag par yang de ltar phyin ci ma log par 'chad kyi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du nams kyang mi 'chad pas na rtag smin byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang na mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rang bzhin du rtag par yang de ltar phyin ci ma log par 'chad kyi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du nams kyang mi 'chad pas na rtag smin byed ces bya'o //
translated: Or else, one always explains that they have the nature of being impermanent, suffering, empty, and selfless, but never explains that they have the characteristics of permanence and so on. Therefore, it is called always bringing to maturity.

original: lus can steng smin byed ces bya ba ni lus can ni sems can la bya ste /
analyzed: lus can steng smin byed ces bya ba ni lus can ni sems can la bya ste /
translated: As for bringing those above to maturity, those above refers to sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams mos pas spyod pa'i sa drod la gnas nas gong ma spyi po thob par byas pas nas dgu pa la gnas na sa bcu thob par byas pa ni steng smin byed ces bya ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams mos pas spyod pa'i sa drod la gnas nas gong ma spyi po thob par byas pas nas dgu pa la gnas na sa bcu thob par byas pa ni steng smin byed ces bya ste /
translated: Having brought sentient beings to the stage of warmth on the level of earnest aspiration, one then brings them to the peak stage and then to the ninth level. This is called bringing those above to maturity.

original: don du nyan thos rgyun du zhugs pa dag smin par byas na ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: don du nyan thos rgyun du zhugs pa dag smin par byas na ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur /
translated: In fact, if one matures stream enterers, one obtains the result of an arhat.

original: sa dang po'i byang chub sems dpa' smin par byas na ni 'chad rgyab thob par 'gyur ba lta bu dag la steng smin byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang po'i byang chub sems dpa' smin par byas na ni 'chad rgyab thob par 'gyur ba lta bu dag la steng smin byed ces bya'o //
translated: If one matures a bodhisattva on the first stage, one obtains the stage of a nonregressing bodhisattva.üîΩThe third and fourth

original: @98b tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa dang bzhi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @98b tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa dang bzhi zhes bya ba la /
translated: verses.

original: da ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa dang bzhi pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams dgongs pa gang dang bsam pa gang gis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i dgongs pa'i khyad par ston te /
analyzed: da ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa dang bzhi pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams dgongs pa gang dang bsam pa gang gis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i dgongs pa'i khyad par ston te /
translated: Now, the third and fourth verses show the distinctive intention with which bodhisattvas mature sentient beings, an intention that is

original: de yang pha ma gnyen bshes kyi bsam pa las bye brag tu 'phags pa dang / 'jig rten bdag la byams pa'i bsam pas bye brag tu 'phags pa des ston te /
analyzed: de yang pha ma gnyen bshes kyi bsam pa las bye brag tu 'phags pa dang / 'jig rten bdag la byams pa'i bsam pas bye brag tu 'phags pa des ston te /
translated: superior to the intention of parents, relatives, and friends, and superior to the worldly intention of self love.

original: ji ltar rgyal sras phan par bsam pa yis //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal sras phan par bsam pa yis //
translated: Just as a mother is to her only child,

original: 'gro ba thams cad rnam par smin byed gnas //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad rnam par smin byed gnas //
translated: so the bodhisattvas are to beings.üîΩJust as a mother is to her only child,üîΩso the bodhisattvas are to beings.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: As such,üîΩhow do bodhisattvas think of benefiting sentient beings? They think, ‚ÄúI will establish sentient beings in the benefits of this life‚Äù and they think, ‚ÄúI will establish them in the happiness of other lives.‚Äù

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can tshe 'di la phan pa la gzhag par bya'o snyam du dgongs pa dang tshe rabs gzhan du bde ba la dgod par bya'o snyam du dgongs pa'i sgo nas sems can la phan par bya ba'i dgongs pas sems can rnams
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can tshe 'di la phan pa la gzhag par bya'o snyam du dgongs pa dang tshe rabs gzhan du bde ba la dgod par bya'o snyam du dgongs pa'i sgo nas sems can la phan par bya ba'i dgongs pas sems can rnams
translated: Through the intention to benefit sentient beings, they benefit sentient beings.

original: tshe 'di la yo byad rnam pa sna tshogs kyis phongs pa med par byas nas /
analyzed: tshe 'di la yo byad rnam pa sna tshogs kyis phongs pa med par byas nas /
translated: Having made sentient beings free of the poverty of various necessities in this life,üîΩthey turn them away from nonvirtue and establish them in virtue, thus ripening them.üîΩAnd in other lives, they establish them in the higher rebirths of gods and humans and in nirvana, thus ripening them.

original: mi dge ba las bzlog cing dge ba la bkod de smin par byed pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du lha dang mi'i mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod de smin par byas pa ltar 'jig rten pa pha ma la sogs pa bu tshal de lta bu'i bsam pa mi 'byung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba las bzlog cing dge ba la bkod de smin par byed pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du lha dang mi'i mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod de smin par byas pa ltar 'jig rten pa pha ma la sogs pa bu tshal de lta bu'i bsam pa mi 'byung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Such a thought does not occur to worldly people, such as parents and so on, with regard to their children.üîΩLikewise, they do not dwell on fathers, mothers, friends,

original: de bzhin pha dang ma dang bshes rnams dang // bu dang gnyen pa rnams la mi gnas so //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin pha dang ma dang bshes rnams dang // bu dang gnyen pa rnams la mi gnas so //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: sons, and relatives.

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems can la phan pa dang / bde bar bya'o snyam du dgongs pa lta bu pha ma bu la phan pa'i bsam pa de lta bu mi 'byung ba dang / gnyen bshes dag gnyen rnams la phan pa'i bsam pa de lta bu mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems can la phan pa dang / bde bar bya'o snyam du dgongs pa lta bu pha ma bu la phan pa'i bsam pa de lta bu mi 'byung ba dang / gnyen bshes dag gnyen rnams la phan pa'i bsam pa de lta bu mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the thought of benefit and happiness for sentient beings that is the intention of the bodhisattva does not occur in parents and relatives, as it does in the bodhisattva.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: pha ma dang gnyen bshes dag ji ltar bu tsha dang gnyen pa rnams la phan pa dang / bde bar bya'o snyam du bsams kyang tshe 'dir zang zing tsam zhig la gzhag par nus su zad kyi dge ba la 'jog par mi nus pa dang /
analyzed: pha ma dang gnyen bshes dag ji ltar bu tsha dang gnyen pa rnams la phan pa dang / bde bar bya'o snyam du bsams kyang tshe 'dir zang zing tsam zhig la gzhag par nus su zad kyi dge ba la 'jog par mi nus pa dang /
translated: Even though parents and relatives think, ‚ÄúMay our children and relatives have benefit and happiness,‚Äù they are only able to establish them in the mere material things of this life, but they are not able to establish them in virtue.

original: tshe rabs gzhan du mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das pa la 'jog par mi nus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das pa la 'jog par mi nus pa'i phyir te /
translated: And they are not able to establish them in the higher realms and nirvƒÅ·πáa in other lives.

original: 'dis ni pha ma dang gnyen bshes kyi bsam pa las bye brag tu 'phags par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni pha ma dang gnyen bshes kyi bsam pa las bye brag tu 'phags par bstan to //
translated: This shows how the intention of parents and relatives is inferior to that of the bodhisattva.

original: ji ltar snying brtse @99a * //
analyzed: ji ltar snying brtse @99a * //
translated: How is it that the bodhisattvas‚Äô compassion is superior?

original: bde dang phan 'god phyir //
analyzed: bde dang phan 'god phyir //
translated: Because they establish them in happiness and benefit.

original: sems can gzhan la byams par 'dod pa ltar //
analyzed: sems can gzhan la byams par 'dod pa ltar //
translated: Just as they wish to benefit sentient beings with love.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩji ltar byang chub sems dpa' snying rje dang ldan pa rnams sems can la tshe 'dir zang zing sna tshogs kyis phan btags nas dge ba la 'god pas bde ba la bkod pa dang tshe rabs gzhan du mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byas
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' snying rje dang ldan pa rnams sems can la tshe 'dir zang zing sna tshogs kyis phan btags nas dge ba la 'god pas bde ba la bkod pa dang tshe rabs gzhan du mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byas
translated: Here,üîΩjust as the bodhisattvas who possess compassion establish sentient beings in happiness by benefiting them in this life with various material things and by establishing them in virtue, and they establish them in benefit by causing them to attain high status and the definite goodness of nirvana in other lives,

original: pas phan pa la bkod de sems can la byams par dgongs pa'i dgongs pa mnga' ba ltar /
analyzed: pas phan pa la bkod de sems can la byams par dgongs pa'i dgongs pa mnga' ba ltar /
translated: and just as they possess the intention of loving sentient beings,

original: 'jig rten pa rnams rang la phan pa'i bsam pa de tsam mi 'byung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams rang la phan pa'i bsam pa de tsam mi 'byung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: mundane beings do not have even that much intention to benefit themselves.

original: de bzhin 'jig rten pa bdag byams min na //
analyzed: de bzhin 'jig rten pa bdag byams min na //
translated: Similarly, mundane beings do not love themselves,

original: shin tu mdza' ba'i 'gro ba gzhan ci smos //
analyzed: shin tu mdza' ba'i 'gro ba gzhan ci smos //
translated: so what need is there to mention their loving other beings who are very dear to them?

original: zhes bya ba la ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can la phan pa dang bde ba'i dgongs pa mnga' ba ltar sems can rnams bdag la phan par bya na ji ltar byas na phan par 'gyur zhes rnam pa du mar bsams kyang phan pa'i bsam pa
analyzed: zhes bya ba la ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can la phan pa dang bde ba'i dgongs pa mnga' ba ltar sems can rnams bdag la phan par bya na ji ltar byas na phan par 'gyur zhes rnam pa du mar bsams kyang phan pa'i bsam pa
translated: Just as the bodhisattvas have the intention to benefit and make happy all sentient beings, sentient beings also think, ‚ÄúHow can we benefit ourselves?‚Äù

original: de lta bu mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de lta bu mi 'byung ste /
translated: But they do not have the intention to benefitüîΩin the way that bodhisattvas do.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag la phan par bya bar bsams su zin kyang phan pa ma yin pa dang bde ba ma yin pa la 'god par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la phan par bya bar bsams su zin kyang phan pa ma yin pa dang bde ba ma yin pa la 'god par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though they think they are benefiting themselves, they are actually being set in what is not beneficial and not happy.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?üîΩThey think, ‚ÄúI will make myself happy,‚Äù and they engage in taking what is not given and so on.

original: bdag la bde bar bya'o zhes ma byin par len pa la sogs pa dang / byas pa dang de'i rkyen gyis tshe 'dir bcing ba dang bsad pa la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur bas phan pa ma yin pa la bkod do //
analyzed: bdag la bde bar bya'o zhes ma byin par len pa la sogs pa dang / byas pa dang de'i rkyen gyis tshe 'dir bcing ba dang bsad pa la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur bas phan pa ma yin pa la bkod do //
translated: And as a result of that, in this life they experience being bound, killed, and so on. So they are set in what is not beneficial.

original: de'i rkyen gyis tshe rabs gzhan du sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa ngan song gsum du skye ba yin pas bde ba ma yin pa la bkod do //
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis tshe rabs gzhan du sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa ngan song gsum du skye ba yin pas bde ba ma yin pa la bkod do //
translated: Therefore, in other lives, they are reborn in the three miserable realms, such as the hells. Thus, they are established in what is not happiness.

original: yang mu stegs pa la sogs pa bdag tshe 'di dang phyi mar bde bar bya'o zhes tshe 'dir thal ba'i nang na nyal ba dang / khyi dang ba lang gi dka' thub dang brag kha nas mchong ba la sogs pa byas pas tshe 'dir phan pa ma yin pa la bkod do //
analyzed: yang mu stegs pa la sogs pa bdag tshe 'di dang phyi mar bde bar bya'o zhes tshe 'dir thal ba'i nang na nyal ba dang / khyi dang ba lang gi dka' thub dang brag kha nas mchong ba la sogs pa byas pas tshe 'dir phan pa ma yin pa la bkod do //
translated: Moreover, the tƒ´rthikas, etc., thinking, ‚ÄúI will be happy in this life and the next,‚Äù lie down in the ashes in this life, and practice the austerities of dogs and cows, jumping off cliffs, etc. Thus, they are established in what is not beneficial in this life.

original: de'i rgyus tshe rabs gzhan du ngan song gsum du skye bar 'gyur bas na bde ba ma yin pa la bkod de /
analyzed: de'i rgyus tshe rabs gzhan du ngan song gsum du skye bar 'gyur bas na bde ba ma yin pa la bkod de /
translated: By reason of that, they are reborn in the three miserable realms in other lives. Thus, they are established in what is not happiness.

original: 'dis ni 'jig rten pa bdag la byams pa'i bsam pa bas lhag par ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'jig rten pa bdag la byams pa'i bsam pa bas lhag par ston to //
translated: This shows that the bodhisattvas‚Äô love for sentient beings surpasses the love that ordinary people have even for themselves.

original: 'jig rten pa dag la bdag phan par bya'o snyam du bsams na yang byang chub sems dpa' sems can gzhan phan pa dang bde bar bya bar dgongs pa'i bsam @99b pa lta bu mi 'byung na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dag la bdag phan par bya'o snyam du bsams na yang byang chub sems dpa' sems can gzhan phan pa dang bde bar bya bar dgongs pa'i bsam @99b pa lta bu mi 'byung na /
translated: Even if worldly people think, ‚ÄúI will benefit myself,‚Äù the thought of a bodhisattva who intends to benefit and gladden other sentient beings does not arise.

original: 'jig rten na grogs dag gis grogs la phan par bya'o snyam du sems pa'i bsam pa la byang chub sems dpa'i dgongs pa lta ga la zhig 'byung ste mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten na grogs dag gis grogs la phan par bya'o snyam du sems pa'i bsam pa la byang chub sems dpa'i dgongs pa lta ga la zhig 'byung ste mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How could the thought of worldly people who think, ‚ÄúI will benefit my friends,‚Äù give rise to the thought of a bodhisattva? The meaning is that it does not arise.

original: tshigs su bcad pa lhag ma rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa lhag ma rnams kyis ni /
translated: The remaining verses

original: sbyor ba gang gis sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams sgrub pa ston to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyor ba gang gis sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams sgrub pa ston to zhes bya ba la /
translated: show the practice by which one accomplishes the perfections through bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig gis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa bstan pa las 'di yan chad tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig gis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa bstan pa las 'di yan chad tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ni bstan zin to //
translated: Among the eleven verses that show the bringing of sentient beings to maturity, four have already been explained.

original: da ni phyi nas tshigs su bcad pa bdun zhig 'dus te /
analyzed: da ni phyi nas tshigs su bcad pa bdun zhig 'dus te /
translated: Now, seven verses are summarized.

original: bdun las kyang tshigs su bcad pa drug gis ni spyor ba dang phrin las gang gis yongs su smin par byed pa bstan /
analyzed: bdun las kyang tshigs su bcad pa drug gis ni spyor ba dang phrin las gang gis yongs su smin par byed pa bstan /
translated: And in seven verses, he shows how they bring beings to full maturity by means of their practice and their activities.

original: tha ma'i tshigs su bcad pa bdun pas ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i bdag nyid chen po bstan to //
analyzed: tha ma'i tshigs su bcad pa bdun pas ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i bdag nyid chen po bstan to //
translated: In the seventh verse, he shows the greatness of the bodhisattvas who bring beings to full maturity.

original: de la sbyor ba gang gis sems can yongs su smin par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba gang gis sems can yongs su smin par mdzad ce na /
translated: What is the practice by which they bring beings to full maturity?

original: sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa'i sbyor bas sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa'i sbyor bas sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they bring beings to full maturity by means of the practice of accomplishing the six transcendent perfections, from generosity to wisdom.

original: sbyin pa ci 'dra bas sems can ji ltar smin par byed pa de las brtsams nas tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin pa ci 'dra bas sems can ji ltar smin par byed pa de las brtsams nas tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The verse beginning ‚ÄúGenerosity‚Äù deals with the question of how beings are brought to full maturity by what kind of generosity.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug las kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas sems can smin par byed pa bshad de /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug las kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas sems can smin par byed pa bshad de /
translated: Of the six transcendent perfections, it is the transcendent perfection of generosity that brings beings to full maturity.

original: de yang sbyin pa ji lta bu btang nas sems can rnams ji ltar smin par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang sbyin pa ji lta bu btang nas sems can rnams ji ltar smin par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how to mature sentient beings by giving what kind of generosity,

original: tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: he composes this verse.

original: de la sbyin pa ci 'dra bas sems can yongs su smin par byed ce na /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa ci 'dra bas sems can yongs su smin par byed ce na /
translated: What kind of generosity matures sentient beings?

original: sbyin pa rnam pa gsum gyis sems can yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: sbyin pa rnam pa gsum gyis sems can yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: One matures sentient beings by means of three kinds of generosity.

original: sbyin pa gsum ni bdag gi lus dang longs spyod thams cad sbyin pa dang / mi mtshungs pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang / mi ngoms pa'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa gsum ni bdag gi lus dang longs spyod thams cad sbyin pa dang / mi mtshungs pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang / mi ngoms pa'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of generosity are: giving one's own body and all possessions, giving without discrimination, and giving without satiation.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang longs spyod dag / gzhan la mi sbyin pa ni gang yang med //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang longs spyod dag / gzhan la mi sbyin pa ni gang yang med //
translated: There is nothing whatsoever that the bodhisattvas' bodies and possessions are not ready to give to others.

original: ces bya bas bdag gi lus dang longs spyod thams cad sbyin pa btang ste /
analyzed: ces bya bas bdag gi lus dang longs spyod thams cad sbyin pa btang ste /
translated: Thus, by giving away one's own body and possessions,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can gyi don du bdag gi dngos po la yang mi sbyin zhing phongs @100a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can gyi don du bdag gi dngos po la yang mi sbyin zhing phongs @100a * //
translated: the bodhisattvas are not stingy even with their own bodies for the sake of sentient beings.

original: te phyi na gzhag pa gang yang med de /
