analyzed: te phyi na gzhag pa gang yang med de /
translated: There is nothing at all that they do not give to beggars.

original: slong ba rnams la mgo dang / mig dang / rkang lag dang / khrag dang / sha dang / rkang dang / tshil la sogs pa mi gtong ba gang yang med do //
analyzed: slong ba rnams la mgo dang / mig dang / rkang lag dang / khrag dang / sha dang / rkang dang / tshil la sogs pa mi gtong ba gang yang med do //
translated: There is nothing at all that they do not give to beggars, not even their head, eyes, legs, arms, blood, flesh, bones, or marrow.

original: longs spyod la yang mi gtong zhing gces te phyi na gzhag pa gang yang med de /
analyzed: longs spyod la yang mi gtong zhing gces te phyi na gzhag pa gang yang med de /
translated: There is nothing at all that they do not give to beggars, not even their possessions.

original: gser dang / dngul dang / 'bru dang / bang ba dang / bu dang / chung ma dang / bran dang / phyugs la sogs pa kun gtong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gser dang / dngul dang / 'bru dang / bang ba dang / bu dang / chung ma dang / bran dang / phyugs la sogs pa kun gtong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They give away everything, gold, silver, grain, treasuries, children, wives, servants, cattle, and so on.

original: mtshungs par sbyin pa zhes bya bas mi mtshungs pa med pa'i sbyin pa bstan te /
analyzed: mtshungs par sbyin pa zhes bya bas mi mtshungs pa med pa'i sbyin pa bstan te /
translated: Giving equally shows that their giving is not unequal.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mthon po la sbyin gyi dma' ba la mi sbyin pa dang / mdza' ba la sbyin gyi mi mdza' ba la mi sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mthon po la sbyin gyi dma' ba la mi sbyin pa dang / mdza' ba la sbyin gyi mi mdza' ba la mi sbyin pa'am /
translated: Bodhisattvas do not give to the high and mighty and not to the lowly, or give to friends and not to enemies,

original: mkhas pa la sbyin gyi mi mkhas pa la mi sbyin zhes bya ba med de /
analyzed: mkhas pa la sbyin gyi mi mkhas pa la mi sbyin zhes bya ba med de /
translated: or give to the learned and not to the ignorant.

original: 'dra ba kho nar sems can kun la gtong zhing sbyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba kho nar sems can kun la gtong zhing sbyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they give and bestow the same on all sentient beings.

original: yon tan ngoms mi 'gyur zhes bya bas mi ngoms pa'i sbyin pa bstan te /
analyzed: yon tan ngoms mi 'gyur zhes bya bas mi ngoms pa'i sbyin pa bstan te /
translated: The line they never have enough of good qualities teaches insatiable generosity.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni /
translated: The generosity of bodhisattvasüîΩis not like that of mundane beings, who think,

original: lo'am bskal pa 'di snyed cig tu byas pas mchog / ces bya ba med kyi /
analyzed: lo'am bskal pa 'di snyed cig tu byas pas mchog / ces bya ba med kyi /
translated: I have given for so many years or eons, so now I have reached the highest.

original: skad cig ma re re yang breng ma chad par 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du byin yang chog pa med pas na yon tan ngoms par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: skad cig ma re re yang breng ma chad par 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du byin yang chog pa med pas na yon tan ngoms par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya'o ;
translated: Because they give without ever being satisfied, even for a single instant, and they give uninterruptedly until the end of samsara, it is called insatiable generosity.

original: / sbyin pa de gsum gyis ji ltar sems can yongs su smin par byed ce na /
analyzed: / sbyin pa de gsum gyis ji ltar sems can yongs su smin par byed ce na /
translated: How do they bring sentient beings to full maturity through these three kinds of generosity?

original: de'i phyir / phan 'dogs rnam pa gnyis kyis gzhan smin byed //üîΩces smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / phan 'dogs rnam pa gnyis kyis gzhan smin byed // ces smos te /
translated: The line they bring others to maturity through two kinds of help

original: ji ltar yongs su smin par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su smin par byed ce na /
translated: How do they bring them to maturity?

original: tshe 'dir phan btags te /
analyzed: tshe 'dir phan btags te /
translated: By helping them in this life

original: phan pa la bkod pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du phan btags te bde ba la bkod pas sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phan pa la bkod pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du phan btags te bde ba la bkod pas sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he helps them in this life and in other lives.

original: de la tshe 'dir phan btags pa ni zang zing rnam pa sna tshogs byin nas yo byad kyis phongs pa'i gnod pa med par bya ste /
analyzed: de la tshe 'dir phan btags pa ni zang zing rnam pa sna tshogs byin nas yo byad kyis phongs pa'i gnod pa med par bya ste /
translated: Helping in this life means that he gives them various material things and thus removes the harm of being without possessions.

original: longs spyod dang ldan par byas pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod dang ldan par byas pa'o //
translated: He makes them prosperous.

original: tshe rabs gzhan du phan btags pa ni tshe 'dir dge ba byed du bcug pas tshe rabs gzhan du lha dang mi'i bde 'gro dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du phan btags pa ni tshe 'dir dge ba byed du bcug pas tshe rabs gzhan du lha dang mi'i bde 'gro dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Helping in other lives means that he causes them to practice virtue in this life, so that in other lives they will attain happy rebirth as gods and humans and the happiness of nirvana.

original: de lta bu'i tshul khrims kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa de las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya @100b ba la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul khrims kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa de las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya @100b ba la /
translated: One verse on the perfection of tolerance as the means of maturing beings.

original: tshul khrims kyis sems can yongs su smin pa ston te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis sems can yongs su smin pa ston te /
translated: Tolerance is shown as the means of maturing beings.

original: de yang tshul khrims ci 'dra bas sems can ji ltar smin par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang tshul khrims ci 'dra bas sems can ji ltar smin par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Moreover, a verse is begun in order to demonstrate by what sort of morality sentient beings are caused to mature.

original: de la ji lta bu'i tshul khrims kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed na /
analyzed: de la ji lta bu'i tshul khrims kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed na /
translated: Therein, by what sort of morality are sentient beings caused to mature?

original: tshul khrims rnam pa lngas sems can yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam pa lngas sems can yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: By five aspects of morality, sentient beings are caused to mature.

original: tshul khrims rnam pa lnga ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam pa lnga ni /
translated: The five aspects of morality are:

original: rtag pa'i tshul khrims dang / rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag par rtogs pa'i tshul khrims dang / 'khrul pa med pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: rtag pa'i tshul khrims dang / rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag par rtogs pa'i tshul khrims dang / 'khrul pa med pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: the morality of the vow, the natural morality, the morality of conscientious attitudes, the morality of vigor, and the morality of the immeasurables.

original: rtag tu zhes bya bas lhag pa'i tshul khrims bstan te /
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya bas lhag pa'i tshul khrims bstan te /
translated: The morality of the vow is indicated by the word always.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos dag ni sdom pa mnos nas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du yod kyi /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos dag ni sdom pa mnos nas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du yod kyi /
translated: The noble disciples, having taken the vow, have it as long as they live.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sdom pa mnos pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sdom pa mnos pa nas brtsams te /
translated: But the bodhisattvas, having taken the vow,

original: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du tshul khrims yod pas na rtag pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du tshul khrims yod pas na rtag pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúconstant morality‚Äù because morality exists until one sits on the seat of enlightenment.

original: yang na dang po sdom pa mnos nas bar 'ga' bsrung /
analyzed: yang na dang po sdom pa mnos nas bar 'ga' bsrung /
translated: Or, it is called ‚Äúconstant morality‚Äù because, having taken up the vow in the beginning, one does not protect it for a while,

original: bar 'ga' mi bsrung ma yin gyi //
analyzed: bar 'ga' mi bsrung ma yin gyi //
translated: and then not protect it for a while,

original: nam 'tsho'i bar du bsrung bas na rtag pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nam 'tsho'i bar du bsrung bas na rtag pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: but protects it for as long as one lives.

original: rang bzhin zhes bya bas rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims bstan te /
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya bas rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims bstan te /
translated: ‚ÄúNatural‚Äù shows natural morality.

original: tshul khrims bsrung ba la sngon shin tu goms par byas pas phyis 'bad pa dang rtsol ba chen po med par tshul khrims la rang gi ngang gis gnas pas na rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrung ba la sngon shin tu goms par byas pas phyis 'bad pa dang rtsol ba chen po med par tshul khrims la rang gi ngang gis gnas pas na rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúnatural morality‚Äù because one protects morality by abiding in it naturally, without great effort or exertion, because one has become very familiar with protecting morality in the past.

original: yang na sdom pa mnos te tshe 'dir ma ral na tshe rabs gar skye gar skyes kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen las tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin dang / yon tan ma thos par yang dang gis kha na ma tho ba'i chos rnams mi byed par 'dzem pa yod pa dang /
analyzed: yang na sdom pa mnos te tshe 'dir ma ral na tshe rabs gar skye gar skyes kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen las tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin dang / yon tan ma thos par yang dang gis kha na ma tho ba'i chos rnams mi byed par 'dzem pa yod pa dang /
translated: Moreover, if one has taken the vows and does not break them in this life, then wherever one is born in one's future lives, one will have a natural aversion to committing any misdeeds, even without hearing about the nature and qualities of morality from a spiritual master, and

original: dge ba'i chos byed pa la dga' ba yod pa ni rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos byed pa la dga' ba yod pa ni rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: one will have a natural delight in practicing virtue. This is called natural morality.

original: lhag par 'tshe ba med ces bya bas yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshul khrims bstan te /
analyzed: lhag par 'tshe ba med ces bya bas yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshul khrims bstan te /
translated: The line and especially nonviolence teaches perfect morality.

original: 'tshe ba med pa ni mi dge ba bcu mi spyod pa ste /
analyzed: 'tshe ba med pa ni mi dge ba bcu mi spyod pa ste /
translated: Nonviolence is not committing the ten nonvirtues.

original: mi dge ba bcu rmi lam na yang spyod par mi 'byung ba ni lhag par 'tshe ba med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu rmi lam na yang spyod par mi 'byung ba ni lhag par 'tshe ba med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Not committing the ten nonvirtues even in dreams is called especially nonviolent.

original: de ltar gyur na tshul khrims yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na tshul khrims yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When one is like that, it is called perfect morality.

original: de yangs bcu'i sa gnyis su phyin pa'i @101a * //
analyzed: de yangs bcu'i sa gnyis su phyin pa'i @101a * //
translated: This is the perfection of morality on the second ground, the Immaculate.

original: dus na byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba bcu yongs su rdzogs par lhag par 'tshe bar byed pa'i chos mi dge ba bcu rmi lam na yang spyod pa mi 'byung bas yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus na byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba bcu yongs su rdzogs par lhag par 'tshe bar byed pa'i chos mi dge ba bcu rmi lam na yang spyod pa mi 'byung bas yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: At that time, the ten virtues of the bodhisattva are completely perfected, and the ten non-virtues that are harmful to others are not engaged in even in dreams. Therefore, it is called the morality of perfection.

original: bdag dga' zhes bya bas lhag par rtogs pa'i tshul khrims bstan te /
analyzed: bdag dga' zhes bya bas lhag par rtogs pa'i tshul khrims bstan te /
translated: By I am delighted, the morality of superior realization is taught.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa dang por chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du rtogs nas bden pa mthong ba dang 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims thob ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa dang por chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du rtogs nas bden pa mthong ba dang 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims thob ste /
translated: Having realized on the first ground that the dharmadhatu is the characteristic of all-pervasiveness, the bodhisattva sees the truth and attains the morality pleasing to the aryas.

original: dang gis mi dge ba bcu spangs pa dang / dge ba bcu la gnas par dga' ba ni bdag dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang gis mi dge ba bcu spangs pa dang / dge ba bcu la gnas par dga' ba ni bdag dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Being delighted in abandoning the ten non-virtues and abiding in the ten virtues is called I am delighted.

original: bag yod ces bya bas rtag tu 'khrul pa med pa'i tshul khrims bstan te /
analyzed: bag yod ces bya bas rtag tu 'khrul pa med pa'i tshul khrims bstan te /
translated: By I am heedful, the morality of always being without error is taught.

original: ngag gi sgo nas smra bar bya ba ma yin pa dag smra ba dang / lus kyi sgo nas 'gro bar bya ba ma yin pa dag gi gnas su 'gro ba dang / yid kyi sgo nas bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'i chos dag sems pa ni bag med ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ngag gi sgo nas smra bar bya ba ma yin pa dag smra ba dang / lus kyi sgo nas 'gro bar bya ba ma yin pa dag gi gnas su 'gro ba dang / yid kyi sgo nas bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'i chos dag sems pa ni bag med ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Speaking with the voice what should not be said, going with the body to places where one should not go, and thinking with the mind thoughts that should not be thought are called heedlessness.

original: de las ni ltung ba dang nyes byas dag gis 'khrul pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ni ltung ba dang nyes byas dag gis 'khrul pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From that, mistakes arise through downfalls and wrong actions.

original: ngag gi sgo nas smra bar bya ba ma yin pa mi smra ba dang / lus kyi sgo nas 'gro bar bya ba ma yin pa'i gnas dag tu mi 'gro ba dang / yid kyi sgo nas bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'i chos dag mi sems pa ni bag yod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ngag gi sgo nas smra bar bya ba ma yin pa mi smra ba dang / lus kyi sgo nas 'gro bar bya ba ma yin pa'i gnas dag tu mi 'gro ba dang / yid kyi sgo nas bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'i chos dag mi sems pa ni bag yod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Not speaking with the voice what should not be said, not going with the body to places where one should not go, and not thinking with the mind thoughts that should not be thought are called heedfulness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bag yod pa de la rtag tu gnas nas spyod lam thams cad du yang ltung ba dang nyes byas dag gis 'khrul pa mi 'byung bas 'khrul pa med pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bag yod pa de la rtag tu gnas nas spyod lam thams cad du yang ltung ba dang nyes byas dag gis 'khrul pa mi 'byung bas 'khrul pa med pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who always abides in heedfulness does not err in any situation through downfalls or wrong actions, so it is called the morality of non-error.

original: yang na rgyu rnam pa gsum las 'khrul pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang na rgyu rnam pa gsum las 'khrul pa 'byung ste /
translated: Or else, error arises from three causes.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: le lo dang / bag med pa dang / brjed pas pa'o //
analyzed: le lo dang / bag med pa dang / brjed pas pa'o //
translated: Laziness, heedlessness, and forgetfulness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni spyod lam thams cad du yang nan tan du bcas par gnas pas le lo dang / bag med pa dang / brjed ngas pa med pa'i phyir ltung ba dang nyes byas la sogs pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir 'khrul pa med pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni spyod lam thams cad du yang nan tan du bcas par gnas pas le lo dang / bag med pa dang / brjed ngas pa med pa'i phyir ltung ba dang nyes byas la sogs pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir 'khrul pa med pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva, in all situations, abides in the practice of heedfulness, so he does not err through downfalls or wrong actions, because he is free from laziness, heedlessness, and forgetfulness. Thus it is called the morality of non-error.

original: ji ltar sems can yongs su smin par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems can yongs su smin par byed ce na /
translated: How does he bring beings to maturity?

original: de'i phyir / gzhan yang 'di la 'god ces smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gzhan yang 'di la 'god ces smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúAnd he establishes others in it.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid tshul khrims rnam pa lnga la gnas pa bzhin du sems can gzhan yang tshul khrims rnam pa lnga la bkod @101b de de dang ldan par byas pas yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: bdag nyid tshul khrims rnam pa lnga la gnas pa bzhin du sems can gzhan yang tshul khrims rnam pa lnga la bkod @101b de de dang ldan par byas pas yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: Just as he himself abides in the five kinds of morality, he establishes other sentient beings in the five kinds of morality and causes them to possess them.üîΩIn this way he matures them.

original: ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa yang de ltar yang cung zad kyi gzhan yang yod par bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩpha rol gcig nas gcig tu phan gnyis 'dogs //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa yang de ltar yang cung zad kyi gzhan yang yod par bstan pa'i phyir / pha rol gcig nas gcig tu phan gnyis 'dogs // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to show that there is also another way of maturing, he says:üîΩHe benefits them in this life and in future lives.

original: phan gnyis 'dogs pa ni tshe 'dir phan 'dogs pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: phan gnyis 'dogs pa ni tshe 'dir phan 'dogs pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: He benefits them in this life and in future lives.

original: de la tshe 'dir phan 'dogs pa ni sems can rnams tshul khrims la bkod pa ni /
analyzed: de la tshe 'dir phan 'dogs pa ni sems can rnams tshul khrims la bkod pa ni /
translated: In this life, he benefits them by establishing sentient beings in morality.

original: dge ba byed cing mi dge ba mi byed pa'i phyir mi dge ba byas pa las gyur pa'i bcing ba dang / bsad pa la sogs pa mi 'byung bas tshe 'dir phan btags so //
analyzed: dge ba byed cing mi dge ba mi byed pa'i phyir mi dge ba byas pa las gyur pa'i bcing ba dang / bsad pa la sogs pa mi 'byung bas tshe 'dir phan btags so //
translated: Because they do what is wholesome and do not do what is unwholesome, they do not experience the bondage, killing, etc. that result from doing what is unwholesome. Thus he benefits them in this life.

original: tshe rabs gzhan du phan btags pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du phan btags pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are also two kinds of benefit in other lives:

original: tshe gcig nas gcig tu rnam par smin pa rgyun ma chad par byas pa dang / tshe gcig nas gcig tu rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu rgyun ma chad par byas pa'o //
analyzed: tshe gcig nas gcig tu rnam par smin pa rgyun ma chad par byas pa dang / tshe gcig nas gcig tu rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu rgyun ma chad par byas pa'o //
translated: the uninterrupted maturation of the result from life to life and the uninterrupted similar result from life to life.

original: de la pha rol gcig nas gcig tu zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan tshe rabs gcig nas gcig tu brgyud mar zhe sa bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la pha rol gcig nas gcig tu zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan tshe rabs gcig nas gcig tu brgyud mar zhe sa bya ba'i don to //
translated: In this regard, ‚Äúfrom one life to another‚Äù means that one should be respectful to other sentient beings from one life to another.

original: tshe rabs gzhan du phan pa rnam pa gnyis 'dogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩrnam smin rgyu mthun legs par smin par byed //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du phan pa rnam pa gnyis 'dogs pa bstan pa'i phyir / rnam smin rgyu mthun legs par smin par byed //
translated: In order to demonstrate the two kinds of benefit in other lives,üîΩhe says,

original: ces bya ba smos te /üîΩtshe 'dir tshul khrims bsrungs pas tshe rabs gzhan du lha dang mi'i bde 'gro thob pa ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te / tshe 'dir tshul khrims bsrungs pas tshe rabs gzhan du lha dang mi'i bde 'gro thob pa ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe maturation and the similar effect are well matured.‚ÄùüîΩThe attainment of happy rebirth as a god or human through observing morality in this life is the maturational result.

original: lha dang mi'i gnas su skye ba na tshul khrims bsrung ba la dga' bar gyur pa ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i gnas su skye ba na tshul khrims bsrung ba la dga' bar gyur pa ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The delight in observing morality when reborn in the divine or human states is the similar result.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu de las lha dang mi'i bde 'gro thob pa ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu de las lha dang mi'i bde 'gro thob pa ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result that resembles the cause is the attainment of happy rebirth as a god or human, which is the maturational result.

original: de na yang tshul khrims bsrung ba la dga' ba ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de na yang tshul khrims bsrung ba la dga' ba ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: Moreover, the delight in guarding morality is the result that resembles the cause.

original: de ltar rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu gnyis ni gcig gis gcig bskyed de rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba ni tshe rabs gzhan du phan btags pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: de ltar rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu gnyis ni gcig gis gcig bskyed de rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba ni tshe rabs gzhan du phan btags pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: Thus, the two results, the maturational and the result that resembles the cause, are mutually generated and occur uninterruptedly, which is called ‚Äúbenefiting others in other lives.‚Äù

original: / yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshul khrims ni lhag par 'tshe ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshul khrims ni lhag par 'tshe ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Perfect morality is nonviolence.

original: mi dge ba bcu mi byed pa ni 'tshe ba med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu mi byed pa ni 'tshe ba med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Nonviolence is the nonperformance of the ten nonvirtues.

original: rmi lam du yang mi dge ba bcu mi spyod pa ni lhag par 'tshe ba med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rmi lam du yang mi dge ba bcu mi spyod pa ni lhag par 'tshe ba med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The nonperformance of the ten nonvirtues even in dreams is called ‚Äúsuperior nonviolence.‚Äù

original: de ltar na yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshul @102a * //üîΩkhrims yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar na yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshul @102a * //üîΩkhrims yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, it is perfect morality.

original: 'tshe ba med pa'i rdzogs pa ni lhag par mi 'tshe ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'tshe ba med pa'i rdzogs pa ni lhag par mi 'tshe ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The perfection of nonviolence is the nonviolence of the superior man.

original: lhag par mi 'tshe ba'i don 'chad de /
analyzed: lhag par mi 'tshe ba'i don 'chad de /
translated: The meaning of nonviolence is explained.

original: mi dge ba bcu rmi lam na yang mi byed par rdzogs na lhag par mi 'tshe ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu rmi lam na yang mi byed par rdzogs na lhag par mi 'tshe ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one perfects the ten virtues even in a dream, one is said to be nonviolent.

original: ji ltar na yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshul khrims su 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshul khrims su 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one become one who has perfected morality?

original: de'i phyir / dge ba bcu'i las rmi lam na yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dge ba bcu'i las rmi lam na yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said: because the ten virtues are perfected even in a dream.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yongs su rdzogs nas mi dge ba bcu rmi lam na yang byed par mi rmi na yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshul khrims yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yongs su rdzogs nas mi dge ba bcu rmi lam na yang byed par mi rmi na yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshul khrims yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one perfects the ten virtuous paths of action and does not dream of committing the ten nonvirtues even in a dream, one is said to have perfected morality.

original: rmi lam na yang mi dge ba bcu mi byed pa ni sa bcu las sa gnyis kyi tshe na mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: rmi lam na yang mi dge ba bcu mi byed pa ni sa bcu las sa gnyis kyi tshe na mi 'byung ste /
translated: The nonperformance of the ten nonvirtues even in a dream does not occur on the second stage of the ten stages.

original: de bas na sa bcu pa'i sa gnyis las kyang kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' sa gnyis pa 'di la gnas pa rnams ni dbyig pa spangs mtshon cha spangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na sa bcu pa'i sa gnyis las kyang kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' sa gnyis pa 'di la gnas pa rnams ni dbyig pa spangs mtshon cha spangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúO son of the victors, the bodhisattvas who are on this second stage, the Immaculate, avoid sticks and avoid weapons, and so on.

original: bdag nyid de la dga' bas lhag par rtogs pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag nyid de la dga' bas lhag par rtogs pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe morality of delight in that‚Äù means that one delights in it.

original: sa dang po'i chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa na bden pa mthong bas mi dge ba mi byed pa dang dge ba byed pa la rang gi dang gis dga' zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa dang po'i chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa na bden pa mthong bas mi dge ba mi byed pa dang dge ba byed pa la rang gi dang gis dga' zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When one realizes the characteristic of the all-pervading ultimate realm on the first stage, one sees the truth and does not commit nonvirtuous actions and does commit virtuous actions. This is the meaning of ‚Äúdelight in it.‚Äù

original: bag yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bag yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of heedfulness‚Äù means that one is heedful.

original: ngag gi sgo nas smra bar bya ba ma yin pa mi smra ba dang / lus kyi sgo nas 'gro bar bya ba ma yin pa dag tu mi 'gro ba dang / sems kyi sgo nas bsam par bya ba ma yin pa dag mi bsam pa ni bag yod pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: ngag gi sgo nas smra bar bya ba ma yin pa mi smra ba dang / lus kyi sgo nas 'gro bar bya ba ma yin pa dag tu mi 'gro ba dang / sems kyi sgo nas bsam par bya ba ma yin pa dag mi bsam pa ni bag yod pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: One does not speak with the voice about what should not be said, one does not go with the body to places where one should not go, and one does not think with the mind about what should not be thought. This is called ‚Äúheedfulness.‚Äù

original: / bag yod pa rnams las rtag tu ltung ba dang nyes byas mi 'byung bas de nyid la 'khrul pa med pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / bag yod pa rnams las rtag tu ltung ba dang nyes byas mi 'byung bas de nyid la 'khrul pa med pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: And because there is never any downfall or transgression for the heedful, that is called the morality of non-error.

original: bzod pa ji lta bus sems can yongs su smin par byed pa de las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzod pa ji lta bus sems can yongs su smin par byed pa de las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The verse beginning ‚ÄúThe one who is patient‚Äù treats the question of how beings are matured by what kind of patience.

original: da ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa bstan te /
analyzed: da ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa bstan te /
translated: Now, the perfection of patience is taught as the means of maturing beings.

original: de yang bzod pa 'di 'dra bas sems can 'di ltar smin par byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang bzod pa 'di 'dra bas sems can 'di ltar smin par byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And in order to show that ‚Äúby this kind of patience, beings are matured in this way,‚Äù the verse is begun.

original: bzod pa ci 'dra bas sems can yongs su smin par byed ce na /
analyzed: bzod pa ci 'dra bas sems can yongs su smin par byed ce na /
translated: By what kind of patience are beings matured?

original: de'i phyir / @102b pha rol gnod par byed pa phan byed blo //
analyzed: de'i phyir / @102b pha rol gnod par byed pa phan byed blo //
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: nyes pa byas pa drag po rab tu bzod //
analyzed: nyes pa byas pa drag po rab tu bzod //
translated: The one who is patient, regarding even the most violent offenders

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: as benefactors,

original: sems can gzhan gyi srog dang srid dang longs spyod la sogs pa med par byed pa ni pha rol gnod pa byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyi srog dang srid dang longs spyod la sogs pa med par byed pa ni pha rol gnod pa byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The harmful are those who destroy the life, property, and so on of other sentient beings.

original: gnod par byed pa de dag la byang chub sems dpa' gnod pa la klan kar snyad mi dgos te gnod par byas pa 'di dag la bzod par byas na bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa de dag la byang chub sems dpa' gnod pa la klan kar snyad mi dgos te gnod par byas pa 'di dag la bzod par byas na bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva should not find fault with those who harm him, thinking, If I practice patience toward these who harm me, I will complete the perfection of patience.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur na /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur na /
translated: If I complete the perfection of patience,üîΩI will attain supreme enlightenment.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pas 'di ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin no snyam du sems shing smra ba ni /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pas 'di ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin no snyam du sems shing smra ba ni /
translated: Thinking thus, he should speak to them,

original: pha rol gnod par byed pa phan byed blo //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol gnod par byed pa phan byed blo // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thinking of the harmful as helpful.

original: srog dang srid la 'bab pa'i nyes pa byas na yang zhe sdang mi ldang zhing nyams su mi len na /
analyzed: srog dang srid la 'bab pa'i nyes pa byas na yang zhe sdang mi ldang zhing nyams su mi len na /
translated: If he does not arouse anger or resentment even when harmed by others, even when his life and property are at stake, then he should think, I will not give up my patience even in a dream.

original: slar gnod pa'i len mi ldon pa ni nyes par byed pa drag po bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: slar gnod pa'i len mi ldon pa ni nyes par byed pa drag po bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Not returning harm in return is called ‚Äúforbearance with regard to the violence of evildoers.‚Äù

original: ji ltar yongs su smin par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su smin par byed ce na /
translated: How does one bring them to maturity?üîΩTherefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / thabs shes gnod par byed pa'i bzod pa yis //
analyzed: de'i phyir / thabs shes gnod par byed pa'i bzod pa yis //
translated: By the forbearance of the skillful one who is harmed,

original: gnod par byed pa dag ni dge la bkod //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa dag ni dge la bkod //
translated: the one who does the harm is established in virtue.

original: ces bya ba smos te /üîΩgnod par byed pa rnams la /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te / gnod par byed pa rnams la /
translated: This is what is said:üîΩ‚ÄúThis is helpful to me.‚Äù

original: 'di ni phan 'dogs pa yin no snyam du sems shing tshig tu de skad smras pa nyid thabs shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phan 'dogs pa yin no snyam du sems shing tshig tu de skad smras pa nyid thabs shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thinking this and saying it is called ‚Äúskill in means.‚Äù

original: phan 'dogs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of help:

original: tshe 'dir phan 'dogs pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'dir phan 'dogs pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: help in this life and help in other lives.

original: tshe 'dir phan 'dogs pa ni nyes pa drag po byas pa rnams la yang gnod pa drag po dag bzod do //
analyzed: tshe 'dir phan 'dogs pa ni nyes pa drag po byas pa rnams la yang gnod pa drag po dag bzod do //
translated: Help in this life is the forbearance of the violence of evildoers.

original: slar gnod pa'i lan ma glan pas na tshe 'dir phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: slar gnod pa'i lan ma glan pas na tshe 'dir phan 'dogs so //
translated: By not returning harm in return, one helps in this life.

original: tshe rabs gzhan du phan 'dogs pa'i thabs shes pa'i sems kyis gnod par byed pa rnams la phan 'dogs so snyam du sems shing khyod kyis phan 'dogs so zhes smras pas gzhan dag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du phan 'dogs pa'i thabs shes pa'i sems kyis gnod par byed pa rnams la phan 'dogs so snyam du sems shing khyod kyis phan 'dogs so zhes smras pas gzhan dag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: One should think, ‚ÄúI will help those who harm me,‚Äù and say, ‚ÄúI will help you.‚ÄùüîΩOthers think, ‚ÄúThis person is a great being, since he says he will help even when we harm him.‚Äù Thus they develop faith in him, come under his influence, and are established in the performance of good actions in this life and in the attainment of high status and ultimate bliss in other lives.

original: bdag gis gnod par byas na yang slar phan 'dogs so zhes smras pa dang sbyar na sems can 'di ni sems can chen po zhig ste snyam nas de la dad pa skye zhing de'i dbang du gyur pa dang / tshe 'dir dge ba byed pa la bkod de tshe rabs gzhan du mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byas pa ni tshe gzhan du phan @103a * //
analyzed: bdag gis gnod par byas na yang slar phan 'dogs so zhes smras pa dang sbyar na sems can 'di ni sems can chen po zhig ste snyam nas de la dad pa skye zhing de'i dbang du gyur pa dang / tshe 'dir dge ba byed pa la bkod de tshe rabs gzhan du mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byas pa ni tshe gzhan du phan @103a * //
translated: This is how one matures others in other lives.

original: 'degs pa'o // brtson 'grus ji lta bus ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa de las brtsams te /üîΩtshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'degs pa'o // brtson 'grus ji lta bus ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa de las brtsams te /üîΩtshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: How does the bodhisattva mature beings through the transcendent perfections?

original: da ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sems can smin par byed pa ston te /üîΩde yang brtson 'grus ji lta bus sems can 'di 'dra bar yongs su smin par byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: da ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sems can smin par byed pa ston te / de yang brtson 'grus ji lta bus sems can 'di 'dra bar yongs su smin par byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Now, the perfection of effort is taught to be the ripening of sentient beings.üîΩAnd in order to demonstrate by what kind of effort such sentient beings are ripened, the verse is begun.

original: brtson 'grus ji lta bus sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ji lta bus sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: The verse is begun in order to demonstrate by what kind of effort such sentient beings are ripened.

original: de yang nan tan mchog la gnas nas su //
analyzed: de yang nan tan mchog la gnas nas su //
translated: And that one, abiding in supreme practice,üîΩthe victors' spiritual heir, ripens many beings.üîΩThat one, abiding in supreme practice,

original: rgyal sras sems can mang po smin par byed //üîΩces bya ba smos te /üîΩde yang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dang sbyar te /
analyzed: rgyal sras sems can mang po smin par byed // ces bya ba smos te / de yang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dang sbyar te /
translated: the victors' spiritual heir, ripens many beings.üîΩThat one is a bodhisattva.üîΩAnd that one is a bodhisattva.üîΩHe becomes endowed with the perfection of effort.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par 'gyur te byang chub sems dpa' de yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par 'gyur te byang chub sems dpa' de yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That bodhisattva is the one who is meant.

original: go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / ma zhum pa'i brtson 'grus dang / ma 'khrugs pa'i brtson 'grus dang / chog mi shes pa'i brtson 'grus la gnas shing brtson 'grus de dag kyang 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du gtong bar mi byed pa ni nan tan mchog la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / ma zhum pa'i brtson 'grus dang / ma 'khrugs pa'i brtson 'grus dang / chog mi shes pa'i brtson 'grus la gnas shing brtson 'grus de dag kyang 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du gtong bar mi byed pa ni nan tan mchog la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The armor-like effort, the effort of application, the effort of non-discouragement, the effort of non-perturbation, and the effort of non-satisfaction.

original: brtson 'grus de lta bu la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' sems can mtha' yas pa rnams yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brtson 'grus de lta bu la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' sems can mtha' yas pa rnams yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And, based on such effort, the bodhisattva brings to maturity infinite sentient beings.üîΩNow, in order to demonstrate how he brings them to maturity,

original: da ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: he says:

original: pha rol dge ba'i sems gcig phyir yang ni //üîΩbskal pa bye ba stong du skyo mi 'gyur //
analyzed: pha rol dge ba'i sems gcig phyir yang ni // bskal pa bye ba stong du skyo mi 'gyur //
translated: For the sake of a single virtuous thought in another,

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: he would not tire even in a thousand million eons.

original: sems can gcig gi sems kyi rgyud kyi skad cig ma gcig la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba gcig bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can gcig gi sems kyi rgyud kyi skad cig ma gcig la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba gcig bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of a single virtuous thought in the mind-stream of a single sentient being,üîΩhe would not tire even in a thousand million eons.

original: dge pa bskyed par nus pa'i skabs gzigs na 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du yang gshegs shing bskal pa bye ba brgya stong grangs med par yang sems can gyi don mdzad cing gshegs pa la skyo ba mi mnga'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge pa bskyed par nus pa'i skabs gzigs na 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du yang gshegs shing bskal pa bye ba brgya stong grangs med par yang sems can gyi don mdzad cing gshegs pa la skyo ba mi mnga'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When he sees the opportunity to generate virtue, he goes to all the worlds and he does not get tired of working for the welfare of sentient beings for countless hundreds of thousands of millions of eons.

original: de mi 'di skad du bstan ba yin te /
analyzed: de mi 'di skad du bstan ba yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyis sems can rnams la tshe 'dir phan btags pa dang tshe rabs gzhan du phan btags pas sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyis sems can rnams la tshe 'dir phan btags pa dang tshe rabs gzhan du phan btags pas sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By means of the bodhisattva‚Äôs effort, sentient beings are brought to maturity through being benefited in this life and through being benefited in other lives.

original: de la brtson @103b 'grus kyis tshe 'dir dge ba'i sems gcig la bkod pa ni tshe 'dir phan btags pa'o //
analyzed: de la brtson @103b 'grus kyis tshe 'dir dge ba'i sems gcig la bkod pa ni tshe 'dir phan btags pa'o //
translated: Among them, being placed in a virtuous state of mind in this life through effort is benefiting in this life.

original: de'i rgyus tshe rabs gzhan du mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byas pa ni tshe rabs gzhan du phan btags pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyus tshe rabs gzhan du mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byas pa ni tshe rabs gzhan du phan btags pa'o //
translated: Through that cause, attaining high rebirth and nirvana in other lives is benefiting in other lives.

original: bsam gtan ji lta bus ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam gtan ji lta bus ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: One verse on the topic of how one matures whom by what meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ston te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ston te /
translated: The perfection of meditative concentration shows how one matures beings.

original: bsam gtan ci 'dra bas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsam gtan ci 'dra bas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The verse is begun in order to show by what kind of meditative concentration one matures beings.

original: bsam gtan ji lta bus sems can yongs su smin par byed ce na de'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam gtan ji lta bus sems can yongs su smin par byed ce na de'i phyir /
translated: By what kind of meditative concentration does one mature beings?

original: yid kyis bla na med pa'i dbang bskur nas //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yid kyis bla na med pa'i dbang bskur nas // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He bestows the unsurpassable consecration of the mind.

original: yid ni sems la bya ste /
analyzed: yid ni sems la bya ste /
translated: Mind refers to the mental faculty.

original: sems kyang rnam par shes pa kun la mi bya'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyang rnam par shes pa kun la mi bya'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la bya'o //
translated: And mind refers not to all consciousnesses, but to the mental consciousness.

original: dbang ni ting nge 'dzin la bya ste ;
analyzed: dbang ni ting nge 'dzin la bya ste ;
translated: Consecration refers to meditative concentration.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis sems mi g-yeng bar rtse gcig tu 'jog par byed pas na ting nge 'dzin la dbang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis sems mi g-yeng bar rtse gcig tu 'jog par byed pas na ting nge 'dzin la dbang zhes bya ste /
translated: Since concentration causes the mind to be placed one-pointedly without distraction, it is called mastery of concentration.

original: theg pa chen po'i ting nge 'dzin dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa thob par byas pa la /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i ting nge 'dzin dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa thob par byas pa la /
translated: Having attained the mental consciousness that is the Mahayana concentration, such as the concentration of Brave Progression,

original: yid kyis bla na med pa'i dbang bkur nas //
analyzed: yid kyis bla na med pa'i dbang bkur nas //
translated: one has attained mastery of the mind.

original: zhes bya'o // de ltar ting nge 'dzin bsgrubs nas ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus 'phrul gyi mig dang / rna ba la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul rnams kyang sems can gyi don du byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de ltar ting nge 'dzin bsgrubs nas ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus 'phrul gyi mig dang / rna ba la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul rnams kyang sems can gyi don du byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, having accomplished concentration, through the power of concentration, one also performs the miracles of the divine eye, ear, and so on, for the benefit of sentient beings. This is the meaning.

original: gzhan gyis mchod 'dod thams cad bcom nas su ;üîΩ/ zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mchod 'dod thams cad bcom nas su ;üîΩ/ zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having destroyed all the desires of others for worship,

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad bsgrubs pa dang / rdzu 'phrul bsgrubs pa dag kyang sems can gzhan gyis mchod pa dang / bkur sti'i phyir bsgrubs pa ni ma yin gyi zang zing med pa'i sems can gyis mchod pa dang bkur sti byed par 'gyur ba la chags pa spangs nas sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad bsgrubs pa dang / rdzu 'phrul bsgrubs pa dag kyang sems can gzhan gyis mchod pa dang / bkur sti'i phyir bsgrubs pa ni ma yin gyi zang zing med pa'i sems can gyis mchod pa dang bkur sti byed par 'gyur ba la chags pa spangs nas sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And they accomplish all meditative concentrations and the bases of supernatural power, not for the sake of being worshipped and honored by other beings, but in order to abandon attachment to being worshipped and honored by beings who are free from materiality.

original: ji ltar yongs su smin par byed ce na /üîΩde'i phyir / gzhan yang mchog gi bstan la 'jug par byed //
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su smin par byed ce na / de'i phyir / gzhan yang mchog gi bstan la 'jug par byed //
translated: How do they bring beings to maturity?üîΩTherefore it is said:

original: ces smos te /
analyzed: ces smos te /
translated: And they introduce others to the supreme teaching.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus 'bar pa dang 'phur ba la sogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus 'bar pa dang 'phur ba la sogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Having demonstrated blazing and flying, etc., by the power of their supernatural knowledge,üîΩthey cause other beings to delight in, rejoice in, and have faith in the teachings of the Tathagata.

original: @104a * // sems can gzhan de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la dga' ba dang / mgu pa dang / dad pa skyed par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @104a * // sems can gzhan de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la dga' ba dang / mgu pa dang / dad pa skyed par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: der yang ma zad kyi gzhan yang byed par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: der yang ma zad kyi gzhan yang byed par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: And not only that, but they also do something else. In order to demonstrate that, it is said:

original: de dag dge ba yang dag 'phel bar byed //
analyzed: de dag dge ba yang dag 'phel bar byed //
translated: They cause virtue to increase.

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is meant.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la dad pa bskyed pa tsam du ma zad kyi dad pa yang bskyed pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod du yang bcug pas dge ba yang 'phel bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la dad pa bskyed pa tsam du ma zad kyi dad pa yang bskyed pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod du yang bcug pas dge ba yang 'phel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Not only does he generate faith in the teaching of the Buddha, but he also causes others to practice the six perfections, thus causing virtue to increase.

original: shes rab ji lta bus ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa de las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: shes rab ji lta bus ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa de las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la ;
translated: The verse beginning ‚ÄúBy what kind of wisdom‚Äù treats the topic of how beings are brought to full maturity.

original: da ni shes rab kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ston te /
analyzed: da ni shes rab kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ston te /
translated: Now, the bringing of beings to full maturity through wisdom is taught.

original: de yang shes rab ji lta bus sems can ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang shes rab ji lta bus sems can ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And in order to demonstrate by what kind of wisdom beings are brought to full maturity, the verse is begun.

original: shes rab ji lta bus sems can ji ltar yongs su smin par byed ce na /üîΩde'i phyir / de nyid dgongs pa'i tshul la de nges pas //
analyzed: shes rab ji lta bus sems can ji ltar yongs su smin par byed ce na / de'i phyir / de nyid dgongs pa'i tshul la de nges pas //
translated: By what kind of wisdom are beings brought to full maturity?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said: ‚ÄúBy that very wisdom, through the method of intention, he is certain of the ultimate.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi tshul la nges pa dang dgongs tshul la nges pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshul la nges pa dang dgongs tshul la nges pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúcertainty with regard to the way things really are‚Äù should be applied to the two kinds of selflessness, that of persons and that of things.

original: de la gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag ming pa gnyis ni de nyid kyi tshul zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag ming pa gnyis ni de nyid kyi tshul zhes bya ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúcertainty with regard to the way things really are‚Äù should be applied to the two kinds of selflessness, that of persons and that of things.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i shes rab kyis chos de la the tshom med par byas shing gtan la phab par byas pa ni de nyid kyi tshul la nges par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i shes rab kyis chos de la the tshom med par byas shing gtan la phab par byas pa ni de nyid kyi tshul la nges par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva‚Äôs wisdom, having made those things free from doubt and having determined them, is called ‚Äúcertainty with regard to the way things really are.‚Äù

original: don gzhan la dgongs pa dang dus gzhan la dgongs ba la sogs pa dgongs pa bzhi dang ldem por dgongs pa bzhi la ni dgongs pa'i tshul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don gzhan la dgongs pa dang dus gzhan la dgongs ba la sogs pa dgongs pa bzhi dang ldem por dgongs pa bzhi la ni dgongs pa'i tshul zhes bya'o //
translated: The four kinds of intention and the four kinds of indirect communication are called ‚Äúthe way things are intended.‚Äù

original: chos de dag la the tshom med par byas pa ni dgongs pa'i tshul la nges pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos de dag la the tshom med par byas pa ni dgongs pa'i tshul la nges pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The absence of doubt with regard to those things is called ‚Äúcertainty with regard to the way things are intended.‚Äù

original: tshig 'dis bdag nyid kyi ye shes kyi tshogs kyi yon tan la gnas par bstan to //
analyzed: tshig 'dis bdag nyid kyi ye shes kyi tshogs kyi yon tan la gnas par bstan to //
translated: This verse shows that the bodhisattva is established in the excellence of the accumulation of intuition.

original: ji ltar sems can the tshom bsal nas yongs su smin par byed ce na ;üîΩde'i phyir / sems can the tshom shin tu sel bar byed //
analyzed: ji ltar sems can the tshom bsal nas yongs su smin par byed ce na ; de'i phyir / sems can the tshom shin tu sel bar byed //
translated: How does he ripen beings by removing their doubts?

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore he says:üîΩHe removes the doubts of beings.

original: de ltar bdag nyid the tshom med par byas nas sems can rnams de kho na'i tshig dang / dgongs pa'i tshul la the tshom du gyur pa rnams kyi the tshom bsal nas the tshom med pa la dgod par byed kyi /
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid the tshom med par byas nas sems can rnams de kho na'i tshig dang / dgongs pa'i tshul la the tshom du gyur pa rnams kyi the tshom bsal nas the tshom med pa la dgod par byed kyi /
translated: Thus, having made himself free from doubt, he removes the doubts of beings about the words and the method of that reality, and he establishes them in freedom from doubt.

original: de lta @104b bu'i tshul gyis sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: de lta @104b bu'i tshul gyis sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: In this way he ripens beings.

original: 'dis ni sems can gzhan dag ye shes kyi tshogs la bkod pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sems can gzhan dag ye shes kyi tshogs la bkod pa bstan to //
translated: This shows how he establishes others in the accumulation of wisdom.

original: tshig de dag ni mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig de dag ni mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: The following verse is a summary of the above.

original: de'i phyir rgyal ba'i bstan la de gus pas //üîΩbdag dang pha rol dge ba'i yon tan 'phel //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyal ba'i bstan la de gus pas // bdag dang pha rol dge ba'i yon tan 'phel //
translated: Therefore, through his respect for the teaching of the Victor,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he and others increase in the good qualities of virtue.

original: sems can rnams de nyid kyi tshul dang / dgongs pa'i tshu la the tshom med par byas pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la gus pa dang dad pa dang rim gro bskyed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams de nyid kyi tshul dang / dgongs pa'i tshu la the tshom med par byas pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la gus pa dang dad pa dang rim gro bskyed do //
translated: By removing doubts about the way things really are and about the interpretable meaning, he generates respect, faith, and reverence for the teaching of the Lord Buddha.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' des bdag gi dge ba'i yon tan yang 'phel bar byas pha rol gyi dge ba'i yon tan yang 'phel bar byas so //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' des bdag gi dge ba'i yon tan yang 'phel bar byas pha rol gyi dge ba'i yon tan yang 'phel bar byas so //
translated: Therefore, the Bodhisattva increases his own good qualities and increases the good qualities of others.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de nyid dang dgongs pa'i tshul la the tshom med pas na bdag dge ba'i yon tan 'phel bar byas so //
analyzed: de nyid dang dgongs pa'i tshul la the tshom med pas na bdag dge ba'i yon tan 'phel bar byas so //
translated: By removing his own doubts about the way things really are and about the interpretable meaning, he increases his own good qualities.

original: de nyid dang dgongs pa'i tshul la sems can gzhan the tshom bsal bas pha rol kyang dge ba'i yon tan la 'phel bar byas so //
analyzed: de nyid dang dgongs pa'i tshul la sems can gzhan the tshom bsal bas pha rol kyang dge ba'i yon tan la 'phel bar byas so //
translated: By removing the doubts of other beings about the way things really are and about the interpretable meaning, he increases the good qualities of others.

original: mjug bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A concluding verse

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i skabs su pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes rgya cher bstan nas da don de nyid mjug bsdu zhing ji ltar sems can yongs su smin par byas pa'i don mdor bsdus te
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i skabs su pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes rgya cher bstan nas da don de nyid mjug bsdu zhing ji ltar sems can yongs su smin par byas pa'i don mdor bsdus te
translated: Now, he concludes that very topic and composes verses to teach in brief the meaning of how sentient beings are brought to full maturity.

original: bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of composes.

original: sems can gang du 'dul zhing smin par byed ce na /üîΩde'i phyir / ji ltar bde 'gror 'gro ba dge gsum mam //
analyzed: sems can gang du 'dul zhing smin par byed ce na / de'i phyir / ji ltar bde 'gror 'gro ba dge gsum mam //
translated: In what realms do sentient beings become disciplined and mature?üîΩTherefore, he says:

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: How do they go to the happy realms through the three virtues?

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar na gong du byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar na gong du byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How means that, as explained above, the bodhisattva brings sentient beings to full maturity. This is the meaning of how.

original: gang zag rigs med pa rnams ni dge ba bcu spyod du bcug cing lha dang mi'i bde 'gro'i gnas su bkod cing yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zag rigs med pa rnams ni dge ba bcu spyod du bcug cing lha dang mi'i bde 'gro'i gnas su bkod cing yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that those who are not of the spiritual lineage are induced to practice the ten virtues and are established in the happy migratory states of gods and humans and are brought to full maturity.

original: gang zag nyan thos kyi rigs can nam rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can nam /
analyzed: gang zag nyan thos kyi rigs can nam rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can nam /
translated: Those who are of the spiritual lineage of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, of the pratyekabuddha,

original: sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dag ni dge ba la bkod par byed de dge ba gsum ni theg pa gsum la bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dag ni dge ba la bkod par byed de dge ba gsum ni theg pa gsum la bya ste /
translated: or of the Buddha are established in virtue. The three virtues refer to the three vehicles.

original: de la nyan thos kyi rigs can ni nyan thos kyi theg par bkod cing yongs su smin par byed /üîΩrang @105a * //
analyzed: de la nyan thos kyi rigs can ni nyan thos kyi theg par bkod cing yongs su smin par byed / rang @105a * //
translated: Among them, those who are of the ≈õrƒÅvaka lineage are established in the ≈örƒÅvakayƒÅna and brought to full maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rigs can ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la bkod cing yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rigs can ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la bkod cing yongs su smin par byed /
translated: Those who are of the pratyekabuddha lineage are established in the PratyekabuddhayƒÅna and brought to full maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rigs can ni theg pa chen po la yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rigs can ni theg pa chen po la yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Those who are of the Buddha lineage are brought to full maturity in the MahƒÅyƒÅna. This is the meaning.

original: su dag yongs su smin par byed ce na /
analyzed: su dag yongs su smin par byed ce na /
translated: Who does he bring to full maturity?

original: de'i phyir / 'gro bam lus zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'gro bam lus zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúthe entire world.‚Äù

original: rigs med pa dang / nyan thos kyi rigs can dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can la sogs pa sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rigs med pa dang / nyan thos kyi rigs can dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can la sogs pa sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that he brings all beings to maturity, including those who are without potential, those who are of the ≈õrƒÅvaka potential, those who are of the pratyekabuddha potential, and so on.

original: rgyu gang gis yongs su smin par byed ce na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis yongs su smin par byed ce na /
translated: By what means does he bring them to maturity?

original: de'i phyir / snying rje zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / snying rje zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Hence he says, ‚Äúthrough compassion.‚Äù

original: sems can la thugs brtse ba'i rgyus sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can la thugs brtse ba'i rgyus sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that he brings beings to maturity through his love for them.

original: sus yongs su smin par byed ce na /
analyzed: sus yongs su smin par byed ce na /
translated: Who brings them to maturity?

original: de'i phyir / byang chub sems dpas de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / byang chub sems dpas de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Hence he says, ‚Äúthe bodhisattva.‚Äù

original: yongs su smin par byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa' yin te /
analyzed: yongs su smin par byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa' yin te /
translated: The one who brings them to maturity is the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpas yongs su smin par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas yongs su smin par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that the bodhisattva brings them to maturity.

original: rnam pa du dang ji lta bus yongs su smin par byed ce na /üîΩde'i phyir / chung dang mchog dang 'bring gi rnam pa yis //
analyzed: rnam pa du dang ji lta bus yongs su smin par byed ce na / de'i phyir / chung dang mchog dang 'bring gi rnam pa yis //
translated: In what manner and by what means does he bring them to maturity?üîΩHence he says,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚Äúin the manner of the lesser, the middling, and the greater.‚Äù

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gzung 'dzin ma spangs pa dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs shas chung bas bdag nyid kyang chung ba zhes bya bas /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gzung 'dzin ma spangs pa dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs shas chung bas bdag nyid kyang chung ba zhes bya bas /
translated: Bodhisattvas on the level of earnest aspiration are called small because they have not got rid of the subject object duality and their accumulation of merit and wisdom is small.

original: gzhan mos pas spyod pa'i sar bkod nas gzung 'dzin ma spangs pa dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chung du la bzhag pas chung du'i rnam pas yongs su smin par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan mos pas spyod pa'i sar bkod nas gzung 'dzin ma spangs pa dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chung du la bzhag pas chung du'i rnam pas yongs su smin par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: So they are brought to the level of earnest aspiration and are made to acquire the small accumulation of merit and wisdom that is not free of subject object duality. This is called their being brought to maturity by the small.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sa brgyad pa dang dgu pa dang bcu pa la gnas pa la gnas pa'i dus na bdag nyid kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'i lhun gyis grub pa rnyed nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sa brgyad pa dang dgu pa dang bcu pa la gnas pa la gnas pa'i dus na bdag nyid kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'i lhun gyis grub pa rnyed nas /
translated: When bodhisattvas are on the eighth, ninth and tenth levels, they themselves acquire the nonconceptual state of spontaneous accomplishment and

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po la gnas la gzhan yang sa de gsum la bkod na /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po la gnas la gzhan yang sa de gsum la bkod na /
translated: they are established in the great accumulation of merit and wisdom and they bring others to those three levels.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa thob par byas pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po la bzhag pas mchog gi rnam pas yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa thob par byas pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po la bzhag pas mchog gi rnam pas yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And by establishing them in the great accumulations of merit and wisdom, they are brought to full maturity in the highest way.

original: nam byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po nas bdun pa man chad la gnas pa'i @105b dus na bdag nyid kyang 'bad rtsol dang bcas pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la gnas la /
analyzed: nam byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po nas bdun pa man chad la gnas pa'i @105b dus na bdag nyid kyang 'bad rtsol dang bcas pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la gnas la /
translated: When bodhisattvas, from the first level up to the seventh, are themselves established in nonconceptual gnosis, which is accompanied by effort, and in the accumulations of merit and wisdom,

original: sems can gzhan dag kyang sa de dag la bkod na 'bad rtsol dang bcas pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la bkod pa 'bring gi rnam pas sems can yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag kyang sa de dag la bkod na 'bad rtsol dang bcas pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la bkod pa 'bring gi rnam pas sems can yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and they introduce other sentient beings to those levels, they are introducing them to the accumulations of merit and wisdom, which are accompanied by effort, and are bringing sentient beings to full maturity in the middling way.

original: dus ji srid cig tu sems can yongs su smin par byed ce na /
analyzed: dus ji srid cig tu sems can yongs su smin par byed ce na /
translated: For how long do they bring sentient beings to full maturity?

original: de'i phyir / 'jig rten yod dang mnyam par 'jug pas 'dul //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'jig rten yod dang mnyam par 'jug pas 'dul //
translated: They train them for as long as the world exists.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: As long as the limits of space last,

original: nam mkha'i mtha' ji srid du yod par sems can gyi khams kyang nge srid du yod do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtha' ji srid du yod par sems can gyi khams kyang nge srid du yod do //
translated: the realm of sentient beings will last.üîΩAs long as the world lasts, the realm of sentient beings will last.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams ji srid du yod par sems can gyi khams kyang de srid du yod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams ji srid du yod par sems can gyi khams kyang de srid du yod de /
translated: As long as the realm of sentient beings lasts,

original: sems can gyi khams yod kyi bar du sems can yongs su smin par byed pas na /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams yod kyi bar du sems can yongs su smin par byed pas na /
translated: the Bodhisattva will work for the full maturation of sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten yod dang mnyam par 'jug pas 'dul //
analyzed: 'jig rten yod dang mnyam par 'jug pas 'dul //
translated: He is the tamer who acts as long as the world lasts.

original: zhes bya'o // yongs su smin pa'i skabs bshad pa rdzogs so /üîΩ// / yongs su smin pa'i skabs bshad pa'i rjes la /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // yongs su smin pa'i skabs bshad pa rdzogs so / // / yongs su smin pa'i skabs bshad pa'i rjes la /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the chapter on full maturation.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /üîΩde ltar byang chub sems dbas sems can gyi rgyud la'ang dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par byas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na / de ltar byang chub sems dbas sems can gyi rgyud la'ang dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par byas /
translated: What is the connection between the chapter on full maturation and the chapter on the knowledge of all aspects?üîΩIn this way, the Bodhisattva has brought the roots of virtue to full maturity in the mindstreams of sentient beings.

original: bdag gi sems kyi rgyud la'ang dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par byas pa de /
analyzed: bdag gi sems kyi rgyud la'ang dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par byas pa de /
translated: He has also brought the roots of virtue to full maturity in his own mindstream.

original: myur du bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par byas pa des na yongs su smin pa'i skabs kyi 'og tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: myur du bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par byas pa des na yongs su smin pa'i skabs kyi 'og tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Since he has quickly attained unsurpassed enlightenment, the section on complete maturation is related to the section on omniscience.

original: yang na bdag dang gzhan gyi don dang de kho na'i don dang / mthu dang / yongs su smin pa dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub ste /
analyzed: yang na bdag dang gzhan gyi don dang de kho na'i don dang / mthu dang / yongs su smin pa dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub ste /
translated: Or else, the five topics are: the benefit for oneself and others, the meaning of reality, power, complete maturation, and unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: dngos po lnga ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i dmigs par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po lnga ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i dmigs par byas pa yin no //
translated: These five topics are the objects of the bodhisattva's training.

original: de la byang chub kyi sems kyis bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod cing smon lam 'debs so //
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi sems kyis bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod cing smon lam 'debs so //
translated: Therein, one should desire and aspire to unsurpassed enlightenment through the thought of enlightenment.

original: byang chub thob par bya ba yang ci dgos she na /
analyzed: byang chub thob par bya ba yang ci dgos she na /
translated: And why should one attain enlightenment?

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don yongs su rdzogs par dgos te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don yongs su rdzogs par dgos te /
translated: One should do so in order to perfect the benefit for oneself and others.

original: de bas na de'i rjes la bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi skabs bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na de'i rjes la bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi skabs bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the section on the benefit for oneself and others is explained immediately after that.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don la zhugs pa des kyang bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pas ma gos par byas pa yin te /üîΩde @106a * //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don la zhugs pa des kyang bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pas ma gos par byas pa yin te / de @106a * //
translated: And by engaging in the aims of self and other, he is not defiled by the defilements.

original: bas na kun nas nyon mongs pas mi gos ba'i thabs de kho na'i skabs bshad do //
analyzed: bas na kun nas nyon mongs pas mi gos ba'i thabs de kho na'i skabs bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the method of not being defiled by the defilements is explained in that context.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pas kyang ma gos kyang mthu med na sems can gyi don la skyo bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pas kyang ma gos kyang mthu med na sems can gyi don la skyo bar 'gyur te /
translated: Even though he is not defiled by the defilements, if he is powerless, he will become weary of working for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de bas na sems can gdul bar bya ba'i don la mi skyo ba'i thabs mthu'i skabs bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na sems can gdul bar bya ba'i don la mi skyo ba'i thabs mthu'i skabs bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the method of not becoming weary of working to discipline sentient beings is explained in the context of power.

original: de ltar de kho na'i dang / mthu gnyis kyis byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar de kho na'i dang / mthu gnyis kyis byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: Thus, by means of reality and power, the bodhisattva brings about the full maturation of the qualities of the Buddha and the full maturation of sentient beings.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: byang chub sems dpa' de kho na khong du chud na bdag nyid kyi rgyud la dga' ba la sogs pa'i chos dgu shas cher myur du 'grub cing thob par 'gyur gyi de kho na'i khong du ma chud na ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de kho na khong du chud na bdag nyid kyi rgyud la dga' ba la sogs pa'i chos dgu shas cher myur du 'grub cing thob par 'gyur gyi de kho na'i khong du ma chud na ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the bodhisattva has realized reality, he will quickly and easily achieve and attain the nine dharmas in his own stream of consciousness, such as the superknowledges. If he has not realized reality, he will not.

original: de bas na de kho na khong du chud pa las bdag sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na de kho na khong du chud pa las bdag sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, from the realization of reality, he will perfect the qualities of a buddha.

original: mthu dang ldan skyo ba dang gnod pa med par sems can yongs su smin par byed nus te ;
analyzed: mthu dang ldan skyo ba dang gnod pa med par sems can yongs su smin par byed nus te ;
translated: He will be able to ripen sentient beings without weariness or harm, because he has power.

original: mthu med pas ni mi nus te /
analyzed: mthu med pas ni mi nus te /
translated: Without power, he will not be able to.

original: de bas na mi skyo ba'i thabs ni mthu dang ldan pa'i thabs kyis bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na mi skyo ba'i thabs ni mthu dang ldan pa'i thabs kyis bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the method of non-weariness is explained as the method of having power.

original: de ltar bdag dang sems can yongs su smin pa dang ldan pa rnams ni sha thang dang mi bde ba med par tshogs yongs su rdzogs nas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang sems can yongs su smin pa dang ldan pa rnams ni sha thang dang mi bde ba med par tshogs yongs su rdzogs nas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te ;
translated: Thus, those who have perfected themselves and sentient beings, without exhaustion or discomfort, will complete the accumulations and attain unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: de'i rjes la yongs su smin pa'i skabs kyi rjes la /
analyzed: de'i rjes la yongs su smin pa'i skabs kyi rjes la /
translated: The next is the next to the fully matured.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: The next is the next to the occasion of the knowledge of all modes.

original: de la bdag dang gzhan gyi don dang / de kho na'i don dang mthu dang / yongs su smin pa bzhi ni rgyu lta bur dmigs so //
analyzed: de la bdag dang gzhan gyi don dang / de kho na'i don dang mthu dang / yongs su smin pa bzhi ni rgyu lta bur dmigs so //
translated: Among them, the four, the aims of self and other, the aim of reality, the power, and the full accomplishment, are observed as the cause.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub ni 'bras bur dmigs so //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub ni 'bras bur dmigs so //
translated: Unsurpassed enlightenment is observed as the result.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
translated: Two verses on the knowledge of all modes.

original: gsum pa ni bshad pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsum pa ni bshad pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The third is the explanation.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba grub pa'i ye shes dang / chos kyi dbyings dang lnga las sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba grub pa'i ye shes dang / chos kyi dbyings dang lnga las sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
translated: The Buddha is said to be the five: the mirror-like knowledge, the knowledge of sameness, the knowledge of individual awareness, the knowledge of achieving the task, and the knowledge of the ultimate realm.
