original: sangs rgyas de nyid la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas de nyid la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That Buddha is said to be the knowledge of all modes.

original: sangs rgyas de'i don tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni mdo tsam du bstan pa de tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa bzlas te zhib tu 'chad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas de'i don tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni mdo tsam du bstan pa de tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa bzlas te zhib tu 'chad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the Buddha is taught in brief in two verses, and is explained in detail by repeating the third verse.

original: de la tshigs @106b su bcad pa gnyis kyis bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la tshigs @106b su bcad pa gnyis kyis bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The meaning of the two verses is threefold:

original: yang dag par 'thob pa dang / rang bzhin dang dpe'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'thob pa dang / rang bzhin dang dpe'o //
translated: correct attainment, nature, and example.

original: yang dag par thob ba la rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang dag par thob ba la rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Correct attainment is fourfold:

original: dga' ba spyod pa brgya phrag ji snyed pa dang / dge ba'i tshogs ji snyed pa dang / dus ji srid cig dang / nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa ji tsam spangs pas sangs rgyas thob pa ni yang dag par thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dga' ba spyod pa brgya phrag ji snyed pa dang / dge ba'i tshogs ji snyed pa dang / dus ji srid cig dang / nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa ji tsam spangs pas sangs rgyas thob pa ni yang dag par thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The attainment of Buddhahood by however many hundreds of practices of joy, by however many collections of virtue, for however long a time, and by however much abandonment of afflictive and objective obscurations is called ‚Äúcorrect attainment.‚Äù

original: dpag med dka' spyod brgya rnams dang // zhes bya bas dka' ba spyod pa brgya phrag ji snyed cig bstan te /
analyzed: dpag med dka' spyod brgya rnams dang // zhes bya bas dka' ba spyod pa brgya phrag ji snyed cig bstan te /
translated: The verse ‚Äúhowever many hundreds of immeasurable hardships‚Äù teaches however many hundreds of practices of hardship.

original: sems can gyi don du mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa dang bu smad btang ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams me ma mur gyis gang bar yang 'bog cing 'gro ba la sogs pa'i dka' ba spyod pa dpag tu med pa brgya phrag grangs med pa zhig kyang spyad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa dang bu smad btang ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams me ma mur gyis gang bar yang 'bog cing 'gro ba la sogs pa'i dka' ba spyod pa dpag tu med pa brgya phrag grangs med pa zhig kyang spyad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, he gave away his head, legs, arms, and so on, as well as his children and wife, and he practiced countless hundreds of immeasurable austerities, such as going through a world-realm filled with fire.

original: brgya smos pas ni mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi grangs stong phrag la sogs pa tshad med pa rnams kyi'ang bsdu'o //
analyzed: brgya smos pas ni mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi grangs stong phrag la sogs pa tshad med pa rnams kyi'ang bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúhundred‚Äù is used here merely as an illustration; the meaning is that he practiced countless thousands and so on.

original: dpag med dge ba bsags pa dang // zhes bya bas /
analyzed: dpag med dge ba bsags pa dang // zhes bya bas /
translated: The line ‚Äúhe accumulated immeasurable virtue‚Äù

original: dge ba'i chogs ji snyed pa bstan te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chogs ji snyed pa bstan te /
translated: teaches the extent of his accumulation of virtue.

original: sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa dge ba dpag tu med pa yang bsags zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa dge ba dpag tu med pa yang bsags zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he accumulated immeasurable virtue, such as the perfections, the levels, and the factors of enlightenment.

original: dpag tu med pa'i dus dang ni //üîΩzhes bya bas /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa'i dus dang ni // zhes bya bas /
translated: The line ‚Äúfor immeasurable time‚Äù

original: dus ji srid cig bstan te /
analyzed: dus ji srid cig bstan te /
translated: teaches the duration of his practice.

original: dus kyang bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyi bar du spyod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dus kyang bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyi bar du spyod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Time also means that one practices for three measureless kalpas.

original: dpag med sgrib pa zad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dpag med sgrib pa zad pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the immeasurability of the elimination of obscurations,

original: zhes bya bas /
analyzed: zhes bya bas /
translated: it is said.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa ji tsam spangs pa bstan te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa ji tsam spangs pa bstan te /
translated: This teaches the extent to which the obscurations of affliction and the knowable are eliminated.

original: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas ma spangs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa yang spangs /
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas ma spangs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa yang spangs /
translated: The obscurations of affliction that have not been eliminated since beginningless cyclic existence are also eliminated.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa yang spangs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa yang spangs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The obscurations of the knowable are also eliminated.

original: 'di yang chad yang dag par thob pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'di yang chad yang dag par thob pa bstan to //
translated: This also teaches the attainment of the elimination of obscurations.

original: rang bzhin yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rang bzhin yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The nature is also twofold:

original: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the perfection of elimination and the perfection of wisdom.

original: sgrib pa kun gyi dri med pa //
analyzed: sgrib pa kun gyi dri med pa //
translated: Stainless due to the elimination of all obscurations,

original: zhes bya bas spangs pa phan sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas spangs pa phan sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: this teaches the perfection of elimination.

original: sangs rgyas kyi dus na sa bcur gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag chags kyang ma lus par spangs pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi dus na sa bcur gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag chags kyang ma lus par spangs pas /
translated: At the time of Buddhahood, the obscurations of the afflictions belonging to the ten grounds and the habitual tendencies of the obscurations to omniscience are also completely abandoned.

original: sgrib pa kun gyi dri med ces bya'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa kun gyi dri med ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äústainless with respect to all obscurations.‚Äù

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa thob //üîΩces bya bas /üîΩye shes @107a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa thob // ces bya bas / ye shes @107a * //
translated: Obtaining omniscience with respect to all aspects

original: phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: This teaches the perfection of exalted wisdom.

original: de yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is connected with ‚Äúomniscience with respect to all aspects.‚Äù

original: de la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par de lta bur phyin ci ma log par shes pas ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par de lta bur phyin ci ma log par shes pas ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Omniscience with respect to all aspects is so called because of unmistakenly knowing impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness in that way.

original: phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i chos kun ma lus par mkhyen pas na thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i chos kun ma lus par mkhyen pas na thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Omniscience is so called because of knowing all phenomena such as the aggregates and constituents without exception.

original: 'dis ni rang bzhin bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang bzhin bstan to //
translated: This teaches the nature.

original: rin chen snod ni phye ba ltar //üîΩsangs rgyas par ni shin tu bstan //
analyzed: rin chen snod ni phye ba ltar // sangs rgyas par ni shin tu bstan //
translated: Like opening a container of jewels,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Buddhahood is taught to be completely perfect.

original: dper na rin po che'i sgrom kha phyen kha dog dang dbyibs su ldan pa'i rin po che sna tshogs snang ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis spangs te /
analyzed: dper na rin po che'i sgrom kha phyen kha dog dang dbyibs su ldan pa'i rin po che sna tshogs snang ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis spangs te /
translated: Just as when the lid of a jeweled chest is opened and the various jewels with their colors and shapes appear, in the same way, when one has eliminated the two obscurations, afflictive and knowledge,

original: sangs rgyas kyis thob pa'i dus na stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang ma 'dres pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rin po che sna tshogs dag de'i tshe na snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis thob pa'i dus na stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang ma 'dres pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rin po che sna tshogs dag de'i tshe na snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and attained buddhahood, the various jewels of the qualities of the Buddha, such as the strengths, fearlessnesses, and specific knowledges, appear at that time. This is the meaning.

original: dpag med dka' spyod brgya rnams dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dpag med dka' spyod brgya rnams dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The verse says, ‚ÄúThose who have undergone hundreds of hardships for immeasurable eons.‚Äù

original: rgyas bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyas bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain this in detail,

original: ngal brgyas rmad 'byung dka' spyad ces smos te /
analyzed: ngal brgyas rmad 'byung dka' spyad ces smos te /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúThose who have undergone hundreds of hardships for immeasurable eons.‚Äù

original: 'bad pa dang / bsgrub pa dang / brtsal ba drag po grangs med pas mgo dang rkang lag dang / bu smad la sogs pas gtang bar spyad pa ni ngal brgyas rmad 'byung ba'i dka' ba spyad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'bad pa dang / bsgrub pa dang / brtsal ba drag po grangs med pas mgo dang rkang lag dang / bu smad la sogs pas gtang bar spyad pa ni ngal brgyas rmad 'byung ba'i dka' ba spyad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Those who have undergone hardships by giving up their heads, legs, arms, children, wives, and so on, through hundreds of hardships, through immeasurable eons, through intense effort, practice, and striving, are called ‚Äúthose who have undergone hundreds of hardships for immeasurable eons.‚Äù

original: de lta bur dka' ba spyad pa 'jig rten dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la med pas na rmad du byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bur dka' ba spyad pa 'jig rten dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la med pas na rmad du byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since such austerities are not found among worldly persons, ≈õrƒÅvakas, or pratyekabuddhas, they are called ‚Äúwondrous.‚Äù

original: de yang mdo dag las sems can gyi don du ngas mig yongs su btang ba bsags na ni ri rab bas kyang mtho la khrag yongs su btang ba bsags na ni phyogs bzhi'i rgya mtsho bas kyang mang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang mdo dag las sems can gyi don du ngas mig yongs su btang ba bsags na ni ri rab bas kyang mtho la khrag yongs su btang ba bsags na ni phyogs bzhi'i rgya mtsho bas kyang mang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Moreover, the meaning of the sutras is that if the eyes I have given up for the sake of sentient beings were collected, they would be higher than Mount Meru, and if the blood I have given up were collected, it would be greater than the four oceans.

original: dpag med dge ba bsags pa dang // zhes bya ba'i don rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩdge bas bsags kun zhes smos te /
analyzed: dpag med dge ba bsags pa dang // zhes bya ba'i don rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir / dge bas bsags kun zhes smos te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúaccumulated limitless virtue‚Äù is taught extensively.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sa bcu dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i dge ba kun kyang bsags zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩdpag tu med ba'i dus dang ni //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sa bcu dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i dge ba kun kyang bsags zhes bya ba'i don to // dpag tu med ba'i dus dang ni //
translated: ‚ÄúAll virtue accumulated‚Äù refers to the perfection, the ten grounds, the factors of enlightenment, and so on.

original: zhes bya ba'i don rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúinconceivable time‚Äù is taught extensively.

original: dus ring bskal pa mchog 'gro zhes smos te /
analyzed: dus ring bskal pa mchog 'gro zhes smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúLong time, supreme eon‚Äù refers to

original: dus ring gi sgras ni bskal pa chung du dang / par gyi bskal pa tsam du bsgrub pa ma yin gyi bskal pa chen @107b por bsgrub par ston to //
analyzed: dus ring gi sgras ni bskal pa chung du dang / par gyi bskal pa tsam du bsgrub pa ma yin gyi bskal pa chen @107b por bsgrub par ston to //
translated: The word ‚Äúlong‚Äù shows that the practice is not for a short eon or a parinirvƒÅ·πáa eon, but for a great eon.

original: mchog gi sgras ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyi bar du bsgrub par ston to //
analyzed: mchog gi sgras ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyi bar du bsgrub par ston to //
translated: The word ‚Äúsupreme‚Äù shows that the practice is for three incalculable eons.

original: dpag med sgrib pa zad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dpag med sgrib pa zad pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the immeasurable elimination of obscurations,

original: sgrib pa zad ces smos te /
analyzed: sgrib pa zad ces smos te /
translated: it is said that obscurations are eliminated.

original: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas bsags pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa kun sbangs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas bsags pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa kun sbangs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that all the afflictive obscurations and the obscurations to omniscience accumulated since beginningless cyclic existence are eliminated.

original: sgrib pa kun gyi dri med pa //
analyzed: sgrib pa kun gyi dri med pa //
translated: It is stainless with respect to all obscurations.üîΩThis is the meaning of the extensive explanation.

original: zhes bya ba'i don rgya cher bstan ni pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don rgya cher bstan ni pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the meaning of that, it says:

original: sar gtogs sgrib pa phra bcom zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sar gtogs sgrib pa phra bcom zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It conquers the subtle obscurations belonging to the stages.

original: sangs rgyas pa'i dus na sa dang po nas sa bcu yan chad na yod pa'i sgrib pa phra mo dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa phra mo dang yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i dus na sa dang po nas sa bcu yan chad na yod pa'i sgrib pa phra mo dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa phra mo dang yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At the time of buddhahood, it conquers the subtle obscurations that exist from the first to the tenth stages, and the subtle obscurations to omniscience. This is the meaning of ‚Äúand.‚Äù

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa thob //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa thob //
translated: He attains the knowledge of all aspects.

original: zhes bya ba'i don rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of that passage in detail,üîΩit says,

original: sangs rgyas de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat Buddha,‚Äù

original: nam sangs rgyas pa'i dus na chos thams cad phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pas sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nam sangs rgyas pa'i dus na chos thams cad phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pas sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: and so on. When he becomes a Buddha, he is called a Buddha because he has realized all phenomena without error.

original: rin po chen snod nyid phye ba ltar //
analyzed: rin po chen snod nyid phye ba ltar //
translated: Like the opening of a treasure chest,üîΩIn order to teach the meaning of that passage in detail,

original: zhes bya ba'i don rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it says,

original: de ni mthu chen rin chen snod phye bzhin //
analyzed: de ni mthu chen rin chen snod phye bzhin //
translated: ‚ÄúHe is like the opening of a great treasure chest,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: rin po che gang sems can gzhan gyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i rin po che ni mthu chen po'i rin po che zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rin po che gang sems can gzhan gyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i rin po che ni mthu chen po'i rin po che zhes bya ste /
translated: A treasure that fulfills the wishes of other sentient beings is called a great treasure.

original: mthu chen po'i rin po che'i snod kha phye na rin po che chen po sna tshogs snang zhing bdag dang gzhan gyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi sa'i dus na nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib ba ma lus par spangs nas bdag dang gzhan gyi bsam pha yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i chos stobs dang /
analyzed: mthu chen po'i rin po che'i snod kha phye na rin po che chen po sna tshogs snang zhing bdag dang gzhan gyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi sa'i dus na nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib ba ma lus par spangs nas bdag dang gzhan gyi bsam pha yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i chos stobs dang /
translated: Just as when a container of great power, a precious gem, is opened, various great precious things appear and fulfill the wishes of oneself and others, in the same way, at the time of the buddha stage, after all afflictive and cognitive obstructions are abandoned, various aspects of qualities such as powers and fearlessnesses appear and fulfill the wishes of oneself and others.

original: mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs snang zhing bdag dang gzhan gyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs snang zhing bdag dang gzhan gyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of fulfilling the wishes of oneself and others.

original: sangs rgyas de'i gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid mthu dang bcas pa la gnyis te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas de'i gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid mthu dang bcas pa la gnyis te /
translated: The third is the explanation of the nondual character of that buddha together with its power.

original: gsum pa ni bshad par gyur pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsum pa ni bshad par gyur pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The third is the explanation of what has been said.

original: sangs rgyas ni gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: Buddha is the nondual character.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ni gnyis zhes bya la /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ni gnyis zhes bya la /
translated: The two are called the apprehended object and the apprehending subject.

original: sangs rgyas pa'i dus na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis spangs pas gnyis su med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i dus na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis spangs pas gnyis su med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: At the time of Buddhahood, since the two, the apprehended object and the apprehending subject, are abandoned, it is called nondual.

original: yang na yod pa dang med pa gnyis la gnyis su zhes bya ste /üîΩsangs rgyas pa na yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pas gnyis su med @108a * //
analyzed: yang na yod pa dang med pa gnyis la gnyis su zhes bya ste / sangs rgyas pa na yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pas gnyis su med @108a * //
translated: Alternatively, the two are called existence and nonexistence.

original: pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa zhes bya'o //
translated: At the time of Buddhahood, since it is neither existent nor nonexistent, it is called nondual.

original: ci zhig yod pa ma yin zhen /
analyzed: ci zhig yod pa ma yin zhen /
translated: What does not exist?

original: sangs rgyas pa'i tshe gzung ba dang 'dzin pa kun du brtags pa'i kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i tshe gzung ba dang 'dzin pa kun du brtags pa'i kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: At the time of Buddhahood, the imagined reality, which is the imagined reality of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject, does not exist.

original: ci zhig med ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig med ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: What does exist?

original: yongs su grub pa yod pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmthu ni gnyis med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yon tan la bya ste /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa yod pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro // mthu ni gnyis med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yon tan la bya ste /
translated: The perfected reality exists, because its reality exists.üîΩPower refers to the qualities that have the characteristic of nonduality.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mthu mdo tsam du bstan /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mthu mdo tsam du bstan /
translated: The two verses briefly teach the characteristic of nonduality and power.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas ni de nyid kyi don bzlas nas rgya cher 'chad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas ni de nyid kyi don bzlas nas rgya cher 'chad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The third verse restates the meaning of that and explains it extensively.

original: thams cad chos ni sangs rgyas te //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad chos ni sangs rgyas te // zhes bya ba la /
translated: All phenomena are the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa dang / skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i chos la sangs rgyas zhes bya la /üîΩchos thams cad la bdag med pa gnyis dang / skye 'gag med par ma khyab pa med cing sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku bdag med pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin skye 'gag med pa'i rang bzhin dang / chos thams cad kyi bdag med pa gnyis dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa dang / skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i chos la sangs rgyas zhes bya la / chos thams cad la bdag med pa gnyis dang / skye 'gag med par ma khyab pa med cing sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku bdag med pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin skye 'gag med pa'i rang bzhin dang / chos thams cad kyi bdag med pa gnyis dang /
translated: Here, ‚ÄúBuddha‚Äù means the non-existence of a self in persons and the non-existence of a self in phenomena, and the non-arising and non-ceasing of phenomena.

original: skye 'gag med pa'i rang bzhin du mi 'dra ba cung zad kyang med pas na chos thams cad la sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye 'gag med pa'i rang bzhin du mi 'dra ba cung zad kyang med pas na chos thams cad la sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: All phenomena are pervaded by the two kinds of non-self and by the absence of arising and ceasing. The Buddha‚Äôs dharmakƒÅya, which is the nature of the two kinds of non-self, is the nature of non-arising and non-ceasing. And all phenomena, the two kinds of non-self and the nature of non-arising and non-ceasing, are not the slightest bit different. Therefore, all phenomena are called ‚ÄúBuddha.‚Äù

original: de bas na 'phags pa rdo rje gcod pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa rdo rje gcod pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the noble Diamond Cutter S≈´tra also says:

original: gang zhig ngal gzugs su blta //
analyzed: gang zhig ngal gzugs su blta //
translated: Who sees the Buddha as a form,

original: gang zhig ngal dgra ru rtogs //
analyzed: gang zhig ngal dgra ru rtogs //
translated: And who perceives the Buddha as an enemy,

original: log par zhugs pa song bas te //
analyzed: log par zhugs pa song bas te //
translated: Because of their wrong engagement,

original: skye bo de ni nga mi mthong //
analyzed: skye bo de ni nga mi mthong //
translated: Those people do not see me.

original: de bzhin nyid du sangs rgyas blta //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du sangs rgyas blta //
translated: The Buddha is to be seen as suchness.

original: 'dren pa rnams ni chos kyi sku //
analyzed: 'dren pa rnams ni chos kyi sku //
translated: The guides are the body of truth.

original: chos nyid shes par mi rung ste //
analyzed: chos nyid shes par mi rung ste //
translated: The reality of things cannot be known.

original: de dag rnam par rig mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag rnam par rig mi 'gyur //
translated: They are not objects of cognition.

original: zhes gsungs so// 'phags pa ye shes snang ba'i rgyan gyi mdo las kyang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so// 'phags pa ye shes snang ba'i rgyan gyi mdo las kyang /
translated: The noble S≈´tra on the Ornament of Wisdom Light also says,

original: mi skye chos ni rtag tu de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: mi skye chos ni rtag tu de bzhin gshegs //
translated: The non-arisen is always the TathƒÅgata.

original: thams cad chos kyang bde bar gshegs dang 'dra //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thams cad chos kyang bde bar gshegs dang 'dra // zhes gsungs so //
translated: All things are like the Sugata.

original: smas pa / gal te chos thams cad sangs rgyas yin na sangs rgyas kyi yod pa'i rang bzhin yin pas /
analyzed: smas pa / gal te chos thams cad sangs rgyas yin na sangs rgyas kyi yod pa'i rang bzhin yin pas /
translated: If all things are the Buddha, then just as the Buddha has an existent nature,

original: sangs rgyas bzhin du chos yang yod pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ram snyam pa la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bzhin du chos yang yod pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ram snyam pa la /
translated: so too all things would have an existent nature.

original: chos ni gang yang yod ma yin //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: chos ni gang yang yod ma yin //üîΩzhes smos te /
translated: No thing at all exists.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi @108b chos ni gang yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi @108b chos ni gang yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the phenomena of the imagined pattern, which are the imagined characteristics of subject and object, and the phenomena of the imagined pattern, such as pot, cloth, etc., do not exist at all.

original: dkar po'i chos kyi rang bzhin te //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dkar po'i chos kyi rang bzhin te // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The nature of the goodüîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, the nature of the supreme, the nature of the highest, the nature of the ultimate.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.

original: sangs rgyas ni dang po nyid kyang sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsgrub pa las grub la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni dang po nyid kyang sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsgrub pa las grub la //
translated: The Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.

original: sangs rgyas kyi dus na yang sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pas na dkar po'i chos kyi rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi dus na yang sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pas na dkar po'i chos kyi rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
translated: The Buddha is the nature of the good, etc.üîΩThe Buddha

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas de pha rol tu phyin pa de dag nyid kyi rang bzhin kho na yin no zhes brjod dam zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir / des kyang de ni bstan ma yin//
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas de pha rol tu phyin pa de dag nyid kyi rang bzhin kho na yin no zhes brjod dam zhe na / de'i phyir / des kyang de ni bstan ma yin//
translated: Thus, is it said that the Buddha is the very nature of those perfections?üîΩTherefore it is said:

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: Nor is he taught by them.

original: gtong ba po dang / len pa dang / rdzas la sogs pa lta bur rnam pa gsum du dmigs pa'i kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ni rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin pas na kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa des sangs rgyas de'i rang bzhinüîΩyin no zhes kyang mi brjod de /
analyzed: gtong ba po dang / len pa dang / rdzas la sogs pa lta bur rnam pa gsum du dmigs pa'i kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ni rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin pas na kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa des sangs rgyas de'i rang bzhin yin no zhes kyang mi brjod de /
translated: The perfections that are imagined to have the nature of the three‚Äîthe giver, the receiver, the gift, etc.‚Äîdo not exist inherently. Therefore, it is not said that the Buddha is the nature of those perfections that are imagined to have such a nature.

original: ci'i phyir sangs rgyas ni kun brtags kyi chos ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir sangs rgyas ni kun brtags kyi chos ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it not said? Because the Buddha is not a phenomenon that is imagined.

original: de yan chad kyis gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid bshad de /
analyzed: de yan chad kyis gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid bshad de /
translated: Up to this point, the characteristic of nonduality has been explained.

original: rin chen chos kyi rgyu yin pas //
analyzed: rin chen chos kyi rgyu yin pas //
translated: Since it is the cause of the precious Dharma,

original: de ni rin chen 'byung gnas bzhin //
analyzed: de ni rin chen 'byung gnas bzhin //
translated: It is like a mine of jewels.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here it is said:

original: dper na rin po che 'byung gnas nas rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na rin po che 'byung gnas nas rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as various kinds of jewels come from a mine of jewels,

original: sangs rgyas de las kyang bshad par bya ba'i chos rin po che dpag tu med pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i chos rin po che dpag tu med pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas de las kyang bshad par bya ba'i chos rin po che dpag tu med pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i chos rin po che dpag tu med pa 'byung ste /
translated: from that Buddha, the Jewel Mine of the Dharma, immeasurable jewels of Dharma to be explained and immeasurable jewels of Dharma such as the powers and fearlessnesses come forth.

original: chos rin po che rnams 'byung ba'i rgyu dang rkyen dang gzhi byed pas na sangs rgyas ni rin po che'i 'byung gnas dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos rin po che rnams 'byung ba'i rgyu dang rkyen dang gzhi byed pas na sangs rgyas ni rin po che'i 'byung gnas dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since the Buddha is the cause, condition, and basis for the jewels of Dharma to come forth, he is like a mine of jewels.

original: dge ba'i lo rtog rgyu yi phyir //üîΩde ni sprin dang 'dra bar 'dod //
analyzed: dge ba'i lo rtog rgyu yi phyir // de ni sprin dang 'dra bar 'dod //
translated: Because he is the cause of the harvest of virtue,

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: he is considered to be like a cloud.

original: dper na sprin las char 'bab cing 'char 'bab pa'i rkyen gyis nas dang 'bras la sogs pa'i lo tog sna tshogs smin cing rgyas par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na sprin las char 'bab cing 'char 'bab pa'i rkyen gyis nas dang 'bras la sogs pa'i lo tog sna tshogs smin cing rgyas par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as rain falls from a cloud and various harvests such as barley and rice ripen and grow due to the condition of rain falling,

original: sangs rgyas de las kyang chos bshad pa'i char rnam pa sna tshogs phab nas sems can gyi sems kyi rgyud zhing dang 'dra ba la sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa dge ba'i lo tog bskyed pa'i rgyu sangs rgyas byed pas na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas de las kyang chos bshad pa'i char rnam pa sna tshogs phab nas sems can gyi sems kyi rgyud zhing dang 'dra ba la sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa dge ba'i lo tog bskyed pa'i rgyu sangs rgyas byed pas na /
translated: The Buddha, having rained down the various aspects of the Dharma from that cloud, causes the crop of virtue, the perfections such as generosity, to grow in the mental continuum of sentient beings, which is like a field.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas ni sprin @109a * //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas ni sprin @109a * //
translated: Therefore, the Buddha is considered to be like a cloud.

original: dang 'dra bar 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang 'dra bar 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: 'dis ni mthu che ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mthu che ba bstan to //
translated: This shows his great power.

original: de bzhin nyid dang tha dad pa ma yin pas chos thams cad ni sangs rgyas te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang tha dad pa ma yin pas chos thams cad ni sangs rgyas te zhes bya ba la /
translated: All things are the Buddha because they are not different from suchness.

original: bum pa dang snam bu la yod pa'i gang zag dang chos bdag med pa dang skye 'gag med pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi sku'i bdag med pa gnyis dang / skye 'gag med pa'i de bzhin nyid du mi 'dra ba med nas chos thams cad la sangs rgyas zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu la yod pa'i gang zag dang chos bdag med pa dang skye 'gag med pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi sku'i bdag med pa gnyis dang / skye 'gag med pa'i de bzhin nyid du mi 'dra ba med nas chos thams cad la sangs rgyas zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The selflessness of persons and things that exist in pots and cloth, the suchness that is without origination and cessation, the selflessness of the Dharma body, and the suchness that is without origination and cessation are not different. Therefore, all things are called the Buddha. This is the meaning.

original: thams cad chos ni sangs rgyas te //
analyzed: thams cad chos ni sangs rgyas te //
translated: All dharmas are the Buddha.üîΩThe meaning of this is taught by the verse:

original: zhes bya ba'i don dang / dkar po'i chos kyi rang bzhin te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don dang / dkar po'i chos kyi rang bzhin te //
translated: The nature of the good dharma.

original: zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of this, it says:

original: sangs rgyas chos kun tshogs pa'am //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos kun tshogs pa'am // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The Buddha is the collection of all dharmas.

original: bdag med pa gnyis dang / skye 'gag med pa'i chos la ni sangs rgyas zhes bya la /
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis dang / skye 'gag med pa'i chos la ni sangs rgyas zhes bya la /
translated: The two kinds of selflessness and the dharma of non-arising and non-ceasing are called the Buddha.

original: stong pa nyid kyi chos kyi nang du ma 'dus pa'i chos gang yang med pas na sangs rgyas chos kun chogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi chos kyi nang du ma 'dus pa'i chos gang yang med pas na sangs rgyas chos kun chogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since there is no dharma whatsoever that is not included in the dharma of emptiness, the Buddha is said to be the collection of all dharmas.

original: yang na sangs rgyas nyid dang po yangs dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs bsgrub pa las grub la /
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas nyid dang po yangs dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs bsgrub pa las grub la /
translated: Or else, the Buddha is established from the practice of the perfections and the factors of enlightenment in the beginning.

original: sangs rgyas grub pa na yang sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i chos thams cad tshogs par yod pas na sangs rgyas chos kun tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas grub pa na yang sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i chos thams cad tshogs par yod pas na sangs rgyas chos kun tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And when buddhahood is attained, all dharmas such as the levels, perfections, elements leading to enlightenment, powers, and fearlessnesses are complete, so it is called ‚Äúthe collection of all dharmas of buddhahood.‚Äù

original: chos ni gang yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: chos ni gang yang yod ma yin //
translated: There is no dharma at all.üîΩAnd:

original: zhes bya ba dang / des kyang de ni bstan ma yin //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / des kyang de ni bstan ma yin //
translated: That is not taught by that.

original: zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of that, it says:

original: yang na chos kun bral ba ste //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: yang na chos kun bral ba ste // zhes smos te /
translated: Or all dharmas are absent.

original: sangs rgyas pa'i dus na gzung ba dang 'dzin pas kun du brtags pa'i chos gang yang med pas na chos kun dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i dus na gzung ba dang 'dzin pas kun du brtags pa'i chos gang yang med pas na chos kun dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When buddhahood is attained, there are no dharmas at all that are imputed by the apprehended object and apprehending subject, so it is called ‚Äúthe absence of all dharmas.‚Äù

original: yang na gzung 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams de'i dus na med pas na chos kun dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gzung 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams de'i dus na med pas na chos kun dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, the perfections that have the character of apprehended object and apprehending subject are absent at that time, so it is called ‚Äúthe absence of all dharmas.‚Äù

original: rin chen chos kyi rgyu yin pas //
analyzed: rin chen chos kyi rgyu yin pas //
translated: Because it is the cause of the precious Dharma,

original: de ni rin chen 'byung gnas bzhin //
analyzed: de ni rin chen 'byung gnas bzhin //
translated: it is like a mine of jewels.

original: zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of that, it says:

original: rin chen mchog rab che yangs 'byung phyir rin chen chos kyi 'byung gnas bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rin chen mchog rab che yangs 'byung phyir rin chen chos kyi 'byung gnas bzhin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it is the source of the great, supreme, precious, vast jewels, it is like a mine of precious substances.

original: dper na rin po che 'byung gnas nas rin po che sna tshogs 'byung ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na rin po che 'byung gnas nas rin po che sna tshogs 'byung ba bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as various precious substances come from a mine of precious substances,üîΩin the same way, from that Buddha, the cause of the arising of the precious Dharma of the Great Vehicle, which is the Dharma to be explained, and the cause of the arising of the vast and extensive Dharma of the levels, perfections, powers, fearlessnesses, and so on, arises.

original: sangs rgyas de las kyang bshad par bya ba'i chos theg pa chen po'i chos @109b rin po che rnams 'byung ba dang / yangs shing rgya che ba'i chos sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i rgyu byed pas na sangs rgyas ni rin po che'i 'byung gnas dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas de las kyang bshad par bya ba'i chos theg pa chen po'i chos @109b rin po che rnams 'byung ba dang / yangs shing rgya che ba'i chos sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i rgyu byed pas na sangs rgyas ni rin po che'i 'byung gnas dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the Buddha is like a mine of precious substances.

original: dge ba'i lo tog rgyu yi phyir //
analyzed: dge ba'i lo tog rgyu yi phyir //
translated: Because it is the cause of the growth of the crop of virtue,

original: de ni sprin dang 'dra bar 'dod //
analyzed: de ni sprin dang 'dra bar 'dod //
translated: it is asserted to be like a cloud.

original: ces bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of that, it says:

original: 'byung po dge ba'i lo tog cher 'phel rgyu phyir sprin dang 'dra //
analyzed: 'byung po dge ba'i lo tog cher 'phel rgyu phyir sprin dang 'dra //
translated: Because it is the cause of the great growth of the crop of virtue of living beings, it is like a cloud.

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: As it is said:

original: dper na sprin las char phab nas lo tog rnam pa sna tshogs 'phel zhing rgyas par byed pa de bzhin du 'byung po ni sems can la bya ste /
analyzed: dper na sprin las char phab nas lo tog rnam pa sna tshogs 'phel zhing rgyas par byed pa de bzhin du 'byung po ni sems can la bya ste /
translated: Just as clouds rain down and cause the various crops to grow and expand, so too do the elements, which refer to sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas kyang chos kyi char phab nas sems can gyi sems kyi rgyud zhing dang 'dra ba la pha rol tu phyin pa'i dge ba'i lo tog rgya cher 'phel zhing rgyas bar byed pas na sangs rgyas ni sprin dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas kyang chos kyi char phab nas sems can gyi sems kyi rgyud zhing dang 'dra ba la pha rol tu phyin pa'i dge ba'i lo tog rgya cher 'phel zhing rgyas bar byed pas na sangs rgyas ni sprin dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as the Tathagata rains down the Dharma and causes the crops of virtue, the perfections, to grow and expand in the fields of sentient beings' minds, so too is the Buddha like a cloud.

original: ji ltar chos kyi char 'bebs pa bsan  pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar chos kyi char 'bebs pa bsan  pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show how he rains down the Dharma, it says:

original: skye dgu dag la chos kyi char chen legs bshad mi zad rab tu 'bebs //üîΩzhes smos so //
analyzed: skye dgu dag la chos kyi char chen legs bshad mi zad rab tu 'bebs // zhes smos so //
translated: He rains down the great Dharma rain of excellent explanations that are inexhaustible for living beings.

original: de la char chen legs bshad mi zad pa zhes bya ba'i tshig phyis 'byung la /
analyzed: de la char chen legs bshad mi zad pa zhes bya ba'i tshig phyis 'byung la /
translated: Here, the phrase the great Dharma rain of excellent explanations that are inexhaustible comes later,

original: skye dgu dag la chos kyi char zhes bya ba'i tshig sngar byung mod kyi /
analyzed: skye dgu dag la chos kyi char zhes bya ba'i tshig sngar byung mod kyi /
translated: while the phrase for living beings comes earlier.

original: tshig 'di ltar sbyar te chos chen po legs par bshad pa mi zad pa skye dgu dag gi sems kyi rgyud la 'bebs pas na sprin dang 'dra'o zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshig 'di ltar sbyar te chos chen po legs par bshad pa mi zad pa skye dgu dag gi sems kyi rgyud la 'bebs pas na sprin dang 'dra'o zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The words are to be applied thus: ‚ÄúIt is like a cloud, because it rains down upon the mental continuities of living beings the great Dharma, the inexhaustible good explanation.‚Äù

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid theg pa chen po'i chos la bya'o //üîΩchos de yang thog mar yang dge /üîΩbar du yang dge /
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid theg pa chen po'i chos la bya'o // chos de yang thog mar yang dge / bar du yang dge /
translated: ‚ÄúGreat‚Äù refers to the Dharma of the Great Vehicle, which is characterized by the stages and perfections.

original: tha mar yang dge /
analyzed: tha mar yang dge /
translated: That Dharma is ‚Äúgood in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end.‚Äù

original: don bzang tshig bzang bas na legs par bshad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don bzang tshig bzang bas na legs par bshad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúwell explained‚Äù because it has a good meaning and good words.

original: chos de lan cig rtogs na 'khor ba mtha'i bar du yang med par mi 'gyur bas na mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos de lan cig rtogs na 'khor ba mtha'i bar du yang med par mi 'gyur bas na mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúinexhaustible‚Äù because, once it is understood, it does not disappear until the end of cyclic existence.

original: 'bebs zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la bshad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bebs zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la bshad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúRains down‚Äù means that it is explained to those living beings who are to be disciplined.

original: sangs rgyas pa de nyid skyabs bla na med pa la tshigs su bcad pa lnga'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa de nyid skyabs bla na med pa la tshigs su bcad pa lnga'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Five verses on the same Buddha‚Äôs being the unexcelled refuge.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthu'i skabs kyi rjes la skyabs bla na med pa'i khyad par bshad pa'i 'brel pa ci yod ce na /üîΩlan du 'jig rten pa dag ri la sogs pa la skyabs tshol ba dang / nyan thos dag mya ngan las 'das pa la skyabs tshol bas ni rin po che'i @110a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthu'i skabs kyi rjes la skyabs bla na med pa'i khyad par bshad pa'i 'brel pa ci yod ce na / lan du 'jig rten pa dag ri la sogs pa la skyabs tshol ba dang / nyan thos dag mya ngan las 'das pa la skyabs tshol bas ni rin po che'i @110a * //
translated: What is the connection between the section on the power of the buddhas and the explanation of the superiority of the unsurpassable refuge?

original: 'byung gnas lta bu dang / sprin lta bu'i mthu dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas su grub na skyabs su song ba thams cad kyi skyabs pas skyabs bla na med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung gnas lta bu dang / sprin lta bu'i mthu dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas su grub na skyabs su song ba thams cad kyi skyabs pas skyabs bla na med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The reply is that since mundane beings seek refuge in mountains and so on and ≈õrƒÅvakas seek refuge in nirvƒÅ·πáa, if one accomplishes buddhahood, which is endowed with the power of a source of jewels and a cloud, one has gone for refuge in the unsurpassable refuge of all.

original: mthu'i rjes la skyabs bla na med pa'i khyad par bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: mthu'i rjes la skyabs bla na med pa'i khyad par bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, after the section on power, the explanation of the superiority of the unsurpassable refuge is connected.

original: rgal ba dang / sngar skyabs kyi skabs bshad pa dang 'dir skyabs kyi skabs bshad par gnyis su khyad par ci yod nas /
analyzed: rgal ba dang / sngar skyabs kyi skabs bshad pa dang 'dir skyabs kyi skabs bshad par gnyis su khyad par ci yod nas /
translated: What is the difference between the explanation of refuge in the section on refuge above and the explanation of refuge here?

original: lan gnyis su bzlas te bshad ce na /
analyzed: lan gnyis su bzlas te bshad ce na /
translated: Why is it explained twice?

original: sngar ni gang zag gi khyad par gyi dbang du byas nas theg chen mchog phyir dkon mchog rnams la skyabs song bas /
analyzed: sngar ni gang zag gi khyad par gyi dbang du byas nas theg chen mchog phyir dkon mchog rnams la skyabs song bas /
translated: Previously, it was said that from the perspective of the individual, those who go for refuge to the Three Jewels for the sake of the supreme Mahayana

original: de nyid skyabs su song ba'i mchog tu rig par bya'o zhes smos la /üîΩ'dir ni 'jig rten pa dag rgyal po dang rkun po la sogs pas 'jigs nas ri la sogs pa la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / nyan thos pa dag 'khor ba'i skye rgan 'chi la sogs pas 'jigs nas bdag bskyab pa'i phyir dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i gang zag de dag pas gang zag gang sangs rgyas gang la skyabs su song pa'i sangs rgyas de nyid thob par byas nas bdag
analyzed: de nyid skyabs su song ba'i mchog tu rig par bya'o zhes smos la / 'dir ni 'jig rten pa dag rgyal po dang rkun po la sogs pas 'jigs nas ri la sogs pa la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / nyan thos pa dag 'khor ba'i skye rgan 'chi la sogs pas 'jigs nas bdag bskyab pa'i phyir dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i gang zag de dag pas gang zag gang sangs rgyas gang la skyabs su song pa'i sangs rgyas de nyid thob par byas nas bdag
translated: are to be known as the best of those who have gone for refuge.üîΩHere, those who go for refuge to the Three Jewels for the sake of protecting themselves from the fears of samsara such as birth, aging, sickness and death are the listeners.üîΩThose who go for refuge to the Three Jewels for the sake of protecting others from the fears of samsara such as birth, aging, sickness and death are bodhisattvas.

original: nyid sems can kun gyi skyabs su gyur cig ces dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de skyabs gzhan pas mchog tu gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: nyid sems can kun gyi skyabs su gyur cig ces dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de skyabs gzhan pas mchog tu gyur pa yin te /
translated: Those who go for refuge to the Three Jewels with the thought May I become a buddha and then protect all sentient beings are the best of those who go for refuge.

original: bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga gnod ba thams cad las bskyab pa'i phyir skyabs su song bas so //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga gnod ba thams cad las bskyab pa'i phyir skyabs su song bas so //
translated: Because one has gone for refuge in order to protect oneself and others from all harms.

original: de'i skabs su ni gang zag gi dbang du byas nas skyabs su 'gro ba'i skabs bshad kyi byang chub kyi dbang du byas pas ni ma yin no//
analyzed: de'i skabs su ni gang zag gi dbang du byas nas skyabs su 'gro ba'i skabs bshad kyi byang chub kyi dbang du byas pas ni ma yin no//
translated: In this context, the going for refuge is explained from the perspective of the individual, but not from the perspective of enlightenment.

original: skyabs su 'gro ba'i khyad par 'di ni byang chub tu byas pas te /
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba'i khyad par 'di ni byang chub tu byas pas te /
translated: This distinction of going for refuge is made from the perspective of enlightenment.

original: sus bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa de ni bdag dang gzhan gyi skyabs su gyur pas skyabs bla na med pa yin no zhes ston te /
analyzed: sus bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa de ni bdag dang gzhan gyi skyabs su gyur pas skyabs bla na med pa yin no zhes ston te /
translated: Whoever attains unsurpassed enlightenment becomes a refuge for oneself and others, so it is the unsurpassed refuge.

original: de bas na khyad par ni de yod do //
analyzed: de bas na khyad par ni de yod do //
translated: Therefore, this is the distinction.

original: sangs rgyas pa ni skyabs yin la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa ni skyabs yin la //
translated: The Buddha is the refugeüîΩ.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs nas chos thams cad thugs su chud de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs nas chos thams cad thugs su chud de /
translated: having abandoned the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, he has realized all phenomena.

original: sangs rgyas pa nyid skyabs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa nyid skyabs zhes bya ste /
translated: Buddhahood itself is called the refuge.

original: ci las skyob che na /
analyzed: ci las skyob che na /
translated: What does it protect from?

original: nyon mongs pa dang las dang tshe gsum las skyob pas sangs rgyas pa nyid skyabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las dang tshe gsum las skyob pas sangs rgyas pa nyid skyabs zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it protects from the three: afflictions, karma, and life, Buddhahood itself is called ‚Äúrefuge.‚Äù

original: rtag tu nyon mongs tshogs kun dang // @110b zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtag tu nyon mongs tshogs kun dang // @110b zhes bya ba la /
translated: It always protects from all the hosts of afflictionsüîΩand from all misdeeds.

original: nyon mongs pa'i nyon mongs pa las skyob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i nyon mongs pa las skyob par 'gyur te /
translated: It is said that it protects from the affliction of afflictions.

original: sangs rgyas bar gyur na 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du yang mthong ba dang bsgom bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kun sems la mi 'byung zhing nyon mongs pas mi gos par gyur ba na nyon mongs pa las skyob bo zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩnyes spyod dag ni thams cad dang // zhes bya bas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bar gyur na 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du yang mthong ba dang bsgom bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kun sems la mi 'byung zhing nyon mongs pas mi gos par gyur ba na nyon mongs pa las skyob bo zhes bya ba'i don to // nyes spyod dag ni thams cad dang // zhes bya bas /
translated: When one becomes a Buddha, the hosts of afflictions that are to be abandoned by seeing and by cultivation do not arise in the mind until the end of cyclic existence. When one is not covered by afflictions, it has the meaning of ‚Äúprotecting from afflictions.‚Äù

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las skyob par bstan te /
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las skyob par bstan te /
translated: It is said that it protects from the affliction of karma.

original: mtshams med pa lnga dang / mi dge ba bcu la sogs pa ni nyes par spyod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga dang / mi dge ba bcu la sogs pa ni nyes par spyod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The five heinous actions, the ten non-virtues, and so forth are called ‚Äúmisdeeds.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas par gyur na mtshams med pa lnga dang mi dge ba bcu la sogs pa mi mdzad pa las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las skyob pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas par gyur na mtshams med pa lnga dang mi dge ba bcu la sogs pa mi mdzad pa las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las skyob pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When one becomes a Buddha, one does not commit the five sins with an immediately successive retribution, the ten unwholesome actions, etc.

original: rga dang shi ba dag las kyang //
analyzed: rga dang shi ba dag las kyang //
translated: And from old age and death.

original: zhes bya bas tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las skyob par ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las skyob par ston te /
translated: This shows that one is protected from the defilement of life.

original: 'dir skye ba zhes bya ba smos su zin gyis kyang /
analyzed: 'dir skye ba zhes bya ba smos su zin gyis kyang /
translated: Although birth is mentioned here,

original: ma skyes par rga ba dang 'chi ba mi srid pas skye ba yang don gyi shugs kyis bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ma skyes par rga ba dang 'chi ba mi srid pas skye ba yang don gyi shugs kyis bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: since aging and death are not possible without birth, birth is also implied by the force of the meaning.

original: sangs rgyas par gyur na skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa mi 'byung bas tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang skyob pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas par gyur na skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa mi 'byung bas tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang skyob pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When one becomes a Buddha, birth, aging, sickness, death, etc. do not occur, so one is also protected from the defilement of life. This is the meaning.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni bdag gi skyabs su bdag gyur par ston te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni bdag gi skyabs su bdag gyur par ston te /
translated: This verse shows that one becomes one's own protector.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas pa nyid skyabs yin par ston to //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas pa nyid skyabs yin par ston to //
translated: Therefore, it is shown that the Buddha is the refuge.

original: da ni sangs rgyas na sems gzhan la yang skyabs rnam pa lnga byed pas skyabs bla na med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ni sangs rgyas na sems gzhan la yang skyabs rnam pa lnga byed pas skyabs bla na med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Now, since the Buddha is the refuge in five ways even for other minds, he is the unsurpassed refuge.

original: 'tshe ba dag ni 'tshe ba thams cad dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig smos so //
analyzed: 'tshe ba dag ni 'tshe ba thams cad dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig smos so //
translated: One verse on the protection from all injury, etc.

original: de la 'tshe ba thams cad las skyob pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis long bas ni mig rnyed /üîΩ'on pas ni sgra thos /
analyzed: de la 'tshe ba thams cad las skyob pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis long bas ni mig rnyed / 'on pas ni sgra thos /
translated: Protection from all injury is the protection of the blind, deaf, and insane by the Buddha's blessing.

original: smyon pas ni dran pa rnyed /
analyzed: smyon pas ni dran pa rnyed /
translated: The blind recover their sight, the deaf their hearing, and the insane their reason.

original: nang rnam pa sna tshogs dang lo nyes ni zhi bar byas zhes bya ba la sogs te /
analyzed: nang rnam pa sna tshogs dang lo nyes ni zhi bar byas zhes bya ba la sogs te /
translated: The various internal and external calamities, such as famine, are pacified.

original: 'di ni gzhan gyi skyob pa rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan gyi skyob pa rnam pa gcig go //
translated: This is one kind of protection of others.

original: ngan song dang ni zhes bya bas ngan song las skyob pa ston to /
analyzed: ngan song dang ni zhes bya bas ngan song las skyob pa ston to /
translated: The line from the miserable destinies shows protection from the miserable destinies.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od btang bas /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od btang bas /
translated: And that is by the Buddha's sending forth light.

original: sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa ngan song rnams kyi lus la reg nas ngan song gi sdug bsngal thams cad zhi bar byas te /üîΩmtho ris su @111a * //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa ngan song rnams kyi lus la reg nas ngan song gi sdug bsngal thams cad zhi bar byas te / mtho ris su @111a * //
translated: Having touched the bodies of sentient beings in the lower realms, such as the hells, it pacifies all the suffering of the lower realms.

original: skye bar byas pa dang / ngan song du skye bar 'dod pa rnams la 'od des reg nas ngan song du mi skye bar byas te /
analyzed: skye bar byas pa dang / ngan song du skye bar 'dod pa rnams la 'od des reg nas ngan song du mi skye bar byas te /
translated: Having touched the bodies of those who wish to be reborn in the lower realms, it prevents their rebirth in the lower realms and causes them to be reborn in the higher reams.

original: 'di ni gzhan skyob pa rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan skyob pa rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: This is the twofold protection of others.

original: thabs min dang zhes bya ba thabs ma yin pa las skyob pa bstan te /
analyzed: thabs min dang zhes bya ba thabs ma yin pa las skyob pa bstan te /
translated: Protection from what is not the method is taught by ‚Äúnot the method.‚Äù

original: mu stegs can gyi lta ba rnam ba sna tshogs thal ba la nyal bas thar pa dang mtho ris tshol ba dang / tsher ma na nyal bas thar pa dang mtho ris tshol ba dang brag kha nas mchong bas thar pa dang mtho ris tshol ba dag ni de las thar pa dang mtho ris thob par mi 'gyur bas na thabs ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi lta ba rnam ba sna tshogs thal ba la nyal bas thar pa dang mtho ris tshol ba dang / tsher ma na nyal bas thar pa dang mtho ris tshol ba dang brag kha nas mchong bas thar pa dang mtho ris tshol ba dag ni de las thar pa dang mtho ris thob par mi 'gyur bas na thabs ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The various tƒ´rthika views are called ‚Äúnot the method‚Äù because they do not attain liberation and the higher realms through lying on ashes, seeking liberation and the higher realms by lying on thorns, or seeking liberation and the higher realms by jumping off a cliff.

original: thabs ma yin pa la zhugs pa'i mu stegs pa de dag lam ngan pa dor du bcug nas /
analyzed: thabs ma yin pa la zhugs pa'i mu stegs pa de dag lam ngan pa dor du bcug nas /
translated: Having caused those who have entered into what is not the method, the tƒ´rthikas, to abandon the bad path,

original: mtho ris kyi lam dang / dge ba bcu dang thar pa'i lam 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad la 'god de 'di ni gzhan skyob pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: mtho ris kyi lam dang / dge ba bcu dang thar pa'i lam 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad la 'god de 'di ni gzhan skyob pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: they are established in the path to the higher realms, the ten virtues, and the path to liberation, the eightfold noble path. This is the third type of protection of others.

original: 'jig tshogs ni zhes bya bas 'jig tshogs la skya ba pa ston te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs ni zhes bya bas 'jig tshogs la skya ba pa ston te /
translated: The line ‚Äúthe view of the transitory collection‚Äù teaches the protection from the view of the transitory collection.

original: bdag dang bdag gi med pa'i phung po lnga la bdag dang bdag gir lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i sems can de dag la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos gang zag la bdag med pa bstan nas /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi med pa'i phung po lnga la bdag dang bdag gir lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i sems can de dag la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos gang zag la bdag med pa bstan nas /
translated: Those sentient beings who view the five aggregates, which are devoid of a self and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù as a self and ‚Äúmine‚Äù are taught the Dharma of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, the selflessness of persons.

original: nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod pa ni 'jig tshogs las skyob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod pa ni 'jig tshogs las skyob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Establishing them in the nirvƒÅ·πáa of the ≈õrƒÅvakas is called ‚Äúthe protection from the view of the transitory collection.‚Äù

original: 'di ni gzhan skyob pa rnam pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan skyob pa rnam pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth type of protection of others.

original: theg chung las zhes bya bas theg pa chung du las skyob pa bstan te /
analyzed: theg chung las zhes bya bas theg pa chung du las skyob pa bstan te /
translated: The line ‚Äúfrom the Hƒ´nayƒÅna‚Äù teaches the protection from the Hƒ´nayƒÅna.

original: ma nges pa'i rigs can dag nyan thos kyi theg par zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i rigs can dag nyan thos kyi theg par zhugs pa'am /
translated: Those of unfixed potential who have entered the Listeners' Vehicle orüîΩwish to enter it are turned away from it and established in the Great Vehicle.

original: 'jug du 'dod pa rnams de las bzlog nas theg pa chen po la 'god par byed pa ni theg pa las skyob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jug du 'dod pa rnams de las bzlog nas theg pa chen po la 'god par byed pa ni theg pa las skyob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is the protection from the vehicle.

original: 'di ni gnas gzhan skyob pa rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gnas gzhan skyob pa rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: These are the five kinds of protection from other states.üîΩFor these reasons, he is the supreme refuge.

original: de'i phyir skyabs ni dam pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan la yang skyabs rnam pa lnga byed pas na de'i phyir sangs rgyas su grub pas ni skyabs dam pa skyabs bla na med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyabs ni dam pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan la yang skyabs rnam pa lnga byed pas na de'i phyir sangs rgyas su grub pas ni skyabs dam pa skyabs bla na med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because he also gives five kinds of protection to other sentient beings, the Buddha is the supreme refuge, the unsurpassable refuge.

original: de ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas skyabs de nyid dpe med pa dang / mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyir skyabs pas kyang skyabs bla na med pa yin no zhes gong du tshigs su bcad pa dang po dang gnyis par bstan pa'i don gnyis kyis bla na med pa'i don du bstan @111b pa'i phyir
analyzed: de ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas skyabs de nyid dpe med pa dang / mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyir skyabs pas kyang skyabs bla na med pa yin no zhes gong du tshigs su bcad pa dang po dang gnyis par bstan pa'i don gnyis kyis bla na med pa'i don du bstan @111b pa'i phyir
translated: The verse says,

original: / sangs rgyas skyabs ni dpe med mchog yin te //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig smos so //
analyzed: / sangs rgyas skyabs ni dpe med mchog yin te // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig smos so //
translated: The Buddha‚Äôs refuge is incomparable and supreme.

original: sangs rgyas par gyur ba nyid bdag dang gzhan gyi gnas su gyur pas sangs rgyas kyi skyabs yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas par gyur ba nyid bdag dang gzhan gyi gnas su gyur pas sangs rgyas kyi skyabs yin te /
translated: The Buddha is the refuge because he is the support of self and others.

original: sangs rgyas kyi skyabs dang skyabs 'di gnyis su 'dra'o zhes de dang bstun cing 'dra bar gzhal du rung ba 'jig rten gang na yang med pas na dpe med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi skyabs dang skyabs 'di gnyis su 'dra'o zhes de dang bstun cing 'dra bar gzhal du rung ba 'jig rten gang na yang med pas na dpe med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: There is no other refuge in the world that is comparable to this refuge, that is, to the Buddha, that can be considered equal to it. Therefore, it is said to be incomparable.

original: 'jig rten pa dag ri la sogs pa la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / nyan thos dag mya ngan las 'das pa la skyabs su 'gro ba bas /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dag ri la sogs pa la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / nyan thos dag mya ngan las 'das pa la skyabs su 'gro ba bas /
translated: The disciples go for refuge to nirvana.

original: skyabs 'di dam pa yin pas na mchog ces bya ste /
analyzed: skyabs 'di dam pa yin pas na mchog ces bya ste /
translated: This refuge is the highest, therefore it is called supreme.

original: de'i phyir na skyabs bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na skyabs bla na med pa'o //
translated: Therefore it is the highest refuge.üîΩHow is it the highest?

original: ji ltar na bla na med pa'i phyir skye 'chi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar na bla na med pa'i phyir skye 'chi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it protects from birth and death.

original: sangs rgyas bar gyur na skye 'chi kun las srung bar byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bar gyur na skye 'chi kun las srung bar byed do //
translated: When one becomes a Buddha, one is protected from all birth and death.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sangs rgyas phan chad skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba la sogs pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas phan chad skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba la sogs pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because after Buddhahood, birth, aging, sickness, etc. do not occur.

original: 'dis ni tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs ba las skyob par bstan to //üîΩnyon mongs ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dis ni tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs ba las skyob par bstan to // nyon mongs ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This shows protection from the defilement of life.

original: sangs rgyas par gyur na nyon mongs pa las srung bar byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas par gyur na nyon mongs pa las srung bar byed do //
translated: The defilement of karma is protected from by the Buddha.

original: ngan song kun las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngan song kun las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From all evil destinies.

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las srung bar byed do //
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las srung bar byed do //
translated: This shows protection from the defilement of karma.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sangs rgyas phan chad mtshams med pa lnga dang mi dge ba bcu la sogs pa'i las mi byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas phan chad mtshams med pa lnga dang mi dge ba bcu la sogs pa'i las mi byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because after becoming a Buddha, one does not perform actions such as the five inexpiable sins and the ten unwholesome actions.

original: 'dis ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las skyob pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las skyob pa bstan to //
translated: This shows protection from the defilement of action.

original: tshig de dag gis sangs rgyas nas bdag gi skyabs su bdag 'gyur bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig de dag gis sangs rgyas nas bdag gi skyabs su bdag 'gyur bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Those words show that after becoming a Buddha, one becomes a refuge for oneself.

original: nga sangs rgyas na gzhan gyi skyabs su gyur ba yang yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nga sangs rgyas na gzhan gyi skyabs su gyur ba yang yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that after becoming a Buddha, one also becomes a refuge for others, he says:

original: sna tshogs 'jigs 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sna tshogs 'jigs 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom various fears‚Äù and so on.

original: sangs rgyas 'jigs pa sna tshogs las kyang srung bar byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'jigs pa sna tshogs las kyang srung bar byed /
translated: A Buddha protects from various fears.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthus /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthus /
translated: Because of the power of the Tathagata.

original: long bas mig rnyed pa dang / 'on pas rna bas sgra thos pa la sogs pa bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: long bas mig rnyed pa dang / 'on pas rna bas sgra thos pa la sogs pa bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The blind obtain sight, the deaf hear sounds, and so on.

original: 'jig tshogs thams cad dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs thams cad dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom all the perversions of the perishable aggregates‚Äù means

original: sangs rgyas na 'jig tshogs thams cad las srung bar byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas na 'jig tshogs thams cad las srung bar byed do //
translated: that after becoming a Buddha, one protects from all the perversions of the perishable aggregates.

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩlha dang mi la sogs pa bdag med pa bdag gir chags pa rnams la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa chos gang zag @112a * //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / lha dang mi la sogs pa bdag med pa bdag gir chags pa rnams la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa chos gang zag @112a * //
translated: How is that?

original: la bdag med ba bstan nas mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la bdag med ba bstan nas mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For those who are attached to the self and what belongs to the self, such as gods and humans, who are devoid of self, he teaches the Dharma of the ≈örƒÅvaka and Pratyekabuddha vehicles, and establishes them in nirvƒÅ·πáa, by teaching the selflessness of persons.üîΩFor those who are attached to the self and what belongs to the self, such as gods and humans, who are devoid of self, he teaches the Dharma of the MahƒÅyƒÅna, and establishes them in the great nirvƒÅ·πáa, by teaching the selflessness of dharmas.

original: theg pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: theg pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The vehicle is the means of going.

original: sangs rgyas par gyur na theg pa chung du las srung bar byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas par gyur na theg pa chung du las srung bar byed do //
translated: When one becomes a Buddha, one protects from the lesser vehicle.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams theg pa rnam pa gnyis su zhugs pa dang / 'jug par 'dod pa rnams de las bzlog nas theg pa chen por bkod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams theg pa rnam pa gnyis su zhugs pa dang / 'jug par 'dod pa rnams de las bzlog nas theg pa chen por bkod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For those of undetermined lineage who have entered the two vehicles, and for those who wish to enter, he turns them away from that and establishes them in the MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: rnam mang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam mang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la /
translated: The many kinds of suffering are the sufferings of the hells and so on.

original: sangs rgyas par gyur na sdug bsngal rnam pa mang po las srung bar byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas par gyur na sdug bsngal rnam pa mang po las srung bar byed de /
translated: When one becomes a Buddha, one protects from the many kinds of suffering.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'od bkye ba'i sgo nas sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal zhi bar byas te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'od bkye ba'i sgo nas sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal zhi bar byas te /
translated: By means of the light rays of the TathƒÅgata, the sufferings of the hells and so on are pacified.

original: mtho ris su skye bar byed pa dang / sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ba rnams la 'od kyis reg pas der skye bar mi 'gyur bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtho ris su skye bar byed pa dang / sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ba rnams la 'od kyis reg pas der skye bar mi 'gyur bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the light touches those who are to be born in the higher realms and in the hells, and causes them not to be born there.

original: thabs med song zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thabs med song zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who have gone without means.

original: sangs rgyas na thabs med par song ba rnams srung bar byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas na thabs med par song ba rnams srung bar byed de /
translated: The Buddha protects those who have gone without means to buddhahood.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: thabs med pa ni mu stegs pa thal ba dang tsher ma la sogs pa la nyal ba'i sgo nas thar pa dang / mtho ris tshol bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: thabs med pa ni mu stegs pa thal ba dang tsher ma la sogs pa la nyal ba'i sgo nas thar pa dang / mtho ris tshol bar byed pa ste /
translated: Those without means are the tƒ´rthikas who seek liberation and the higher realms by such means as sleeping in ashes and on thorns.

original: de dag la thar pa'i lam byang chub kyi phyogs ston par byed pa dang / mtho ris kyi lam dge ba bcu ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la thar pa'i lam byang chub kyi phyogs ston par byed pa dang / mtho ris kyi lam dge ba bcu ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha shows them the path to liberation, the factors of awakening, and the path to the higher realms, the ten virtues.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pas ni rgyu gang gis na sangs rgyas su grub pa de skyabs bla na med pa'i rgyu gang yin pa ston te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pas ni rgyu gang gis na sangs rgyas su grub pa de skyabs bla na med pa'i rgyu gang yin pa ston te /
translated: The fourth verse shows the cause by which the Buddha becomes the unsurpassed refuge.

original: skyabs bla na med pa'i rgyu yang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: skyabs bla na med pa'i rgyu yang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The cause of being the unsurpassed refuge is twofold.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: bdag gi don mthar thug pa dang / gzhan gyi don mthar thug pa'o //
