analyzed: bdag gi don mthar thug pa dang / gzhan gyi don mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The ultimate of one's own aim and the ultimate of the aim of others.

original: de ltar bdag dang gzhan gyi don mthar thug pas na rgyu des skyabs bla na med pa'i mthu dang ldan par 'gyur ba ston to //
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang gzhan gyi don mthar thug pas na rgyu des skyabs bla na med pa'i mthu dang ldan par 'gyur ba ston to //
translated: Thus, by the ultimate of one's own aim and the ultimate of the aim of others, it shows that by that cause one becomes a refuge with unsurpassed power.

original: de la bdag gi don mthar thug pa'i dbang du byas nas /üîΩsangs rgyas chos kyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i lus //
analyzed: de la bdag gi don mthar thug pa'i dbang du byas nas / sangs rgyas chos kyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i lus //
translated: Therein, with respect to the ultimate of one's own aim,

original: zhes smos te /üîΩnam sangs rgyas pa'i dus na sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang ldan pa'i chos kyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang /
analyzed: zhes smos te / nam sangs rgyas pa'i dus na sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang ldan pa'i chos kyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang /
translated: it is said:üîΩThe body completely perfected by the qualities of a Buddha.

original: sprul pa'i sku thob ste /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku thob ste /
translated: When one becomes a Buddha, one attains the Dharma Body endowed with the qualities of a Buddha, such as the powers, the fearlessnesses, the proprieties, and the elements that contribute to enlightenment, and one attains the Complete Enjoyment Body and the Transformation Body.

original: de bas na bdag gi don mthar phyin to //
analyzed: de bas na bdag gi don mthar phyin to //
translated: Therefore, one's own aim is fulfilled.

original: gzhan gyi @112b don mthar thug pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi @112b don mthar thug pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The ultimate of the aim of others is also twofold:

original: chos la sems can 'dul bar rig pa dang / snying rje mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: chos la sems can 'dul bar rig pa dang / snying rje mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: 1. He knows how to discipline beings through the Dharma, and 2. he has perfected compassion.

original: dam pa'i chos la sems can 'dul bar rig / ces bya bas chos la sems can 'dul bar rig pa bstan te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la sems can 'dul bar rig / ces bya bas chos la sems can 'dul bar rig pa bstan te /
translated: He knows how to discipline beings through the Dharma shows that he knows how to discipline beings through the Dharma.

original: dam pa'i chos la legs par bshad pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis la sems can 'god cing 'dul bar bya ba'i thabs thugs su chud de /üîΩ'dod chags can la ni /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la legs par bshad pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis la sems can 'god cing 'dul bar bya ba'i thabs thugs su chud de / 'dod chags can la ni /
translated: He knows the means of setting beings in the twelve branches of the excellent speech, the well-explained Dharma, and of disciplining them.

original: mi gtsang ba bstan pas 'dul /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba bstan pas 'dul /
translated: He knows that those with attachment are disciplined by teaching them the impure,

original: zhe sdang can la ni byams pa bstan pas 'dul /
analyzed: zhe sdang can la ni byams pa bstan pas 'dul /
translated: those with aversion are disciplined by teaching them love,

original: gti mug can la ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bstan pas 'dul ba thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gti mug can la ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bstan pas 'dul ba thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and those with confusion are disciplined by teaching them dependent origination.

original: 'dis ni shes rab dang ldan par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni shes rab dang ldan par bstan to //
translated: This shows that he is endowed with wisdom.

original: 'gro ba kun la snying brtses pha rol song //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun la snying brtses pha rol song //
translated: He has gone beyond with compassion for all beings.

original: zhes bya bas /
analyzed: zhes bya bas /
translated: This shows that

original: snying rje mthar phyin pa bstan te /
analyzed: snying rje mthar phyin pa bstan te /
translated: he has perfected compassion.

original: khams gsum pa'i sems can dus gsum gyis bsdus pa skye ba rnam pa bzhi nas skye ba rnams ni 'gro ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i sems can dus gsum gyis bsdus pa skye ba rnam pa bzhi nas skye ba rnams ni 'gro ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The beings of the three realms, included in the three times, who are born in the four modes of birth, are called migrating beings.

original: de dag gi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya'o snyam du sems pa'i snying rje mthar phyin cing yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya'o snyam du sems pa'i snying rje mthar phyin cing yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: The compassion that thinks, I will remove their suffering, is perfected and fulfilled.

original: snying rjes pha rol song zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snying rjes pha rol song zhes bya'o //
translated: Compassion is said to go to the other shore.

original: yang na snying rje'i shugs kyis yon tan thams cad rdzogs par thob pa la snying brtses pha rol song zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na snying rje'i shugs kyis yon tan thams cad rdzogs par thob pa la snying brtses pha rol song zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, compassion is said to go to the other shore through the force of compassion, since all qualities are attained through compassion.

original: yang na sems can la snying rje ba'i mthus mthar thug pa'i gnas sangs rgyas su grub pa'i snying rjes pha rol song zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na sems can la snying rje ba'i mthus mthar thug pa'i gnas sangs rgyas su grub pa'i snying rjes pha rol song zhes bya ste /
translated: Or, compassion is said to go to the other shore through compassion, since through the power of compassion for sentient beings, one attains the ultimate stage of buddhahood.

original: 'dis ni thabs dang ldan pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni thabs dang ldan pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the possession of method.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' thabs dang shes rab dang ni bdag gzhan gnyi ga skyob par nus pa thabs dang shes rab gnyis ni skyabs bla na med pa 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' thabs dang shes rab dang ni bdag gzhan gnyi ga skyob par nus pa thabs dang shes rab gnyis ni skyabs bla na med pa 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva, with method and wisdom, is able to protect both self and other. The two, method and wisdom, are the cause of the arising of the unsurpassed refuge.

original: sangs rgyas de 'dir skyabs kyi mchog tu dgongs //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas de 'dir skyabs kyi mchog tu dgongs // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Buddha is considered here to be the supreme refuge.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas par gyur na bdag gi don yang mthar thug gzhan gyi don yang mthar thug pas na sangs rgyas pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i skyabs gzhan las kyang mchog tu gyur cing bla na med par byed pa yin no zhes bya
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas par gyur na bdag gi don yang mthar thug gzhan gyi don yang mthar thug pas na sangs rgyas pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i skyabs gzhan las kyang mchog tu gyur cing bla na med par byed pa yin no zhes bya
translated: Thus, when one becomes a buddha, one's own purpose is fulfilled and the purpose of others is fulfilled. Therefore, buddhahood is the supreme and unsurpassed refuge, surpassing other mundane and supramundane refuges.

original: ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: tshigs su bcad pa lnga pas ni dus ji srid cig tu sems can gyi skyabs byed pa dang / sems can ji snyed cig gi skyabs byed pa dang / gang gi phyir @113a * //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa lnga pas ni dus ji srid cig tu sems can gyi skyabs byed pa dang / sems can ji snyed cig gi skyabs byed pa dang / gang gi phyir @113a * //
translated: The fifth verse shows for how long a time one acts as a refuge for sentient beings, for how many sentient beings one acts as a refuge, and for what purpose one acts as a refuge.

original: skyabs byed pa de don rnam pa gsum gyis bstan to //
analyzed: skyabs byed pa de don rnam pa gsum gyis bstan to //
translated: The protection is shown in three ways.

original: dus ji srid cig tu sems can gyi skyabs byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dus ji srid cig tu sems can gyi skyabs byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show for how long a time he protects beings,üîΩhe says

original: 'jig rten bar du zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten bar du zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚Äúas long as the world exists.‚Äù

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug pa 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mtha' yang der thug go ;
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug pa 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mtha' yang der thug go ;
translated: The limit of the world-realms is the limit of space.

original: /'jig rten gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa sems can gyi khams kyi mtha' yang der thug go //
analyzed: /'jig rten gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa sems can gyi khams kyi mtha' yang der thug go //
translated: The limit of the world-realms is the limit of the realm of beings.

original: sems can gyi khams kyi mtha' gar thug pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems can gyi skyabs mdzad pa'i mtha' yang der thug go //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams kyi mtha' gar thug pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems can gyi skyabs mdzad pa'i mtha' yang der thug go //
translated: The limit of the realm of beings is the limit of the Buddhas‚Äô protection of beings.

original: don du nam mkha'i khams kyi mtha' yang thug pa med pa de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mtha' la yang thug pa med do //
analyzed: don du nam mkha'i khams kyi mtha' yang thug pa med pa de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mtha' la yang thug pa med do //
translated: In fact, just as the limit of space is limitless, so the limit of the world-realms is limitless.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mtha' la thug pa med pa de bzhin du sems can gyi khams kyi mtha' la yang thug pa med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mtha' la thug pa med pa de bzhin du sems can gyi khams kyi mtha' la yang thug pa med do //
translated: Just as the limit of the world-realms is limitless, so the limit of the realm of beings is limitless.

original: sems can gyi khams kyi mtha' la thug pa med pa bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems can bskyab pa'i mtha' yang thug pa med do //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams kyi mtha' la thug pa med pa bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems can bskyab pa'i mtha' yang thug pa med do //
translated: Just as the realm of sentient beings is limitless, so too the protection of sentient beings by the Blessed Buddhas is limitless.

original: 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du skyabs mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du skyabs mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they act as a refuge for as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: ji snyed cig gi skyabs mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ji snyed cig gi skyabs mdzad ce na /
translated: How many do they act as a refuge for?

original: de'i phyir / 'gro ba kun gyi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'gro ba kun gyi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚Äúof all beings.‚Äù

original: rigs yod pa dang / rigs med pa dang / rigs ma nges pa la sems can kun gyi skyabs mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rigs yod pa dang / rigs med pa dang / rigs ma nges pa la sems can kun gyi skyabs mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they act as a refuge for all sentient beings, whether they have the potential, do not have the potential, or have an undetermined potential.

original: sangs rgyas skyabs ni chen po ste //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas skyabs ni chen po ste //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: The Buddha‚Äôs refuge is the great one.

original: de ltar 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du sems can kun gyi skyabs byed pas na sangs rgyas kyis sems can skyob pa ni 'jig rten pa'i skyabs dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i skyabs pas kyang skyabs mchog tu gyur pa dang / chen por gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du sems can kun gyi skyabs byed pas na sangs rgyas kyis sems can skyob pa ni 'jig rten pa'i skyabs dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i skyabs pas kyang skyabs mchog tu gyur pa dang / chen por gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, since he protects all sentient beings until the end of cyclic existence, the Buddha‚Äôs protection of sentient beings is the highest and greatest protection, compared to the worldly and ≈örƒÅvaka protections.

original: gang gi phyir skyob ce na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyob ce na /
translated: Why does he protect?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / sdug bsngal 'byor pa thams cad ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir / sdug bsngal 'byor pa thams cad ni //
translated: All the sufferings of sentient beingsüîΩare to be eliminated, and all their excellences

original: bzlog pa dang ni 'phel bar rig / ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bzlog pa dang ni 'phel bar rig / ces bya ba smos te /
translated: are to be increased.

original: sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal skye rga na 'chi la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal bzlog par bya ba dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'byor pa thams cad 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir skyabs mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal skye rga na 'chi la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal bzlog par bya ba dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'byor pa thams cad 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir skyabs mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He protects in order to eliminate the sufferings of sentient beings, such as birth, old age, sickness, death, etc., and in order to increase all their mundane and supramundane excellences.

original: gnas yongs su gyur pa'i tshigs su bcad pa drug ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas yongs su gyur pa'i tshigs su bcad pa drug ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Six verses on the transformation of the basis.

original: skyabs bla @113b na med pa'i don bstan nas /
analyzed: skyabs bla @113b na med pa'i don bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the meaning of the unsurpassed refuge,

original: da ni gnas yongs su gyur pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa drug rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: da ni gnas yongs su gyur pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa drug rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: now, in order to teach the meaning of the transformation of the basis, he composes six verses. This is the meaning.

original: de la gnas zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du phung po lnga la bya ste /
analyzed: de la gnas zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du phung po lnga la bya ste /
translated: Therein, basis refers to the five aggregates from the form aggregate up to consciousness.

original: phung po de dag la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ; shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs nas chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag par gyur pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes su gyur pa la gnas gzhan du gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phung po de dag la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ; shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs nas chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag par gyur pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes su gyur pa la gnas gzhan du gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having abandoned the afflictions and the obscurations to knowledge that exist in those aggregates, the transformation of the basis is called the purification of the dharmadhatu and the attainment of nonconceptual wisdom.

original: de la gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed de phung po bzhi dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po las mig gi rnam par shes pa nas nyon mongs pa'i yid kyi bar du dag na chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed de phung po bzhi dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po las mig gi rnam par shes pa nas nyon mongs pa'i yid kyi bar du dag na chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therein, when the four aggregates of form, feeling, perception, and mental formations, and the aggregate of consciousness, from the eye consciousness up to the afflicted mental consciousness, are purified, the dharmadhatu becomes purified.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dag na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dag na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes su 'gyur ro //
translated: In the storehouse consciousness, it is nonconceptual wisdom.

original: yang na gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dag dang / rnam par shes pa brgyad la yod pa'i stong pa nyid dag na chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dag dang / rnam par shes pa brgyad la yod pa'i stong pa nyid dag na chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Alternatively, in the emptiness of the eight kinds of form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, the completely pure expanse of reality is present.

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad las kun gzhi dag na me long lta bu'i ye shes su gyur to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad las kun gzhi dag na me long lta bu'i ye shes su gyur to //
translated: In the storehouse consciousness, which is one of the eight kinds of consciousness, it is mirror-like wisdom.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid dag na mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid dag na mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes su 'gyur ro //
translated: In the afflicted mind, it is the wisdom of equality.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag na so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag na so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes su 'gyur ro //
translated: In the mental consciousness, it is the wisdom of individual realization.

original: mig nas lus kyi bar du rnam par shes pa lnga dag na bya ba grub pa'i ye shes su 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig nas lus kyi bar du rnam par shes pa lnga dag na bya ba grub pa'i ye shes su 'gyur te /
translated: In the five consciousnesses of the eye, etc., it is the wisdom of accomplishment.

original: ye shes bzhi dang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa lnga thob pa la gnas gzhan du gyur pa lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes bzhi dang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa lnga thob pa la gnas gzhan du gyur pa lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: The attainment of these four wisdoms and the completely pure expanse of reality is called the ‚Äúfive states of transformation.‚Äù

original: gnas gzhan du gyur pa la tshigs su bcad pa drug gis bstan pa la tshigs su bcad pa dang po'i bsdus pa'i don ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sa bon dang bral pa dang / gnyen po'i phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas gnas gzhan du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gnas gzhan du gyur pa la tshigs su bcad pa drug gis bstan pa la tshigs su bcad pa dang po'i bsdus pa'i don ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sa bon dang bral pa dang / gnyen po'i phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas gnas gzhan du gyur pa ste /
translated: The transformation of the basis is shown in six verses. The condensed meaning of the first verse is that the transformation of the basis is due to being free from the seeds of the counteragents and possessing the abundance of the antidotes.

original: mdor na don de bstan to //
analyzed: mdor na don de bstan to //
translated: In brief, that meaning is taught.

original: nyon mongs shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon dus ring rtag ldan pa //
analyzed: nyon mongs shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon dus ring rtag ldan pa //
translated: The seeds of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, which have always been possessed for a long time,

original: zhes bya ba dang / gang la byang 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis su sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / gang la byang 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis su sbyar te /
translated: are connected with the two phrases ‚Äúin regard to what‚Äù and ‚Äúin what way.‚Äù

original: sa bon ni bag chags la bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon ni bag chags la bya'o //
translated: Seeds should be understood as predispositions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i sa bon ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i bag chags so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i sa bon ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i bag chags so //
translated: The seeds of the afflictive obstructions are the predispositions of the afflictive obstructions.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag @114a * //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag @114a * //
translated: The seeds of the obstructions to omniscience are the predispositions of the obstructions to omniscience.

original: chags so // dus ring zhes bya ba ni bag chags de dag kyang 'khor ba thog ma med pa'i dus nas bsags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chags so // dus ring zhes bya ba ni bag chags de dag kyang 'khor ba thog ma med pa'i dus nas bsags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúFor a long time‚Äù means that those predispositions have been accumulated since beginningless cyclic existence.

original: rtag ldan zhes bya ba ni bag chags de dag kyang sngon so so'i skye bo'i dus na 'ga' yang 'phags pa'i lam gyis ma spangs ma bcom zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag ldan zhes bya ba ni bag chags de dag kyang sngon so so'i skye bo'i dus na 'ga' yang 'phags pa'i lam gyis ma spangs ma bcom zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúAlways‚Äù means that those predispositions were not abandoned or destroyed by the ƒÅrya path at any time in the past when one was an ordinary being.

original: 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sa bon dang bral ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sa bon dang bral ba bstan to //
translated: This shows that they are free from the seeds of the counteragents.

original: bag chags de dag gnyen po gang gis spangs she na /üîΩde'i phyir / spong ba rgya che rnam pa kun gyis byang gyur pa //
analyzed: bag chags de dag gnyen po gang gis spangs she na / de'i phyir / spong ba rgya che rnam pa kun gyis byang gyur pa //
translated: By what antidote are those predispositions abandoned?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúThey are purified by the complete abandonment of the extensive afflictions.üîΩ‚Äù

original: spong ba zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: spong ba zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: This shows the abandonment.

original: de dag ji ltar spong bar byed ce na zhes bya ba ston te /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar spong bar byed ce na zhes bya ba ston te /
translated: How do they abandon them?

original: rgya che ba zhes bya ba ni sa dang po nas sa bcu pa man chad kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi lam la rgya che ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgya che ba zhes bya ba ni sa dang po nas sa bcu pa man chad kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi lam la rgya che ba zhes bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúExtensive‚Äù refers to the path of transcendent wisdom from the first to the tenth bodhisattva stages.

original: ye shes des spong bar byed ces byas ba'i don to //
analyzed: ye shes des spong bar byed ces byas ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is by means of that intuition that one is purified.

original: rnam pa kun gyis zhes bya ba ni sa re re la yang ye shes chen po'i chen po la sogs pa dgu dgu yod pas spong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa kun gyis zhes bya ba ni sa re re la yang ye shes chen po'i chen po la sogs pa dgu dgu yod pas spong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In every way means that one is purified by means of the ninefold great of the great, etc., intuition on each of the ten spiritual levels.

original: gang la byang 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ye shes de dag gi gnyen po byas nas gang gi sems la nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa byang bar gyur na gnas gzhan du gyur pa thob par 'gyur na zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: gang la byang 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ye shes de dag gi gnyen po byas nas gang gi sems la nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa byang bar gyur na gnas gzhan du gyur pa thob par 'gyur na zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The meaning is that when the mind is purified of the addictive and objective obscurations by the antidotes of those intuitions, one attains the transmutation of the basis.

original: /'dis ni gnyen po phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa bstan to //
analyzed: /'dis ni gnyen po phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of the antidote.

original: gnas gyur thob pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas gyur thob pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Attaining the transmutation of the basis,

original: de ltar sgrib pa gnyis spangs pas ye shes bzhi dang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa lnga thob pa ni gnas gyur pa thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sgrib pa gnyis spangs pas ye shes bzhi dang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa lnga thob pa ni gnas gyur pa thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: thus, the attainment of the four intuitions and the five aspects of the pure reality realm through the abandonment of the two obscurations is called the attainment of the transmutation of the basis.

original: sangs rgyas dkar po'i chos mchog yon tan ldan //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkar po'i chos mchog yon tan ldan //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: Endowed with the supreme qualities of the pure buddha qualities,

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi sar chos lnga thob pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa rnyed par 'gyur bas na dkar po'i chos mchog gi yon tan ldan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi sar chos lnga thob pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa rnyed par 'gyur bas na dkar po'i chos mchog gi yon tan ldan zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, on the level of buddhahood, one acquires the five qualities and the abundant excellent qualities of the strengths, fearlessnesses, and distinctive qualities.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa la yon tan de med pas na mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa la yon tan de med pas na mchog ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúendowed with the excellent qualities of the supreme virtuous practice,‚Äù because the listeners and so forth do not have those excellent qualities.üîΩIt was explained above that the elimination of the two obscurations is brought about by the supramundane path.

original: gong du sgrib pa gnyis spong bar byed pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi lam gyis spang ngo zhes bshad pa la ye shes kyi gnyis yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gong du sgrib pa gnyis spong bar byed pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi lam gyis spang ngo zhes bshad pa la ye shes kyi gnyis yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there are two kinds of supramundane gnosis, it is said:üîΩNonconceptual gnosis is the path,

original: rnam par mi rtog ye shes lam dag de thob @114b phyir ;üîΩ/ zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ye shes lam dag de thob @114b phyir ;üîΩ/ zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: for attaining that.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi lam thob ba dang / de'i phyis nas thob par shes bya mtha' dag yul du gyur ba'i dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyi lam thob pas lam de gnyis kyi sgrib ba gnyis ma lus par spangs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi lam thob ba dang / de'i phyis nas thob par shes bya mtha' dag yul du gyur ba'i dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyi lam thob pas lam de gnyis kyi sgrib ba gnyis ma lus par spangs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By these two paths, one abandons all of the two obstructions.

original: de la shin tu rnam par dag pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis chos thams cad nam mkha'i ngos bzhin du stong par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de la shin tu rnam par dag pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis chos thams cad nam mkha'i ngos bzhin du stong par mthong ngo //
translated: With the extremely pure nonconceptual exalted wisdom, one sees all phenomena as empty like the face of the sky.

original: de'i phyis nas thob pa shes bya mtha' yas pa yul du gyur pa /
analyzed: de'i phyis nas thob pa shes bya mtha' yas pa yul du gyur pa /
translated: After that, with the pure mundane exalted wisdom whose object is the limitless objects of knowledge,

original: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis ni dus gsum gyis bsdus pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dngos po thams cad sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bur mthong ngo //
analyzed: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis ni dus gsum gyis bsdus pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dngos po thams cad sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bur mthong ngo //
translated: one sees all the things of the world included in the three times as like illusions and mirages.

original: da ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la yang gnas gzhan du gyur ba yod mod kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas gzhan du gyur pa ni de dag las kyang 'phags shing khyad zhugs par ston to //
analyzed: da ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la yang gnas gzhan du gyur ba yod mod kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas gzhan du gyur pa ni de dag las kyang 'phags shing khyad zhugs par ston to //
translated: Now, in two verses, he shows that although the disciples and hermit buddhas also have a transmutation of the life-basis, the transmutation of the life-basis of the TathƒÅgata is superior to theirs and distinguished by its excellence.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa de ni der bzhugs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig smos so //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa de ni der bzhugs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says one verse: ‚ÄúThus, the TathƒÅgata, having entered that state. . . ‚Äù

original: de la chos kyi dbyings ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du thugs su chud pas de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la chos kyi dbyings ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du thugs su chud pas de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therein, he is called the TathƒÅgata because he has realized reality just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa der zhugs zhes bya ba ni gnas gzhan du gyur pa'i zag pa med pa'i dbyings de brnyes thugs su chud nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa der zhugs zhes bya ba ni gnas gzhan du gyur pa'i zag pa med pa'i dbyings de brnyes thugs su chud nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving entered that state‚Äù means having attained and realized that untainted realm, which is the transmutation of the life-basis.

original: ri dbang mtho steng bzhugs bzhin 'gro la gzigs //
analyzed: ri dbang mtho steng bzhugs bzhin 'gro la gzigs //
translated: He is like the lord of mountains, seated above all, beholding all.

original: zhes bya ba ni ri'i dbang po ni ri rab ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ri'i dbang po ni ri rab ste /
translated: The lord of mountains is Mount Sumeru.

original: sems can la la zhig ri rab kyi steng na gnas nas phyogs bcur bltas na nye ba yang mthong ngo //
analyzed: sems can la la zhig ri rab kyi steng na gnas nas phyogs bcur bltas na nye ba yang mthong ngo //
translated: Some sentient beings, dwelling on top of Mount Meru, see the ten directions as near.

original: ring ba yang mthong /
analyzed: ring ba yang mthong /
translated: They see the far,

original: bzang ba yang mthong /
analyzed: bzang ba yang mthong /
translated: they see the good,üîΩthey see the bad.

original: ngan pa yang mthong ba de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi gnas gzhan du gyur pa las 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas gzhan du gyur pa mthon po de brnyes nas /
analyzed: ngan pa yang mthong ba de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi gnas gzhan du gyur pa las 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas gzhan du gyur pa mthon po de brnyes nas /
translated: In the same way, the Tathagatas, having attained the exalted state of the Tathagata, which is a transformation of the state of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas,

original: thugs rje chen pos sems can thams cad la gzigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thugs rje chen pos sems can thams cad la gzigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: look with great compassion on all sentient beings.

original: zhi bar mngon dga'i 'gro la'ang thugs rje can //
analyzed: zhi bar mngon dga'i 'gro la'ang thugs rje can //
translated: The compassionate one looks with compassion on those who delight in peace,

original: srid la mngon dga'i 'gro la ci zhig smos //
analyzed: srid la mngon dga'i 'gro la ci zhig smos //
translated: how much more so on those who delight in existence.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here it is said:

original: de ltar thugs rjes kun la @115a * //
analyzed: de ltar thugs rjes kun la @115a * //
translated: Thus, with compassion, he is the protector of all.

original: gzigs nas nyan thos snying rje chen po med pas sems can gyi don spangs te bdag 'ba' zhig gi don du zhi ba mya ngan las 'das par zhugs pa de dag 'khor ba thob ma med pa nas nye bar gnyen du gyur pa'i sems can gyi don maüîΩbyas pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ma thob bo zhes de dag la yang thugs rje dgongs nas sems can phal pa 'jig rten gyi khams chos la mngon par dga' ba bdag gi don tsam yang byed mi nus pa sdug bsngal rnam pa
analyzed: gzigs nas nyan thos snying rje chen po med pas sems can gyi don spangs te bdag 'ba' zhig gi don du zhi ba mya ngan las 'das par zhugs pa de dag 'khor ba thob ma med pa nas nye bar gnyen du gyur pa'i sems can gyi don ma byas pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ma thob bo zhes de dag la yang thugs rje dgongs nas sems can phal pa 'jig rten gyi khams chos la mngon par dga' ba bdag gi don tsam yang byed mi nus pa sdug bsngal rnam pa
translated: Having seen this, he thought, ‚ÄúThe ≈õrƒÅvakas, who lack great compassion, have abandoned the welfare of sentient beings and entered into the peace of nirvana for their own sake alone. They have not benefited sentient beings, who have been their close friends since beginningless cyclic existence,üîΩand they have not attained the omniscient wisdom that eliminates the cognitive obstructions.‚Äù

original: mang pos rtag tu gzir cing 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan gyis 'khor ba'i sems can rnams la thugs brtse bar gyur pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: mang pos rtag tu gzir cing 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan gyis 'khor ba'i sems can rnams la thugs brtse bar gyur pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: Having reflected on this, he thought, ‚ÄúWhat need is there to mention my compassion for ordinary sentient beings, who are unable to accomplish even their own welfare in the world realm of SahƒÅ, who are constantly tormented by many kinds of suffering, and who are attached to the five sense pleasures and wander in cyclic existence?

original: thugs rje 'byung zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thugs rje 'byung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúarisen from compassion‚Äù is this.

original: khyad par ring ba'i 'jig rten ngan pa rnams la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khyad par ring ba'i 'jig rten ngan pa rnams la zhes bya ba la /
translated: In particular, the inferior worlds are far away.

original: khyad par ring ba'i 'jig rten ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams de bzhin gshegs pa dang gnyis kyi bar na yon tan khyad zhugs par 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par ring ba'i 'jig rten ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams de bzhin gshegs pa dang gnyis kyi bar na yon tan khyad zhugs par 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inferior worlds are the worlds of the disciples and the Solitary Buddhas, because they are far away from the Tathagata, and because they are inferior in their excellence of qualities.

original: 'jig rten ngan pa ni so so skye bo rnams te /
analyzed: 'jig rten ngan pa ni so so skye bo rnams te /
translated: The inferior worlds are the worlds of the ordinary men,

original: 'khor ba las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are far away from the transcendence of suffering.

original: da ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas gnas gzhan du gyur pa ni yon tan phyen du yod pa'i yon tan gyi rab tu dbye ba ston to //
analyzed: da ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas gnas gzhan du gyur pa ni yon tan phyen du yod pa'i yon tan gyi rab tu dbye ba ston to //
translated: Now, in the third verse, the author teaches the differentiation of the qualities which are the possession of the transformation of the basis.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,üîΩhe says one verse, beginning with:

original: 'jug dang rab 'jug mi 'jug gnas mi 'jug / ces bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig smos so //
analyzed: 'jug dang rab 'jug mi 'jug gnas mi 'jug / ces bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig smos so //
translated: The engagement, the full engagement, the non-engagement, the non-abiding engagement,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas gzhan du gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas gzhan du gyur pa ni /
translated: The transformation of the basis of the Tathagata

original: rtag tu'ang sems can gyi don 'ba' zhig mdzad de gzhan gyi don du 'jug pas na 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag tu'ang sems can gyi don 'ba' zhig mdzad de gzhan gyi don du 'jug pas na 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: is always engaged in the sole benefit of sentient beings, because it is engaged in the benefit of others.

original: gnas gzhan du gyur pa de chos thams cad kyi mchog yin te /
analyzed: gnas gzhan du gyur pa de chos thams cad kyi mchog yin te /
translated: That transformation of the basis is the supreme of all dharmas.

original: mchog tu 'jug pas na rab tu 'jug ces bya ste /
analyzed: mchog tu 'jug pas na rab tu 'jug ces bya ste /
translated: It is called ‚Äúsupreme engagement‚Äù because it engages the supreme.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos thams cad bas kyang mchog tu gyur la nyan thos pa 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams kyi gnas gzhan du gyur pa bas kyang mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos thams cad bas kyang mchog tu gyur la nyan thos pa 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams kyi gnas gzhan du gyur pa bas kyang mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the supreme of all mundane dharmas and it is the supreme of the supramundane dharmas of the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: gnas mi 'jug ces bya ba la gnas ni gnas gzhan du gyur pa la bya ste /
analyzed: gnas mi 'jug ces bya ba la gnas ni gnas gzhan du gyur pa la bya ste /
translated: It is called ‚Äúnonengagement with the basis‚Äù because it does not engage the basis.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rnam pa gsum la mi 'jug pas na gnas mi 'jug ces bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rnam pa gsum la mi 'jug pas na gnas mi 'jug ces bya'o //
translated: The basis is the transformation of the basis. It is called ‚Äúnonengagement with the basis‚Äù because it does not engage the three causes of affliction.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rnam pa gsum ni yul nye bar gyur pa @115b dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa la yid la byed pa dang / bag la nyal ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rnam pa gsum ni yul nye bar gyur pa @115b dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa la yid la byed pa dang / bag la nyal ma spangs pa'o //
translated: The three causes of affliction are the object that is present, incorrect mental attention, and the nonabandonment of latent propensities.

original: ldog dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ldog dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is called ‚Äúcessation‚Äù because it ceases.

original: gnas gzhan du gyur pa de kun nas nyon mongs ba rnams la yang mi 'jug / sdig pa mi dge ba rnams la yang mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: gnas gzhan du gyur pa de kun nas nyon mongs ba rnams la yang mi 'jug / sdig pa mi dge ba rnams la yang mi 'jug ste /
translated: That transformation of the basis is also the entry into the afflictions and the entry into evil and unwholesome states.

original: bdag spyod pa la log pas na ldog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag spyod pa la log pas na ldog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the ‚Äúreversal‚Äù because it reverses the conduct of the self.

original: kun la 'jug ces bya ba la /
analyzed: kun la 'jug ces bya ba la /
translated: The entry into all is as follows.

original: dus kun du 'jug bas na kun 'jug ste /
analyzed: dus kun du 'jug bas na kun 'jug ste /
translated: It is the entry into all because it enters all the time.

original: lan cig gnas gzhan du gyur pa thob nas 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du yang nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lan cig gnas gzhan du gyur pa thob nas 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du yang nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Having attained the transformation of the basis just once, it does not degenerate until the end of sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i chos kun la yang 'jug pas na kun 'jug ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i chos kun la yang 'jug pas na kun 'jug ces bya'o //
translated: Or it is called the entry into all because it enters all the dharmas that are the antidotes to the afflictions.

original: gnyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: The entry into two is as follows.

original: dang po nyid du mngon par byang chub pa ston pa la 'jug / mjug tu mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: dang po nyid du mngon par byang chub pa ston pa la 'jug / mjug tu mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa la 'jug ste /
translated: It is the entry into the demonstration of manifest enlightenment at the beginning and the entry into the demonstration of nirvƒÅ·πáa at the end.

original: rnam pa gnyis ston pa la 'jug pas na gnyis 'jug ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ston pa la 'jug pas na gnyis 'jug ces bya'o //
translated: It is called the entry into two because it enters the demonstration of those two.üîΩThe entry into nonduality is as follows.

original: mi gnyis zhes bya ba la don du gnyis su mi 'jug ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi gnyis zhes bya ba la don du gnyis su mi 'jug ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the entry into nonduality because it does not enter duality.

original: gnyis su mi 'jug pa ni 'khor bar yang mi 'jug / mya ngan las 'das par yang mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su mi 'jug pa ni 'khor bar yang mi 'jug / mya ngan las 'das par yang mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-entry into duality means non-entry into cyclic existence and non-entry into nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de la shes rab dang ldan pas 'dus byas kyi mtha' spangs pa'i phyir 'khor bar mi 'jug go //
analyzed: de la shes rab dang ldan pas 'dus byas kyi mtha' spangs pa'i phyir 'khor bar mi 'jug go //
translated: Therein, because of possessing wisdom, one does not enter cyclic existence because of abandoning the extremes of conditioned states.

original: snying rjes 'dus ma byas spangs pas na mya ngan las 'das par yang mi 'jug go //
analyzed: snying rjes 'dus ma byas spangs pas na mya ngan las 'das par yang mi 'jug go //
translated: And because of compassion, one does not enter nirvƒÅ·πáa because of abandoning the unconditioned.

original: mnyam dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mnyam dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúEquality‚Äù means

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i rnam par grol ba la ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas su tha dad pa med pas na mnyam du 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i rnam par grol ba la ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas su tha dad pa med pas na mnyam du 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: that there is no difference between the disciples, the solitary sages, and the buddhas in terms of the liberation that is the abandonment of all the afflictions. Therefore, it is called ‚Äúentry into equality.‚Äù

original: bye brag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: bye brag ces bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúDistinction‚Äù means

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyis ni nyin thos kyi gnas gzhan du gyur pa bas 'phags pas bye brag tu 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyis ni nyin thos kyi gnas gzhan du gyur pa bas 'phags pas bye brag tu 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: that the buddhas are superior to the disciples and solitary sages in terms of the transmutation of the basis, because of the abandonment of the obstructions to omniscience and because of the qualities such as the powers and the fearlessnesses. Therefore, it is called ‚Äúentry into distinction.‚Äù

original: kun 'gro nyid ces bya ba la sogs sems can rnams la theg pa rnam pa gsum kun 'gro 'jug ces bya'o //üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa yongs su gyur pa 'dod //
analyzed: kun 'gro nyid ces bya ba la sogs sems can rnams la theg pa rnam pa gsum kun 'gro 'jug ces bya'o // de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su gyur pa 'dod //
translated: The universal vehicle is the transformation of the transcendent lords.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: This is the meaning of the above verse.üîΩThe universal vehicle is the transformation of the transcendent lords, and is endowed with the special qualities explained above.üîΩIt is the universal practice of all beings because it is the universal practice of the universal vehicle.üîΩThe universal vehicle is the universal practice of all beings because it is the universal practice of the universal vehicle.üîΩIt is the universal practice of all beings because it is the universal practice of the universal vehicle.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas gzhan du gyur pa gong du bshad pa'i yon tan gyi bye brag dang ldan par 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas gzhan du gyur pa gong du bshad pa'i yon tan gyi bye brag dang ldan par 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the universal practice of all beings because it is the universal practice of the universal vehicle.

translated: It is the universal practice of all beings because it is the universal practice of the universal vehicle.üîΩIt is the universal practice of all beings because it is the universal practice of the universal vehicle.üîΩIt is the universal practice of all beings because it is the universal practice of the universal vehicle.üîΩIt is the universal practice of all beings because it is the universal practice of the universal vehicle.üîΩIt is the universal practice of all beings because it is the universal practice of the universal vehicle.üîΩIt is the universal practice of all beings because it is the universal practice of the universal vehicle.üîΩIt is the universal practice of all beings because it is the universal practice of the universal vehicle.üîΩIt is the universal practice of all beings because it is the universal practice of the universal vehicle.üîΩIt is the universal practice of all beings because it is the universal practice of the universal vehicle.üîΩIt is the universal practice of all beings because it is the universal practice of the universal vehicle.üîΩIt is the universal practice of all beings because it is the universal practice of the universal vehicle.üîΩIt is the universal practice of all beings because it is the universal practice of the universal vehicle.üîΩIt is the universal practice of all beings because it is the universal practice of the universal vehicle.üîΩIt is the universal practice of all beings because it is the universal practice of the universal vehicle.üîΩIt is the universal practice of all beings because it is the universal practice of the universal vehicle.üîΩIt is the universal practice of all beings because it is the universal practice of the universal vehicle.üîΩIt is the universal practice of all beings because it is the universal practice of the universal vehicle.

original: de bas na gnyen po'i chos thams cad la 'jug pa'i rgya cher 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gnyen po'i chos thams cad la 'jug pa'i rgya cher 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the universal practice of all beings because it is the universal practice of the universal vehicle.üîΩIt is the universal practice of all beings because

original: tshigs su bcad ba bzhi pas ni snga ma'i phyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin kun du song ba'i don mdor bstan /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad ba bzhi pas ni snga ma'i phyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin kun du song ba'i don mdor bstan /
translated: The fourth verse briefly teaches the meaning of the former half, the omnipresence of the nature of the Buddha.

original: phyi ma'i phyed kyis ni don de nyid bzlas te rgya cher bshad pa'i sgo nas kun du 'gro ba'i don nam mkha' dang mthun pas sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin kun du song ste khyab par ston te /
analyzed: phyi ma'i phyed kyis ni don de nyid bzlas te rgya cher bshad pa'i sgo nas kun du 'gro ba'i don nam mkha' dang mthun pas sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin kun du song ste khyab par ston te /
translated: The latter half repeats the meaning of that and teaches the meaning of omnipresence by way of extensive explanation, teaching that the nature of the Buddha pervades, being omnipresent like space.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore:

original: ji ltar nam mkha' rtag tu kun song 'dod //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' rtag tu kun song 'dod //
translated: Just as space is asserted to be omnipresent at all times,

original: de bzhin de yang rtag tu kun song 'dod //
analyzed: de bzhin de yang rtag tu kun song 'dod //
translated: so too is that asserted to be omnipresent at all times.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: And so on.

original: dper na nam mkha' 'di dus gsum du'ang bum ba dang snam bu la sogs pa dngos po kun du 'gro bar 'dod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' 'di dus gsum du'ang bum ba dang snam bu la sogs pa dngos po kun du 'gro bar 'dod pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as space is asserted to be omnipresent in all things, such as pots and cloth, at all times,

original: chos kyi dbyings zag pa med pa de'ang sems can kun gyi sems kyi rgyud la yod pa dang khyab par 'dod de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings zag pa med pa de'ang sems can kun gyi sems kyi rgyud la yod pa dang khyab par 'dod de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: so too the uncontaminated expanse of reality is asserted to be present in and pervade the mind streams of all sentient beings.

original: 'dir ni kun du khyab pa'i don mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni kun du khyab pa'i don mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, the meaning of ‚Äúpervasiveness‚Äù is taught in brief.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' rtag tu kun song 'dod //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' rtag tu kun song 'dod //
translated: Just as space is always considered to be omnipresent,

original: ces bya ba'i don de nyid rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i don de nyid rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the meaning of that very statement in detail, it says:

original: ji ltar nam mkha' gzugs yul kun du song //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' gzugs yul kun du song // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Just as space is omnipresent in the domain of form,

original: dper na nam mkha' 'di gzugs kyi rnam pa ring po dang / thung du dang / dkar po dang / dmar bo la sogs pa kun la khyab pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' 'di gzugs kyi rnam pa ring po dang / thung du dang / dkar po dang / dmar bo la sogs pa kun la khyab pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as space pervades all aspects of form, such as long and short, white and red,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis kyang kun la khyab bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis kyang kun la khyab bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: in the same way, the dharmadhƒÅtu pervades all.

original: de bzhin de yang rtag tu kun song 'dod //
analyzed: de bzhin de yang rtag tu kun song 'dod //
translated: Just as space is always considered to be omnipresent,

original: ces bya ba'i don de nyid rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩde bzhin de yang sems can tshogs kun song //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i don de nyid rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir / de bzhin de yang sems can tshogs kun song //
translated: in order to teach the meaning of that very statement in detail, it says:

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In the same way, it is considered to be omnipresent in the assemblies of sentient beings.

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra bar zag pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings des kyang sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud la khyab po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra bar zag pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings des kyang sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud la khyab po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the uncontaminated realm of phenomena, which is like space, pervades the mindstreams of all sentient beings.üîΩThe complete transformation of all sentient beings into one‚Äôs own nature should be understood in relation to the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas la sems can thams cad bdag nyid du nye bar 'gro ba yongs su rdzogs pa las rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sems can gyi tshogs kun song ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sems can thams cad bdag nyid du nye bar 'gro ba yongs su rdzogs pa las rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sems can gyi tshogs kun song ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the entire collection of sentient beings has gone to the buddhas.

original: sangs @116b rgyas ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: sangs @116b rgyas ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin la /
translated: The buddhas have the realm of phenomena as their nature.

original: sa dang por chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid rtog pa na bdag dang sems can du sems mnyam pa nyid thob pa dang / bdag gang yin pa sems can yang de yin la /
analyzed: sa dang por chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid rtog pa na bdag dang sems can du sems mnyam pa nyid thob pa dang / bdag gang yin pa sems can yang de yin la /
translated: When they realize on the first bodhisattva stage that the realm of phenomena is omnipresent, they attain the sameness of mind in regard to self and sentient beings, and they understand that whatever is a self is also a sentient being,

original: sems can gang yin pa bdag kyang de yin no zhes khong du chud do //
analyzed: sems can gang yin pa bdag kyang de yin no zhes khong du chud do //
translated: and whatever is a sentient being is also a self.

original: mnyam pa nyid khong du chud pa des bcu rim gyis bsgoms nas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i dus na sems can thams cad dang bdag nyid khong du chud pa yongs su rdzogs pa sems can gyi tshogs thams cad du song zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid khong du chud pa des bcu rim gyis bsgoms nas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i dus na sems can thams cad dang bdag nyid khong du chud pa yongs su rdzogs pa sems can gyi tshogs thams cad du song zhes bya'o //
translated: By cultivating that realization of sameness gradually, at the time of the buddha stage, the complete realization of all sentient beings and oneself is called ‚Äúgone to the totality of sentient beings.‚Äù

original: nye bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i don ni mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nye bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i don ni mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúapproaching‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúrealizing sameness.‚Äù

original: brgal ba / gal te chos kyi dbyings de rtag tu yod la sems can kun la yang khyab na sems can rnams kyis ci'i phyir chos kyi dbyings ma rtogs shing sangs rgyas ma mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: brgal ba / gal te chos kyi dbyings de rtag tu yod la sems can kun la yang khyab na sems can rnams kyis ci'i phyir chos kyi dbyings ma rtogs shing sangs rgyas ma mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: Objection: If the dharma-dhƒÅtu always exists and pervades all sentient beings, why don‚Äôt sentient beings realize the dharma-dhƒÅtu and see buddhahood?

original: da'i lan du tshigs su bcad pa lnga pa rtsom ste /
analyzed: da'i lan du tshigs su bcad pa lnga pa rtsom ste /
translated: In response to that, the fifth verse is begun.

original: tshigs su bcad pa lnga pa'i bsdus pa'i don ni chos kyi dbyings de thams cad du song yang snod du ma gyur pa'i sems can rnams kyis sangs rgyas mi mthong bar dpe dang bcas par ston te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa lnga pa'i bsdus pa'i don ni chos kyi dbyings de thams cad du song yang snod du ma gyur pa'i sems can rnams kyis sangs rgyas mi mthong bar dpe dang bcas par ston te /
translated: The summarized meaning of the fifth verse is that, although the expanse of reality is omnipresent, sentient beings who are not fit vessels do not see the Buddha, as is illustrated by an example.

original: dpe bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩji ltar chu yi snod chag na //
analyzed: dpe bstan pa'i phyir / ji ltar chu yi snod chag na //
translated: In order to teach the example, it says:üîΩJust as the reflection of the moon

original: zla ba'i gzugs brnyan mi snang bzhin ;üîΩ/ zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zla ba'i gzugs brnyan mi snang bzhin ; / zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: does not appear in a broken water pot.

original: dper na chu med pa'i snod du yang zla ba'i gzugs brnyan mi 'byung la snod chag pa'i nang du yang zla ba'i gzugs brnyan mi 'byung ste 'di ni dpe'o //
analyzed: dper na chu med pa'i snod du yang zla ba'i gzugs brnyan mi 'byung la snod chag pa'i nang du yang zla ba'i gzugs brnyan mi 'byung ste 'di ni dpe'o //
translated: For example, the reflection of the moon does not appear in a pot without water, nor does it appear in a broken pot. This is the example.

original: don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning, it says:

original: de bzhin sems can ngan pa la //
analyzed: de bzhin sems can ngan pa la //
translated: In the same way, in evil sentient beings,

original: sangs rgyas gzugs na mi snang ngo ;üîΩ/ zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzugs na mi snang ngo ;üîΩ/ zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the form of the Buddha does not appear.

original: de dang 'dra bar sems can gang gi sems kyi rgyud chu'i snod dang 'dra ba la bsod nams dang ye shes kyi chus ma bkang ba dang // 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i las byas pas sems kyi rgyud snod dang 'dra ba snod chag pa lta bur sems nyams par byas la /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar sems can gang gi sems kyi rgyud chu'i snod dang 'dra ba la bsod nams dang ye shes kyi chus ma bkang ba dang // 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i las byas pas sems kyi rgyud snod dang 'dra ba snod chag pa lta bur sems nyams par byas la /
translated: and the mind-streams of sentient beings, like vessels, are ruined, like broken vessels, by the collection of afflictions such as attachment and aversion, and by the performance of sinful, non-virtuous actions.

original: snod chag pa lta bu'i sems can ngan pas bdag la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod kyang mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snod chag pa lta bu'i sems can ngan pas bdag la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod kyang mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that evil sentient beings, like broken vessels, do not see the Buddha-nature even though it exists in them.

original: tshigs su bcad pa drug pa'i bsdus pa'i don ni sangs rgyas mthong bar @117a * //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa drug pa'i bsdus pa'i don ni sangs rgyas mthong bar @117a * //
translated: The summarized meaning of the sixth verse is:

original: gyur pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs 'di bsags pa /
analyzed: gyur pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs 'di bsags pa /
translated: This accumulation of the collections of merit and wisdom, which has become the seeing of the Buddha,

original: sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i gdul bya yod na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i gdul bya yod na /
translated: if there are disciples to be tamed by the Buddha,

original: sangs rgyas 'jig rten du skye bas na de dag gis mthong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'jig rten du skye bas na de dag gis mthong bar 'gyur la /
translated: the Buddha is born in the world, so they will see him.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gdul ba'i skal pa can rnams btul nas dka' ba med par gyur na mya ngan las 'da' bas de dag gis mi mthong ba dpe dang bcas par bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gdul ba'i skal pa can rnams btul nas dka' ba med par gyur na mya ngan las 'da' bas de dag gis mi mthong ba dpe dang bcas par bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom ste /
translated: The verse is composed to show that by means of an example, he is not seen by those who are not fit to be converted.

original: dpe bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /üîΩji ltar me ni gzhan du 'bar //
analyzed: dpe bstan pa'i phyir smras pa / ji ltar me ni gzhan du 'bar //
translated: In order to show the example, he says:üîΩJust as fire burns in one place

original: gzhan du yang ni zhi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan du yang ni zhi bar 'gyur //
translated: and is extinguished in another,üîΩso should the appearance and disappearance

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: of the Buddha be understood.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIn one place‚Äù means

original: me dang shing yod pa'i gnas la snyegs te /
analyzed: me dang shing yod pa'i gnas la snyegs te /
translated: in the place where there is fire and fuel.

original: dper na me 'di dag gang na me dang shing yod pa'i gnas na ni 'bar gyi /
analyzed: dper na me 'di dag gang na me dang shing yod pa'i gnas na ni 'bar gyi /
translated: For example, this fire burns in the place where there is fire and fuel.

original: gnas gang na me dang shing med par ni mi 'bar bas gzhan du yang zhi bar 'gyur zhes te 'di ni dpe'o //
analyzed: gnas gang na me dang shing med par ni mi 'bar bas gzhan du yang zhi bar 'gyur zhes te 'di ni dpe'o //
translated: Since it does not burn in the place where there is no fire and fuel, it is extinguished in another place. This is the example.

original: don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the meaning, he says:

original: snang ba dang ni mi snang ba ;
analyzed: snang ba dang ni mi snang ba ;
translated: The appearance and disappearance

original: / sangs rgyas la yang de bzhin shes //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: / sangs rgyas la yang de bzhin shes // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: of the Buddha should be understood in the same way.

original: dper na me shing yod pa'i gnas ni 'bar /
analyzed: dper na me shing yod pa'i gnas ni 'bar /
translated: For example, fire burns in the place where there is fire and fuel.

original: shing med pa'i gnas ni mi 'bar ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyang de dang 'dra bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: shing med pa'i gnas ni mi 'bar ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyang de dang 'dra bar shes par bya ste /
translated: Just as a place without wood does not burn, so should the Buddha be understood.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?üîΩThose whose mental continuum has the tree of the collections of merit and knowledge are the sentient beings to be converted by the Buddha.

original: sems can gang gi sems kyi rgyud la bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi shing sbungs pa de dag ni sangs rgyas kyis gdul bar bya ba'i sems can yin pas gnas der sangs rgyas mngon par sangs rgyas par ston pas sems can gyis mthong ba'i phyir snangüîΩba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gang gi sems kyi rgyud la bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi shing sbungs pa de dag ni sangs rgyas kyis gdul bar bya ba'i sems can yin pas gnas der sangs rgyas mngon par sangs rgyas par ston pas sems can gyis mthong ba'i phyir snang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the Buddha manifests manifest enlightenment in that place, he is seen by sentient beings, and so is called manifest.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gdul bar bya ba'i skal ba can rnams ni btul nas sangs rgyas mthong ba'i skal ba med na sangs rgyas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas na de dag gis mi mthong ba'i phyir mi snang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gdul bar bya ba'i skal ba can rnams ni btul nas sangs rgyas mthong ba'i skal ba med na sangs rgyas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas na de dag gis mi mthong ba'i phyir mi snang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are fortunate enough to be converted by the Buddha, when they are converted and no longer have the fortune to see the Buddha, since the Buddha passes into final nirvƒÅ·πáa, he is not seen by them, and so is called unmanifest.

original: sangs rgyas bya ba lhun gyis grub pas rgyun mi 'chad pa la tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bya ba lhun gyis grub pas rgyun mi 'chad pa la tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Four verses on the Buddha‚Äôs effortless, uninterrupted activity.

original: zag pa med pa'i dbyings kyi mtshan nyid bshad nas /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbyings kyi mtshan nyid bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the characteristic of the uncontaminated realm,

original: da ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi phrin las kyi mtshan nyid tshigs su bcad pa bzhi bstan to //
analyzed: da ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi phrin las kyi mtshan nyid tshigs su bcad pa bzhi bstan to //
translated: now, in four verses, he teaches the characteristic of the enlightened activities of the buddhas.

original: de la 'phags pa nyan thos dag bdag gi don gyi las byed pa na yang 'di ltar bya'o snyam du sems na brtsams pa dang 'bad pa med pas na lhun gyis grub pa ma @117b yin no //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa nyan thos dag bdag gi don gyi las byed pa na yang 'di ltar bya'o snyam du sems na brtsams pa dang 'bad pa med pas na lhun gyis grub pa ma @117b yin no //
translated: In this regard, when the noble disciples perform activities for their own benefit, they do so thinking, ‚ÄúI will do this,‚Äù and so their activities are not spontaneous, since they are initiated and require effort.

original: phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su zhugs pas na /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su zhugs pas na /
translated: And since they enter the realm of nirvana without any remainder of the aggregates,

original: bya ba thams cad rgyun chad pas na rgyun mi chad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad rgyun chad pas na rgyun mi chad pa ma yin no //
translated: their activities are not uninterrupted, since all activity is terminated.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las de las khyad zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las de las khyad zhugs pa ste /
translated: The enlightened activities of the tathagatas are quite different from that.

original: dgongs pa dang btsal ba dang 'bad pa med par 'gyur bas na lhun gyis grub pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa dang btsal ba dang 'bad pa med par 'gyur bas na lhun gyis grub pa'o //
translated: Since they are performed without any deliberation, search, or effort, they are spontaneous.

original: bdag dang sems can gyi don du 'khor pa'i mtha' dang sems can gyi mtha' bar du mdzad pas rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can gyi don du 'khor pa'i mtha' dang sems can gyi mtha' bar du mdzad pas rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: And since they are performed for the benefit of both oneself and others, until the end of samsara and the end of beings, they are uninterrupted.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang po dang gnyis pa'i bsdus pa'i don ni rnga ma brdungs pa'i sgra dang / nor bu'i mthu dang mthun pas sangs rgyas kyi phrin las lhun gyis grub par mdzad pas de dpe bstan to //üîΩrnga'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩji ltar rnga dag ma brdungs par //
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang po dang gnyis pa'i bsdus pa'i don ni rnga ma brdungs pa'i sgra dang / nor bu'i mthu dang mthun pas sangs rgyas kyi phrin las lhun gyis grub par mdzad pas de dpe bstan to // rnga'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir / ji ltar rnga dag ma brdungs par //
translated: The condensed meaning of the first and second verses is taught by the example of the sound of an unstruck drum, in accordance with the power of the gem, because the Buddha's activity is spontaneously accomplished.

original: sgra ni kun du 'byung ba ltar //
analyzed: sgra ni kun du 'byung ba ltar //
translated: In order to teach the example of the drum,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said:üîΩJust as the sound of drums arisesüîΩwithout being struck,

original: dper na sems can gyi bsod nams las byung ba'i rnga dang shing bu dang lag pas ma brdungs par yang 'dus byas thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: dper na sems can gyi bsod nams las byung ba'i rnga dang shing bu dang lag pas ma brdungs par yang 'dus byas thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: For example, the sound All conditioned things are impermanent,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: all contaminated things are suffering,

original: chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: all phenomena are selfless,

original: zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra 'byung ba ltar zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra 'byung ba ltar zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: peace is nirvana and so on arises without being struck by the drum, the stick, or the hand, which arise from the merit of sentient beings. This is the meaning.

original: brgya byin lha'i dbang po'i gnas nas brgya byin gyi bsod nams las byung ba'i rnga ni de nam brgya byin 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la 'jug pa na sus kyang ma brdungs par 'dod pa lnga la dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / rjes su mthun par sgra 'byung ngo //
analyzed: brgya byin lha'i dbang po'i gnas nas brgya byin gyi bsod nams las byung ba'i rnga ni de nam brgya byin 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la 'jug pa na sus kyang ma brdungs par 'dod pa lnga la dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / rjes su mthun par sgra 'byung ngo //
translated: When Indra, lord of the gods, engages in the five sense objects that arise from his merit, the drum that arises from Indra's merit sounds a sound that accords with delight in the five sense objects without being beaten by anyone.

original: nam brgya byin 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la ldog par gyur pa na sus kyang ma brdungs par 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga las phyir ldog par 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i sgra 'byung ste /
analyzed: nam brgya byin 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la ldog par gyur pa na sus kyang ma brdungs par 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga las phyir ldog par 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i sgra 'byung ste /
translated: When Indra turns away from the five sense objects, a sound that accords with turning away from the five sense objects arises without being beaten by anyone.

original: dpe dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dpe dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is like the example.

original: don bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩde bzhin rgyal ba zag med par //
analyzed: don bstan pa'i phyir / de bzhin rgyal ba zag med par //
translated: To teach the meaning, it says:üîΩIn the same way, the explanations

original: bshad pa dag ni 'byung bar 'gyur//üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bshad pa dag ni 'byung bar 'gyur//üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
translated: of the Victor arise without outflows.

original: dpe de dang 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zag pa med pa'i dbyings la bzhugs shing sems can gyi don du chos bshad pa rnam pa sna tshogs mdzad pa yang chos bshad par bya'o snyam dgongs pa mi mnga' zhing 'bad pa dang btsal ba med par yang
analyzed: dpe de dang 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zag pa med pa'i dbyings la bzhugs shing sems can gyi don du chos bshad pa rnam pa sna tshogs mdzad pa yang chos bshad par bya'o snyam dgongs pa mi mnga' zhing 'bad pa dang btsal ba med par yang
translated: Just as in that example, the Tathagatas, while dwelling in the uncontaminated realm, also teach the Dharma for the sake of sentient beings in various ways, without any thought of ‚ÄúI will teach the Dharma,‚Äù and without any effort or search,

original: lhun @118a * //
analyzed: lhun @118a * //
translated: they spontaneously

original: gyis grub pa nyid du chos bshad pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gyis grub pa nyid du chos bshad pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: teach the Dharma. This is the meaning.

original: lhun gyis grub par sems can gyi don mdzad pa nor bu'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub par sems can gyi don mdzad pa nor bu'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the spontaneous benefit of sentient beings through the example of a jewel,üîΩit is said:

original: ji ltar nor bu 'bad med par //
analyzed: ji ltar nor bu 'bad med par //
translated: Just as a jewel, without any effort,

original: rang gi 'od ni bstan pa ltar //
analyzed: rang gi 'od ni bstan pa ltar //
translated: displays its own light,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: so it is.

original: dper na nor bu rin po che la sogs pa nor bu rnams las 'od byung bas na nor bu 'di ltar bdag gis 'od 'byung bar bya'o snyam du bsam pa dang / 'bad rtsol med par yang 'od snang ba de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dper na nor bu rin po che la sogs pa nor bu rnams las 'od byung bas na nor bu 'di ltar bdag gis 'od 'byung bar bya'o snyam du bsam pa dang / 'bad rtsol med par yang 'od snang ba de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For example, jewels such as precious jewels emit light, so this jewel thinks, ‚ÄúI will emit light,‚Äù and without any effort or exertion, the light shines. This is the meaning.

original: don de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that meaning, he says:

original: de bzhin sangs rgyas rtog med par //
analyzed: de bzhin sangs rgyas rtog med par //
translated: Similarly, the buddhas, without conceptualization,

original: mdzad pa dag ni rnam par ston //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mdzad pa dag ni rnam par ston // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Display their activities.

original: de dang 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sems can gyi don du sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi sbrul pa ston pa na bdag gis sprul pa 'di lta bu dag bya'o snyam du dgongs pa dang / 'bad rtsol med par lhun gyis grub pa nyid du sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi sprul pa dag 'byung ba ston te /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sems can gyi don du sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi sbrul pa ston pa na bdag gis sprul pa 'di lta bu dag bya'o snyam du dgongs pa dang / 'bad rtsol med par lhun gyis grub pa nyid du sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi sprul pa dag 'byung ba ston te /
translated: Thus, when the tathƒÅgatas display the emanations of body, speech, and mind for the sake of sentient beings, they do so without any thought such as, ‚ÄúI will emanate such and such an emanation.‚Äù They display the emanations of body, speech, and mind without any effort, spontaneously and effortlessly.

original: 'dis ni sangs rgyas kyi bya ba lhun gyis grub par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sangs rgyas kyi bya ba lhun gyis grub par bstan to //
translated: This demonstrates the effortless activity of the buddhas.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa dang bzhi pas ni sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mi 'chad par nam mkha'i dpe bstan te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa dang bzhi pas ni sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mi 'chad par nam mkha'i dpe bstan te /
translated: The third and fourth verses demonstrate the analogy of space in order to demonstrate that the activity of the buddhas is uninterrupted.

original: dpe bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: dpe bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the analogy, he says:

original: ji lta bur na nam mkha' la //
analyzed: ji lta bur na nam mkha' la //
translated: How is it that the activity of the buddhas

original: 'jig rten byed ba mi 'chad snang //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten byed ba mi 'chad snang //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Is seen to be uninterrupted in the world?

original: 'jig rten gyi byed pa ni 'gro ba dang 'dug pa dang nyal ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi byed pa ni 'gro ba dang 'dug pa dang nyal ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The activities of the world are going, sitting, sleeping, and so on.

original: dper na nam mkha'i dbyings de la kha cig tu ni 'jig rten 'gro bar snang /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i dbyings de la kha cig tu ni 'jig rten 'gro bar snang /
translated: For example, in that realm of space, in some places the world appears to go,

original: kha cig tu 'jig rten gnas par snang ba la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi bya ba rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kha cig tu 'jig rten gnas par snang ba la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi bya ba rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: in some places the world appears to stay, and so on. The meaning is that the activities of the world occur uninterruptedly.

original: don de bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: don de bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach that meaning, it is said:

original: de bzhin zag med dbyings na yang //üîΩrgyal ba'i bye brag rgyun mi 'chad //
analyzed: de bzhin zag med dbyings na yang // rgyal ba'i bye brag rgyun mi 'chad //
translated: In the same way, in the uncontaminated realm,

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: the activities of the Victorious Ones are uninterrupted.üîΩThe meaning is that just as in space, in the uncontaminated realm,üîΩthe activities of the Victorious Ones are uninterrupted.

original: de dang 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zag pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la gnas na yang sems can gyi don du sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul pa'i phrin las rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩnam mkha' la ni bya ba dag //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zag pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la gnas na yang sems can gyi don du sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul pa'i phrin las rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to // nam mkha' la ni bya ba dag //
translated: The activities of the world

original: rtag tu 'bri zhing mngon par 'byung //
analyzed: rtag tu 'bri zhing mngon par 'byung //
translated: are always decreasing and increasing in space.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: As it is said:

original: dper na nam mkha'i dbyings @118b 'di la sems can sems can ma yin pa'i bya ba rtag tu 'bri ba dang / rtag tu mngon par 'byung ste /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i dbyings @118b 'di la sems can sems can ma yin pa'i bya ba rtag tu 'bri ba dang / rtag tu mngon par 'byung ste /
