translated: In this realm of space, the activity of sentient beings and non-sentient beings is always decreasing and always increasing.

original: kha cig tu ni phyi'i dngos po nags tshal la sogs pa mes tshig cing med par gyur pa dang / nang gi dngos po sems can la sogs pa 'chi bar yang snang bas na 'bri bar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni phyi'i dngos po nags tshal la sogs pa mes tshig cing med par gyur pa dang / nang gi dngos po sems can la sogs pa 'chi bar yang snang bas na 'bri bar 'byung ngo //
translated: In some places, external things such as forests are burned by fire and become nothing, and internally, sentient beings and so on die, so it appears that they are decreasing.

original: nam mkha'i phyogs kha cig tu phyi'i dngos po nags la sogs pa skye ba dang / nang gi dngos po sems can dag kyang skye bas na mngon par snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nam mkha'i phyogs kha cig tu phyi'i dngos po nags la sogs pa skye ba dang / nang gi dngos po sems can dag kyang skye bas na mngon par snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In some places in the realm of space, external things such as forests grow, and internally, sentient beings are born, so it appears that they are increasing.

original: de bzhin zag med dbyings na yang //üîΩsangs rgyas phrin las skye zhing 'bri //
analyzed: de bzhin zag med dbyings na yang // sangs rgyas phrin las skye zhing 'bri //
translated: In the same way, in the uncontaminated realm

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The activity of the buddhas increases and decreases.

original: de 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zag pa med pa'i dbyings na bzhugs pa na /
analyzed: de 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zag pa med pa'i dbyings na bzhugs pa na /
translated: In this way, the tathƒÅgatas dwelling in the uncontaminated realm

original: sangs rgyas kyi skye bar 'gyur ba yang snang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi skye bar 'gyur ba yang snang /
translated: appear to be born as buddhas.

original: 'bri bar 'gyur ba yang snang ste /
analyzed: 'bri bar 'gyur ba yang snang ste /
translated: It also appears to diminish.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: nam sems can skal ba yod pa'i dus na ni sbrul pa'i skus mngon par sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa ston pas na skye bar snang ngo //
analyzed: nam sems can skal ba yod pa'i dus na ni sbrul pa'i skus mngon par sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa ston pas na skye bar snang ngo //
translated: When sentient beings have the good fortune, then it appears to arise, because the emanation body demonstrates manifest enlightenment, etc.

original: skal ba med par gyur pa la mya ngan las 'das pas na 'bri bar yang snang ngo //
analyzed: skal ba med par gyur pa la mya ngan las 'das pas na 'bri bar yang snang ngo //
translated: When they do not have the good fortune, then it appears to diminish, because of the nirvana.

original: 'dis ni sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mi snang bar 'chad pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mi snang bar 'chad pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the explanation of the non-appearance of the Buddha's activity.

original: zag pa med pa'i dbyings zab pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu drug go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbyings zab pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu drug go zhes bya ba la /
translated: Sixteen verses on the profundity of the uncontaminated realm.

original: sangs rgyas kyi phrin las lhun gyis grub pa dang rgyun mi 'chad par bstan nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi phrin las lhun gyis grub pa dang rgyun mi 'chad par bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the spontaneity and continuity of the Buddha's activity,

original: da zag pa med pa'i dbyings zab pa bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa bcu drug rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: da zag pa med pa'i dbyings zab pa bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa bcu drug rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: now, in order to teach the profundity of the uncontaminated realm, he begins the sixteen verses.

original: de zag pa med pa'i dbyings zab pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de zag pa med pa'i dbyings zab pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The profundity of the uncontaminated realm is threefold:

original: mtshan nyid zab pa dang / gnas pa zab ba dang / las zab pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid zab pa dang / gnas pa zab ba dang / las zab pa'o //
translated: The profound characteristic, the profound abiding, and the profound activity.

original: mtshan nyid zab pa la yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid zab pa la yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The profound characteristic is also fourfold:

original: rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bdag gi mchog tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid dang / lang du ma bstan pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bdag gi mchog tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid dang / lang du ma bstan pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of purification, the characteristic of being the supreme self, the characteristic of the reality of non-manifestation, and the characteristic of liberation.

original: snga ma phyi mar khyad med kyang //
analyzed: snga ma phyi mar khyad med kyang //
translated: Although there is no difference between the former and the latter,

original: sgrib pa thams cad dri ma med //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad dri ma med //
translated: It is stainless with respect to all obscurations.

original: dag pa ma yin yang dag min //
analyzed: dag pa ma yin yang dag min //
translated: It is neither pure nor impure.

original: sangs rgyas de bzhin nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: sangs rgyas de bzhin nyid du 'dod //
translated: The Buddha is asserted to be thusness.

original: ces bya bas rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid bstan te /
analyzed: ces bya bas rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid bstan te /
translated: This teaches the characteristic of purification.

original: sngon kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa las phyis lam bsgoms te /
analyzed: sngon kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa las phyis lam bsgoms te /
translated: Previously, it had the nature of afflictions, but later, through cultivating the path,

original: @119a * // dri ma med par gyur pa ni dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @119a * // dri ma med par gyur pa ni dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It becomes stainless, and that is called ‚Äúpure.‚Äù

original: snga ma ni so so'i skye bo'i dus so //
analyzed: snga ma ni so so'i skye bo'i dus so //
translated: The former refers to the time of ordinary beings,

original: phyi ma ni mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i dus la bya ste /
analyzed: phyi ma ni mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i dus la bya ste /
translated: And the latter refers to the time of manifest enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku ni de bzhin nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin bar 'dod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku ni de bzhin nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin bar 'dod de /
translated: The dharmakaya of the Buddha is held to be the nature of suchness, emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid ni so so'i skye bo'i dus na yang stong pa nyid dang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni so so'i skye bo'i dus na yang stong pa nyid dang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin /
translated: Emptiness is the nature of the ordinary person, and it is also the nature of the fully enlightened Buddha.

original: phyi ma ste mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i dus na yang stong pa dang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pas dag pa'i rang bzhin du khyad par med de de la sbyang du med pas na dag pa med pa yin no//
analyzed: phyi ma ste mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i dus na yang stong pa dang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pas dag pa'i rang bzhin du khyad par med de de la sbyang du med pas na dag pa med pa yin no//
translated: Since there is no difference in the pure nature of emptiness and natural luminosity, there is nothing to purify.

original: 'on kyang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i dus na lam bsgoms pa'i mthus nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa glo bur gyi dri ma med par gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i dus na lam bsgoms pa'i mthus nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa glo bur gyi dri ma med par gyur te /
translated: However, at the time of full enlightenment, the force of the path has removed the stains of the afflictions and the stains of the knowable,

original: phyis dag par 'gyur bas na ma dag par yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyis dag par 'gyur bas na ma dag par yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and since it will become pure later, it is not impure.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings na sangs rgyas rnams bdag gi mchog tu gyur pa ston te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings na sangs rgyas rnams bdag gi mchog tu gyur pa ston te /
translated: The second verse shows that the Buddhas are the supreme self in the uncontaminated realm.

original: ci'i phyir bdag gi mchog tu gyur to zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag gi mchog tu gyur to zhe na /
translated: Why are they the supreme self?

original: de'i phyir / bdag med pa'i mchog thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / bdag med pa'i mchog thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúbecause they attain the supreme selflessness.‚Äù

original: bdag med pa'i mchog ni gang zag la bdag med pa dang // chos la bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i mchog ni gang zag la bdag med pa dang // chos la bdag med pa ste /
translated: The supreme selflessness is the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: zag pa med pa'i dbyings na sangs rgyas rnams bdag med pa gnyis kyi mchog gi bdag nyid dang / rang bzhin du gyur pas na bdag gi mchog tu gyur par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbyings na sangs rgyas rnams bdag med pa gnyis kyi mchog gi bdag nyid dang / rang bzhin du gyur pas na bdag gi mchog tu gyur par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The Buddhas are established as the supreme self in the uncontaminated realm because they are the supreme nature of the two selflessnesses and their intrinsic nature.

original: de la bdag ces bya ba'i sgra 'di ni skabs kha cig tu mu stegs pas yongs su brtags pa'i bdag nyid la yang bya bar 'dren te /
analyzed: de la bdag ces bya ba'i sgra 'di ni skabs kha cig tu mu stegs pas yongs su brtags pa'i bdag nyid la yang bya bar 'dren te /
translated: In some contexts, the term ‚Äúself‚Äù refers to the self imagined by the heterodox.

original: 'di ltar bdag dang sems can dang srog ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag dang sems can dang srog ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúself,‚Äù ‚Äúsentient being,‚Äù ‚Äúliving being,‚Äù and so on.

original: bdag ces bya ba'i sgra 'di ni skabs kha cig tu chos kyi rang bzhin la yang bya bar 'dren te /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba'i sgra 'di ni skabs kha cig tu chos kyi rang bzhin la yang bya bar 'dren te /
translated: In some contexts, the term ‚Äúself‚Äù is used to refer to the intrinsic nature of phenomena.

original: me ni dro ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: me ni dro ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
translated: For example, fire is said to have the characteristic of heat.

original: dro ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dro ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that it has the intrinsic nature of heat.

original: sa sra ba'i bdag nyid ces bya ba bshad na /
analyzed: sa sra ba'i bdag nyid ces bya ba bshad na /
translated: Similarly, earth is said to have the intrinsic nature of solidity.

original: sra ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sra ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that it has the intrinsic nature of solidity.

original: 'di'i skabs bdag ces bya ba'i sgra rang bzhin gyi don du drang ste /
analyzed: 'di'i skabs bdag ces bya ba'i sgra rang bzhin gyi don du drang ste /
translated: In the present context, the term ‚Äúself‚Äù should be interpreted to mean intrinsic nature.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni bdag med pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pas bdag gi mchog thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni bdag med pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pas bdag gi mchog thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The buddhas have attained the supreme self by becoming the intrinsic nature of selflessness.

original: de la bdag med pa'i mchog @119b gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la bdag med pa'i mchog @119b gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the supreme self?

original: de'i phyir / stong pa nyid ni rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / stong pa nyid ni rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that emptiness is purity.

original: nam gang zag med pa'i stong pa dang / chos dngos po med pa'i stong pa gzung 'dzin gyi dri ma las dag par gyur te /
analyzed: nam gang zag med pa'i stong pa dang / chos dngos po med pa'i stong pa gzung 'dzin gyi dri ma las dag par gyur te /
translated: When the emptiness of the nonexistence of the person and the emptiness of the nonexistence of entities are purified of the stains of subject and object,

original: stong pa dag par de thob na bdag med pa'i mchog thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa dag par de thob na bdag med pa'i mchog thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one attains that pure emptiness, it is called ‚Äúattaining the supreme selflessness.‚Äù

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that meaning,

original: sangs rgyas dag pa'i bdag thob pas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dag pa'i bdag thob pas //
translated: having attained the pure self of the buddhas,

original: bdag nyid chen po bdag tu gyur //üîΩces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po bdag tu gyur // ces bya ba smos te /
translated: the great self becomes the self.

original: zag pa med pa'i dbyings na stong pa nyid rnam par dag pa thob nas /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbyings na stong pa nyid rnam par dag pa thob nas /
translated: Having attained pure emptiness in the uncontaminated realm,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bdag med pa'i mchog thob par gyur bas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bdag med pa'i mchog thob par gyur bas /
translated: the buddhas attain the supreme selflessness.

original: de'i tshe na sangs rgyas rnams bdag nyid chen po'i bdag nyid du gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe na sangs rgyas rnams bdag nyid chen po'i bdag nyid du gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: At that time, the buddhas are said to become the great self.

original: de ltar bdag nyid chen po'i bdag tu gyur pas na zag pa med pa'i dbyings las bdag gi mchog tu gyur par rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid chen po'i bdag tu gyur pas na zag pa med pa'i dbyings las bdag gi mchog tu gyur par rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Since they become the great self in that way, they are posited as the supreme self in the uncontaminated realm.

original: 'dis ni bdag gi mchog gi mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag gi mchog gi mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: This teaches the definition of the supreme self.

original: bdag gi dpe med pa'i mchog gi bdag nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba la gang zag la bdag med pa dang chos la bdag med pa gnyis ni bdag med pa'i chos mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi dpe med pa'i mchog gi bdag nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba la gang zag la bdag med pa dang chos la bdag med pa gnyis ni bdag med pa'i chos mchog ces bya'o //
translated: The two kinds of selflessness, the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of things, are called the supreme selflessness.

original: de'ang nam gzung 'dzin gyi dri ma las dag bar gyur na bdag med pa'i mchog tu gzhag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'ang nam gzung 'dzin gyi dri ma las dag bar gyur na bdag med pa'i mchog tu gzhag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And when it is purified from the stain of subject and object, it is called the supreme selflessness.

original: de yang ngo bo nyid kyi don du sangs rgyas rnams kyi bdag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang ngo bo nyid kyi don du sangs rgyas rnams kyi bdag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And that is the self of the Buddhas, in the sense of their essence.

original: bdag gi mchog thob bdag med pa'i //
analyzed: bdag gi mchog thob bdag med pa'i //
translated: The supreme self is attained, which is selflessness.

original: zhes bya ba'i bdag gi sgra ni 'di'i skabs su ngo bo nyid kyi don la bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bdag gi sgra ni 'di'i skabs su ngo bo nyid kyi don la bya ste /
translated: The word self in the phrase ‚Äúthe supreme self is attained‚Äù should be understood here in the sense of essence.

original: sangs rgyas rnams bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas bdag gi mchog thob pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas bdag gi mchog thob pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The Buddhas have attained the supreme self, which is the essence of selflessness.

original: de rnam par dag pas bdag med pa'i bdag gi mchog dag pa /üîΩsangs rgyas rnams kyis thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pas bdag med pa'i bdag gi mchog dag pa / sangs rgyas rnams kyis thob par 'gyur //
translated: The supreme self, which is selflessness,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: is attained by the Buddhas, through its purification.

original: zag pa med pa'i dbyings na bdag med pa gnyis rnam par bdag nyid du sangs rgyas rnams gyur pas na bdag med pa'i bdag gi mchog dam pa sangs rgyas kyis thob bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbyings na bdag med pa gnyis rnam par bdag nyid du sangs rgyas rnams gyur pas na bdag med pa'i bdag gi mchog dam pa sangs rgyas kyis thob bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since the buddhas have become the nature of the two kinds of selflessness in the uncontaminated realm, they have attained the supreme self of selflessness.

original: da sangs rgyas shi nas 'byung bar 'gyur ram sangs rgyas shi nas 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes dri ba la lung bstan du med par bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩdngos min dngos po med min te //
analyzed: da sangs rgyas shi nas 'byung bar 'gyur ram sangs rgyas shi nas 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes dri ba la lung bstan du med par bstan pa'i phyir / dngos min dngos po med min te //
translated: Now, in response to the question, ‚ÄúDoes the Buddha arise after death or not?‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa smos te /
translated: The third verse is stated to show that the Buddha is not declared to be either existent or nonexistent.

original: de la zag pa med pa'i dbyings nas sangs rgyas rnams ni dngos po yod pa yang ma yin dngos po med pa yang ma yin te /üîΩci'i @120a * //
analyzed: de la zag pa med pa'i dbyings nas sangs rgyas rnams ni dngos po yod pa yang ma yin dngos po med pa yang ma yin te / ci'i @120a * //
translated: In the uncontaminated realm, the buddhas are neither existent nor nonexistent.

original: phyir zhe na /üîΩsangs rgyas ni chos kyi sku yin la /
analyzed: phyir zhe na / sangs rgyas ni chos kyi sku yin la /
translated: Why is that?üîΩThe Buddha is the body of truth, and the body of truth is emptiness.

original: chos kyi sku ni stong pa nyid yin pas stong pa nyid la ni kun du brtags ba'i gang zag gi dngos po yang med /
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni stong pa nyid yin pas stong pa nyid la ni kun du brtags ba'i gang zag gi dngos po yang med /
translated: In emptiness, there is no entity of the imputed person,

original: kun du brtags pa'i chos kyi dngos po yang med pa'i phyir dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i chos kyi dngos po yang med pa'i phyir dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Because the entity of the imagined reality does not exist, it is not an existent entity.

original: yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin ni yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin ni yod pa ma yin la /
translated: The perfected nature does not exist.

original: kun brtags kyi chos dang gang zag gi ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pas na de'i tshe na yod par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: kun brtags kyi chos dang gang zag gi ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pas na de'i tshe na yod par mi gzhag go //
translated: Since the imagined reality, the person, and so on, are non-existent like the horn of a rabbit, it is not posited as existent at that time.

original: dngos po med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not non-existent,

original: de bzhin nyid yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de'i tshe yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de'i tshe yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because suchness, the characteristic of the perfected, exists at that time.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid ces brjod //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid ces brjod //
translated: Therefore, it is called buddhahood.

original: zhes bya ba la gong du bshad pa ltar na sangs rgyas de dngos po yod pa yang ma yin pa dngos po med pa yang ma yin par brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gong du bshad pa ltar na sangs rgyas de dngos po yod pa yang ma yin pa dngos po med pa yang ma yin par brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: As explained above, that buddha is said to be neither existent nor non-existent. This is the meaning.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas de bzhin 'dri //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas de bzhin 'dri //
translated: Therefore, the buddha is like a reflection.

original: lung du mi bstan tshul du rig / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: lung du mi bstan tshul du rig / ces bya ba la /
translated: It should be known as neutral.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pas sangs rgyas shi nas 'byung bar 'gyur ram /üîΩsangs rgyas shi nas mi 'byung ngo zhes 'dri ba la /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pas sangs rgyas shi nas 'byung bar 'gyur ram / sangs rgyas shi nas mi 'byung ngo zhes 'dri ba la /
translated: Thus, since the Buddha is neither existent nor nonexistent, it is asked whether the Buddha occurs after death or

original: sangs rgyas shi nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas shi nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin /
translated: whether the Buddha does not occur after death.üîΩIt should be understood that the Buddha does not occur after death,

original: sangs rgyas shi nas mi 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin zhes lung du mi bstan pa'i tshul du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas shi nas mi 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin zhes lung du mi bstan pa'i tshul du rig par bya'o //
translated: nor does he not occur after death.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: sangs rgyas shi nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas shi nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: The Buddha does not occur after death,

original: kun brtags kyi bdag dang / chos kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun brtags kyi bdag dang / chos kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he does not occur as the imagined nature of self and of the characteristics of things.

original: sangs rgyas shi nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas shi nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does the Buddha occur after death,

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he does occur as the perfected nature.

original: 'dis ni lung du ma bstan pa'i nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni lung du ma bstan pa'i nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid du bstan to //
translated: This shows the characteristic of the indeterminate afflictions.üîΩAs the eye and the eye disease,

original: ji ltar mig la ra pa rib dang // lcags la tshab zhi ba ltar //
analyzed: ji ltar mig la ra pa rib dang // lcags la tshab zhi ba ltar //
translated: as iron and a magnet,

original: sangs rgyas sems dang shes rab la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sems dang shes rab la //
translated: Buddhahood is neither said to exist nor not exist

original: yod dang med pa mi brjod do //
analyzed: yod dang med pa mi brjod do //
translated: in the mind and wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: As it is said:

original: dper na mig la rab rib zhib de yod pa //üîΩzhes kyang mi brjod /
analyzed: dper na mig la rab rib zhib de yod pa // zhes kyang mi brjod /
translated: ‚ÄúFor example, it is not said that the eye disease existsüîΩor does not exist.‚Äù

original: med pa zhes kyang mi brjod /
analyzed: med pa zhes kyang mi brjod /
translated: It is not said that it exists.

original: ji ltar yod pa zhes kyang mi brjod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa zhes kyang mi brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it not said that it exists?

original: rab rib zhi ba dang med pa dang 'gag par gyur pa de rab rib kyi dngos por gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rab rib zhi ba dang med pa dang 'gag par gyur pa de rab rib kyi dngos por gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the pacification of the eye disease is not the entity of the eye disease, which is nonexistent and has ceased.

original: dper na rims nad kyi tsha ba dang bral na /
analyzed: dper na rims nad kyi tsha ba dang bral na /
translated: For example, when one is free from the fever of a contagious disease,

original: nam bral ba'i dus na rkang lag na bar byed pa'i tshab de'i dus na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam bral ba'i dus na rkang lag na bar byed pa'i tshab de'i dus na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: at the time of freedom, the fever that made the limbs ache does not exist at that time.

original: med pa zhes kyang brjod de /
analyzed: med pa zhes kyang brjod de /
translated: It is said that it does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir mig dag pa yod pas mig gi las gzugs la blta @120b ba'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig dag pa yod pas mig gi las gzugs la blta @120b ba'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the pure eye exists, the function of the eye performs the action of seeing forms.

original: gal te de'i tshe thams cad du med par gyur na ni rab rib bzhin du mig kyang med par gyur pas mig gi bya ba gzugs la blta ba la sogs pa'i bya ba byed mi nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe thams cad du med par gyur na ni rab rib bzhin du mig kyang med par gyur pas mig gi bya ba gzugs la blta ba la sogs pa'i bya ba byed mi nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were completely absent at that time, then like the eye of one with an eye disease, the eye would be absent, and so the eye would be unable to perform the function of seeing form and so on.

original: de yang rims nad byang ba dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de yang rims nad byang ba dang 'dra ste /
translated: Moreover, it is like the recovery from a fever.

original: rims nad byang ba ni rims kyi tsha ba med kyang tsha ba dang bral ba'i lus bde ba phyin yod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rims nad byang ba ni rims kyi tsha ba med kyang tsha ba dang bral ba'i lus bde ba phyin yod pa bzhin no //
translated: The recovery from a fever is the absence of the heat of the fever, but it is the presence of a body that is free from heat.

original: de bzhin du lcags la tsha ba zhi ba yang yod pa zhes kyang mi brjod /
analyzed: de bzhin du lcags la tsha ba zhi ba yang yod pa zhes kyang mi brjod /
translated: In the same way, the pacification of the heat of the iron is not said to be its existence.

original: med pa zhes kyang mi brjod de /
analyzed: med pa zhes kyang mi brjod de /
translated: Nor is it said to be its nonexistence.

original: ci'i phyir yod pa ces mi brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yod pa ces mi brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it not said to be its existence?

original: lcags bsil bar gyur pa na tsha ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lcags bsil bar gyur pa na tsha ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because when the iron has cooled, the state of heat does not exist.

original: rims kyi tsha ba med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rims kyi tsha ba med pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the absence of the heat of a fever.

original: med pa zhes kyang mi brjod de /
analyzed: med pa zhes kyang mi brjod de /
translated: Nor is it said to be its nonexistence.

original: lcags kyi bsil ba phyin yod pas gang gi phyir bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lcags kyi bsil ba phyin yod pas gang gi phyir bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cooling of the iron is present, since it performs various functions.

original: gal te de'i tshe thams cad du med par gyur na ni lcags kyang med par gyur pas lcags kyi bya ba byed pa yang med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe thams cad du med par gyur na ni lcags kyang med par gyur pas lcags kyi bya ba byed pa yang med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If at that time it were non-existent everywhere, then since the iron would also be non-existent, the activity of the iron would not be non-existent.

original: de yang rims med kyang rims dang bral ba'i lus bde ba phyin yod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang rims med kyang rims dang bral ba'i lus bde ba phyin yod pa bzhin no //
translated: And that is like the body of one who is free from fever, even though the fever is not present, being well.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi sems lcags dang 'dra ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi sems lcags dang 'dra ba la /
translated: In the same way, in the Buddha‚Äôs mind, which is like the iron,

original: 'dod chags kyi me tsha ba dang 'dra ba zhi ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mig dang 'dra ba yang ma rig pa rab rib dang 'dra ba zhi ba ni yod pa zhes kyang mi brjod /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi me tsha ba dang 'dra ba zhi ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mig dang 'dra ba yang ma rig pa rab rib dang 'dra ba zhi ba ni yod pa zhes kyang mi brjod /
translated: the fire of passion, which is like the heat, is pacified, and the Buddha‚Äôs wisdom, which is like the eye, is pacified of the eye-disease of ignorance. It is not said to be existent,

original: med pa zhes kyang mi brjod do //
analyzed: med pa zhes kyang mi brjod do //
translated: nor is it said to be non-existent.

original: ci'i phyir yod pa zhes kyang mi brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yod pa zhes kyang mi brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it not said to be existent?

original: nam sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba'i dus na 'dod chags kyi tsha ba dang / ma rig pa'i rab rib med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba'i dus na 'dod chags kyi tsha ba dang / ma rig pa'i rab rib med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when the mind is liberated and wisdom is liberated, the heat of passion and the eye-disease of ignorance are absent.

original: med pa zhes kyang mi brjod de /
analyzed: med pa zhes kyang mi brjod de /
translated: It is not said to be non-existent.

original: sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba phyin yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba phyin yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind is liberated and wisdom is liberated.

original: de la 'dod chags dang bral na ni sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang bral na ni sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: When one is free from passion, the mind is liberated.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thob ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that one attains nirvana.

original: ma rig pa dang bral na ni shes rab rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang bral na ni shes rab rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: When one is free from ignorance, wisdom is liberated.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that one attains the wisdom of omniscience.

original: de med pas skyed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pas skyed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is produced by the absence of those two.

original: med pa ma yin pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: med pa ma yin pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not non-existent.

original: 'dod chags med pa las byung ba ni sems rnam par grol ba ma rig pa med pa las byung ba ni shes rab rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa las byung ba ni sems rnam par grol ba ma rig pa med pa las byung ba ni shes rab rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: The mind liberated from passion is the liberation of the mind. The wisdom liberated from ignorance is the liberation of wisdom.

original: de gnyis dang bral ba'i bde ba'i mtshan nyid ni mad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de gnyis dang bral ba'i bde ba'i mtshan nyid ni mad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The characteristic of bliss that is free from those two is not non-existent. This is the meaning.

original: de la rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The characteristic of liberation is as follows:

original: @121a * // mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba ni sems rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: @121a * // mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba ni sems rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The mind is liberated from the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: rnam par grol ba la rnam par grol ba nyid du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ni shes rab rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba la rnam par grol ba nyid du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ni shes rab rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The knowledge that the mind is liberated just as it is in reality is the liberation of wisdom.

original: 'dis ni rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: This teaches the characteristic of liberation.

original: de la 'di yan chad zab pa bstan pa la mtshan nyid zab pa la tshigs su bcad pa bzhis bstan te /
analyzed: de la 'di yan chad zab pa bstan pa la mtshan nyid zab pa la tshigs su bcad pa bzhis bstan te /
translated: The profound is taught in four verses in the section beginning with ‚ÄúHere, the profound is taught in four verses.‚Äù

original: 'di yan chad kyi tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis ni de bzhin gnas gzhan du gyur pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'di yan chad kyi tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis ni de bzhin gnas gzhan du gyur pa bstan to //
translated: The three verses beginning with ‚ÄúHere, the profound is taught in four verses‚Äù teach the transformation of the basis as it is.

original: ji ltar mig la rab rib dang // zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad gcig gis ni gnas ngan len gyi lam gnas bzhin du gyur pa bstan te /
analyzed: ji ltar mig la rab rib dang // zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad gcig gis ni gnas ngan len gyi lam gnas bzhin du gyur pa bstan te /
translated: The one verse beginning with ‚ÄúJust as the eye is free from cataracts‚Äù teaches the transformation of the basis while remaining in the basis of defilement.

original: sems gnas gzhan du gyur te zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems gnas gzhan du gyur te zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the mind is transformed.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zag pa med pa'i dbyings la bzhugs pa'i tshe /üîΩsku gcig pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zag pa med pa'i dbyings la bzhugs pa'i tshe / sku gcig pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: When the Tathagatas dwell in the uncontaminated realm,üîΩis it said that they have one body

original: tha dad pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: or many bodies?üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / sangs rgyas rnams kyi dri med dbyings //
analyzed: de'i phyir / sangs rgyas rnams kyi dri med dbyings //
translated: The uncontaminated realm of the Buddhas

original: gcig min rnam mang ma yin te //
analyzed: gcig min rnam mang ma yin te //
translated: is not one, nor is it many.

original: zhes bya ba la tshigs su bcad pa gcig smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la tshigs su bcad pa gcig smos so //
translated: One verse.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zag pa med pa'i dbyings chos kyi dbyings la bzhugs pa'i dus la sku gcig pa zhes kyang mi bya /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zag pa med pa'i dbyings chos kyi dbyings la bzhugs pa'i dus la sku gcig pa zhes kyang mi bya /
translated: When the Tathagatas dwell in the uncontaminated realm, the realm of the Dharma, it is not said that they have one body,

original: sku rnam pa mang ba ste tha dad pa du ma zhes kyang mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sku rnam pa mang ba ste tha dad pa du ma zhes kyang mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: nor is it said that they have many bodies, that is, different bodies.

original: ji ltar tha dad pa zhes kyang mi bya zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir / nam mkha' lta bur lus med cing //
analyzed: ji ltar tha dad pa zhes kyang mi bya zhe na / de'i phyir / nam mkha' lta bur lus med cing //
translated: How is it not said that they have different bodies?üîΩTherefore it is said:

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Like space, they are incorporeal.

original: gang la lus med pa dang / bdag tu 'dzin pa med pa de dag la ni lus tha dad pa gzhag par mi nus kyi /
analyzed: gang la lus med pa dang / bdag tu 'dzin pa med pa de dag la ni lus tha dad pa gzhag par mi nus kyi /
translated: Those who are incorporeal and free from the grasping of self cannot be said to have different bodies.

original: gang la lus yod pa dang / bdag tu 'dzin pa yod pa de la ni lha sbyin gyi lus 'di ni mchod sbyin gyi lus tha dad par gzhag par nus so //üîΩdper na nam mkha' lus med pa la bdag tu 'dzin pa med pas nam mkha' la tha dad par gzhag par mi nus pa de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings la bzhugs pa'i dus na yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku la lus med pa dang /
analyzed: gang la lus yod pa dang / bdag tu 'dzin pa yod pa de la ni lha sbyin gyi lus 'di ni mchod sbyin gyi lus tha dad par gzhag par nus so // dper na nam mkha' lus med pa la bdag tu 'dzin pa med pas nam mkha' la tha dad par gzhag par mi nus pa de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings la bzhugs pa'i dus na yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku la lus med pa dang /
translated: But when there is a body and there is self-grasping, then it is possible to posit the body of Devadatta as separate from the body of Yaj√±adatta.üîΩFor example, space, which has no body and no self-grasping, cannot be posited as separate in space.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa med pas na tha dad pa du mar gzhag ste /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa med pas na tha dad pa du mar gzhag ste /
translated: In the same way, when the TathƒÅgatas abide in the dharma-dhƒÅtu, their dharmakƒÅya has no body and no self-grasping, so it cannot be posited as multiple.

original: thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid du ro gcig par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid du ro gcig par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all abide as one taste in the characteristic of the dharma-dhƒÅtu.

original: ji ltar gcig pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gcig pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How are they not one?

original: de'i phyir / sngon gyi lus rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / sngon gyi lus rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚Äúbecause of following the previous body.‚Äù

original: chos kyi dbyings la bzhugs pa'i tshe na sku rnam pa du mar gzhag pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la bzhugs pa'i tshe na sku rnam pa du mar gzhag pa med mod kyi /
translated: When they abide in the dharma-dhƒÅtu, although they are not posited as multiple bodies,

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas sa bcu @121b dag la /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas sa bcu @121b dag la /
translated: On the levels, from the level of earnest aspiration up to the tenth level,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug cing spyod pa na byang chub sems dpa'i so so'i sku du ma yod pas na sku gcig ba kho nar yang mi gzhag go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug cing spyod pa na byang chub sems dpa'i so so'i sku du ma yod pas na sku gcig ba kho nar yang mi gzhag go //
translated: when they are engaged in and practicing bodhisattva activities, they have many different bodhisattva bodies, so they cannot be said to have only one body.

original: 'dis ni gnas pa zab pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni gnas pa zab pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the profundity of their state,

original: gcig dang du ma ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are in a state that is not characterized by oneness or multiplicity.

original: las zab pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa rin po che'i gnas kyi las dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i las dang / mthar thug par 'gro ba'i las dang / chos bstan pa'i las dang / sprul pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i las dang /
analyzed: las zab pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa rin po che'i gnas kyi las dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i las dang / mthar thug par 'gro ba'i las dang / chos bstan pa'i las dang / sprul pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i las dang /
translated: The profundity of their activities refers to their activities as the source of the precious gems of the elements that lead to enlightenment, their activities in bringing sentient beings to full maturity, their activities in reaching the ultimate goal, their activities in teaching the Dharma, their activities in manifesting emanations and so forth, their activities in displaying their own bodies and those of others and their activities in displaying the adornments of the universe.

original: ye shes 'jug pa'i las dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i las dang / sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i ye shes kyi las dang / ye shes mi 'jug pa'i las dang / rnam par grol ba mtshungs pa la ye shes kyi bye brag gi las dang /
analyzed: ye shes 'jug pa'i las dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i las dang / sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i ye shes kyi las dang / ye shes mi 'jug pa'i las dang / rnam par grol ba mtshungs pa la ye shes kyi bye brag gi las dang /
translated: The first is the function of engaging in gnosis, the second is the function of nonconceptuality, the third is the function of the gnosis of various aspects, the fourth is the function of the nonengagement of gnosis and the fifth is the function of the specific gnosis in the equality of liberation.

original: las de rnams bstan te /üîΩstobs sogs sangs rgyas chos rnams kyis //
analyzed: las de rnams bstan te / stobs sogs sangs rgyas chos rnams kyis //
translated: These functions are taught.üîΩThe jewel mine of enlightenment

original: byang chub rin chen 'byung gnas 'dra //
analyzed: byang chub rin chen 'byung gnas 'dra //
translated: is the source of the jewels of the powers and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs nas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs nas /
translated: having abandoned the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience,

original: mngon par byang chub pa ni rin po che'i 'byung gnas dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa ni rin po che'i 'byung gnas dang 'dra ste /
translated: enlightenment is like a jewel mine.

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩdper na rin po che'i 'byung gnas nas /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / dper na rin po che'i 'byung gnas nas /
translated: How so?üîΩFor example, just as various jewels

original: rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: are produced from a jewel mine,

original: mngon par byang chub pa las kyang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rin po che 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa las kyang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rin po che 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: And from the manifest enlightenment, because the jewels of the powers, fearlessnesses, and the factors of enlightenment arise.

original: 'di ni byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa rin po che'i gnas kyi las bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa rin po che'i gnas kyi las bstan to //
translated: This shows the activity of the realm of the jewels of the factors of enlightenment, etc.

original: 'gro ba'i dge ba'i lo tog gi //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i dge ba'i lo tog gi //
translated: It is like a great cloud for the crop of virtue of living beings.

original: sprin chen dang yang 'dra bar rig / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: sprin chen dang yang 'dra bar rig / ces bya ba la /
translated: It should be understood as a great cloud.

original: sprin chen po las char bab nas 'bru rnam pa sna tshogs smin par byed pa de bzhin du sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis dge ba'i lo tog skye ba'i rgyu byed pas na /
analyzed: sprin chen po las char bab nas 'bru rnam pa sna tshogs smin par byed pa de bzhin du sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis dge ba'i lo tog skye ba'i rgyu byed pas na /
translated: Just as a great cloud, raining, causes the various grains to grow, so the perfections in the mental series of the bodhisattvas cause the crop of virtue to grow in the mental series of living beings.

original: zag pa med ba'i dbyings ni sprin chen po dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: zag pa med ba'i dbyings ni sprin chen po dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The uncontaminated realm should be understood as a great cloud.

original: 'dis ni sems can yongs su smin pa'i las bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sems can yongs su smin pa'i las bstan to //
translated: This shows the activity of bringing living beings to maturity.üîΩIt is like the full moon,

original: bsod nams ye shes rab rdzogs pas //üîΩzla ba nya ba 'dra bar rig /
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes rab rdzogs pas //üîΩzla ba nya ba 'dra bar rig /
translated: because of the perfection of merit and intuition.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: zla ba nya ba'i dus na /
analyzed: zla ba nya ba'i dus na /
translated: at the time of the full moon,

original: zla ba cha shas rdzogs pas da rdzogs par bya ba cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: zla ba cha shas rdzogs pas da rdzogs par bya ba cung zad kyang med de /
translated: the moon is complete in all its parts. There is not the slightest thing left to be completed.

original: rnam pa thams cad du rdzogs pa de bzhin du mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i dus na yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ma rdzogs pa cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du rdzogs pa de bzhin du mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i dus na yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ma rdzogs pa cung zad kyang med de /
translated: In the same way, at the time of manifest enlightenment, there is not the slightest thing left to be completed in the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs thams cad rdzogs ye @122a * //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs thams cad rdzogs ye @122a * //
translated: All the accumulations of merit are complete,

original: shes kyi tshogs thams cad rdzogs bas zla ba nya ba dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: shes kyi tshogs thams cad rdzogs bas zla ba nya ba dang 'dra ste /
translated: and all the accumulations of wisdom are complete. Thus, it is like the full moon.

original: 'dis ni mthar 'gro ba'i las bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mthar 'gro ba'i las bstan to //
translated: This shows the activity of going to the end.

original: ye shes snang ba byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ye shes snang ba byed pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is the light of wisdom,

original: nyi ma chen po 'dra bar rig / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: nyi ma chen po 'dra bar rig / ces bya ba la /
translated: it should be known as like a great sun.

original: de la nyi ma la ni che chung med de /
analyzed: de la nyi ma la ni che chung med de /
translated: In this verse, the sun has no size.

original: thams cad kyang gling bzhi snang ba tsam du zad do //
analyzed: thams cad kyang gling bzhi snang ba tsam du zad do //
translated: It is just the light of the four continents.

original: de la nyi ma chen po zhes bya ba yang ni yod par mi srid mod kyi /
analyzed: de la nyi ma chen po zhes bya ba yang ni yod par mi srid mod kyi /
translated: There is no such thing as a great sun,

original: 'on kyang sgro btags nas thams cad du byas te /
analyzed: 'on kyang sgro btags nas thams cad du byas te /
translated: but it is fabricated and made to be everywhere.

original: gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du snang bar byed pa la nyi ma chen po zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du snang bar byed pa la nyi ma chen po zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The great sun is so called because it illuminates the entire trichiliocosm.

original: dper na nyi ma chen pos stong gsum kun du snang bar byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na nyi ma chen pos stong gsum kun du snang bar byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the great sun illuminates the entire trichiliocosm,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes las kyang dam pa'i chos bshad pa'i 'od zer byung nas phyogs bcu'i sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud la snang bar byed pas na nyi ma chen po dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes las kyang dam pa'i chos bshad pa'i 'od zer byung nas phyogs bcu'i sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud la snang bar byed pas na nyi ma chen po dang 'dra ste /
translated: so also the light rays of the Dharma teaching arise from the gnosis of the Tathagatas and illuminate the mental continua of all sentient beings in the ten directions.

original: 'dis ni chos bstan pa'i las bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni chos bstan pa'i las bshad do //
translated: This explains the activity of teaching the Dharma.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'od zer ni //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'od zer ni //
translated: The light rays of the sun‚Äôs orb

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: üîΩüîΩ

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor las byung ba'i 'od zer la nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'od zer zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor las byung ba'i 'od zer la nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'od zer zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The light rays that arise from the sun‚Äôs orb are called the light rays of the sun‚Äôs orb.

original: 'od zer rnam pa gnyis su 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'od zer rnam pa gnyis su 'jug ste /
translated: The light rays function in two ways:

original: 'dres pa gcig tu 'jug pa dang bya ba gcig tu 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dres pa gcig tu 'jug pa dang bya ba gcig tu 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: they function in a single combination and they function in a single activity.

original: 'dres pa tshad med pa de bzhin du zhes bya bas 'dres pa gcig tu 'jug pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dres pa tshad med pa de bzhin du zhes bya bas 'dres pa gcig tu 'jug pa bstan te /
translated: Just as the sun‚Äôs rays are immeasurable and undifferentiated, so too are the rays of wisdom of the Tathagata.

original: 'dres pa gcig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dres pa gcig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that they are undifferentiated.

original: 'od zer de dag dang po yang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor las byung ba la /
analyzed: 'od zer de dag dang po yang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor las byung ba la /
translated: Those rays first arise from the orb of the sun.

original: byung ba'i tshe na yang dus gcig tu byung zhing tha dad pa mi 'dra ba med par 'byung la /
analyzed: byung ba'i tshe na yang dus gcig tu byung zhing tha dad pa mi 'dra ba med par 'byung la /
translated: When they arise, they arise simultaneously and they arise without being different and distinct.

original: rten kyang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la brten cing 'od zer thams cad snang bar byed par 'od zer gcig gis snang ba'i las byas pa na 'od zer tshad med pa gzhan thams cad kyi snang ba'i las kyang 'od zer gcig po des byas pa yin te /
analyzed: rten kyang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la brten cing 'od zer thams cad snang bar byed par 'od zer gcig gis snang ba'i las byas pa na 'od zer tshad med pa gzhan thams cad kyi snang ba'i las kyang 'od zer gcig po des byas pa yin te /
translated: They are based on the orb of the sun, and when the function of illuminating is performed by one ray of all the rays, the function of illuminating of all the other immeasurable rays is performed by that one ray.

original: 'dres pa'i las byas pa'i don ni de'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa'i las byas pa'i don ni de'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the function of undifferentiation.

original: rtag tu bya ba gcig 'jug cing //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtag tu bya ba gcig 'jug cing // zhes bya ba la /
translated: They always perform the same function.

original: bya ba gcig tu 'jug par bstan te /
analyzed: bya ba gcig tu 'jug par bstan te /
translated: The meaning of the verse is that they perform the same function.

original: bya ba gcig tu 'jug pa'i don ni 'od zer gcig gis 'dam la sogs pa skems par byed pa dang / lo tog la sogs pa smin par byed pa'i las byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: bya ba gcig tu 'jug pa'i don ni 'od zer gcig gis 'dam la sogs pa skems par byed pa dang / lo tog la sogs pa smin par byed pa'i las byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: The meaning of engaging in a single activity is that just as one ray of light dries up mud, etc. and performs the action of ripening crops, etc.,

original: 'od zer gnyis pa dang gsum pa la sogs pa yang gzhan mi byed kyi /
analyzed: 'od zer gnyis pa dang gsum pa la sogs pa yang gzhan mi byed kyi /
translated: so also a second and third ray of light do not perform other actions.

original: skems pa dang smin par byed pa'i las byed par zad pas na bya ba gcig go //
analyzed: skems pa dang smin par byed pa'i las byed par zad pas na bya ba gcig go //
translated: They only perform the actions of drying up and ripening, so they are a single activity.

original: de bzhin zag pa med dbyings na //üîΩ@122b zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin zag pa med dbyings na // @122b zhes bya ba la /
translated: Similarly, in the uncontaminated realm,üîΩthe meaning of the verse is that just as the Bhagavan Buddhas, when dwelling in the uncontaminated realm, engage in a single mixture of Tathagatas,

original: de dang 'dra bar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings na bzhugs pa'i tshe na yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'dres pa gcig tu 'jug ba dang / bya ba gcig tu 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings na bzhugs pa'i tshe na yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'dres pa gcig tu 'jug ba dang / bya ba gcig tu 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: they also engage in a single activity.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi tshad med 'dres pa gcig tu 'jug pa ston te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi tshad med 'dres pa gcig tu 'jug pa ston te /
translated: This shows the Buddhas' engagement in a single mixture of immeasurable qualities.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las ni tshad med pa mdzad na yang nam yang de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gis sems can gcig yongs su smin par mdzad pa na chos kyi sku la tha dad pa med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las ni tshad med pa mdzad na yang nam yang de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gis sems can gcig yongs su smin par mdzad pa na chos kyi sku la tha dad pa med de /
translated: Likewise, although the tathƒÅgatas perform immeasurable activities, when a single tathƒÅgata brings a single sentient being to full maturity, there is no difference in the dharmakƒÅya.

original: chos kyi sku rang bzhin gcig pas na /
analyzed: chos kyi sku rang bzhin gcig pas na /
translated: Since the dharmakƒÅya is of a single nature,

original: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis kyang sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis kyang sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: at that time all tathƒÅgatas bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: 'di ni 'dres pa gcig pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dres pa gcig pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the single mixture.

original: bya ba dag la byed gcig cing //
analyzed: bya ba dag la byed gcig cing //
translated: And in the single performance of actions

original: zhes bya bas byed pa gcig pa'i don bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas byed pa gcig pa'i don bstan to //
translated: This teaches the meaning of the single performance.

original: byed pa gcig pa ni ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gis sprul pa mdzad cing sems can gyi sems kyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa 'dam dang 'dra ba skems par byed pa dang / dge ba'i lo tog smin par mdzad pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan gyis kyang phrin las de kho na mdzad par zad kyi phrin las gzhan ma mdzad pas na bya ba gcig go //üîΩye shes snang ba byed par 'dod //
analyzed: byed pa gcig pa ni ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gis sprul pa mdzad cing sems can gyi sems kyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa 'dam dang 'dra ba skems par byed pa dang / dge ba'i lo tog smin par mdzad pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan gyis kyang phrin las de kho na mdzad par zad kyi phrin las gzhan ma mdzad pas na bya ba gcig go // ye shes snang ba byed par 'dod //
translated: The same activity is that just as one tathagata performs emanations and dries up the swamp of the afflictions in the mindstreams of sentient beings and ripens the crop of virtue, so too other tathagatas perform just that activity and do not perform other activities.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: The light of gnosis is asserted to be the same.üîΩJust as a single ray of sunlight illuminates the entire world, so too a second ray and so on illuminates and pervades all places pervaded by the first.

original: ji ltar nyi ma'i 'od zer gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar bya ba kun du byed pa de bzhin du 'od zer gnyis pa la sogs pas kyang gcig gis khyab pa'i gnas kun du khyab cing snang bar byed pa de dang 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma'i 'od zer gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar bya ba kun du byed pa de bzhin du 'od zer gnyis pa la sogs pas kyang gcig gis khyab pa'i gnas kun du khyab cing snang bar byed pa de dang 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs
translated: In the same way, the tathagatas

original: pa gcig gi ye shes kyis shes bya kun la khyab cing snang ba dang / sprul pa'i las kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: pa gcig gi ye shes kyis shes bya kun la khyab cing snang ba dang / sprul pa'i las kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the wisdom of one Buddha pervades and appears in all objects of knowledge, and his emanations ripen sentient beings,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan gyis kyang ye shes bya kun la snang zhing khyab par byed la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan gyis kyang ye shes bya kun la snang zhing khyab par byed la /
translated: in the same way, other Tathagatas also cause wisdom to appear and pervade all objects of knowledge,

original: sprul pas sems can smin par byed la yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sprul pas sems can smin par byed la yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and their emanations ripen sentient beings.

original: 'dis ni sprul pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i las bstan to //üîΩnyi ma'i 'od zer gcig byung na //
analyzed: 'dis ni sprul pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i las bstan to // nyi ma'i 'od zer gcig byung na //
translated: This teaches the activity of the deeds of emanation and so forth.üîΩJust as when one sunbeam

original: 'od zer thams cad 'byung ba bzhin //
analyzed: 'od zer thams cad 'byung ba bzhin //
translated: arises, all sunbeams arise,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: so it is with the Tathagatas.

original: dper na nyi ma'i 'od zer gcig 'byung ba'i dus na 'od zer gzhan ma byung yang ma yin pa dang / snga phyir byung ba yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na nyi ma'i 'od zer gcig 'byung ba'i dus na 'od zer gzhan ma byung yang ma yin pa dang / snga phyir byung ba yang ma yin gyi /
translated: For example, when one sunbeam arises, it is not that the other sunbeams do not arise, nor that they arise earlier and later.

original: thams cad dus gcig tu 'byung ba de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don @123a * //üîΩto ; / de bzhin sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang //
analyzed: thams cad dus gcig tu 'byung ba de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don @123a * //üîΩto ; / de bzhin sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang //
translated: Rather, all of them arise simultaneously.

original: ye shes 'byung bar shes par bya //
analyzed: ye shes 'byung bar shes par bya //
translated: One should know that the Buddha's intuition is like that.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩde dang 'dra bar sangs rgyas kyi ye shes shes bya la 'jug pa na shes bya kha cig ni mkhyen kha cig ni mkhyen ce'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / de dang 'dra bar sangs rgyas kyi ye shes shes bya la 'jug pa na shes bya kha cig ni mkhyen kha cig ni mkhyen ce'am /
translated: In this verse,üîΩwhen the Buddha's intuition engages its object, it does not happen that it knows some things and does not know other things, or that it knows some things earlier and other things later.

original: kha cig ni sngar mkhyen kha cig ni phyis mkhyen zhes bya ba med par dus gcig tu phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i shes bya rnam pa sna tshogs ma lus pa mkhyen to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kha cig ni sngar mkhyen kha cig ni phyis mkhyen zhes bya ba med par dus gcig tu phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i shes bya rnam pa sna tshogs ma lus pa mkhyen to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is said that all objects of knowledge, the aggregates, elements, etc., are simultaneously known in their manifold aspects.

original: 'dis ni ye shes 'jug pa'i las bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ye shes 'jug pa'i las bstan to //
translated: This shows the function of the intuition's engagement.

original: ji ltar nyi ma'i 'od zer ni //
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma'i 'od zer ni //
translated: The sun's rays

original: 'jug pa bdag gir bya ba med //
analyzed: 'jug pa bdag gir bya ba med //
translated: are engaged without any sense of possession.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: dper na nyi ma'i 'od zer 'dis snang bar bya ba'i gnas sems can dang gling dag tu snang bar byed pa la 'jug cing /
analyzed: dper na nyi ma'i 'od zer 'dis snang bar bya ba'i gnas sems can dang gling dag tu snang bar byed pa la 'jug cing /
translated: for example, the sun's rays are engaged in illuminating the places to be illuminated, sentient beings and the continents, and they do not think,

original: gnas 'di dag tu ni bdag gis snang bar bya /
analyzed: gnas 'di dag tu ni bdag gis snang bar bya /
translated: I illuminate these places.

original: 'di dag tu ni mi bya zhes rtog pa dang / 'od zer de dag ni bdag gi 'od zer yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag tu ni mi bya zhes rtog pa dang / 'od zer de dag ni bdag gi 'od zer yin te /
translated: Here, the meaning is that he does not think, I should not do this, or These light rays are mine,

original: 'od zer 'dis kun du snang bar bya'o snyam du mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'od zer 'dis kun du snang bar bya'o snyam du mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and by these light rays, I should illuminate everything.

original: de bzhin sangs rgyas ye shes kyang //üîΩ'jug pa bdag gir bya ba med //
analyzed: de bzhin sangs rgyas ye shes kyang // 'jug pa bdag gir bya ba med //
translated: Likewise, the Buddha's gnosis

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: does not engage with the thought of an inner self.

original: de bzhin du gang zag dang chos la bdag med par thugs su chud nas nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa ye shes bzhis sems can rnams la phan pa dang / bde ba dag la 'jug pa nang dang bdag tu rtog pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zag dang chos la bdag med par thugs su chud nas nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa ye shes bzhis sems can rnams la phan pa dang / bde ba dag la 'jug pa nang dang bdag tu rtog pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, the meaning is that, having realized the selflessness of persons and phenomena, the four kinds of gnosis, such as the mirror-like gnosis, which have eliminated the afflictive and cognitive obscurations, do not engage with the thoughts of an inner self or an objective self in order to bring about the benefit and happiness of sentient beings.

original: 'dis ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i las bstan to //üîΩnyi ma'i 'od zer gcig btang bas //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i las bstan to // nyi ma'i 'od zer gcig btang bas //
translated: This shows the activity of nonconceptuality.üîΩJust as a single ray of sunlight

original: ji ltar 'jig rten snang byed bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten snang byed bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: illuminates the world,

original: nyi ma'i 'od zer stong dang ldan par 'dod de /
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od zer stong dang ldan par 'dod de /
translated: The sun is held to have a thousand rays.

original: de las kyang 'od gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams dang gling thams cad du snang bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las kyang 'od gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams dang gling thams cad du snang bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And from it, one ray illuminates all the world-realms and continents.

original: de bzhin shes bya thams cad la //üîΩsangs rgyas ye shes cig car snang //
analyzed: de bzhin shes bya thams cad la // sangs rgyas ye shes cig car snang //
translated: So it is with the buddhas' gnosis.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is held that the buddhas' gnosis is like the sun.üîΩJust as the sun's rays are held to be obscured by clouds and so on,

original: dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor du de dang nye ba'i gzugs rnams ji snyed yod pa thams cad dus gcig tu snang ba de bzhin du shes par bya ba'i chos phung po dang khams la sogs pa ji snyed yod pa thams cad la ye shes cig carüîΩ'jug ste / thogs pa med par dus gcig tu thams cad thugs su chud ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dper na me long gi dkyil 'khor du de dang nye ba'i gzugs rnams ji snyed yod pa thams cad dus gcig tu snang ba de bzhin du shes par bya ba'i chos phung po dang khams la sogs pa ji snyed yod pa thams cad la ye shes cig car 'jug ste / thogs pa med par dus gcig tu thams cad thugs su chud ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: so too is the buddhas' gnosis held to be obscured by the obscurations of sentient beings.

original: 'dis ni sna tshogs kyi rnam pa ye shes kyi las bstan to //üîΩji ltar nyi ma'i 'od zer la //
analyzed: 'dis ni sna tshogs kyi rnam pa ye shes kyi las bstan to // ji ltar nyi ma'i 'od zer la //
translated: This verse shows that the buddhas' gnosis is like the sun.

original: @123b sprin la sogs pas bsgrib par 'dod //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @123b sprin la sogs pas bsgrib par 'dod //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: Just as the sun's rays are held to be obscured by clouds and so on,üîΩso too is the buddhas' gnosis held to be obscured by the obscurations of sentient beings.

original: dper na nyi ma'i 'od zer kun du snang ba bkye yang /
analyzed: dper na nyi ma'i 'od zer kun du snang ba bkye yang /
translated: For example, although the sun's light rays shine everywhere,

original: sprin dang khang khyim dang skyabs la sogs pas bsgribs na 'od zer mi snang ste /
analyzed: sprin dang khang khyim dang skyabs la sogs pas bsgribs na 'od zer mi snang ste /
translated: if they are obscured by clouds, houses, shelters, etc., the light rays are not seen.

original: nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis bsgribs te mi snang bar byas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde bzhin sangs rgyas ye shes la //
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis bsgribs te mi snang bar byas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // de bzhin sangs rgyas ye shes la //
translated: The meaning is that the sun's light rays are not obscured and not seen.üîΩLikewise, the obscurations of sentient beings

original: sgrib pa sems can nyes ldan pas //
analyzed: sgrib pa sems can nyes ldan pas //
translated: with faults prevent the wisdom of the Buddhas.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,üîΩjust as the sun's light rays are obscured by clouds, etc.,

original: de dang 'dra bar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis sems can gyi don du ye shes kyi 'od zer kun du btang yang sems can gyis sprul pa'i sku la sogs pa mi mthong ba ni sems can rnams kyi rgyud la snod du mi 'gyur ba'i sgrib pa
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis sems can gyi don du ye shes kyi 'od zer kun du btang yang sems can gyis sprul pa'i sku la sogs pa mi mthong ba ni sems can rnams kyi rgyud la snod du mi 'gyur ba'i sgrib pa
translated: in the same way, although the BhagavƒÅn Buddhas have sent forth the light rays of wisdom for the sake of sentient beings, sentient beings do not see the nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya, etc. The meaning is that they do not see it because the continuums of sentient beings have the obscurations that prevent them from becoming vessels

original: rtog pa lnga la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang ldan pas na ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtog pa lnga la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang ldan pas na ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and because they have the faults of the five concepts, etc.

original: 'dis ni ye shes mi 'jug pa'i las bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ye shes mi 'jug pa'i las bstan to //
translated: This shows the function of the non-engagement of wisdom.

original: ji ltar mdud pa'i dbang gis na //
analyzed: ji ltar mdud pa'i dbang gis na //
translated: Just as a cloth is dyed in various places

original: gos la mtshon bkra ri mo bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gos la mtshon bkra ri mo bzhin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: by the power of the knots,üîΩso too is the gnosis of liberation of the TathƒÅgatas.

original: dper na gos dkar po'i mtshan nyid rang bzhin gcig kyang mdud pa bor nas tshon du bcos na gang du mdud pa ma bor bar ni tshon gyis zhen la /
analyzed: dper na gos dkar po'i mtshan nyid rang bzhin gcig kyang mdud pa bor nas tshon du bcos na gang du mdud pa ma bor bar ni tshon gyis zhen la /
translated: For example, a cloth that has the characteristic of being white has a single nature. But if it is dyed with colors after knots are tied in it, the dye adheres in the places where the knots are untied.

original: gang du mdud pa bor bar ri mo bkra ba de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang du mdud pa bor bar ri mo bkra ba de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is variegated.

original: de bzhin 'phen pa'i dbang gis ni //
analyzed: de bzhin 'phen pa'i dbang gis ni //
translated: So too, by the power of aspiration,

original: grol ba'i ye shes ri mo bkra //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: grol ba'i ye shes ri mo bkra // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the gnosis of liberation is variegated.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i zag pa med pa'i dbyings stong pa nyid du ro gcig mod kyi /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i zag pa med pa'i dbyings stong pa nyid du ro gcig mod kyi /
translated: For example, the uncontaminated realm is of one taste in emptiness.

original: sngon byang chub sems dpa'i dus na smon lam btab pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i shugs kyis na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rnam par grol ba'i ye shes ri mo bkra ste /
analyzed: sngon byang chub sems dpa'i dus na smon lam btab pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i shugs kyis na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rnam par grol ba'i ye shes ri mo bkra ste /
translated: But by the power of the prayers of aspiration made in the past when they were bodhisattvas and the accumulation of the power of the collections of merit and wisdom, the gnosis of liberation of the tathƒÅgatas is variegated.

original: ye shes rnam pa bzhi mnga' ba dang / ye shes des kyang shes bya thams cad thugs su chud pa dang / sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul pa la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ye shes rnam pa bzhi mnga' ba dang / ye shes des kyang shes bya thams cad thugs su chud pa dang / sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul pa la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because he possesses the four kinds of exalted wisdom, because he has realized all objects of knowledge by means of that exalted wisdom, and because he emits various emanations of body, speech, and mind.

original: 'dis ni rnam par grol ba mtshungs pa la ye shes kyi bye brag gi las bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam par grol ba mtshungs pa la ye shes kyi bye brag gi las bstan to //
translated: This shows the activity of the distinctive exalted wisdom in the equality of liberation.

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩnyon mongs pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid du ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa 'dra mod kyi nyan thos la sogs pas shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po ma bsags pas ye shes bzhi dang /üîΩsprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'gyed par mi nus pas na rnam par grol @124a * //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid du ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa 'dra mod kyi nyan thos la sogs pas shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po ma bsags pas ye shes bzhi dang / sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'gyed par mi nus pas na rnam par grol @124a * //
translated: How is that?üîΩThe sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and tathagatas are similar in that they have the characteristic of abandoning the afflictions. However, the sravakas and so on are not able to emit various kinds of emanations because they have not abandoned the obscurations to omniscience, they have not accumulated the great collections of merit and wisdom, and they do not possess the four kinds of exalted wisdom.

original: ba bkra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ba bkra ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore their liberation is not variegated.

original: zag pa med pa'i dbyings ni zab pa rgya che bar bshad nas /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbyings ni zab pa rgya che bar bshad nas /
translated: The profound and vastness of the uncontaminated realm has been explained.

original: don de nyid bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: A verse summarizing the topics discussed

original: dri med dbyings kyang zab pa ni //
analyzed: dri med dbyings kyang zab pa ni //
translated: . The uncontaminated realm is also profoundüîΩin terms of its characteristics, its abode, and its actions,

original: mtshan dang gnas dang las rnams dang // sangs rgyas rnams kyis de bshad pa //
analyzed: mtshan dang gnas dang las rnams dang // sangs rgyas rnams kyis de bshad pa //
translated: which the buddhas have explained.

original: tshon gyis nam mkhar ri mo 'dri //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshon gyis nam mkhar ri mo 'dri // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is like painting the sky with colors.

original: dri ma med pa'i dbyings ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i dbyings ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings so //
translated: The uncontaminated realm is the uncontaminated realm of the buddhas.

original: zag pa med pa'i dbyings de ni gzung 'dzin gyi spros pa thams cad las 'das pas na nam mkha' ltar zab pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbyings de ni gzung 'dzin gyi spros pa thams cad las 'das pas na nam mkha' ltar zab pa ste /
translated: That uncontaminated realm is profound like space, because it transcends all the constructs of subject and object.

original: de yang zab pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de yang zab pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Moreover, it is threefold:

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: mtshan nyid zab pa dang / gnas zab pa dang / las zab pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid zab pa dang / gnas zab pa dang / las zab pa'o //
translated: The profound characteristic, the profound abode, and the profound action.

original: de gsum sangs rgyas kyis bshad pa ni tshon gyis nam mkha' la ri mo 'dri ba dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de gsum sangs rgyas kyis bshad pa ni tshon gyis nam mkha' la ri mo 'dri ba dang 'dra ste /
translated: The buddhas have explained these three, which are like painting the sky with colors.

original: dper na skyes bu la la zhig gis tshon gyis nam mkha' la ri mo 'dri bar byed na de ni shin tu dka' ba spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu la la zhig gis tshon gyis nam mkha' la ri mo 'dri bar byed na de ni shin tu dka' ba spyod pa yin no //
translated: For example, if someone were to paint the sky with colors, that would be extremely difficult.

original: 'on kyang skyes bu mkhas pa des tshon gyis nam mkha' la ri mo 'dri bar byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang skyes bu mkhas pa des tshon gyis nam mkha' la ri mo 'dri bar byed do //
translated: But the wise man would paint a picture in the sky with the colors.

original: de ni shin tu ngo mtshar du bya'o //
analyzed: de ni shin tu ngo mtshar du bya'o //
translated: That would be a great wonder.

original: de dang 'dra bar zag pa med pa'i dbyings ni 'phags pa rnams kyi ye shes kyis so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i chos yin te /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar zag pa med pa'i dbyings ni 'phags pa rnams kyi ye shes kyis so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i chos yin te /
translated: In the same way, the realm of Dharma is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones, to be realized by each one for himself.

original: tshig tu brjod pa mi nus na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mtshan nyid zab pa dang / gnas zab pa dang / las zab pa'i sgo nas tshigs su bcad pa ni kun du dka' bar spyod pa ste /
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa mi nus na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mtshan nyid zab pa dang / gnas zab pa dang / las zab pa'i sgo nas tshigs su bcad pa ni kun du dka' bar spyod pa ste /
translated: If it cannot be expressed in words, then the TathƒÅgatas have made it difficult to practice by means of the profound characteristics, the profound abode, and the profound activity.

original: ngo mtshar du bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ngo mtshar du bya ba yin no //
translated: It is a great wonder.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: spros pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is free from conceptual elaboration means because it is free from the duality of object and subject.

original: chos kyi dbyings de sems can la yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
