analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de sems can la yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the realm of Dharma exists in sentient beings,

original: thams cad bye brag med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig smos so //
analyzed: thams cad bye brag med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig smos so //
translated: One verse on the absence of distinctions in reality.

original: de bzhin nyid ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: Reality is the nature of the selflessness of persons and things.

original: bdag med pa gnyis kyis ni dngos po kun la khyab po //
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis kyis ni dngos po kun la khyab po //
translated: And it is undifferentiated, since it is the same in all things.

original: de las kyang so so'i skye bo rnams la yod pa'i gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa dang / 'phags pa rnams la yod pa'i gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa gnyis su tha dad pa med pas na bye brag med pa zhes bya'o //üîΩde bzhin nyid ni dag gyur pas //
analyzed: de las kyang so so'i skye bo rnams la yod pa'i gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa dang / 'phags pa rnams la yod pa'i gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa gnyis su tha dad pa med pas na bye brag med pa zhes bya'o // de bzhin nyid ni dag gyur pas //
translated: It is called undifferentiated because there is no difference between the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of things, both of which exist for worldlings and the noble ones.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The verse states that the Tathagata is the reality of the purified Dharma Realm.

original: de bzhin nyid @124b ni kun la yod mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid @124b ni kun la yod mod kyi /
translated: The Dharma Realm is the reality of all things.

original: nam bdag med pa gnyis nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa glo bur dang bral te /
analyzed: nam bdag med pa gnyis nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa glo bur dang bral te /
translated: But when it is purified of the two obscurations, addictive and objective, which are adventitious to it,

original: dag par gyur pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dag par gyur pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then it is called the Tathagata.

original: de'i phyir / de yi stong pa lus can kun //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de yi stong pa lus can kun // zhes bya ba la /
translated: its emptiness is in all embodied beings.

original: de ltar de bzhin nyid sems can la yod pas na de'i phyir sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩ'byor pa rnam par dbye ba tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig go zhes bya ba la /üîΩzag pa med pa'i dbyings zab pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin nyid sems can la yod pas na de'i phyir sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // 'byor pa rnam par dbye ba tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig go zhes bya ba la / zag pa med pa'i dbyings zab pa bshad nas /
translated: Thus, because suchness exists in sentient beings, therefore all sentient beings have the essence of the Tathagata. This is the meaning of the verse.üîΩThe eleven verses beginning with ‚ÄúThe realm of Dharma is the emptiness of that‚Äù explain the five perfections of the uncontaminated realm:

original: da tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig gis zag pa med pa'i dbyings de 'byor pa dang / bde ba dang / skyid pa dang longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa lnga pa dang ldan par ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: da tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig gis zag pa med pa'i dbyings de 'byor pa dang / bde ba dang / skyid pa dang longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa lnga pa dang ldan par ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: perfection of mastery, perfection of bliss, perfection of joy, perfection of wealth, and perfection of retinue.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi 'byor pas ni //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi 'byor pas ni //
translated: The mastery of the Listeners

original: 'jig rten pa yi zil gyis gnon //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi zil gyis gnon //
translated: surpasses that of the worldly.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyi bsdus pa'i don ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings na mthu'i mchog gi khyad par ldan pas sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'byor pa'i khyad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyi bsdus pa'i don ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings na mthu'i mchog gi khyad par ldan pas sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'byor pa'i khyad bstan pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the two verses beginning with ‚Äúthus‚Äù is that the special qualities of the buddhas‚Äô mastery are taught, since they possess the special quality of the supreme power in the uncontaminated realm.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang / mngon par shes pa rnams kyis ni 'jig rten pa'i bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dang / drang srong gi mngon par shes pa la sogs pa 'byor pa zil gyis gnon te /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang / mngon par shes pa rnams kyis ni 'jig rten pa'i bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dang / drang srong gi mngon par shes pa la sogs pa 'byor pa zil gyis gnon te /
translated: The accumulations of merit and wisdom and the superknowledges of the sravakas surpass the mundane accumulations of merit and wisdom and the superknowledges of the sages and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'jig rten pa'i 'byor pa bas ni nyan thos kyi 'byor pa khyad zhugs zhing rgya che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i 'byor pa bas ni nyan thos kyi 'byor pa khyad zhugs zhing rgya che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the sravakas‚Äô mastery is superior and greater than the mundane mastery.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa yis ni /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa yis ni /
translated: The level of the pratyekabuddhas

original: nyan thos kyi ni zil gyis gnon //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi ni zil gyis gnon //üîΩces bya ba la /
translated: surpasses that of the sravakas.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang / mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyis nyan thos kyi 'byor pa zil gyis gnon te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang / mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyis nyan thos kyi 'byor pa zil gyis gnon te /
translated: The accumulations of merit and wisdom of the Bodhisattva grounds and the qualities of superknowledge and so forth surpass the riches of the Sravakas,

original: de bas 'phags shing rgya che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas 'phags shing rgya che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are superior and more vast.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'byor pa yi //üîΩde yi char yang nyer mi 'gro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'byor pa yi // de yi char yang nyer mi 'gro //
translated: The riches of the Bodhisattvas

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: do not approach even a fraction of that.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang / mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi thad nas sangs rgyas kyi yon tan brgya'i cha stong gi cha /üîΩbye ba'i char yang mi 'gro zhes bya bas na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang / mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi thad nas sangs rgyas kyi yon tan brgya'i cha stong gi cha / bye ba'i char yang mi 'gro zhes bya bas na /
translated: In terms of the accumulations of merit and wisdom of the Bodhisattvas and the qualities of superknowledge and so forth, the qualities of the Buddhas do not approach even a hundredth, a thousandth,üîΩa hundred thousandth part.

original: grangs dang bgrang ba dang / dpe la sogs par yang mi rung ngo zhes @125a * //üîΩbya ba'i don to //
analyzed: grangs dang bgrang ba dang / dpe la sogs par yang mi rung ngo zhes @125a * // bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, it is said that they are not suitable as a number, a count, or a simile.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'byor pa yi //üîΩde yi char yang nyer mi 'gro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'byor pa yi // de yi char yang nyer mi 'gro //
translated: The riches of the Tathagatas

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: do not approach even a fraction of that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang / mngon par shes pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi thad nas byang chub sems dpa'i 'byor pa dang / yon tan brgya'i cha dang / stong dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang / mngon par shes pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi thad nas byang chub sems dpa'i 'byor pa dang / yon tan brgya'i cha dang / stong dang /
translated: In terms of the accumulations of merit and wisdom of the tathagatas, their superknowledges, their strengths, their fearlessnesses and so forth, the bodhisattvas' riches and qualities do not approach even a hundredth part,

original: bye ba'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bye ba'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: a thousandth or a hundred thousandth part of those of the tathagatas.

original: sa bcu'i sa bcu pa las kyang /
analyzed: sa bcu'i sa bcu pa las kyang /
translated: The Ten Levels Sutra says:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa'i yul dang byin gyi rlabs 'di yang de ltar tshad med pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod yul dang yul 'jug pa ci 'dra /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa'i yul dang byin gyi rlabs 'di yang de ltar tshad med pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyod yul dang yul 'jug pa ci 'dra /
translated: O child of the conquerors, the domain of the bodhisattvas' activities and their blessings are also like that, immeasurable. How is it that the domain and objects of activity of the tathagatas are engaged?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje snying pos smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje snying pos smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Vajra garbha said:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /
translated: O child of the conquerors, it is like this.

original: dper na mi la la zhig gis 'jig rten gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas rde'u rgya shug gi tshi gu tsam gnyis sam gsum blangs te /üîΩ'di skad du /
analyzed: dper na mi la la zhig gis 'jig rten gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas rde'u rgya shug gi tshi gu tsam gnyis sam gsum blangs te / 'di skad du /
translated: For example, suppose someone were to take two or three pebbles the size of juniper berries from a world system with four continents and say:

original: 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa dag na sa'i khams ji snyed cig yod /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa dag na sa'i khams ji snyed cig yod /
translated: How many earth elements are there in limitless world systems?

original: rde'u 'di las ji tsam zhig gis lhag par 'phags shing lhag par tshad med ces zer ba zhig yod na /
analyzed: rde'u 'di las ji tsam zhig gis lhag par 'phags shing lhag par tshad med ces zer ba zhig yod na /
translated: By how much does this pebble surpass that, and by how much is it limitless?

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras de ltar khyod de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i ye shes tshad med pa mnga' ba rnams kyi chos nyid la byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid kyis 'jal ba ni khyod kyis tshig 'di dang 'dra bar bdag gi dpags
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras de ltar khyod de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i ye shes tshad med pa mnga' ba rnams kyi chos nyid la byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid kyis 'jal ba ni khyod kyis tshig 'di dang 'dra bar bdag gi dpags
translated: O son of noble family, in that way, when you measure the reality of the tathƒÅgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened ones, who possess immeasurable pristine wisdom, with the reality of a bodhisattva, you are like the person who measures the earth element of limitless world systems with a few pebbles the size of juniper berries.

original: so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: You should understand this statement in the same way as that statement.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa'i bsdus pa'i don ni rnam par rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par dang / zab pa'i khyad par nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi 'byor pa tshad med pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab par ston te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa'i bsdus pa'i don ni rnam par rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par dang / zab pa'i khyad par nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi 'byor pa tshad med pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab par ston te /
translated: The condensed meaning of the third verse shows the immeasurability and inconceivability of the Buddha‚Äôs wealth through the distinction of differentiation and the distinction of profundity.

original: rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par gyis na tshad med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par gyis na tshad med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Through the distinction of differentiation, it is called ‚Äúimmeasurable.‚Äù

original: tshig gi sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'byor pa la grangs kyis 'di snyed cig yod ces bcad par mi nus pas na tshad med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gi sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'byor pa la grangs kyis 'di snyed cig yod ces bcad par mi nus pas na tshad med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is not possible to delimit the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs wealth by number, saying, ‚ÄúIt is this much,‚Äù it is called ‚Äúimmeasurable.‚Äù

original: zab pa'i khyad par gyis na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zab pa'i khyad par gyis na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya ste /
translated: Through the distinction of profundity, it is called ‚Äúinconceivable.‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'byor pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i sems kyi spyod yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'byor pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i sems kyi spyod yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs wealth is beyond the range of experience of the minds of ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'byor ba ni //üîΩbsam yas dpag tu med par 'dod //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'byor ba ni // bsam yas dpag tu med par 'dod //
translated: The wealth of the buddhas

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: is asserted to be inconceivable and immeasurable.üîΩHere,

original: de bzhin gshegs @125b pa rnams kyi 'byor ba dang longs spyod ni bsam gyis mi khyab par 'dod pa dang / dpag tu med par 'dod de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @125b pa rnams kyi 'byor ba dang longs spyod ni bsam gyis mi khyab par 'dod pa dang / dpag tu med par 'dod de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The wealth and enjoyment of the Tathagatas are asserted to be inconceivable and immeasurable.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: What does that mean?

original: 'byor pa zab pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems kyi yul las 'das pas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //üîΩrab tu dbye ba mtha' yas te //
analyzed: 'byor pa zab pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems kyi yul las 'das pas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o // rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas te //
translated: They are inconceivable because they are profound wealth, beyond the scope of the minds of Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: grangs kyis 'di snyed cig yod do //
analyzed: grangs kyis 'di snyed cig yod do //
translated: They are immeasurable because they are infinite in their differentiation.üîΩThey cannot be measured by saying, ‚ÄúThere are this many.‚Äù

original: zhes tshig gis bcad par mi nus pas na dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes tshig gis bcad par mi nus pas na dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: They are inconceivable because they are immeasurable.

original: ji ltar tshad med pa dang / ji ltar na bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir / gang gis gang du ji lta dang // ji tsam gang du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar tshad med pa dang / ji ltar na bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin zhe na / de'i phyir / gang gis gang du ji lta dang // ji tsam gang du 'jug pa'o //
translated: How are they immeasurable? How are they inconceivable?üîΩTherefore he says:

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: By whom, where, how, to what extent, and where they are applied.

original: gang zag gi don du 'jug pa nyid kyang tshad med cing bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
analyzed: gang zag gi don du 'jug pa nyid kyang tshad med cing bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
translated: The application for the sake of persons is also immeasurable and inconceivable.

original: gang zag gcig gnyis kyi don du zhugs pa ma yin gyi sems can tshad med pa'i don du zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag gcig gnyis kyi don du zhugs pa ma yin gyi sems can tshad med pa'i don du zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not engaged for the sake of one or two persons, but for the sake of immeasurable sentient beings.

original: gang du 'jug pa yang bsam yas shing dpag tu med de /
analyzed: gang du 'jug pa yang bsam yas shing dpag tu med de /
translated: The place of engagement is also inconceivable and immeasurable.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gnyis su med pa'i sems can gyi don la zhugs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gnyis su med pa'i sems can gyi don la zhugs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not engaged for the sake of sentient beings in two world systems,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but for the sake of sentient beings in immeasurable world systems.

original: ji ltar zhugs pa yang bsams yas shing dpag tu med de /
analyzed: ji ltar zhugs pa yang bsams yas shing dpag tu med de /
translated: The manner of engagement is also inconceivable and immeasurable.

original: rnam pa'am thabs sam rgyu gcig gnyis kyis 'byor pa bsgrub pa ma yin gyi rgyu dang thabs kyi rnam pa dpag tu med pas bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa'am thabs sam rgyu gcig gnyis kyis 'byor pa bsgrub pa ma yin gyi rgyu dang thabs kyi rnam pa dpag tu med pas bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not accomplished by one or two aspects, methods, or causes, but is accomplished by immeasurable aspects, methods, and causes.

original: ji tsam du 'jug pa yang bsam yas shing dpag tu med de /
analyzed: ji tsam du 'jug pa yang bsam yas shing dpag tu med de /
translated: The extent of engagement is also inconceivable and immeasurable.

original: sems can la la la phan pa dang / bde ba mang po byas pa phan mang po btags pa yang grangs med la /
analyzed: sems can la la la phan pa dang / bde ba mang po byas pa phan mang po btags pa yang grangs med la /
translated: Having done much benefit and happiness for some sentient beings, the benefit is immeasurable.

original: sems can la la la phan pa dang / bde ba kun du phan btags pa'i nyung dus phan btags pa yang grangs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can la la la phan pa dang / bde ba kun du phan btags pa'i nyung dus phan btags pa yang grangs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he benefits some sentient beings with a little benefit and happiness, and he benefits countless sentient beings with a great deal of benefit and happiness.

original: dus ji srid cig tu 'jug pa bsam yas shing dpag tu med de /
analyzed: dus ji srid cig tu 'jug pa bsam yas shing dpag tu med de /
translated: The duration of his activity is inconceivable and immeasurable,

original: bskal pa grangs med pa'i par 'jug cing sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa'i par 'jug cing sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he engages in and accomplishes it for countless eons.

original: tshigs su bcad pa lhag ma rnams kyis ni gzhan du 'gyur ba'i khyad par gyis 'byor pa'i khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa lhag ma rnams kyis ni gzhan du 'gyur ba'i khyad par gyis 'byor pa'i khyad par bstan to //
translated: The remaining verses show the difference in mastery by the difference in transformation.

original: 'byor pa'i khyad par bstan pa la tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig gis 'byung ba las /
analyzed: 'byor pa'i khyad par bstan pa la tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig gis 'byung ba las /
translated: The eleven verses on the demonstration of mastery are to be understood as follows.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyi don bshad nas phyi nas tshigs su bcad pa lhag ma brgyad kyis ni phung po lnga gnas gzhan du gyur pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas sangs rgyas kyi 'byor pa dang / longs spyod kyang tha dad pa mang po yod do zhes ston to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyi don bshad nas phyi nas tshigs su bcad pa lhag ma brgyad kyis ni phung po lnga gnas gzhan du gyur pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas sangs rgyas kyi 'byor pa dang / longs spyod kyang tha dad pa mang po yod do zhes ston to //
translated: Having explained the meaning of the first three verses, the remaining eight verses show that the Buddha's mastery is manifold, since the transformation of the five aggregates is manifold.

original: chos 'di'i gnas gyur na 'byor pa 'di @126a * //
analyzed: chos 'di'i gnas gyur na 'byor pa 'di @126a * //
translated: If one attains mastery over this Dharma, one attains these excellences.

original: thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs par ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs par ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the above passage.

original: dbang po lnga rnams gzhan gyur na //
analyzed: dbang po lnga rnams gzhan gyur na //
translated: When the five faculties are transformed,

original: 'byor pa'i mchog kyang thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'byor pa'i mchog kyang thob par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: one attains the highest mastery.

original: dbang po drug las yid kyi dbang po bzhag ste mig gi dbang po nas lus kyi dbang po'i bar du dbang po lnga gzhan du gyur te dag par gyur na 'byor pa'i mchog dam pa rnam pa gnyis thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang po drug las yid kyi dbang po bzhag ste mig gi dbang po nas lus kyi dbang po'i bar du dbang po lnga gzhan du gyur te dag par gyur na 'byor pa'i mchog dam pa rnam pa gnyis thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Of the six faculties, the mental faculty is set aside. When the five faculties from the eye to the body are transformed, purified, one attains the highest, the most excellent, mastery.

original: kun gyi don kun 'jug pa dang // zhes bya ba la /üîΩkun ni mig gi dbang po nas lus kyi dbang po'i bar du dbang po lnga la bya'o //
analyzed: kun gyi don kun 'jug pa dang // zhes bya ba la / kun ni mig gi dbang po nas lus kyi dbang po'i bar du dbang po lnga la bya'o //
translated: Engaging all objects of all.üîΩAll refers to the five faculties from the eye to the body.

original: don kun ni gzugs nas reg bya'i bar yul lnga la bya ste /
analyzed: don kun ni gzugs nas reg bya'i bar yul lnga la bya ste /
translated: All objects refers to the five objects from form to tactility.

original: sngon dbang po ma dag pa'i dus na ni mig gi dbang pos kyang gzugs 'ba' zhig la 'jug par nus kyi /
analyzed: sngon dbang po ma dag pa'i dus na ni mig gi dbang pos kyang gzugs 'ba' zhig la 'jug par nus kyi /
translated: In the past, when the faculties were impure, the eye faculty was only able to engage with form,

original: sgra la sogs pa'i yul lhag ma la 'jug par mi nus pa las gnas gzhan du gyur te dag par gyur na mig gi dbang po 'ba' zhig gis gzugs la blta bar nus pa nas /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa'i yul lhag ma la 'jug par mi nus pa las gnas gzhan du gyur te dag par gyur na mig gi dbang po 'ba' zhig gis gzugs la blta bar nus pa nas /
translated: but it was not able to engage with the remaining objects such as sound. When the eye faculty transforms into another state and becomes pure, the eye faculty alone is able to see form,

original: sgra la nyan pa dang / reg bya la shes par nus pa'i bar du dbang po lhag ma rnams kyi las kun kyang byed par nus te /
analyzed: sgra la nyan pa dang / reg bya la shes par nus pa'i bar du dbang po lhag ma rnams kyi las kun kyang byed par nus te /
translated: and it is also able to hear sound, and to know tactile objects. In this way, it is able to perform the functions of all the remaining faculties.

original: 'di ni 'byor pa mchog thob pa rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni 'byor pa mchog thob pa rnam pa gcig go //
translated: This is the first type of attainment of the highest mastery.üîΩThe second type of attainment of the highest mastery is described in the lines:

original: brgya rtsa bcu gnyis yon tan 'byung //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩdbang po gcig cing yang yon tan brgya rtsa bcu gnyis bcu gnyis dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: brgya rtsa bcu gnyis yon tan 'byung // zhes bya ba la / dbang po gcig cing yang yon tan brgya rtsa bcu gnyis bcu gnyis dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: The qualities of the faculties arise in a hundred and twelve ways.üîΩThe qualities of the faculties arise in a hundred and twelve ways.

original: dbang po gcig cing yon tan de snyed dang ldan pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: dbang po gcig cing yon tan de snyed dang ldan pa'i yon tan no //
translated: The qualities of the faculties arise in a hundred and twelve ways.

original: 'phags pa gzungs kyi dbang phyug chen po'i rgyal po dang // dam pa'i chos punda r'i ka la sogs pa'i mdo sde las 'byung ba bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa gzungs kyi dbang phyug chen po'i rgyal po dang // dam pa'i chos punda r'i ka la sogs pa'i mdo sde las 'byung ba bzhin du blta'o //
translated: One should see it as it appears in the noble Great King of Formulae of the Lord of Great Power, and in the sutra collection such as the Pu·πá·∏çarƒ´ka of the True Dharma.

original: 'di 'byor pa mchog thob pa rnam pa gnyis pa'o //üîΩrgal ba gal te gnyis la sogs pa phyi'i yul med de /
analyzed: 'di 'byor pa mchog thob pa rnam pa gnyis pa'o // rgal ba gal te gnyis la sogs pa phyi'i yul med de /
translated: This is the second kind of attainment of the highest prosperity.

original: ri bong gi rva bzhin du yin na dbang po lnga ji ltar gnas gzhan du 'gyur /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva bzhin du yin na dbang po lnga ji ltar gnas gzhan du 'gyur /
translated: Objection: If the external object such as the two does not exist, like the horn of a rabbit, how can the five sense organs change to another state?üîΩIn response, it is said:

original: lan du / rang gi sa bon gang dag la //
analyzed: lan du / rang gi sa bon gang dag la //
translated: Whatever seeds

original: rnam rig snang ba gang 'byung ba //
analyzed: rnam rig snang ba gang 'byung ba //
translated: from which the appearance of consciousness arises,üîΩthe Sage has taught

original: skye mched rnam pa gnyis so zhes //üîΩde dang de dag thub pas gsungs //
analyzed: skye mched rnam pa gnyis so zhes // de dang de dag thub pas gsungs //
translated: those two kinds of sense bases.

original: zhes rnam par shes pa tsam du ston pa'i bstan bcos las 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes rnam par shes pa tsam du ston pa'i bstan bcos las 'byung ste /
translated: This is from the treatise demonstrating consciousness only.

original: de'i don ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bag chags dang / sa bon yod pa nas mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa drug 'byung ba la ni nang gi skye mched drug du bshad /
analyzed: de'i don ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bag chags dang / sa bon yod pa nas mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa drug 'byung ba la ni nang gi skye mched drug du bshad /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: The six sense faculties are explained as the six internal sense bases from the existence of the latent tendencies of apprehendeds and apprehenders and seeds in the foundation consciousness to the arising of the six consciousnesses from eye consciousness to mental consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa de dag @126b las kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa las kyang gzugs su snang ba 'byung ba las yid kyi rnam par shes pa las chos su snang ba 'byung ba ni phyi'i skye mched du bshad de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de dag @126b las kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa las kyang gzugs su snang ba 'byung ba las yid kyi rnam par shes pa las chos su snang ba 'byung ba ni phyi'i skye mched du bshad de /
translated: The external sense bases are explained as the arising of the appearance of form from eye consciousness to the arising of the appearance of phenomena from mental consciousness.

original: de bas na rnam par rig pa tsam du smra ba la yang phyi nang gi skye mched du dbye ba yod do //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par rig pa tsam du smra ba la yang phyi nang gi skye mched du dbye ba yod do //
translated: Therefore, even in the system of Vij√±aptimƒÅtra, there is a division into internal and external sense bases.

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpas khams gsum thams cad ni sems tsam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rim pas gzugs kyi 'du shes bsal nas gzugs la sogs pa'i phyin ci log spong bar byed
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpas khams gsum thams cad ni sems tsam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rim pas gzugs kyi 'du shes bsal nas gzugs la sogs pa'i phyin ci log spong bar byed
translated: When the bodhisattva, through the stages of affliction, intention, meditation, and so on, eliminates the discernment of form and so on by thinking, ‚ÄúAll three realms are mind only,‚Äù and so on, he abandons the error of form and so on.

original: pa na gang sngon gyi nang gi skye mched so so'i nang gi mngon bar chags pa'i phyin ci log spangs na /
analyzed: pa na gang sngon gyi nang gi skye mched so so'i nang gi mngon bar chags pa'i phyin ci log spangs na /
translated: When he abandons the error of attachment to the internal sense bases,

original: gnas gzhan du gyur pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnas gzhan du gyur pa zhes bya ste /
translated: he is said to have ‚Äútransformed his basis.‚Äù

original: de las 'byor pa mchog rnam pa gnyis thob par gyur pas na yul med par yang gnas gzhan du gyur par rung ste /
analyzed: de las 'byor pa mchog rnam pa gnyis thob par gyur pas na yul med par yang gnas gzhan du gyur par rung ste /
translated: Since he has attained the two supreme masteries, it is suitable to say that he has transformed his basis even without an object.

original: 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction.

original: yid kyang gzhan du gyur na ni //
analyzed: yid kyang gzhan du gyur na ni //
translated: When the mind has transformed,

original: 'byor ba dam pa thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'byor ba dam pa thob par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: he attains the highest mastery.

original: nyan thos kyi lta ba'i tshul gyis ni rnam par shes pa drug 'das ma thag pa la yid kyi dbang po zhes zer te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lta ba'i tshul gyis ni rnam par shes pa drug 'das ma thag pa la yid kyi dbang po zhes zer te /
translated: In the system of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, the immediately past six consciousnesses are called the mental faculty.

original: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis ni yid kyi de la mi bya'i /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis ni yid kyi de la mi bya'i /
translated: But according to the Mahayana, it is not the mental consciousness that is so transformed,

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid la bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid la bya ste /
translated: but the defiled manas.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid de gnas gzhan du gyur na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid de gnas gzhan du gyur na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúwhen that manas is transformed‚Äù is that.

original: de la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang yang dag par ldan zhing byung ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang yang dag par ldan zhing byung ste /
translated: Nonconceptual intuition arises in association with the mental consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten ni nyon mongs pa'i yid yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten ni nyon mongs pa'i yid yin te /
translated: The support of the mental consciousness is the defiled manas,

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten mig gi dbang po yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten mig gi dbang po yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: just as the support of visual consciousness is the eye faculty.

original: de la ji srid du so so'i skye bo'i dus na nyon mongs pa'i yid gnas gzhan du ma gyur pa'i tshe bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu chags pa dang / bdag tu nga rgyal dang / bdag tu gti mug pa la sogs pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhi dang ldan zhing kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las bdag dang bdag gi zhes phyin ci log gi rnam par 'jug go //
analyzed: de la ji srid du so so'i skye bo'i dus na nyon mongs pa'i yid gnas gzhan du ma gyur pa'i tshe bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu chags pa dang / bdag tu nga rgyal dang / bdag tu gti mug pa la sogs pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhi dang ldan zhing kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las bdag dang bdag gi zhes phyin ci log gi rnam par 'jug go //
translated: As long as the afflicted mind of an ordinary being has not transformed into another state, it is associated with four secondary afflictions: the view of self, attachment to self, pride in self, and confusion about self. It engages the foundation consciousness with the distorted concepts of ‚Äúself‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: ji ltar nyon mongs pa'i yid phyin ci log gi rnam par zhugs pas de la brten pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la yang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la phyin ci log tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: ji ltar nyon mongs pa'i yid phyin ci log gi rnam par zhugs pas de la brten pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la yang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la phyin ci log tu 'jug ste /
translated: Since the afflicted mind engages in distorted concepts, the mental consciousness that is based on it also engages in distorted concepts about objects such as form.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul med par yang yod do snyam du mngon par chags par byed do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul med par yang yod do snyam du mngon par chags par byed do //
translated: Even though objects such as form do not exist, it becomes attached to them, thinking that they exist.

original: nam nyon mongs pa'i yid de bdag dang bdag gir lta ba spangs nas gnas gzhan du gyur te /
analyzed: nam nyon mongs pa'i yid de bdag dang bdag gir lta ba spangs nas gnas gzhan du gyur te /
translated: When the afflicted mind abandons the view of self and mine and transforms into another state,

original: mnyam pa nyid @127a * //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid @127a * //
translated: it becomes the wisdom of equality.

original: kyi ye shes su gyur na 'byor pa dam pa mchog thob par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kyi ye shes su gyur na 'byor pa dam pa mchog thob par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one attains mastery over the pristine wisdom of the Dharma, one attains the supreme, holy mastery.

original: chos gang la 'byor pa thob ce na /
analyzed: chos gang la 'byor pa thob ce na /
translated: With respect to what phenomena does one attain mastery?üîΩTherefore it says:

original: de'i phyir / 'byor pa'i rjes su ye shes ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'byor pa'i rjes su ye shes ni //
translated: The pristine wisdom that follows mastery

original: rnam par mi rtog dri ma med //üîΩces smos te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog dri ma med // ces smos te /
translated: is nonconceptual and stainless.

original: 'byor pa'i sgras ni dbang po lnga gnas gzhan du gyur nas yul thams cad la 'jug par nus pa dang gcig yang yon tan brgya rtsa bcu gnyis thob pa la bya ste /üîΩrjes su 'jug pa ni 'byor pa de dang lhan cig 'grogs pa'am /
analyzed: 'byor pa'i sgras ni dbang po lnga gnas gzhan du gyur nas yul thams cad la 'jug par nus pa dang gcig yang yon tan brgya rtsa bcu gnyis thob pa la bya ste / rjes su 'jug pa ni 'byor pa de dang lhan cig 'grogs pa'am /
translated: The term mastery refers to the five powers, which, having transformed the basis, are able to engage all objects, and also to the attainment of the one hundred and twelve qualities.

original: 'byor pa de dang mthun par gnas pa la bya ste /
analyzed: 'byor pa de dang mthun par gnas pa la bya ste /
translated: Following means accompanying that mastery or abiding in accordance with that mastery.

original: 'byor pa dang lhan cig gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'byor pa dang lhan cig gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is it to abide with mastery?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dri ma med pa'o //
translated: It is nonconceptual, stainless pristine wisdom.

original: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas gzhan du gyur na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas gzhan du gyur na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes su 'gyur te /
translated: If the foundation consciousness transforms its basis, it becomes nonconceptual pristine wisdom.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par rtog pa med pas na rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par rtog pa med pas na rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: It is non-conceptual because it does not conceive of subject and object.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas na dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas na dri ma med pa'o //
translated: It is immaculate because it eliminates the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid ma dag pa'i dus na yang kun gzhi la bdag dang bdag gir dmigs pa dag ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid ma dag pa'i dus na yang kun gzhi la bdag dang bdag gir dmigs pa dag ste /
translated: Even when the afflicted mind is impure, it observes the self and entities connected to the self in the foundation consciousness.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes su gyur pa na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la bdag dbang gir med par mnyam pa nyid du dmigs te /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes su gyur pa na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la bdag dbang gir med par mnyam pa nyid du dmigs te /
translated: When it becomes the transcendent wisdom of equality, it observes the equality of the absence of self and entities connected to the self in nonconceptual wisdom.

original: de bas na nyon mongs pa'i yid gnas gzhan du gyur na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la dmigs pa'i 'byor pa'i dam pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na nyon mongs pa'i yid gnas gzhan du gyur na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la dmigs pa'i 'byor pa'i dam pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, when the afflicted mind transforms its basis, it attains the highest mastery in observing nonconceptual wisdom.

original: yang na nyon mongs pa'i yid gnas gzhan du gyur pa dang / dbang po gcig kyang kun gyi don la 'jug pa dang / yon tan brgya rtsa bcu gnyis 'thob pa'i 'byor pa dang lhan cig 'byung zhing 'grogs pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa'i dri ma med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa'i yid gnas gzhan du gyur pa dang / dbang po gcig kyang kun gyi don la 'jug pa dang / yon tan brgya rtsa bcu gnyis 'thob pa'i 'byor pa dang lhan cig 'byung zhing 'grogs pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa'i dri ma med par 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, the afflicted mind is transformed into the pristine wisdom of equality, which is nonconceptual and stainless.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes su gyur pa nyid 'byor ba'i mchog rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes su gyur pa nyid 'byor ba'i mchog rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The attainment of the supreme mastery of the pristine wisdom of equality is called the attainment of the supreme mastery.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes su gyur pa na bdag dang bdag gir rtog pa med pas na rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes su gyur pa na bdag dang bdag gir rtog pa med pas na rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When it becomes the pristine wisdom of equality, it is called nonconceptual because it does not conceive of self and mine.

original: bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu gti mug la sogs nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhi dang bral bas na dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu gti mug la sogs nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhi dang bral bas na dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called stainless because it is free from the four secondary afflictions such as the view of self and delusion of self.

original: de dang lhan cig tu 'byor pa'i ye shes thams cad du 'jug go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu 'byor pa'i ye shes thams cad du 'jug go zhes bya ba la /
translated: All pristine wisdoms that are mastered together with it engage in all objects.

original: de dang lhan cig ces bya ba ni dbang po gcig cing yang yul kun la 'jug pa dang / yon tan brgya rtsa bcu gnyis kyis 'byor pa dang / rnam par rtog @127b pa'i ye shes dang / de'i rgyab nas thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la dmigs pa mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang bcas pas rtag par yang sems can gyi don la 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig ces bya ba ni dbang po gcig cing yang yul kun la 'jug pa dang / yon tan brgya rtsa bcu gnyis kyis 'byor pa dang / rnam par rtog @127b pa'i ye shes dang / de'i rgyab nas thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la dmigs pa mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang bcas pas rtag par yang sems can gyi don la 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Together with that means that the single faculty engages all objects, is endowed with the twelve hundred qualities, and is the wisdom of conceptualization, and that, following that, it is the wisdom of equality that focuses on the pure mundane wisdom and nonconceptual wisdom that are attained, and that it always engages in the benefit of sentient beings.

original: don bcas 'dzin pa gzhan gyur pas //üîΩ'byor pa dam pa thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: don bcas 'dzin pa gzhan gyur pas // 'byor pa dam pa thob par 'gyur //
translated: The transformation of the apprehender of objects

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: is the attainment of the highest mastery.

original: don gyi sgra ni gzugs nas chos kyi bar du yul drug la bya'o //
analyzed: don gyi sgra ni gzugs nas chos kyi bar du yul drug la bya'o //
translated: The term object refers to the six objects from form to phenomena.

original: 'dzin pa'i sgras ni mig gi rnam par shes pa nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs la bya ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i sgras ni mig gi rnam par shes pa nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs la bya ste /
translated: The term apprehender refers to the five collections of consciousness from eye consciousness to body consciousness.

original: yul drug dang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs dag ste /
analyzed: yul drug dang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs dag ste /
translated: The six objects and the collections of consciousnessüîΩare the six sense bases.

original: gnas gzhan du gyur na /
analyzed: gnas gzhan du gyur na /
translated: If the realm is transformed,üîΩone obtains the two kinds of excellent mastery.

original: 'byor pa dam pa rnam pa gnyis 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'byor pa dam pa rnam pa gnyis 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The verse states:üîΩThe field is pure as one wishes,

original: zhing yang 'dod bzhin dag pa dang // longs spyod shin tu ston par ro //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhing yang 'dod bzhin dag pa dang // longs spyod shin tu ston par ro // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and one displays enjoyments.

original: phyi'i yul rnams gzhan du ma gyur pa'i dus na ni ngam grog dang / tsher ma dang / gseg ma dang / gyo mo la sogs pa lta bur ma dag pa snang la /
analyzed: phyi'i yul rnams gzhan du ma gyur pa'i dus na ni ngam grog dang / tsher ma dang / gseg ma dang / gyo mo la sogs pa lta bur ma dag pa snang la /
translated: When the external objects have not been transformed, they appear impure, like ravines, thorns, pebbles, gravel, and so on.

original: nam dag par gyur pa'i dus na ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du bee d'u rya dang / shel dang gser la sogs pa'i kha dog gis gzhi lta bur dag par snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam dag par gyur pa'i dus na ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du bee d'u rya dang / shel dang gser la sogs pa'i kha dog gis gzhi lta bur dag par snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: But when they have been transformed, they appear pure, like a ground of beryl, crystal, gold, and so on, as one wishes.

original: don dag ni 'byor pa de 'thob bo //
analyzed: don dag ni 'byor pa de 'thob bo //
translated: This is the meaning of obtaining mastery over objects.

original: rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs ma dag pa'i dus na ni mig gi rnam par shes pas kyang gzugs la dmigs shing gzugs la longs spyod byed pa tsam las mi nus te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs ma dag pa'i dus na ni mig gi rnam par shes pas kyang gzugs la dmigs shing gzugs la longs spyod byed pa tsam las mi nus te /
translated: When the five collections of consciousness are impure, the eye consciousness, for example, is only able to observe forms and experience forms. It is not able to do anything else.

original: so so'i yul nyi tshe la 'jug pa tsam las lhag par mi nus pa las nam dag ste gnas gyur pa na rnam par shes pa lnga la sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na bdud rtsi'i rdzing dang / dpag bsam gyi shing la sogs pa'i longs spyod rnam pa sna tshogs ston te /üîΩ'dzin pa gzhan du gyur pa las ni 'byor pa'i mchog thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so so'i yul nyi tshe la 'jug pa tsam las lhag par mi nus pa las nam dag ste gnas gyur pa na rnam par shes pa lnga la sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na bdud rtsi'i rdzing dang / dpag bsam gyi shing la sogs pa'i longs spyod rnam pa sna tshogs ston te / 'dzin pa gzhan du gyur pa las ni 'byor pa'i mchog thob par 'gyur ro //
