original: rnam rtog gzhan du gyur na ni //üîΩ'byor pa dam pa thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam rtog gzhan du gyur na ni // 'byor pa dam pa thob par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five consciousnesses are transformed into the mirror-like intuition, etc.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are transformed into the mirror-like intuition, etc.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are transformed into the mirror-like intuition, etc.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are transformed into the mirror-like intuition, etc.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are transformed into the mirror-like intuition, etc.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are transformed into the mirror-like intuition, etc.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are transformed into the mirror-like intuition, etc.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are transformed into the mirror-like intuition, etc.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are transformed into the mirror-like intuition, etc.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are transformed into the mirror-like intuition, etc.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are transformed into the mirror-like intuition, etc.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i sgras ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la bya ste /üîΩyid kyi rnam par shes pa ma dag pa'i dus na gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa chos rnam pa sna tshogs la rtog pa de dag ste gnas gyur na 'byor pa dam pa rnam pa gnyis 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i sgras ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la bya ste / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma dag pa'i dus na gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa chos rnam pa sna tshogs la rtog pa de dag ste gnas gyur na 'byor pa dam pa rnam pa gnyis 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The five consciousnesses are transformed into the mirror-like intuition, etc.

original: ye shes dang ni las kun kyang //
analyzed: ye shes dang ni las kun kyang //
translated: The five consciousnesses are transformed into the mirror-like intuition, etc

original: rtag tu thogs pa med pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtag tu thogs pa med pa'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is always unobstructed.

original: 'byor pa gnyis @128a * //
analyzed: 'byor pa gnyis @128a * //
translated: The two masteries

original: ni ye shes rtag tu thogs pa med pa dang / las kun la rtag tu thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ni ye shes rtag tu thogs pa med pa dang / las kun la rtag tu thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: are the mastery of always unobstructed knowledge and the mastery of always unobstructed activity.

original: de la ye shes kyi sgras ni me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes dang / so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
analyzed: de la ye shes kyi sgras ni me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes dang / so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
translated: The word knowledge refers to mirror knowledge, knowledge of equality, discriminating knowledge, and all accomplishing knowledge.

original: ye shes de dag gis dngos po kha cig shes kha cig mi shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ye shes de dag gis dngos po kha cig shes kha cig mi shes pa ma yin te /
translated: These knowledges do not know some things and not others,

original: dngos po kun shes pa dang / dus kha cig du shes kha cig du mi shes pa ma yin gyi dus thams cad du shes pa ni ye shes rtag tu thogs pa med ces bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po kun shes pa dang / dus kha cig du shes kha cig du mi shes pa ma yin gyi dus thams cad du shes pa ni ye shes rtag tu thogs pa med ces bya'o //
translated: but know all things. They do not know at some times and not at others, but know at all times. This is called the mastery of always unobstructed knowledge.

original: las kyi sgras ni sprul pa'i phrin las mdzad pa la bya ste /
analyzed: las kyi sgras ni sprul pa'i phrin las mdzad pa la bya ste /
translated: The word activity refers to the performance of emanation activity.

original: 'og min gyi pho brang nas 'chi 'pho ba dang / mngon par byang chub pa la sogs pa sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: 'og min gyi pho brang nas 'chi 'pho ba dang / mngon par byang chub pa la sogs pa sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par mdzad pas na /
translated: Because he always and uninterruptedly performs various emanations, such as passing away from the palace of Akani·π£·π≠ha and manifesting complete enlightenment,

original: las kun la rtag tu thogs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las kun la rtag tu thogs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: he is called ‚Äúalways unobstructed in all actions.‚Äù

original: rten kyang gzhan du gyur na ni //
analyzed: rten kyang gzhan du gyur na ni //
translated: When the basis is transformed,

original: 'byor pa dam pa thob par 'gyur ro //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'byor pa dam pa thob par 'gyur ro // zhes bya ba la /
translated: he attains the highest mastery.

original: rten gyi sgras ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / de'i dmigs pa'i bya ba'i yul snod kyi 'jig rten sa gzhi chen po la bya ste /
analyzed: rten gyi sgras ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / de'i dmigs pa'i bya ba'i yul snod kyi 'jig rten sa gzhi chen po la bya ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúbasis‚Äù refers to the container consciousness and the objective realm that is the domain of its activity, the great earth of the world receptacle.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yang las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bag chags kyi gnas su gyur pa dang / lus dang longs spyod dang / gnas lta bur yang kun gzhi nyid de ltar snang bas na kun gzhi la brten te zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yang las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bag chags kyi gnas su gyur pa dang / lus dang longs spyod dang / gnas lta bur yang kun gzhi nyid de ltar snang bas na kun gzhi la brten te zhes bya'o //
translated: The container consciousness is the basis of the propensities for good and bad actions, and the container consciousness itself appears as the body, as possessions, and as the external environment. Therefore, it is said that the container consciousness is the basis.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten sa gzhi chen po yang sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi gnas su gyur pa dang / rtsva shing rnam pa sna tshogs skye ba'i rten du gyur pas na rten ces bya ste /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten sa gzhi chen po yang sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi gnas su gyur pa dang / rtsva shing rnam pa sna tshogs skye ba'i rten du gyur pas na rten ces bya ste /
translated: The great earth, the physical cosmos, is called the support because it is the abode of the world of sentient beings and the support for the growth of various kinds of grass and trees.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten kun gzhi'i dmigs pa'i yul yin par ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten kun gzhi'i dmigs pa'i yul yin par ci mngon zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow is it known that the physical cosmos is the objective domain of the ƒÅlaya-consciousness?‚Äù

original: sum cu pa'i rab tu dbye ba las /üîΩgang phyir kun gzhi rnam shes las //
analyzed: sum cu pa'i rab tu dbye ba las / gang phyir kun gzhi rnam shes las //
translated: The Tri·πÉ≈õikƒÅ‚Äôs Analysis of the Elements says:üîΩBecause all the seeds of karmic ripening

original: rnam smin sa bon thams cad la //
analyzed: rnam smin sa bon thams cad la //
translated: are taken up in the ƒÅlaya-consciousness,

original: len pa dag dang de yi gnas //
analyzed: len pa dag dang de yi gnas //
translated: it is the support of the seeds

original: rnam par rig pa ma rig pa'o //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa ma rig pa'o // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: and the consciousness of the elements.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dmigs pa'i yul dang bcas te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dmigs pa'i yul dang bcas te /
translated: The ƒÅlaya-consciousness is the objective domain of the objective support.

original: gnas gzhan du gyur na 'byor pa'i dam pa mchog thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnas gzhan du gyur na 'byor pa'i dam pa mchog thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When it transforms into another state, it is said that one attains the supreme, excellent mastery.

original: 'byor pa gang 'thob ce na /üîΩde'i phyir / mi gnas pa yi mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: 'byor pa gang 'thob ce na / de'i phyir / mi gnas pa yi mya ngan 'das //
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat mastery is attained?‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi mi g-yo gnas //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi mi g-yo gnas //üîΩzhes smos te /
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúThe buddhas‚Äô state of nonabiding nirvƒÅ·πáa.‚Äù

original: kun gzhi dmigs pa dang bcas te gnas gzhan du gyur na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zag pa med pa'i dbyings na @128b bzhugs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: kun gzhi dmigs pa dang bcas te gnas gzhan du gyur na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zag pa med pa'i dbyings na @128b bzhugs pa'i tshe /
translated: If the foundation consciousness were to exist with its object, then when the tathƒÅgatas abide in the uncontaminated realm,üîΩ

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'byor pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'byor pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: If the foundation consciousness, together with its object, were to transform into something else, then the TathƒÅgatas would attain the endowment of non-abiding nirvana when they abide in the uncontaminated realm.

original: mi gnas pa ni 'khor ba na yang mi gnas mya ngan las 'das pa la yang mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa ni 'khor ba na yang mi gnas mya ngan las 'das pa la yang mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Non-abiding means not abiding in sa·πÉsƒÅra or nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: 'khrig pa gzhan du gyur na ni //
analyzed: 'khrig pa gzhan du gyur na ni //
translated: If sexual intercourse transforms,

original: 'byor pa dam pa thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'byor pa dam pa thob par 'gyur //
translated: one attains the highest endowment.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: 'khrig pa ni lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs gcig ste /
analyzed: 'khrig pa ni lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs gcig ste /
translated: sexual intercourse is a part of the body faculty.

original: bud med dang skyes pa'i dbang po gnyis phan tshun sbyor ba la 'khrig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa'i dbang po gnyis phan tshun sbyor ba la 'khrig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The union of the two faculties of women and men is called sexual intercourse.

original: 'khrig pa la gnas gzhan du gyur te /
analyzed: 'khrig pa la gnas gzhan du gyur te /
translated: If sexual intercourse transforms into something else,

original: mi tshangs par spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur na 'byor pa dam pa rnam pa gnyis 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi tshangs par spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur na 'byor pa dam pa rnam pa gnyis 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it means that one becomes free from the attachment of sexual misconduct. The meaning is that one attains the two kinds of highest endowment.

original: sangs rgyas bde bar gnas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bde bar gnas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Buddha is called the one who dwells in bliss.

original: mi tshangs par spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral na sangs rgyas rnams kyi spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi tshangs par spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral na sangs rgyas rnams kyi spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba thob par 'gyur te /
translated: When one is free from the passion of sexual misconduct, one attains the bliss of the concentration of the Buddhas, which is free from all discursive thought.

original: 'di ni 'byor pa dam pa thob pa rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni 'byor pa dam pa thob pa rnam pa gcig go //
translated: This is the second kind of attainment of the highest mastery.

original: bud med nyon mongs med pa lta //üîΩzhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: bud med nyon mongs med pa lta // zhes bya ba'am /
translated: One sees a good woman without affliction.

original: mi tshangs par spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral na 'gro ba bzang mo dag mthong du zin kyang nyon mongs pa mi skye ste /
analyzed: mi tshangs par spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral na 'gro ba bzang mo dag mthong du zin kyang nyon mongs pa mi skye ste /
translated: Or, when one is free from the passion of sexual misconduct, one sees good women and yet the afflictions do not arise.

original: 'dod chags mi skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod chags mi skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that passion does not arise.

original: 'dis ni 'byor pa dam pa thob pa rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'byor pa dam pa thob pa rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: This is the second kind of attainment of the highest mastery.

original: nam mkhar 'du shes rnam gyur na //
analyzed: nam mkhar 'du shes rnam gyur na //
translated: When one transforms the perception of space,

original: 'byor pa dam pa rnyed par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'byor pa dam pa rnyed par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: one attains the highest mastery.

original: gang thogs pa med pa de ni nam mkha' bzhin no zhes rtog na /
analyzed: gang thogs pa med pa de ni nam mkha' bzhin no zhes rtog na /
translated: When one imagines that which is unobstructed to be like space,

original: gang du thogs pa dang bcas pa de dag ni gzugs yin no zhes rtog pa ni nam mkha'i 'du shes zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang du thogs pa dang bcas pa de dag ni gzugs yin no zhes rtog pa ni nam mkha'i 'du shes zhes bya ste /
translated: Wherever there is obstruction, that is form.

original: 'du shes de spangs nas 'byor pa dam pa rnam pa gsum thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'du shes de spangs nas 'byor pa dam pa rnam pa gsum thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one attains the three kinds of excellent mastery, having abandoned that discrimination.

original: bsam pa'i don ni 'grub pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam pa'i don ni 'grub pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of the verse is fulfilled.

original: bsam pa'i don 'grub pa ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin thob pas ci bsam pa yo byad thams cad nam mkha' las 'byong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsam pa'i don 'grub pa ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin thob pas ci bsam pa yo byad thams cad nam mkha' las 'byong bar 'gyur te /
translated: The fulfillment of the meaning of intention is the attainment of the concentration of the sky treasury, by which all the articles one wishes for rain down from the sky.

original: 'di ni 'byor pa dam ba thob pa rnams pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni 'byor pa dam ba thob pa rnams pa gcig go //
translated: This is the first kind of attainment of excellent mastery.

original: 'gro dang gzugs ni gcig pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro dang gzugs ni gcig pa'o //
translated: Going and form are the second.

original: zhes bya ba la 'gro ba thogs pa med pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'gro ba thogs pa med pa 'thob ste /
translated: One attains unobstructed going,

original: rtsig pa dang ril sogs pa la thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsig pa dang ril sogs pa la thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is not obstructed by walls, mountains, and so on.

original: 'di ni 'byor pa dam pa thob pa rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'byor pa dam pa thob pa rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: This is the second kind of attainment of excellent mastery.

original: gzugs 'jig pa ni thams cad nam mkhar bya bar bsams na dngos po thams cad nam mkha'i ngos bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs 'jig pa ni thams cad nam mkhar bya bar bsams na dngos po thams cad nam mkha'i ngos bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: If one imagines that the destruction of form is all space, then all things would be like the surface of space.

original: 'di ni 'byor pa dam pa thob pa rnam pa gsum @129a * //
analyzed: 'di ni 'byor pa dam pa thob pa rnam pa gsum @129a * //
translated: This is the three types of attainment of the highest mastery.

original: mo ; / gong du sangs rgyas kyi 'byor pa bshad pa rnams kyi don rgya cher bshad pa bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mo ; / gong du sangs rgyas kyi 'byor pa bshad pa rnams kyi don rgya cher bshad pa bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the above explanation of the mastery of the buddhas in a concise way, it is said:

original: de ltar gzhan gyur dpag med de //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyur dpag med de //
translated: Thus, the infinite transformation

original: 'byor pa dpag tu med par 'dod //
analyzed: 'byor pa dpag tu med par 'dod //
translated: is asserted to be the infinite mastery.

original: bsam yas bya ba bsgrub pa rnams //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig smos te /üîΩde ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i tshul ltar ro //
analyzed: bsam yas bya ba bsgrub pa rnams // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig smos te / de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i tshul ltar ro //
translated: The inconceivable accomplishment of activityüîΩand so on.üîΩThus means in the manner that was explained above.

original: gong du bshad pa'i tshul ltar bshad na /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i tshul ltar bshad na /
translated: If it is explained in the manner that was explained above,

original: gzugs kyi phung po la grangs du yod pa gnas gzhan du gyur pa dang / tshor pa'i phung po la du yod pa gnas gzhan du gyur pa dang / 'du shes kyi phung po la du yod pa gnas gzhan du gyur pa dang / 'du byed kyi phung po la 'du byed kyi sems dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa du yod pa'i gnas gzhan du gyur pa'i tshul gyis phye ste bshad na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la grangs du yod pa gnas gzhan du gyur pa dang / tshor pa'i phung po la du yod pa gnas gzhan du gyur pa dang / 'du shes kyi phung po la du yod pa gnas gzhan du gyur pa dang / 'du byed kyi phung po la 'du byed kyi sems dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa du yod pa'i gnas gzhan du gyur pa'i tshul gyis phye ste bshad na /
translated: The form aggregate has so many transformations, the feeling aggregate has so many transformations, the perception aggregate has so many transformations, and the formations aggregate has so many transformations of formations that are associated with mind and not associated with mind.

original: gnas gzhan du gyur pa dpag tu med par gyur pa dang / gnas gzhan du gyur pa dpag tu med pa rnams ni mdo sde de dang de dag gi nang nas ji skad du 'byung ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas gzhan du gyur pa dpag tu med par gyur pa dang / gnas gzhan du gyur pa dpag tu med pa rnams ni mdo sde de dang de dag gi nang nas ji skad du 'byung ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The transformations are immeasurable, and the immeasurable transformations should be understood as they are described in this and that s≈´tra.

original: de ltar tshul gzhan du gyur pa dpag tu med pas na gzhan gnas du gyur pa las byung ba'i 'byor pa dang yon tan yang dpag tu med par yod par 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar tshul gzhan du gyur pa dpag tu med pas na gzhan gnas du gyur pa las byung ba'i 'byor pa dang yon tan yang dpag tu med par yod par 'dod do //
translated: Thus, because of the immeasurable transformations, the qualities and abilities that arise from the transformation of the basis are also asserted to be immeasurable.

original: ji ltar 'byor pa dpag tu med pa de bzhin du 'byor pa las byung ba'i sprul pa'i sku la sogs pa sems can gyi don du phrin las bsgrub pa yang mtha' yas dpag tu med par 'dod de //
analyzed: ji ltar 'byor pa dpag tu med pa de bzhin du 'byor pa las byung ba'i sprul pa'i sku la sogs pa sems can gyi don du phrin las bsgrub pa yang mtha' yas dpag tu med par 'dod de //
translated: Just as the excellences are immeasurable, so too the activities of the emanation body, etc. that are accomplished for the sake of sentient beings, are infinite and immeasurable,

original: 'byor ba re re zhing yang sprul pa dang phrin las mtha' yas par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byor ba re re zhing yang sprul pa dang phrin las mtha' yas par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because each excellence gives rise to infinite emanations and activities.

original: 'byor ba dang phrin las de dag gang gi dus nas gang dang gang du gnas 'thob ce na /
analyzed: 'byor ba dang phrin las de dag gang gi dus nas gang dang gang du gnas 'thob ce na /
translated: At what time and in what place are the excellences and activities obtained?

original: de'i phyir / sangs rgyas dri med gnas na'o //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / sangs rgyas dri med gnas na'o // zhes smos te /
translated: In the stainless realm of the Buddha,

original: de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi dri ma med pa'i gnas zag pa med pa'i gnas na bzhugs pa'i tshe thob cing de'i tshe 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi dri ma med pa'i gnas zag pa med pa'i gnas na bzhugs pa'i tshe thob cing de'i tshe 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: they are obtained and occur at the time when the Buddha is dwelling in the stainless realm, the uncontaminated realm.

original: sangs rgyas pa de'i tshe sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyu la tshigs su bcad pa bdun no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa de'i tshe sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyu la tshigs su bcad pa bdun no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Seven verses on the cause of the Buddha‚Äôs maturation of sentient beings.

original: 'byor pa'i rjes la yongs su smin pa'i rgyu'i skabs bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'byor pa'i rjes la yongs su smin pa'i rgyu'i skabs bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the section on the cause of complete maturation and the section on endowment?

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi sa'i dus na 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi sa'i dus na 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa 'thob ste /
translated: Thus, at the time of the Buddha stage, one obtains perfect endowment.

original: de rang gi dus kyi mthar thug pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de lhun gyis grub par mi rtog bzhin du sems can yongs su smin par mdzad de /
analyzed: de rang gi dus kyi mthar thug pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de lhun gyis grub par mi rtog bzhin du sems can yongs su smin par mdzad de /
translated: At the end of that time, the Bhagavat Buddha, without deliberate thought, spontaneously brings beings to complete maturation.

original: de'i phyir 'byor pa'i rjes la yongs su smin pa'i @129b skabs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byor pa'i rjes la yongs su smin pa'i @129b skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, the section on complete maturation is connected to the section on endowment.

original: de la gong du yang sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i skabs bshad /
analyzed: de la gong du yang sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i skabs bshad /
translated: In the above, the section on bringing beings to complete maturation was explained.

original: 'dir yang sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i skabs bshad de /
analyzed: 'dir yang sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i skabs bshad de /
translated: Here, the section on bringing beings to complete maturation is explained.

original: lan gnyis su bshad na de gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: lan gnyis su bshad na de gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: If it is explained twice, what is the difference between the two?

original: sngar ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sngar ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas pa'i tshe /
translated: Previously, when abiding in the bodhisattva conduct,

original: de ltar sems can yongs su smin par byed pa de bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar sems can yongs su smin par byed pa de bstan to //
translated: it was taught that one brings beings to complete maturation in that way.

original: da ni mthar thug pa sangs rgyas kyis brnyes nas sems can ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa de ston te /
analyzed: da ni mthar thug pa sangs rgyas kyis brnyes nas sems can ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa de ston te /
translated: Now, having attained the ultimate, Buddhahood, it shows how he brings living beings to full maturity.

original: khyad par ni de yod de /
analyzed: khyad par ni de yod de /
translated: There is a difference,

original: de yang sangs rgyas par gyur pa de ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyu dang gnas dang rten yin no zhes tshigs su bcad pa bdun gyis ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas par gyur pa de ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyu dang gnas dang rten yin no zhes tshigs su bcad pa bdun gyis ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and that is shown in seven verses, in the sense that he who has become a Buddha is the cause, the basis, and the support for bringing living beings to full maturity.

original: tshigs su bcad pa dang po bsdus pa'i don ni yongs su smin pa ci 'dra ba'i rgyur sangs rgyas par gyur pa de ston to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa dang po bsdus pa'i don ni yongs su smin pa ci 'dra ba'i rgyur sangs rgyas par gyur pa de ston to //
translated: The first verse shows the cause of full maturity.

original: dge ba 'phel ba'i 'jig rten rnam dag mchog tu 'gro //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba 'phel ba'i 'jig rten rnam dag mchog tu 'gro //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: The world of virtue increases, and it goes to the highest purity.

original: dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / bslab pa mnos pa dang / srod dang tho rangs la mi nyal ba dang / zas la tshod rig pa la sogs pa'i rim pas mos pas spyod pa'i sa dang sa bcu la sogs par rim gyis zhugs pa ni dge ba 'phel ba'i 'jig rten zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / bslab pa mnos pa dang / srod dang tho rangs la mi nyal ba dang / zas la tshod rig pa la sogs pa'i rim pas mos pas spyod pa'i sa dang sa bcu la sogs par rim gyis zhugs pa ni dge ba 'phel ba'i 'jig rten zhes bya ste /
translated: First, those who have aroused the thought of enlightenment, taken the vow, practiced the stages of faith, the ten stages, etc., by not sleeping in the evening and at dawn, by moderation in eating, etc., are called ‚Äúmundane beings who increase virtue.‚Äù

original: de dag sku dang ye shes kyis bsdus pa sangs rgyas kyi sar mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ni rnam dag mchog tu 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag sku dang ye shes kyis bsdus pa sangs rgyas kyi sar mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ni rnam dag mchog tu 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When they attain the nirvana that is not a resting place, on the stage of the Buddha, which is included in the bodies and intuitions, this is called ‚Äúsupreme progress to purity.‚Äù

original: dge ba ma bsags dge ba 'phel ba'i mchog tu 'gro //
analyzed: dge ba ma bsags dge ba 'phel ba'i mchog tu 'gro //
translated: Those who do not accumulate virtue, and those who increase virtue, progress to the supreme.

original: zhes bya ba la byang chub sems ma bskyed pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la byang chub sems ma bskyed pas na /
translated: Those who have not aroused the thought of enlightenment

original: sa bcu dag tu ma zhugs pa ni dge ba ma bsags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa bcu dag tu ma zhugs pa ni dge ba ma bsags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: have not entered the ten stages, and are called ‚Äúthose who do not accumulate virtue.‚Äù

original: de dag byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni /
analyzed: de dag byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni /
translated: When they arouse the thought of enlightenment,

original: sa bcu dag tu zhugs par gyur pa ni dge ba 'phel bar mchog tu 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa bcu dag tu zhugs par gyur pa ni dge ba 'phel bar mchog tu 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: they enter the ten stages, and are called ‚Äúthose who progress to the supreme increase of virtue.‚Äù

original: de ltar 'jig rten phyogs phyogs rgyal bas rab bshad pas //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten phyogs phyogs rgyal bas rab bshad pas // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, the Victorious Ones in all directions of the world have taught.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad do //
translated: Thus means as previously explained.

original: dge ba 'phel ba rnams rnams par grol bar bzhag pa dang / dge ba ma bsags pa rnams dge ba 'phel ba la bkod pa yang 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu de ltar byas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dge ba 'phel ba rnams rnams par grol bar bzhag pa dang / dge ba ma bsags pa rnams dge ba 'phel ba la bkod pa yang 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu de ltar byas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The increase of virtue is the establishment of liberation, and the placement of those who have not accumulated virtue in the increase of virtue is not done in just one world system.

original: phyogs phyogs te phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten kun du yongs su smin pa dang grol bar mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyogs phyogs te phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten kun du yongs su smin pa dang grol bar mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In all directions, in the ten directions of the world, they bring about complete maturation and liberation. This is the meaning.

original: sus de ltar mdzad ce na /
analyzed: sus de ltar mdzad ce na /
translated: By whom is it done in this way?

original: rgyal bas te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzad do //üîΩrgyu gang @130a * //
analyzed: rgyal bas te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzad do // rgyu gang @130a * //
translated: By the Victorious Ones, by the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: gis mdzad ce na /
analyzed: gis mdzad ce na /
translated: By what cause is it done?

original: rab tu bshad pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu bshad pa ste /
translated: By teaching,

original: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis bshad pa'i thabs kyis mdzad do //
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis bshad pa'i thabs kyis mdzad do //
translated: by the method of teaching the twelve branches of scripture.

original: de ltar bshad pas na /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pas na /
translated: Since it is taught in this way,

original: yongs smin smin pa ltar 'gyur ba //
analyzed: yongs smin smin pa ltar 'gyur ba //
translated: the world is brought to complete maturation.

original: zhes bya ba smon te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smon te /
translated: This is the aspiration.

original: de ltar bshad pas dge ba'i rtsa ba ma smin pa rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba mchog tu 'phel ba la bkod pas yongs su smin par byas so //
analyzed: de ltar bshad pas dge ba'i rtsa ba ma smin pa rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba mchog tu 'phel ba la bkod pas yongs su smin par byas so //
translated: Thus, by this explanation, he has brought to maturity those roots of virtue that have not matured, by establishing them in the supreme increase of roots of virtue.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba smin pa rnams ni mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod bas rnam par dag pa mchog thob par byas so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba smin pa rnams ni mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod bas rnam par dag pa mchog thob par byas so //
translated: He has brought to supreme purity those roots of virtue that have matured, by establishing them in nirvana.

original: yongs su smin par mdzad pa de yang skabs 'ga' tsam lan 'ga' tsam mdzad pa ni ma yin gyi rgyun ma chad par 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du mdzad pas rtag tu 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su smin par mdzad pa de yang skabs 'ga' tsam lan 'ga' tsam mdzad pa ni ma yin gyi rgyun ma chad par 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du mdzad pas rtag tu 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: And this bringing to maturity is not done only occasionally, or only once, but is done continuously, until the end of samsara. Thus, it is said to be constant.

original: de ltar rgyun du sems can yongs su smin par mdzad na 'khor ba'i sems can zad bar mi 'gyur ram snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ltar rgyun du sems can yongs su smin par mdzad na 'khor ba'i sems can zad bar mi 'gyur ram snyam pa la /
translated: If he brings sentient beings to maturity in this way, continuously, will the sentient beings of samsara ever be exhausted?

original: de'i phyir / ma lus 'dir ma yin zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / ma lus 'dir ma yin zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúNot here without remainder.‚Äù

original: de ltar rtag tu smin par mdzad kyang 'khor ba'i gnas 'di nas sems can ma lus par zad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar rtag tu smin par mdzad kyang 'khor ba'i gnas 'di nas sems can ma lus par zad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even though he brings them to maturity in this way, continuously, the sentient beings of this samsaric realm will never be exhausted without remainder.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sems can gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the realm of sentient beings is infinite and boundless.

original: mya ngan las 'das par gnas su yang 'phel pa dang lhag pa med de /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par gnas su yang 'phel pa dang lhag pa med de /
translated: Nor is there any increase or excess in the realm of nirvana,

original: chos kyi dbyings la skye 'gag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la skye 'gag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the dharma-element is without origination and cessation.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i bsdus pa'i don ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i bsdus pa'i don ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la /
translated: The condensed meaning of the second verse is that the bodhisattva‚Äôs activity in bringing sentient beings to maturity

original: ngo mtshar che ba yin pa dang / ngo mtshar che ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid de ston to //
analyzed: ngo mtshar che ba yin pa dang / ngo mtshar che ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid de ston to //
translated: is shown to have the characteristic of being both wondrous and not wondrous.

original: de ltar rnyed dka' zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar rnyed dka' zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúThus, the attainment of enlightenment is difficult‚Äù

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa la bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù refers to what was explained above.

original: gong du bshad pa ltar na byang chub de rnyed par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa ltar na byang chub de rnyed par dka' ba yin no //
translated: As was explained above, the attainment of enlightenment is difficult.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?üîΩBecause of the difficulty of selflessness, the practice of austerities,

original: bdag med dka' spyod brgya rnams dang // dpag med dge ba bsags pa dang // dpag med pa yi dus dang ni //
analyzed: bdag med dka' spyod brgya rnams dang // dpag med dge ba bsags pa dang // dpag med pa yi dus dang ni //
translated: the accumulation of immeasurable virtue, the immeasurable time,

original: dpag med sgrib pa zad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dpag med sgrib pa zad pa'i phyir //
translated: and the exhaustion of immeasurable obscurations.

original: sgrib pa kun gyi dri med pa //
analyzed: sgrib pa kun gyi dri med pa //
translated: The bodhisattva is stainless due to the exhaustion of all obscurations.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa 'thob //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa 'thob //
translated: One attains omniscience.

original: ces bshad pa ltar na /
analyzed: ces bshad pa ltar na /
translated: As this is explained,

original: byang chub de rnyed par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub de rnyed par dka' ba yin no //
translated: enlightenment is difficult to attain.

original: rnyed par dka' ba'i byang chub chen po de bstan pas rtag tu thob bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnyed par dka' ba'i byang chub chen po de bstan pas rtag tu thob bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The great enlightenment, which is difficult to attain, is always attained by teaching it, this is the meaning.

original: de thob na bdag gi don kyang phun sum tshogs par 'gyur gzhan gyi don kyang phung sum tshogs par mdzad //
analyzed: de thob na bdag gi don kyang phun sum tshogs par 'gyur gzhan gyi don kyang phung sum tshogs par mdzad //
translated: When one attains it, one's own aim is also perfected, and one accomplishes the perfection of others' aims.

original: yongs tan mchog ldan rmad 'byung ba //
analyzed: yongs tan mchog ldan rmad 'byung ba //
translated: Endowed with the supreme qualities, it is wondrous.

original: zhes byabs / bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: zhes byabs / bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: This teaches the perfection of one's own aim.

original: byang chub chen po de thob na stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang / @130b ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i yon tan nyan thos dang so so'i skye bo la med pa rnams dang ldan par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: byang chub chen po de thob na stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang / @130b ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i yon tan nyan thos dang so so'i skye bo la med pa rnams dang ldan par 'gyur bas na /
translated: When one attains that great enlightenment, one becomes endowed with the qualities of the strengths, fearlessnesses, and specific knowledges and so on, which are not possessed by sravakas and ordinary beings.

original: yon tan mchog ldan rmad 'byung ba //üîΩzhes bya ste /
analyzed: yon tan mchog ldan rmad 'byung ba // zhes bya ste /
translated: Endowed with the supreme qualities, it is wondrous.

original: yon tan de dag nyan thos la sogs pa la yod par mi srid bas na rmad du byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan de dag nyan thos la sogs pa la yod par mi srid bas na rmad du byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since those qualities are impossible for sravakas and so on to possess, it is called wondrous.

original: byang chub chen po rtag ldan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub chen po rtag ldan zhes bya ba la /
translated: Always possessing great enlightenment.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub de nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas pa'i byang chub pas 'phags pas byang chub chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub de nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas pa'i byang chub pas 'phags pas byang chub chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called great enlightenment because that unsurpassed enlightenment is superior to the enlightenment of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: byang chub de 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du yod pas rtag ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub de 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du yod pas rtag ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called constant because that enlightenment exists until the end of samsara.

original: nams kyang nyams shing 'gyur ba med pas na brtan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nams kyang nyams shing 'gyur ba med pas na brtan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called firm because it never degenerates or changes.

original: skyabs med rnams kyi skyabs zhes bya bas gzhan gyi don mdzad pa bstan te /
analyzed: skyabs med rnams kyi skyabs zhes bya bas gzhan gyi don mdzad pa bstan te /
translated: The line ‚Äúa refuge for those without one‚Äù shows how he benefits others.

original: sems can rnams 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las bsgral zhing mya ngan las 'das pa la 'jog bar byed pa med pas na skyabs med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las bsgral zhing mya ngan las 'das pa la 'jog bar byed pa med pas na skyabs med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Sentient beings are called ‚Äúwithout a refuge‚Äù because they are not liberated from the sufferings of samsara and are not established in nirvana.

original: sems can de dag 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las bsgral nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas su 'jog par byed pas na skyabs med ba rnams kyi skyabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can de dag 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las bsgral nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas su 'jog par byed pas na skyabs med ba rnams kyi skyabs zhes bya'o //
translated: But because he liberates those sentient beings from the sufferings of samsara and establishes them in the state of nirvana, he is called ‚Äúa refuge for those without one.‚Äù

original: phyogs phyogs su ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyogs phyogs su ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: In all directions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de yang 'jig rten gyi khams 'ga'am phyogs 'ga' thob pa ma yin phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'thob bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de yang 'jig rten gyi khams 'ga'am phyogs 'ga' thob pa ma yin phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'thob bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And that bodhisattva also obtains it in some world-realms or in some directions, not in all the world-realms and directions of the ten directions.

original: brtan pa zhes bya ba de'ang sus 'thob ce na /
analyzed: brtan pa zhes bya ba de'ang sus 'thob ce na /
translated: And who is that steadfast one who obtains it?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'thob //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'thob //
translated: The bodhisattvas obtain it.

original: ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning.

original: dus kun du zhes bya ba ni nyi ma re re la'ang thob ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dus kun du zhes bya ba ni nyi ma re re la'ang thob ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: At all times means that they obtain it every day.

original: rtag tu 'thob ces bya ba ni skad cig ma re re la'ang 'thob ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag tu 'thob ces bya ba ni skad cig ma re re la'ang 'thob ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Constantly means that they obtain it in every moment.

original: de ni 'jig rten ngo mtshar mchog / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten ngo mtshar mchog / ces bya ba la /
translated: That is the supreme wonder of the world.

original: de ltar shin tu rnyed dka' byang chub de //
analyzed: de ltar shin tu rnyed dka' byang chub de //
translated: Thus, that enlightenment which is so difficult to attain,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun du nyi ma re re dang skad cig ma re re la yang len cing thob par byed pa ni 'jig rten ngo mtshar mchog tu bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun du nyi ma re re dang skad cig ma re re la yang len cing thob par byed pa ni 'jig rten ngo mtshar mchog tu bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that the bodhisattvas' taking and obtaining of the ten directions' world systems every day and every instant is a supreme wonder of the world.

original: tshul spyod pas rmad 'byung med ces bya ba la /
analyzed: tshul spyod pas rmad 'byung med ces bya ba la /
translated: There is no wonder in the practice of the way.

original: rnam pa gnyis su na ngo mtshar che ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su na ngo mtshar che ba yang ma yin te /
translated: In two ways, it is not even a marvel.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu 'bras s'a lu btab pa la /
analyzed: rgyu 'bras s'a lu btab pa la /
translated: The cause is the planting of rice.

original: 'bras bu yang s'a lu 'byung ba ngo mtshar mi che ba bzhin du tshul ni byang chub thob pa dang mthun pa'i lam la bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang s'a lu 'byung ba ngo mtshar mi che ba bzhin du tshul ni byang chub thob pa dang mthun pa'i lam la bya ste /
translated: The result is the arising of rice. It is not a great wonder. In the same way, the way is the path that is compatible with the attainment of enlightenment.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i lam sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos spyad nas de'i 'bras @131a * //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i lam sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos spyad nas de'i 'bras @131a * //
translated: Having practiced the path for attaining unsurpassed enlightenment, the levels, the perfections and the elements that lead to enlightenment, the result is the attainment of the great enlightenment.

original: bu bla na med pa'i byang chub nyid thob pa ni ngo mtshar chen por bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bu bla na med pa'i byang chub nyid thob pa ni ngo mtshar chen por bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not at all surprising that the son should attain unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa'i bsdus pa'i don ni dus gcig sgo mang po nas yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs kyi rgyud du ma yod par ston to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa'i bsdus pa'i don ni dus gcig sgo mang po nas yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs kyi rgyud du ma yod par ston to //
translated: The condensed meaning of the third verse shows that there are many different continua of methods for bringing to full maturity at one time and through many doors.

original: de yang mdor na ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa dang / gang la gnas pa'i sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyu mdor na de gnyis ston to //üîΩla lar chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba sgo mang brgya dag nas kyang ston //
analyzed: de yang mdor na ji ltar yongs su smin par byed pa dang / gang la gnas pa'i sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyu mdor na de gnyis ston to // la lar chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba sgo mang brgya dag nas kyang ston //
translated: And that, in brief, is the teaching of the two: how one brings to full maturity and the beings in whom one brings to full maturity.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In some places, the wheel of the Dharma is taught through many doors and many hundreds of doors.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams kha cig tu ni phung po dang khams dang skye ma ched dang sa dang pha rol tu phyin ba chos kyi rnam grangs kyi sgo mang po las brtsams te chos kyi 'khor lo bskor zhing 'chad par yang ston to zhes bya ba'i don to
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams kha cig tu ni phung po dang khams dang skye ma ched dang sa dang pha rol tu phyin ba chos kyi rnam grangs kyi sgo mang po las brtsams te chos kyi 'khor lo bskor zhing 'chad par yang ston to zhes bya ba'i don to
translated: In some world systems, he turns the wheel of the Dharma and teaches the Dharma, beginning with many Dharma topics such as the aggregates, elements, faculties, levels, and perfections.

original: // la lar skye ba zhes bya ba la gang gi tshe chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba de nyid kyi dus na 'jig rten gyi khams la lar ni dga' ldan nas shi 'phos nas 'dzam bu'i gling du yum gyi lhums su skye ba la sogs pa ston to zhesüîΩbya ba'i don to //
analyzed: // la lar skye ba zhes bya ba la gang gi tshe chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba de nyid kyi dus na 'jig rten gyi khams la lar ni dga' ldan nas shi 'phos nas 'dzam bu'i gling du yum gyi lhums su skye ba la sogs pa ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In some, he displays birth, in the sense that at the very time he turns the wheel of Dharma, in some world systems he displays passing away from Tushita, taking birth in his mother's womb in Jambudvipa, and so on.

original: mi snang ba zhes bya ba'i don ni de nyid kyi dus na 'jig rten gyi khams la lar mi snang ba ston te /
analyzed: mi snang ba zhes bya ba'i don ni de nyid kyi dus na 'jig rten gyi khams la lar mi snang ba ston te /
translated: In some, he displays disappearance, in the sense that at the very time he turns the wheel of Dharma, in some world systems he displays disappearance.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sku las ni 'phro ba ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩla lar sna tshogs skye ba spyod //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sku las ni 'phro ba ston to zhes bya ba'i don to // la lar sna tshogs skye ba spyod //
translated: In some, he displays emanations from his body.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: In some, he displays various births and activities.

original: sna tshogs skye ba spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyes pa'i rabs kyi spyod pa mdzad pa la bya ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs skye ba spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyes pa'i rabs kyi spyod pa mdzad pa la bya ste /
translated: The conduct of various births refers to the conduct of the bodhisattvas birth stories.

original: de nyid kyi dus na 'jig rten gyi khams kha cig tu skyes pa rabs kyi spyod pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mdzad nas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi dus na 'jig rten gyi khams kha cig tu skyes pa rabs kyi spyod pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mdzad nas /
translated: At that time, in some world systems, they practice the conduct of birth stories, practicing the transcendent perfection of generosity,

original: lus dang longs spyod la sogs pa sems can gzhan la btang ba dang / sems can gyi don du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyad nas kha na ma mtho ba rdul tsam la yang bag bya ba dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa spyad nas /
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod la sogs pa sems can gzhan la btang ba dang / sems can gyi don du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyad nas kha na ma mtho ba rdul tsam la yang bag bya ba dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa spyad nas /
translated: giving their bodies, possessions and so forth to other sentient beings, practicing the transcendent perfection of ethical discipline for the sake of sentient beings and being careful of even the slightest misdeed, practicing the transcendent perfection of patience,

original: ka ling ka'i rgyal pos drang srong bzod pa smra ba yan lag dang nying lag bcad na yang nyams su len pa la sogs pa bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ka ling ka'i rgyal pos drang srong bzod pa smra ba yan lag dang nying lag bcad na yang nyams su len pa la sogs pa bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: demonstrating the practice of patience by the king of Kali·πÖga who cut the limbs and minor parts of the sage known as Pativacana.

original: la lar byang chub thams cad ces bya ba la /
analyzed: la lar byang chub thams cad ces bya ba la /
translated: In some, all the levels of enlightenment.

original: de nyid kyis na 'jig rten gyi khams kha cig tu ni rdo rje gdan la rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs nas mngon par byang chub pa lta bur yang ston to zhes bya ba'i don to
analyzed: de nyid kyis na 'jig rten gyi khams kha cig tu ni rdo rje gdan la rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs nas mngon par byang chub pa lta bur yang ston to zhes bya ba'i don to
translated: Therefore, in some world systems, he manifests as if he were fully enlightened on the vajra seat, having abandoned the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience through the vajra like samadhi.

original: // la lar mya ngan las 'da' bar yang //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // la lar mya ngan las 'da' bar yang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: In some, he manifests nirvana.

original: de nyid kyi tshe na 'jig @131b rten gyi khams kha cig tu mya ngan las 'da' bar bstan nas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe na 'jig @131b rten gyi khams kha cig tu mya ngan las 'da' bar bstan nas /
translated: At that time, he manifests nirvana in some world systems,

original: sems can yongs su smin par yang byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par yang byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and he also ripens sentient beings.

original: lan gcig ma yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lan gcig ma yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: He does not do it only once.

original: gong du bshad pa lta bur yang khams rnam pa sna tshogs kyang lan gcig cig car mdzad nas rgyun gcod pa ma yin gyi 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du rgyun mi 'chad par mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa lta bur yang khams rnam pa sna tshogs kyang lan gcig cig car mdzad nas rgyun gcod pa ma yin gyi 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du rgyun mi 'chad par mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: As explained above, he does not do the various activities of the realms only once, simultaneously, and then stop, but he does them uninterruptedly until the end of cyclic existence.

original: 'dis ni ji ltar sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa de ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ji ltar sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa de ston to //
translated: This shows how he brings beings to full maturity.

original: de yi gnas nas mi g-yo thams cad byed //
analyzed: de yi gnas nas mi g-yo thams cad byed //
translated: He acts in all ways without moving from that abode.

original: ces bya ba la /üîΩde'i gnas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba la / de'i gnas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here,

original: chos kyi dbyings zag pa med pa la bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings zag pa med pa la bya ste /
translated: the abode is the uncontaminated realm.

original: thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi phrin las mdzad de /
analyzed: thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi phrin las mdzad de /
translated: He acts with various kinds of skillful means,

original: nga zag pa med pa'i dbyings las mi g-yo /
analyzed: nga zag pa med pa'i dbyings las mi g-yo /
translated: but he does not move from the uncontaminated realm.

original: mi 'gul / mi nyams la g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phrin las de dag thams cad kyang mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'gul / mi nyams la g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phrin las de dag thams cad kyang mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He does not waver, he does not deteriorate, and he acts with all those activities that have the characteristic of movement.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pa'i bsdus pa'i don ni sems can smin par sbyor zhing mdzad pa'i rgyu zag pa med pa'i dbyings rtog pa dang mngon par 'du byed pa med pa de ston te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pa'i bsdus pa'i don ni sems can smin par sbyor zhing mdzad pa'i rgyu zag pa med pa'i dbyings rtog pa dang mngon par 'du byed pa med pa de ston te /
translated: The condensed meaning of the fourth verse shows the cause of his activity in bringing beings to maturity, which is the uncontaminated realm free of conceptual thought and formation.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: nga yis smin par byas she'am //
analyzed: nga yis smin par byas she'am //
translated: I have brought them to maturity.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs bcad gcig smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs bcad gcig smos te /
translated: And so on.

original: sems can 'di dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnyed pa dang / sangs rgyas su gyur pa 'di dag sngon ngas smin par byas pa yin no zhes de ltar mi dgongs mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩlus can 'di ni smin bya dang // zhes bya ba la /üîΩsems can 'di dag ni da ltar smin par bya dus la ma bab pas phyis la dgod cing 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes de ltar mi rtog mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can 'di dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnyed pa dang / sangs rgyas su gyur pa 'di dag sngon ngas smin par byas pa yin no zhes de ltar mi dgongs mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i don to // lus can 'di ni smin bya dang // zhes bya ba la / sems can 'di dag ni da ltar smin par bya dus la ma bab pas phyis la dgod cing 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes de ltar mi rtog mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the above is that the Buddhas do not think or imagine that these sentient beings have attained the bodhisattva stages and have become Buddhas, and that they have been matured by me in the past.üîΩThe meaning of the above is that the Buddhas do not think or imagine that these sentient beings are to be matured now, but that they will be placed on the stages and become Buddhas in the future.

original: da ltar smin par byed do zhes sangs rgyas rnams ni mi dgongs te sems can 'di dag ni da ltar gyi dus na yang sa la yang mi bkod 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i dus na yang bzhag go zhes de ltar mi dgongs mi rtog zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: da ltar smin par byed do zhes sangs rgyas rnams ni mi dgongs te sems can 'di dag ni da ltar gyi dus na yang sa la yang mi bkod 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i dus na yang bzhag go zhes de ltar mi dgongs mi rtog zhes bya ba'i don
translated: The meaning of the above is that the Buddhas do not think or imagine that these sentient beings are being matured now, but that they will be placed on the stages and become Buddhas in the future.

original: to // 'dis ni rnam par mi rtog mi mnga' ba bstan te /
analyzed: to // 'dis ni rnam par mi rtog mi mnga' ba bstan te /
translated: This shows that they are free from imagination and discrimination.

original: mngon par 'du byed med par zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed med par zhes bya ba la /
translated: Without any deliberate effort.

original: rtog pa mi mnga' bar mi zad kyi sems can smin par mdzad pa na brtsal ba dang / 'bad pa yang med de /üîΩlhun gyis grub par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩphyogs phyogs kun la zhes bya ba la /üîΩde ltar smin par mdzad pa yang phyogs 'ga'am /üîΩ'jig rten gyi khams 'gar mdzad pa ma yin gyi phyogs @132a * //üîΩbcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩsgo gsum nas zhes bya ba la /üîΩsems can smin bar mdzad pa yang thabs 'ga'am theg pa 'gas mdzad pa ma yin gyi sgo gsum ste theg pa gsum char bstan pa'i sgo nas smin par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtog pa mi mnga' bar mi zad kyi sems can smin par mdzad pa na brtsal ba dang / 'bad pa yang med de / lhun gyis grub par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to // phyogs phyogs kun la zhes bya ba la / de ltar smin par mdzad pa yang phyogs 'ga'am / 'jig rten gyi khams 'gar mdzad pa ma yin gyi phyogs @132a * // bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to // sgo gsum nas zhes bya ba la / sems can smin bar mdzad pa yang thabs 'ga'am theg pa 'gas mdzad pa ma yin gyi sgo gsum ste theg pa gsum char bstan pa'i sgo nas smin par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Without any deliberate effort or exertion, he brings beings to maturity,

original: skye bo'i tshogs ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skye bo'i tshogs ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: without any deliberate effort, he brings beings to maturity, without any deliberate effort or exertion, he brings beings to maturity, without any deliberate effort or exertion, he brings
