effort or exertion, he brings beings to maturity, without any deliberate effort or exertion, he brings beings to maturity, without any deliberate effort or exertion, he brings beings to maturity,

original: smin par mdzad pa yang sems can 'ga' zhig smin par mdzad pa ma yin gyi skye bo'i tshogs kyi sems can thams cad smin par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smin par mdzad pa yang sems can 'ga' zhig smin par mdzad pa ma yin gyi skye bo'i tshogs kyi sems can thams cad smin par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And he brings them to maturity, not just a few beings, but all beings in the world.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba la /
translated: Constantly means

original: smin par mdzad pa'ang lo'am bskal pa 'gar mdzad pa ma yin gyi rtag tu ste 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smin par mdzad pa'ang lo'am bskal pa 'gar mdzad pa ma yin gyi rtag tu ste 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that he brings them to maturity not just for a year or for a few eons, but constantly, until the end of cyclic existence.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams 'phel bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams 'phel bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The wholesome factors increase.

original: theg pa gsum gyi sgo nas chos rnams bshad cing bstan pas sems can gyi sems la byang chub kyi phyogs dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos 'phel ba dang / brtas pa dang / smin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi sgo nas chos rnams bshad cing bstan pas sems can gyi sems la byang chub kyi phyogs dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos 'phel ba dang / brtas pa dang / smin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By teaching and explaining the teachings through the three vehicles, the wholesome factors of the factors of enlightenment, the perfections, and so on increase, develop, and mature in the minds of sentient beings.

original: tshigs su bcad pa lnga'i bsdus pa'i don ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par sems can yongs su smin par byed pa nyi ma'i dpe bstan pa de bas na /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa lnga'i bsdus pa'i don ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par sems can yongs su smin par byed pa nyi ma'i dpe bstan pa de bas na /
translated: The verse summary of the chapter's meaning is the teaching of the example of the sun, which matures sentient beings without any deliberate effort.üîΩTherefore,

original: ji ltar nyi ma'i 'od zer rgya cher yongs btang bas //
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma'i 'od zer rgya cher yongs btang bas //
translated: the sun's rays, extending everywhere,

original: phyogs phyogs kun la lo tog smin par mdzad //üîΩces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phyogs phyogs kun la lo tog smin par mdzad // ces bya ba smos te /
translated: ripen the crops in all directions.

original: nyi ma de las 'od zer gcig gnyis 'byung bar ma zad kyi 'od zer brgya stong grangs med par 'byung bas na rgya che ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma de las 'od zer gcig gnyis 'byung bar ma zad kyi 'od zer brgya stong grangs med par 'byung bas na rgya che ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The sun does not emit one or two rays, but countless hundreds of thousands of rays, so it is called extensive.

original: ji tsam snang bar byas pa'i gnas 'dzam bu'i gling dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kun du snang bar byed pas na spangs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ji tsam snang bar byas pa'i gnas 'dzam bu'i gling dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kun du snang bar byed pas na spangs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called pervasive because it illuminates the entire world, the entire universe.

original: dper na nyi ma'i 'od zer btang la lo tog smin par bya'o snyam du rtog pa dang mngon par 'du byed pa med pas kyang /
analyzed: dper na nyi ma'i 'od zer btang la lo tog smin par bya'o snyam du rtog pa dang mngon par 'du byed pa med pas kyang /
translated: The sun does not think, I shall emit rays and ripen the crops, and it does not make any deliberate effort.

original: 'od zer rgya chen po btang nas phyogs bcu kun du nas 'bras la sogs pa lo tog smin par byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'od zer rgya chen po btang nas phyogs bcu kun du nas 'bras la sogs pa lo tog smin par byed pa'i don to //
translated: Having sent forth vast rays of light, he ripens the harvests of rice, barley, etc. in all the ten directions.

original: 'dis ni smin par byed ba'i dpe bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni smin par byed ba'i dpe bstan to //
translated: This teaches the example of ripening.

original: chos kyi nyi ma rab zhi chos tshul 'od btang bas //
analyzed: chos kyi nyi ma rab zhi chos tshul 'od btang bas //
translated: The sun of Dharma, the light of the way of Dharma, having sent forth light,

original: phyogs phyogs kun du sems can smin par byed //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: phyogs phyogs kun du sems can smin par byed // ces bya ba la /
translated: ripens sentient beings in all directions.

original: zag ba med pa'i dbyings ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis 'od zer 'dra bar 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pas nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'dra ba'i phyir chos kyi nyi ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zag ba med pa'i dbyings ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis 'od zer 'dra bar 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pas nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'dra ba'i phyir chos kyi nyi ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The uncontaminated realm is the cause of the arising of the twelve branches of the scriptures, which are like rays of light, and so it is like the orb of the sun. Therefore, it is called the sun of Dharma.

original: rang bzhin ni @132b mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni @132b mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The nature is called nirvana,

original: kun 'byung dang sdug bsngal spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun 'byung dang sdug bsngal spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the abandonment of origination and suffering.

original: chos tshul ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste thob par byed pa'i rgyu dang thabs la bya ste /
analyzed: chos tshul ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste thob par byed pa'i rgyu dang thabs la bya ste /
translated: The way of Dharma is nirvana, which is the cause and method of attainment.

original: de'i rgyu dang gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu dang gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis bshad pa'o //
translated: Its cause and the twelve branches of the scriptures are explained.

original: 'ong gtong ba zhes bya ba ni chos bshad pa'i zhes bya ba'i don te chos bshad pas ni phyogs bcu kun du sems can yongs su smin par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'ong gtong ba zhes bya ba ni chos bshad pa'i zhes bya ba'i don te chos bshad pas ni phyogs bcu kun du sems can yongs su smin par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúgiving forth‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúexpounding the Dharma,‚Äù and the meaning of ‚Äúexpounding the Dharma‚Äù is that one ripens sentient beings in all ten directions.

original: tshigs su bcad pa drug pa'i bsdus pa'i don ni gcig nas gcig tu smin par byed pa mi zad pa ston to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa drug pa'i bsdus pa'i don ni gcig nas gcig tu smin par byed pa mi zad pa ston to //
translated: The meaning of the sixth verse is the teaching of the inexhaustibility of the ripening of one to many.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: ji ltar mar me gcig la mar me'i tshogs mang 'byung //
analyzed: ji ltar mar me gcig la mar me'i tshogs mang 'byung //
translated: just as from one lamp many collections of flames

original: grangs med dpag tu med kyang zad par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: grangs med dpag tu med kyang zad par mi 'gyur te //
translated: are produced, which are innumerable and immeasurable, yet it does not become exhausted,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said.

original: dper na mar me gcig la mar me grangs med dpag tu med pa rnams bsregs te /
analyzed: dper na mar me gcig la mar me grangs med dpag tu med pa rnams bsregs te /
translated: For example, from one lamp, many collections of flames are burned, which are innumerable and immeasurable,

original: so sor lus kyang dang po'i mar me gcig po de la zad pa dang 'grib pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: so sor lus kyang dang po'i mar me gcig po de la zad pa dang 'grib pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and the individual bodies do not have the meaning of exhaustion and decrease of that one original lamp.

original: de bzhin smin pa gcig las sems can tshogs mang po //
analyzed: de bzhin smin pa gcig las sems can tshogs mang po //
translated: In the same way, from one ripening, many collections of sentient beings

original: grangs med dpag tu med pa 'byung yang zad mi 'gyur //
analyzed: grangs med dpag tu med pa 'byung yang zad mi 'gyur //
translated: are produced, which are innumerable and immeasurable, yet it does not become exhausted.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said.

original: de dang 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs pas sems can gcig smin par byas te /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs pas sems can gcig smin par byas te /
translated: In the same way, the Tathagata, having ripened a single sentient being

original: sangs rgyas par byas pa dang / sangs rgyas pa des sems can gyi tshogs mang po grangs med dpag tu med pa rnams 'tshang rgya bar byas te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas par byas pa dang / sangs rgyas pa des sems can gyi tshogs mang po grangs med dpag tu med pa rnams 'tshang rgya bar byas te /
translated: and caused him to become a Buddha, and that Buddha having caused a great, innumerable, limitless number of sentient beings to become Buddhas,

original: smin par byas kyang yongs su smin par byed pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang / chos bshad pa la zad pa dang 'grib par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smin par byas kyang yongs su smin par byed pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang / chos bshad pa la zad pa dang 'grib par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: to become ripened, the Tathagata's gnosis and the Dharma teaching are not exhausted or diminished.

original: don 'di'ang 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pa'i mdo las gsungs te /
analyzed: don 'di'ang 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pa'i mdo las gsungs te /
translated: This meaning is also taught in the Vimalakirti Sutra.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: khyim bdag ji ltar bdag cag bdud kyi gnas nas gnas par bgyi /
analyzed: khyim bdag ji ltar bdag cag bdud kyi gnas nas gnas par bgyi /
translated: Householder, how should we abide in the abode of Mara?

original: smras pa / sring mo dag mi zad pa'i chos kyi sgron ma zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sgo yod do //
analyzed: smras pa / sring mo dag mi zad pa'i chos kyi sgron ma zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sgo yod do //
translated: He said, Sisters, there is a Dharma gate called 'The Lamp of the Inexhaustible Dharma.'

original: de la nan tan gyis shig / de'ang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nan tan gyis shig / de'ang gang zhe na /
translated: Strive in that! And what is that?

original: 'di lta ste sring mo dag sgron ma gcig las sgron ma brgya stong 'bar bar byas kyang sgron ma de 'bri bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du sring mo dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' gcig gis sems can brgya stong mang po rnams byang chub la bkod kyang
analyzed: 'di lta ste sring mo dag sgron ma gcig las sgron ma brgya stong 'bar bar byas kyang sgron ma de 'bri bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du sring mo dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' gcig gis sems can brgya stong mang po rnams byang chub la bkod kyang
translated: In the same way, sisters, if a single bodhisattva establishes a hundred or a thousand sentient beings in enlightenment,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i sems kyi dran ba mi 'bri yongs su mi 'bri ste phyir zhing skye zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i sems kyi dran ba mi 'bri yongs su mi 'bri ste phyir zhing skye zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: the bodhisattva‚Äôs memory is not diminished, is not exhausted, but rather grows.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bdun pa'i bsdus pa'i don ni theg pa gsum gyi @133a * //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bdun pa'i bsdus pa'i don ni theg pa gsum gyi @133a * //
translated: The condensed meaning of the seventh verse is the three vehicles.

original: sgo nas yongs su smin par byas pa rnams rnam par grol ba'i dbyings su 'jug pa na yongs su smin pa thams cad kyi go skabs 'byed pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings mi ngoms pa dang / chos kyi dbyings su smin pa dpag tu med pa lus kyang lhag ma med pa'i phyir 'phel ba med pa rgya chen po'i dpe ston to //
analyzed: sgo nas yongs su smin par byas pa rnams rnam par grol ba'i dbyings su 'jug pa na yongs su smin pa thams cad kyi go skabs 'byed pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings mi ngoms pa dang / chos kyi dbyings su smin pa dpag tu med pa lus kyang lhag ma med pa'i phyir 'phel ba med pa rgya chen po'i dpe ston to //
translated: And the realm of the Dharma is not increased because of the infinite maturation in the realm of the Dharma, without remainder.

original: rgya mtsho chen po chu yis ngoms mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po chu yis ngoms mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The great ocean is not satisfied with water.üîΩFor example, even though many minor rivers and streams from the ten directions are collected in the great ocean, it is not the case that it is satisfied with this much water.

original: dper na rgya mtsho chen por phyogs bcu'i chu bran dang chu bo mang po der bsdus kyang 'di snyed cig bab pas da chog go bya ba med kyi chu bo mang po der 'jug pa'i go skabs 'byed pa'i phyir ngoms pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to
analyzed: dper na rgya mtsho chen por phyogs bcu'i chu bran dang chu bo mang po der bsdus kyang 'di snyed cig bab pas da chog go bya ba med kyi chu bo mang po der 'jug pa'i go skabs 'byed pa'i phyir ngoms pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to
translated: The meaning is that it is not satisfied because it opens up the opportunity for many rivers to enter it.

original: // chu chen mang po rab tu 'bab pas 'phel mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // chu chen mang po rab tu 'bab pas 'phel mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not increased by the descent of many great waters.

original: rgya mtshor phyogs bcu'i chu bo dang chu bran mang po der 'dus te rtag tu 'bab kyang /
analyzed: rgya mtshor phyogs bcu'i chu bo dang chu bran mang po der 'dus te rtag tu 'bab kyang /
translated: The ocean is the place where many rivers and streams from the ten directions converge and flow in constantly.üîΩBut since the ocean does not overflow or become full, it does not increase.

original: rgya mtsho la lud pa dang lhag pa med pas 'phel bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgya mtsho la lud pa dang lhag pa med pas 'phel bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de bzhin sangs rgyas dbyings kyang rnam dag rtag 'bab pas //üîΩngoms shing 'phel bar mi 'gyur ngo mtshar che //
analyzed: de bzhin sangs rgyas dbyings kyang rnam dag rtag 'bab pas // ngoms shing 'phel bar mi 'gyur ngo mtshar che //
translated: The realm of the buddhas is also like that, constantly flowing with purity.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is amazing that it is never satisfied and never increases.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩsangs rgyas dbyings zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba'i don to // sangs rgyas dbyings zhes bya ba ni //
translated: Here, ‚Äúlike that‚Äù means ‚Äúin that way.‚ÄùüîΩThe ‚Äúrealm of the buddhas‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings su zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings su zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means the realm of the buddhas, which is to say, the uncontaminated realm.

original: rnam dag rtag 'bab pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dpag tu med pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa rnams kyang mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa thams cad zag pa med pa'i dbyings su 'jug kyang rnam par grol pa 'di snyed cig zhugs kyis da chog go zhes 'gog pa med kyi rnam par grol ba thams cad derüîΩ'jug pa'i skabs med pas ngoms par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam dag rtag 'bab pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dpag tu med pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa rnams kyang mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa thams cad zag pa med pa'i dbyings su 'jug kyang rnam par grol pa 'di snyed cig zhugs kyis da chog go zhes 'gog pa med kyi rnam par grol ba thams cad der 'jug pa'i skabs med pas ngoms par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is always flowing, pure‚Äù means that although countless ≈õrƒÅvakas, countless pratyekabuddhas, and countless bodhisattvas enter into nirvƒÅ·πáa, the dharmadhƒÅtu is never exhausted.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúit is never satisfied‚Äù means that there is no end to the entry of all those who are liberated into the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: yongs su smin pa dpag tu med pa zhig der zhugs kyang chos kyi dbyings la skyes pa dang lud par gyur pa med pas na 'phel bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa dpag tu med pa zhig der zhugs kyang chos kyi dbyings la skyes pa dang lud par gyur pa med pas na 'phel bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is always increasing‚Äù means that although countless beings enter into the dharmadhƒÅtu, the dharmadhƒÅtu does not increase or decrease.

original: de ni ngo mtshar du bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni ngo mtshar du bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase ‚Äúit is a great wonder.‚Äù

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag ba la tshigs su bcad pa bzhi'o zhes bya ba la sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i skabs kyi rjes la chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag ba la tshigs su bcad pa bzhi'o zhes bya ba la sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i skabs kyi rjes la chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel ba ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the section on the purification of the realm of the Dharma and the section on the evolutionary development of beings?

original: 'di ni byang chub bshad pa'i skabs yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub bshad pa'i skabs yin te /
translated: This is the section on enlightenment.

original: sngar byang chub @133b bshad pa'i skabs su //
analyzed: sngar byang chub @133b bshad pa'i skabs su //
translated: In the section on enlightenment above, it was said:

original: ngal brgyas rmad 'byung dka' spyad dge bsags kun //
analyzed: ngal brgyas rmad 'byung dka' spyad dge bsags kun //
translated: Having practiced the difficult practices for a hundred eons, having accumulated the roots of virtue,

original: dus ring bskal pa mchog 'gro sgrib kun zad //
analyzed: dus ring bskal pa mchog 'gro sgrib kun zad //
translated: having passed through the supreme eons, having exhausted all obscurations,

original: sar gtogs sgrib pa phra bcom sangs rgyas te //
analyzed: sar gtogs sgrib pa phra bcom sangs rgyas te //
translated: having destroyed the subtle obscurations belonging to the stages, the Buddha

original: de ni mthu chen rin chen snod phye bzhin //
analyzed: de ni mthu chen rin chen snod phye bzhin //
translated: is like the opening of a great treasure.

original: zhes bya ba byang chub kyi mtshan nyid spyi tsam du bshad nas sangs rgyas par gyur na yongs su smin par byed do zhes de tsam du zad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba byang chub kyi mtshan nyid spyi tsam du bshad nas sangs rgyas par gyur na yongs su smin par byed do zhes de tsam du zad do //
translated: Having explained the general characteristics of enlightenment, it was said that when one has become a Buddha, one evolves beings.

original: da ni byang chub kyi rang bzhin dang / 'bras bu dang / las dang / ldan pa dang 'jug par phye nas khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i skabs bshad do //
analyzed: da ni byang chub kyi rang bzhin dang / 'bras bu dang / las dang / ldan pa dang 'jug par phye nas khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i skabs bshad do //
translated: Now, in order to teach the distinctions by analyzing the nature, result, action, endowment, and engagement of enlightenment, the chapter on the purity of the dharmadhatu is explained.

original: yang na 'di ni byang chub bshad pa'i skabs yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni byang chub bshad pa'i skabs yin te /
translated: Or, this is the section on explaining enlightenment.

original: sngar gong du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab par bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don la brtsams te /
analyzed: sngar gong du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab par bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don la brtsams te /
translated: Previously, it was explained that the training of bodhisattvas begins with the benefit of self and other,

original: byang chub kyi bar du don rnam pa bdun bslab par bya'o zhes bshad pa las mdo sde de dag gi nang nas byang chub rnam pa du ma bshad de /
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar du don rnam pa bdun bslab par bya'o zhes bshad pa las mdo sde de dag gi nang nas byang chub rnam pa du ma bshad de /
translated: and that up to enlightenment, the seven aspects of benefit should be trained in. From that, many aspects of enlightenment are explained in those sutras.

original: de las kyang sngar ni gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po dang / dam pa'i chos punda r'i ka la sogs pa'i nang nas byang chub kyi mtshan nyid ji ltar 'byung ba de gtan la phab ste bshad do //
analyzed: de las kyang sngar ni gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po dang / dam pa'i chos punda r'i ka la sogs pa'i nang nas byang chub kyi mtshan nyid ji ltar 'byung ba de gtan la phab ste bshad do //
translated: Among them, previously, the characteristics of enlightenment were determined and explained as they appear in the Dharani-raja, the Parinirvana Sutra, the Punyaraja Sutra, and so on.

original: da ni de ma yin pa'i mdo sde gzhan dag gi nang nas byang chub kyi mtshan nyid 'byung ba gtan la dbab par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de ma yin pa'i mdo sde gzhan dag gi nang nas byang chub kyi mtshan nyid 'byung ba gtan la dbab par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to ascertain the characteristics of enlightenment that occur in other s≈´tras,

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i skabs bshad pa bstan te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i skabs bshad pa bstan te /
translated: the section on the pure sphere of reality is explained.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las chos lngas sangs rgyas kyi sa bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las chos lngas sangs rgyas kyi sa bsdus pa yin te /
translated: In the S≈´tra on the Buddha‚Äôs Levels, the buddha level is summarized by five dharmas.

original: chos lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five dharmas?

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes so //üîΩde la sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las 'byung ba'i chos lnga'i dbang du byas nas /üîΩchos lnga po de 'dir mdo tsam du gtan la 'bebs te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes so // de la sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las 'byung ba'i chos lnga'i dbang du byas nas / chos lnga po de 'dir mdo tsam du gtan la 'bebs te /
translated: They are the pure sphere of reality, mirrorlike gnosis, the gnosis of equality, all-discerning gnosis, and the gnosis of accomplishing activities.üîΩHere, the five dharmas that occur in the S≈´tra on the Buddha‚Äôs Levels are ascertained in brief.

original: chos lnga po de rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba rgya cher gtan la dbab pa ni /
analyzed: chos lnga po de rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba rgya cher gtan la dbab pa ni /
translated: The extensive ascertainment of the divisions of those five dharmas is as follows.

original: sangs rgyas kyis theg pa chen po'i mdo sde nyid kyi nang nas 'byung ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis theg pa chen po'i mdo sde nyid kyi nang nas 'byung ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be seen as it is taught in the Mahayana sutras by the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyis las kyang chos kyi dbyings dang por smos pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis las kyang chos kyi dbyings dang por smos pas /
translated: The Buddha first mentioned the dharmadhatu in the Dharmasangiti-sutra,

original: 'dir yang chos kyi dbyings kyi skabs tshigs su bcad pa bzhi dang por 'chad de /
analyzed: 'dir yang chos kyi dbyings kyi skabs tshigs su bcad pa bzhi dang por 'chad de /
translated: and so here too the four verses on the dharmadhatu are explained first.üîΩThe four kinds of gnosis are explained later.

original: ye shes bzhi rnams rim bzhin du phyis 'chad do zhes bya ba'i don 'chad de thams cad chos kyi de bzhin ces bya ba @134a * //
analyzed: ye shes bzhi rnams rim bzhin du phyis 'chad do zhes bya ba'i don 'chad de thams cad chos kyi de bzhin ces bya ba @134a * //
translated: The meaning of all this is as follows.

original: la ; chos thams cad ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas so //üîΩzag pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: la ; chos thams cad ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas so // zag pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: All phenomena are compounded or uncompounded,

original: zag pa med pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa ste /
translated: with or without contaminants,üîΩand so on.

original: chos de rnams kyi de bzhin nyid ni stong pa nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: chos de rnams kyi de bzhin nyid ni stong pa nyid la bya'o //
translated: The suchness of all those phenomena is to be understood as emptiness.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i stong pa nyid dus kyi stong pa nyid de bzhin nyid de'i mtshan nyid dang rang bzhin ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i stong pa nyid dus kyi stong pa nyid de bzhin nyid de'i mtshan nyid dang rang bzhin ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: What are the characteristics and nature of that suchness, the emptiness of the buddha level, the emptiness of time?

original: sgrib pa gnyis dag pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sgrib pa gnyis dag pa'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said to be characterized by the purity of the two obscurations.

original: sangs rgyas kyi dus kyi de bzhin nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid dang rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi dus kyi de bzhin nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid dang rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The suchness at the time of Buddhahood is characterized by being free from the two obscurations, the afflictive and the knowledge obscurations.

original: 'dis ni de bzhin nyid gnas gzhan du gyur pa bstan to //üîΩdngos po shes pa de la dmigs //
analyzed: 'dis ni de bzhin nyid gnas gzhan du gyur pa bstan to // dngos po shes pa de la dmigs //
translated: This shows the suchness that is a transformation of the basis.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The knowledge of things focuses on that.

original: dngos po shes pa ni de'i rgyab nas thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po shes pa ni de'i rgyab nas thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
translated: The knowledge of things refers to the pure mundane gnosis that is attained subsequently to that nonconceptual gnosis.

original: dngos po'i sgras kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gnas gzhan du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i sgras kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gnas gzhan du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la bya'o //
translated: The term thing refers to the dependent characteristic, the ƒÅlaya consciousness, which is the basis of transformation into the nonconceptual gnosis.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de yang de'i rgyab nas thob pa dang / dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis phyin ci ma log par shes par byed kyi ye shes gzhan gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de yang de'i rgyab nas thob pa dang / dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis phyin ci ma log par shes par byed kyi ye shes gzhan gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: That nonconceptual gnosis is known unerringly by the pure mundane gnosis that is attained subsequently to it, not by any other gnosis.

original: de bas na de'i rgyab nas thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes la dngos por shes pa zhes bya ste 'dir 'dis ni gnas ngan len gyi rten kun gzhi gnas gzhan du gyur par bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na de'i rgyab nas thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes la dngos por shes pa zhes bya ste 'dir 'dis ni gnas ngan len gyi rten kun gzhi gnas gzhan du gyur par bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of things that is the subsequently attained pure mundane knowledge is called the knowledge of things. Here, this passage teaches the transformation of the foundation consciousness, which is the support of negative tendencies.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chos kyi dbyings la snyegs te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chos kyi dbyings la snyegs te /
translated: The word ‚Äúit‚Äù refers to the realm of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi dbyings la ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis dmigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis dmigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the realm of the Dharma is perceived by nonconceptual knowledge.

original: 'dis ni lam gyi gnas gzhan du gyur pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni lam gyi gnas gzhan du gyur pa bstan to //
translated: This passage teaches the transformation of the stage of the path.

original: mi zad dbang gis mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mi zad dbang gis mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic is the inexhaustibility of power.

original: zhes bya ba la de'i rgyab nas thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la dmigs nas dbang mi zad pa thob ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de'i rgyab nas thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la dmigs nas dbang mi zad pa thob ste /
translated: The subsequently attained pure mundane knowledge that is the knowledge of things perceives nonconceptual knowledge and attains the inexhaustibility of power.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because pure mundane knowledge correctly realizes the nature of nonconceptuality.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis kyang chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid la dbang mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis kyang chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid la dbang mi zad pa ste /
translated: Also, nonconceptual intuition has inexhaustible power over the reality realm, suchness.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis thams cad du chos kyi dbyings la rtse gcig tu 'jog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis thams cad du chos kyi dbyings la rtse gcig tu 'jog pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because nonconceptual intuition always places the reality realm in a single area.

original: 'dis ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin bstan to //üîΩkun nas de bzhin nyid shes nas //
analyzed: 'dis ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin bstan to // kun nas de bzhin nyid shes nas //
translated: This shows the nature of the reality realm.üîΩThe origination of meditation is

original: bsgom pa yang dag 'byung ba ste//
analyzed: bsgom pa yang dag 'byung ba ste//
translated: the thorough knowledge of suchness.

original: @134b zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshe tshigs bcad gcig gis rgyu'i don dang 'bras bu'i don to //
analyzed: @134b zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshe tshigs bcad gcig gis rgyu'i don dang 'bras bu'i don to //
translated: In the verse beginning ‚ÄúThe origination of meditation is the thorough knowledge of suchness,‚Äù one verse treats the meaning of cause and the meaning of result.

original: kun nas bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i mdo sde de dag gi nang nas chos kyi dbyings ston pa'i ming gi rnam grangs ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba la sogs pa 'byung ba mnyan pa dang / sems pa dang bsgoms pa la sogs pa'i rim pa sbyor ba'i sa na bsgoms pa las mthong ba'i lam na de bzhin nyid shes pa'i ye shes skyes te /
analyzed: kun nas bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i mdo sde de dag gi nang nas chos kyi dbyings ston pa'i ming gi rnam grangs ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba la sogs pa 'byung ba mnyan pa dang / sems pa dang bsgoms pa la sogs pa'i rim pa sbyor ba'i sa na bsgoms pa las mthong ba'i lam na de bzhin nyid shes pa'i ye shes skyes te /
translated: The all-encompassing activity is the application of the stages of listening, reflection, and meditation, etc. to the synonyms for the dharmadhatu that occur in the Mahayana sutras, such as non-arising, non-occurrence, etc. On the path of seeing, which is the path of meditation on the stage of application, the gnosis that knows thusness arises.

original: chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du rtog pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skyes so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du rtog pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skyes so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that non-conceptual gnosis arises, which realizes the dharmadhatu to have the characteristic of pervading all.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyang sa dang po'i dus su thob bo //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyang sa dang po'i dus su thob bo //
translated: Non-conceptual gnosis is also attained at the time of the first bhumi.

original: de nas sa gnyis nas sa bcu man chad ye shes de nyid bsgoms pas yang dag pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas sa gnyis nas sa bcu man chad ye shes de nyid bsgoms pas yang dag pa 'byung ste /
translated: Then, from the second bhumi up to the tenth, that very gnosis is cultivated, and it arises perfectly.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sar chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa mngon sum du byas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sar chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa mngon sum du byas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that on the buddha bhumi, the dharmadhatu is actualized as pure.

original: 'dis ni rgyu'i don bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu'i don bstan to //
translated: This shows the meaning of cause.

original: rnam pa kun du sems can don //üîΩgnyis bskyed mi zad 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rnam pa kun du sems can don // gnyis bskyed mi zad 'bras bu'o //
translated: The benefit of beings in every way

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩrnam pa kun du dus thams cad du'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / rnam pa kun du dus thams cad du'am /
translated: is the generation of the two, with an inexhaustible result.

original: phan pa dang bde ba'i rnam pa thams cad kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba'i rnam pa thams cad kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In every way means at all times, or with every aspect of benefit and happiness.

original: sems can kun zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can kun zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: All beings means all sentient beings.

original: gnyis bskyed pa ni sems can la phan pa dang / bskyed pa dang / bde ba bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis bskyed pa ni sems can la phan pa dang / bskyed pa dang / bde ba bskyed pa ste /
translated: The generation of the two is the generation of benefit and happiness for beings.

original: tshe rabs gzhan du mtho ris dang mya ngan 'das pa la bkod pa ni phan pa'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du mtho ris dang mya ngan 'das pa la bkod pa ni phan pa'o //
translated: The establishment of beings in high status and definite goodness in other lives is benefit.

original: tshe 'dir zang zing gis phan btags na dge ba byed du bcug pa ni phan pa ste /
analyzed: tshe 'dir zang zing gis phan btags na dge ba byed du bcug pa ni phan pa ste /
translated: The inducement of beings to virtuous action through the benefit of material things in this life is happiness.

original: 'dis ni 'bras bu'i don bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'bras bu'i don bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the meaning of result.

original: mi zad par zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du yang bde ba dang bde ba rgyun mi gcod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi zad par zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du yang bde ba dang bde ba rgyun mi gcod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Inexhaustible means that happiness and the cause of happiness are uninterrupted until the end of cyclic existence.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems sprul ba'i //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems sprul ba'i //
translated: The activity of the emanation of body, speech, and mind

original: sbyor ba'i thabs kyi las can no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i thabs kyi las can no //
translated: is the means of application.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs bcad gcig gis las kyi don dang ldan pa'i don bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs bcad gcig gis las kyi don dang ldan pa'i don bstan te /
translated: This one verse teaches the meaning of activity.

original: lus sprul pa'i sbyor ba'i thabs kyi las can dang / ngag sprul pa'i sbyor ba'i thabs kyi las can dang / sems sprul pa'i sbyor ba'i thabs kyi las can no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: lus sprul pa'i sbyor ba'i thabs kyi las can dang / ngag sprul pa'i sbyor ba'i thabs kyi las can dang / sems sprul pa'i sbyor ba'i thabs kyi las can no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The activity of the means of application of the emanation of body, the activity of the means of application of the emanation of speech, and the activity of the means of application of the emanation of mind.

original: de la brgya byin dang tshangs pa dang / lha dang klu la sogs pa'i lus su bstan pa ni lus sprul pa'i sbyor ba'i thabs kyi las can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la brgya byin dang tshangs pa dang / lha dang klu la sogs pa'i lus su bstan pa ni lus sprul pa'i sbyor ba'i thabs kyi las can zhes bya'o //
translated: Among these, the display of the body of Indra, Brahma, gods, nagas, and so on is called the activity of the means of application of the emanation of body.

original: byin gyi rlabs kyis nam mkha' dang / rtsig ba dang / shing la sogs pa las kyang dam pa'i chos 'chad pa'i sgra 'byung ba ni ngag @135a * //
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs kyis nam mkha' dang / rtsig ba dang / shing la sogs pa las kyang dam pa'i chos 'chad pa'i sgra 'byung ba ni ngag @135a * //
translated: The sound of the holy Dharma arising from the sky, walls, trees, and so on by the power of blessing is called the activity of the means of application of the emanation of speech.

original: sprul pa'i thabs kyi las can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i thabs kyi las can zhes bya'o //
translated: The activity of the means of application of the emanation of mind is the activity of the mind that is the means of application of the emanation of mind.

original: byin gyis brlabs nas blun po rnams kyang zab mo rtogs pa'i sems dang ldan par bya ste /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs nas blun po rnams kyang zab mo rtogs pa'i sems dang ldan par bya ste /
translated: Having blessed them, he causes even fools to have the mind that understands the profound.

original: chos bshad nas chos kyi don rtogs par byas pa dang / 'phags pa sh'a ri'i sras po dang / rab 'byor la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa 'chang du bcug pa ni sems sprul pa'i sbyor ba'i thabs kyi las can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos bshad nas chos kyi don rtogs par byas pa dang / 'phags pa sh'a ri'i sras po dang / rab 'byor la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa 'chang du bcug pa ni sems sprul pa'i sbyor ba'i thabs kyi las can zhes bya ste /
translated: Having explained the Dharma, he causes them to understand the meaning of the Dharma. Having blessed the noble son Shariputra and Subhuti, etc., he causes them to expound the perfection of wisdom, etc. This is called the function of the method of the application of emanation of mind.

original: sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni las la bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni las la bya'o //
translated: Application should be understood as referring to function.

original: sprul pa ni las gsum gyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i las dang las de nyid thabs yin te /
analyzed: sprul pa ni las gsum gyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i las dang las de nyid thabs yin te /
translated: Emanation is the function of bringing sentient beings to maturity through the three kinds of function, and that function is the method.

original: thabs de lta bu dag mdzad pa thugs su chud pas na las can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: thabs de lta bu dag mdzad pa thugs su chud pas na las can zhes bya ste /
translated: Since he has realized the performance of such methods, it is called the function.

original: 'dis ni las kyi don bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni las kyi don bstan to //
translated: This shows the meaning of function.

original: de la lus sprul pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la lus sprul pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therein, the emanation of body is also twofold:

original: bdag dang 'brel pa dang / gzhan dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang 'brel pa dang / gzhan dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: related to oneself and related to others.

original: de la bdag dang 'brel ba ni bdag nyid brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lus su sprul pa'o //
analyzed: de la bdag dang 'brel ba ni bdag nyid brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lus su sprul pa'o //
translated: In this regard, related to oneself is the transformation of oneself into the body of Indra, Brahma, and so on.

original: gzhan dang 'brel pa ni sems can gzhan dang rtsi shing la sogs pa yang byin gyis brlabs nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba lta bur ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dang 'brel pa ni sems can gzhan dang rtsi shing la sogs pa yang byin gyis brlabs nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba lta bur ston pa'o //
translated: Related to others is the transformation of other sentient beings, trees, and so on, and the manifestation of the birth of a Buddha or Bodhisattva.

original: ngag sprul pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ngag sprul pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The emanation of speech is also twofold:

original: bdag dang 'brel pa dang / gzhan dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang 'brel pa dang / gzhan dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: related to oneself and related to others.

original: de la bdag dang 'brel pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid gsung yan lag dbyangs drug cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan par sprul nas dam pa'i chos 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: de la bdag dang 'brel pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid gsung yan lag dbyangs drug cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan par sprul nas dam pa'i chos 'chad pa'o //
translated: In this regard, related to oneself is the emanation of the Tathagata himself with the sixty-two branch vowels and the teaching of the true Dharma.

original: gzhan dang yang 'brel ba ni rtsig pa dang shing dang nam mkha' la sogs pa las kyang dam pa'i chos 'chad pa'i sgra 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dang yang 'brel ba ni rtsig pa dang shing dang nam mkha' la sogs pa las kyang dam pa'i chos 'chad pa'i sgra 'byung ba'o //
translated: Related to others is the sound of the teaching of the true Dharma that arises from walls, trees, space, and so on.

original: sems sprul pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sems sprul pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The emanation of mind is also twofold:

original: bdag dang 'brel pa dang / gzhan dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang 'brel pa dang / gzhan dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: The first is related to the self, and the second is related to others.

original: bdag dang 'brel pa ni ye shes kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis chos kyi don zab mo dag thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang 'brel pa ni ye shes kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis chos kyi don zab mo dag thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: The first is the realization of the profound meaning of the Dharma by the power of the Buddha's wisdom.

original: gzhan dang 'brel ba ni byin gyis brlabs nas blun po rnams kyang dam pa'i chos zab mo rtogs par byas pa dang 'phags pa nyan thos dag kyang dam pa'i chos zab mo 'chad du bcug pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dang 'brel ba ni byin gyis brlabs nas blun po rnams kyang dam pa'i chos zab mo rtogs par byas pa dang 'phags pa nyan thos dag kyang dam pa'i chos zab mo 'chad du bcug pa'o //
translated: The second is the realization of the profound Dharma by fools through the Buddha's blessing, and the teaching of the profound Dharma by the noble disciples through the Buddha's blessing.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sgo //üîΩgnyis po dpag tu med dang ldan //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sgo // gnyis po dpag tu med dang ldan //
translated: The doors of concentration and retention

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Are endowed with the two kinds of immeasurability.

original: chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: The realm of the Dharma

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang ldan pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang ldan pa dang / gnyis po dpag tu med pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang ldan pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang ldan pa dang / gnyis po dpag tu med pa dang ldan te /
translated: Is endowed with the doors of concentration and retention, and with the two kinds of immeasurability.

original: des ni ldan @135b pa'i don bstan pa'o //
analyzed: des ni ldan @135b pa'i don bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the meaning of endowment.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin ni theg pa chen po'i ting nge 'dzin dang / nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin ni theg pa chen po'i ting nge 'dzin dang / nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
translated: Concentration is the concentrations of the Great Vehicle, such as the concentration of the sky treasure, the concentration of the heroic walk, and so on.

original: gzungs kyi sgo ni mi zad pa'i zam tog gi gzungs dang / sgo mtha' yas pa'i gzungs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo ni mi zad pa'i zam tog gi gzungs dang / sgo mtha' yas pa'i gzungs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The door of retention is such as the retention of the inexhaustible casket, the retention called the door of infinity, and so on.üîΩThe two kinds of immeasurable are the immeasurable accumulation of merit and the immeasurable accumulation of knowledge.üîΩThe Dharma Body is the basis of the Enjoyment Body and the Transformation Body.üîΩThe Enjoyment Body and the Transformation Body are the manifestation of the Dharma Body.üîΩThe Enjoyment Body and the Transformation Body are the manifestation of the Dharma Body.

original: rang bzhin chos dang rdzogs longs spyod //
analyzed: rang bzhin chos dang rdzogs longs spyod //
translated: The Enjoyment Body and the Transformation Body are the manifestation of the Dharma Body.

original: sprul pa dag gis tha dad 'jug / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: sprul pa dag gis tha dad 'jug / ces bya ba la /
translated: The Enjoyment Body and the Transformation Body are the manifestation

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni chos kyi sku 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi rang bzhin gyi sku dang / chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku dang tha dad pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gsum gyis sems can gyi don la 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni chos kyi sku 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi rang bzhin gyi sku dang / chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku dang tha dad pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gsum gyis sems can gyi don la 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The body of the Tathagata is not only the Dharma body, but also the natural body, the body of complete enjoyment of the Dharma, and the emanation body. It is said that it engages in the benefit of sentient beings through these three distinct aspects.

original: de la rang bzhin gyi sku ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyi sku ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Among them, the natural body is the Dharma body.

original: chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i sku'o //
translated: The body of complete enjoyment of the Dharma is the enjoyment body.

original: sprul pa ni sprul pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: sprul pa ni sprul pa'i sku ste /
translated: Emanation is the emanation body.

original: 'dis ni 'jug pa'i don bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'jug pa'i don bstan to //
translated: This teaches the meaning of engagement.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i don gong du rgya cher bshad pa rnams kyang mjug bsdus pa'i phyir te /üîΩ'di ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i don gong du rgya cher bshad pa rnams kyang mjug bsdus pa'i phyir te / 'di ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang //
translated: The meaning of the purity of the Dharma realm, which was explained extensively above, is also summarized here.

original: chos dbyings rnam par dag pa bshad //
analyzed: chos dbyings rnam par dag pa bshad //
translated: This is also explained as the purity of the Dharma realm of the Buddhas.

original: ces smos te /
analyzed: ces smos te /
translated: It is said:üîΩThe purity of the Dharma realm of the Buddhas is also explained.

original: gong du rang bzhin dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / las dang ldan pa dang / 'jug pa bshad pa de ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa de lta bu yin no zhes bshad pa'i don to //
analyzed: gong du rang bzhin dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / las dang ldan pa dang / 'jug pa bshad pa de ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa de lta bu yin no zhes bshad pa'i don to //
translated: The above explanation of the nature, cause, result, activity, endowment, and function of the Dharma Body is the explanation of the pure Dharma Sphere of the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bdun te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bdun te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Seven verses on the analysis of the Buddha bodies.

original: gong du sku gsum tha dad du 'jug pa mdo tsam du bstan nas /
analyzed: gong du sku gsum tha dad du 'jug pa mdo tsam du bstan nas /
translated: The three bodies of the Buddha have been briefly indicated above.

original: da tshigs su bcad pa bdun gyis sku gsum tha dad du 'jug pa rgya cher zhib tu 'chad do zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩrang bzhin dang ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: da tshigs su bcad pa bdun gyis sku gsum tha dad du 'jug pa rgya cher zhib tu 'chad do zhes bya ba'i don to // rang bzhin dang ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Now, in seven verses, their differentiation is explained in detail.

original: rang bzhin ni chos kyi sku la bya ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni chos kyi sku la bya ste /
translated: The nature is the Dharma Body,üîΩbecause it is the basis of the powers, etc.

original: nam kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dri ma spangs nas chos kyi dbyings me long lta bu'i ye shes su gyur pa na chos kyi sku zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nam kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dri ma spangs nas chos kyi dbyings me long lta bu'i ye shes su gyur pa na chos kyi sku zhes bya'o //
translated: The Dharma Body is the purified Dharma Sphere, which is the conversion of the container consciousness when the stains consisting of the subject-object dichotomy are gone, and which is the mirror-like wisdom.
